One side holds the Pug's clever apology message, with space on the back to write your own "Sincere Apuglogies."  Use these Apuglogies whenever just saying "I'm sorry" doesn't seem to be enough.

No fluff here! Author Paige Padgett gets right down to serious discussions about the chemicals and toxins that are too abundant in today's alleged "beauty" products. This guide is for the woman truly interested in knowing exactly what she is putting onto and inside her body, all for the sake of looking good, and how to determine exactly what products and ingredients to look for, or to avoid at all costs. One of the most helpful lists is her recommendations for safe and effective beauty products at affordable prices at your local drugstore.

Although the story in this children's tale is Scripture and God centered, you don't have to be a church goer to appreciate its central message: "what matters most is how you treat your friends." Most of the world has gotten severely off track in recent decades, emphasizing winning and competition over cooperation and the simple enjoyment of participating, whether or not you win or lose. The artwork accompanying the text is beautiful and enchanting and the lesson being taught by the central character of LuLu is one that can benefit children of every race, color, age and creed!

This gadget is a great way to be able to enjoy scrambled eggs with your choice of add-ons, such as chopped veggies, ham or cheese, in less than two minutes! This unit is easy to use and clean, but extreme care must be taken because the ceramic heats up very quickly and stays hot, so take extreme care when taking the Egg-Tastic out of the microwave when cooking has completed. Have two hot pads or a pair of heat-resistant gloves on hand. For the best results, read over the safeguards and instructions that come with this unit, such as using eggs at room temperature and blending the eggs with a fork prior to cooking. The unit will cook up to 4 eggs at one time, enough for two hearty appetites or four smaller ones. Pay attention as well to the suggested cooking times on the enclosed cooking guide, depending on the power of your microwave oven. We are fans of eggs for breakfast and brunch and were delighted to receive Egg-Tastic free of charge in exchange for our honest, unbiased opinion in this review. This is definitely a great addition to your cooking equipment pantry, so long as you use the proper protection when handling the Egg-Tastic unit when it is hot!

Having nicely manicured hands can get pretty expensive pretty quickly if done by a professional manicurist. But the Roto Clipper is a very nifty gadget that enables you to keep your nails nicely trimmed and filed for a fraction of the cost. We received the Roto Clipper at no charge and with no fee in exchange for an honest and unbiased review, and we're happy to report this is one beauty care aid you'll want to find in your Christmas stocking this year. It fits nicely into the palm of your hand, is easy to maneuver as you guide each nail around the rotating blade for a nice smooth file or trim job and is small enough to easily store in your purse or beauty supply cabinet. We especially like that the blade comes with a protective cover when the unit is not in use and the built-in light makes it easy to see what you are doing. Roto Clipper even comes with a brush so you can clean the blade and keep it in good working order longer. Roto Clipper is a smart investment to make to keep your manicure looking clean and trim.

If you want to add a splash of color and sparkle to your ears, this is the pair of earrings for you. We have worn them with a variety of outfits and it's amazing how these zirconia manage to complement whatever color we're wearing. These earrings are sturdy and well crafted without being heavy on the ear and they hang nicely balanced just below the lobe. These stones have such quality of color and shine, no one will know you are wearing faux jewels! And they look just as nice for days you are wearing jeans, as they do at night with evening wear.

Our senior years won't be as appealing if we are forgetful or exhibiting symptoms of memory loss or other neurological disfunction. Dr. Fraser Smith offers some easy and simple solutions for keeping our brain cells active and healthy, with the first portion of this book some fun as well as challenging exercises to keep your gray matter vital, followed by a cookbook section that enables the reader to custom tailor their own brain health and wellness plan using any of Smith's 125 recipe suggestions. You don't have to be in the senior age category in order to benefit from this helpful guidebook, as everyone in the family can participate in the brain training exercises, and individuals of all ages will enjoy feasting on the brain-healthy suggested recipes, including Fragrant Rice-Stuffed Peppers, Avocado and Egg Breakfast Wraps, and Parmesan Herb Baked Fish Fillets.

This book is a wonderful blend showcasing some of the world's most stunning architecture, juxtaposing these edifices against what very creative amateur achitects have managed to create using Legos as building blocks. If you have the patience and can read directions, The LEGO Architect can help you become a LEGO architect yourself with a builder's guide to 12 different scale models. The craftsmanship and creativity illustrated by the photos in this volume of both real-life and scale-life LEGO models of famous buildings will give the reader a new appreciation for the art of architecture and will likely inspire more than a few to consider architecture as a career choice.

Author Leonhardi guides the reader to not only understand the philosophy behind this holistic approach to cooking but also how to apply it in a custom-tailored fashion for optimum health and wellness. Not only will the reader gain insight into the tastes, qualities and elements associated with specific food choices, they will also be able to take a quiz to determine whether their constitution is vata, pitta or kapha, call the three doshas. Armed with this knowledge, readers can select the recipes and preparations that offer them the best opportunity for balance, energy and overall wellness. This is not a cookbook that you open to any page and start cooking. It guides you through a commitment to choosing a different way of daily dietary choices that works with, rather than against, your dosha. We love the emphasis on using an abundance of fresh seasonal produce in the 200 recipes presented, as well as the use of more off-beat meat choices such as bison and rabbit. Kudos to Leonhardi for serving as the reader's personal Ayruvedic coach as they pursue a goal of a more balanced life that emphasizes eating and feeling well!

This three-set volume is an amazing historical record of how World War II affected the life and family of one senior Army officer who spent three years overseas. It is made all the more personal by using the actual letters sent back and forth among family members to describe the activity, the morale and the emotional impact of what was to have been "the war to end all wars."

There's a very charming chemisty between Keaton and co-star Freeman in this comedy-drama, backed up by a nice supporting performance by Cynthia Nixon as a hard-driving real estate agent who also happens to be a relative. The writer has managed to capture the idiocy of today's rude social interactions quite adeptly, contrasted to the authenticity of the main characters' relationship that relies on shared values, good manners and common sense. Viewers who are thinking of making a drastic change in their life will identify with the fears and confusion expressed in this well-written and acted film and may wind up asking themselves, what's the real reason behind their wanting a change of scenery!

The action in this thriller is fast-paced and contains just enough twists and turns to keep you interested. We purchased this movie because we are big fans of both Duchovny and Hutton and we weren't disappointed. Although some of the plot points may seem hard to believe, Playing God is fun entertainment about how the criminal element operates to live in high style.

This is possibly the best dog cookbook and healthcare guide I've ever run across. Suzuki offers detailed advice on everything the quality of water you pour into your dog's water dish to the best vegetables and grains to include in their diet. She doesn't minimize the amount of work involved in cooking from scratch for your four-legged friends, but the benefits are well documented. This book will help you better understand just what makes your dog tick and how changing the way you care for and feed your dog can make all the difference to his longevity.

If you are not at all familiar with the contributions that Woody Allen has made to the world of cinema entertainment, this comprehensive guide provides an excellent education. And if you are already a Woody Allen fan, this book will make you want to revisit some of your favorite W.A. films and perhaps re-evaluate them in a new light. We were only sorry that the book offers no visuals or photographs. Reel to Real is an important addition to any film buff's library.

This is an amazing account of one woman's grueling 20-year journey through sleepwalking, night terrors and an insomnia that bled into every aspect of her life and her relationships. Most of us take sleep for granted, and too many of us in our gotta keep busy world don't understand the real importance of getting a good night's sleep. But sleep is a fascinating topic and we doubt that your head will hit the pillow in the same way after reading this account of her fears of falling asleep and a near-fatal episode of sleep walking. We came away with a tremendous respect for the courage it took for Frazier to tell her story and a newfound respect for how far the medical community has advanced in the past several decades in the techniques it uses to help  somnambulists stop suffering and achieve full recovery.

Dr. George has done an outstanding job of shining a spotlight on the many ugly truths about the Affordable Care Act (ObamaCare), legislation  that is as close to a swindle as has ever been foisted upon the American populace. Every American owes it to themselves to understand the ramifications of the government and big business calling the shots when it comes to medical decisions, rather than the patient and his/her doctor. Reading this remarkable book, which advocates for the patient rather than big pharma, made us even more angry than we have been at the current White House administration, led by a President who misinforms and lies at every opportunity. Luckily, George outlines some positive steps every individual can take to regain free market medicine in the USA. This book is must reading for anyone who wants to be empowered by the truth about today's healthcare system.

Be forewarned. These slightly sweetened treats are positively addictive, especially if you love coconut. Their individual packaging makes them the perfect coconut snack to take along anywhere. But we think they are outrageously priced for what they are -- there are only 8 treats per bag, so enjoying O'Coconuts is an exercise in both bliss and self-restraint!

We are big fans of breakfast, and although the recipes in this book are designed to be made in an actual sandwich maker appliance, you can improvise and still enjoy these creative dishes without actually owning this gizmo. Why settle for cold cereal or simply scrambled eggs and bacon in the a.m. when you can treat yourself to a Continential Ham, Brie and Fig on French Bread, a gourmet antipasto breakfast sandwich, or a delicious vegetarian pear and almond butter sandwich without that much more effortThere are enough ideas presented in this wonderful cookbook to enjoy a different breakfast sandwich Monday through Friday for almost an entire year!

Ever since reading this extremely insightful book, I notice how often the term "perfect" is being used in everything from advertising to article titles in the Family Circle Magazine. Author Bluestein does an excellent job of defining how our current culture's admiration of and striving for perfection has warped our values, our lives and our very souls. Constant anxiety and depression are just some of the results, with people having more choices and resources than ever, yet remaining the unhappiest generation. You will definitely start seeing the world around you much differently after reading The Perfection Deception. Bluestein offers some concrete ways to escape this trap in order to become what she calls your "biggest, baddest self."

The Think Board is a great way to inspire children of all ages to be creative. It installs easily, is fun to use, and wipes clean with a dry paper towel for re-use again and again. This is the smallest of 3 sizes and we like the fact that it fits in a compact space. Use it to post reminders, work out math problems or to post messages. We also like the fact that it encourages kids to write out things by hand rather than use a technological device. A great gift for any boy or girl, son or daughter returning back to the classroom this fall.

Reading the wonderful insights and suggestions in this book is like having someone hold your hand in the darkness, assuring you that a light will come on at some point once again to light your path. Author Tako does an excellent job of balancing her own unique journey after her breast cancer diagnosis, which she calls her "personal 9/11" , with the acknowledgement that the reader's journey and experiences may be similar but also just as unique. Her warm, candid, conversational tone draws the reader in to a safe and comfortable place during a time when everything seems pretty scary. If you can't be there in person to help someone who has been diagnosed with cancer, this book will help hold their hand and give them some resources they may not have considered to help them through a life-changing experience.

Elizabeth Rose decided to turn the lemons of  being assigned as a permanent rotating substitute teacher into the refreshing lemonade that is this very entertaining book. Rose gives her readers a very fascinating look at the world of a school teacher in the 21st century, highlighting the diversity of challenges and students she encounters, some funny, some poignant, some brilliant and some sad,  as she travels through 25 different NYC schools in the course of what she describes as "1 wacky year."

The story premise is a good one that never comes to fruition. Many of the descriptions used by the author are trite cliches and the character development of Nikki and C.J. could have been more in-depth. A lot of the conversations between characters seems a bit forced or stilted and the ending to me was very unsatisfying.

This is a thoroughly charming story meant to be read together by mothers and daughters. Princess Cupcake Jones is an engaging character that most little girls will be able to relate to and we adore the bright and colorful illustrations that accompany this tale.

Vanessa Chamberlin really has a knack for making every member of the family actually get excited about changing food and dietary choices for a happier, healthier life. Her enthusiasm for the Plantfire lifestyle is contagious and the abundance of fresh produce-rich recipes featured in this book are gourmet gorgeous and much better for your body than most traditional ingredients found in today's supermarket. We especially like her section about how to set up a Plantfire kitchen, listing the key herbs, spices and other ingredients designed to make your dishes more appetizing and appealing. From a Mexican Spaghetti that needs no tomato pasta sauce to a dessert cream created using cashews and a meatless burger featuring black beans, Chamnberlin's recipe suggestions are both delicious and inspired.

We initially expected this book to be about Captain Van Kleeff's adventures as an American Airlines pilot, but it is a more comprehensive view of his entire career, including the influences of his childhood and his experiences during the Vietnam War. Van Kleef is an engaging story teller and the reader feels as though he's talking to a good friend while at the local tavern nursing a cold beer.  Van Kleef doesn't pull any punches describing the victories, failures, romances and risks he's taken, both as a private and commercial pilot. His experiences while flying the skies above Saudi Arabia are especially entertaining. The story of his life, his choices and his adventures are well worth reading.

The central theme of homecoming and finding out exactly who you are and where you want to be in life is one that will resonate with most readers. Author Sperrazza does a good job of getting us to care about college drop-out Laura, who finds herself backpedaling into a life at home with her relatives that no longer seems to fit her. Some surprising plot twists and turns along the way, as well as a satisfying decision by Laura that changes her life for the better.

If you're the kind of person whose waist size varies with the seasons, or after you've eaten a hearty meal,  you will love this style of Mission Belt. It is very well constructed and has a comfortable fit. Rather than holes that you have to fumble with and that can easily wear out over time, the Mission Belt features a rachet system that is easily controlled by a latch on the underside of the buckle with just one flick of the finger. You can tighten or loosen the belt in just seconds. This is a versatile and stylish belt that can easily be worn with jeans, or to create a waistline when wearing an oversized top. The Mission Belt is a winner and makes a good investment for your fall fashion wardrobe.

The conversational style used in the recipes throughout this wonderful collection feel like having Chef Gosney right in your kitchen as you prepare dishes ranging from such comfort food favorites as New England Clam Chowder and Bread Pudding to the more ethnically inspired entrees as Chipotle Seared Salmon to Korean Barbecue and Tandoori Chicken. Gosney includes a nice mix of old standbys you'll want to serve again and again with new variations on old favorites, such as Jalapeno Cauliflower "Grits". And if you've never considered cooking up a batch of your own soup , Gosney's Soup section also includes the basics of making your own stock. Method of Procedure is a worthwhile investment for anyone who enjoys getting creative in the kitchen.

A flat stale taste, unappetizing appearance and not very good results. I fell asleep fast enough but didn't stay sleeping - woke up around midnight feeling very fuzzy and exhausted, and woke up the next morning still feeling tired.

This is a very well constructed case for securely storing a week's worth of medications or vitamin supplements. We love the green and pink color motif since it reminds us of the legendary Beverly Hills Hotel, surely one of the icons of great style. The compartments in the removable inner case open and shut easily and in each day's compartment you can fit 4-5 small pills or up 2 large gel capsules. The Style Rx looks so much prettier sitting at the table or on your bedroom dresser than a pill bottle and it is easily transported in pocket, luggage or purse. The Style Rx is a lovely way to keep your vitamins/medications secure and at hand, either at home or on the road, and is a classy way to remind yourself to take good care of yourself!

Author Cipullo does a very thorough job in the first 60 pages of this book of helping guide the reader in setting up a workable meal plan following a diagnosis of diabetes, including when and how much to eat, what blood tests mean, a protein and fat cheat sheet, and suggestions for healthful grab and go snacks. The remainder of this book features more than 100 recipes designed to provide good nutrition and variety for the diabetic patient, from breakfast through evening dessert. Most of the recipes, including such specialties as Turkey and Orzo Stuffed Peppers, Buffalo Chicken Quesadilla and Asian Lettuce Cups are designed to curb carbs, fill up on fiber and favor healthy fats, all of which are very beneficial in defeating the negative effects of diabetes.All of the recipes make liberal use of seasonal fruits and vegetables and other fresh foodstuffs and are delicious enough for the diabetic cook to share with the entire family. This book is a must-have for anyone whose family has been affected by diabetes!

This is a great way to keep your medications and daily vitamin supplements organized, in addition to reminding you to not forget to take your pills. Each day's "compartment" features four separate compartments capable of holding up to six small pills or three gel caps. Since we are using it for daily vitamin supplements, we disregard the morning/noon/afternoon/nighttime designations and just fill the compartments to use every morning. The clock, which features a light, is also a handy feature to note the time and day, in addition to setting it with either an alarm or a voice reminder to take a specific dosage at an appointed time. MedCenter answers the question - "did I take my pills" today - to ensure that you don't forget and that you also don't take a double dose because you turn each day's container from the green to the red side when you have taken your pills.But you must be willing to take the time to open up each compartment within the day's container and fill it in order for this system to work - but once you get the hang of opening up each compartment, it becomes easy and after about 20-30 minutes investment of your time, your organizer is filled for the month and you never have to go searching for your pills or have a variety of bottles strewn around the table. We found some of the compartment lids a little stiff, but with practice you get the hang of it, but this may pose an initial problem if you have arthritis. When we asked the company specific questions about our unit, they were quick to respond and are customer friendly. Although this organizer was designed with seniors in mind, it is really a very helpful device for individuals of all ages who take daily vitamins, medications or both.

The reader of this novella is treated not only to Freiermuth's writing talents that weave an engaging story of adventure,  but also to his talents as an artist, with his own beautiful watercolor illustrations accompanying the text throughout the book. The setting in late 18th century Spain shed light on the trials, tribulations and traditions of the Romani, or Gypsy people, and their persecution during the Spanish Inquisition. Characters and plot line are well developed, with plenty of suspense to hold the reader's attention, and the heroine Jacaranda is very likable. Freiermuth's tale mentally takes the reader away to another time and place that is both gritty and romantic, making for a very enjoyable and satisfying read.

The author manages to craft characters that you care about, despite their flaws, in addition to telling a story that weaves in and out of past and present time, managing to delay answers to "who done it" until the final chapters. Your own heart and hopes will rise and sink as Mary Jo and Feb vacillate between believing in love and redemption, while circumstances and certain evidence point instead to cunning and betrayal. You'll be asking yourself as you turn the pages of this enchanting novella, should I listen to my heart or my head?

This story from L.T. Graham contains all of the elements necessary for an enjoyable detective thriller -- steamy sex, an unsolved mystery, plenty of secrets hidden behind affluent walls, and enough plots twists and turns to keep you turning the page without putting the book down. The Blue Journal will keep you guessing and ready for another of  Lieutenant Anthony Walker's cases by the time you finish this novel.

We were surprised to discover that this is Jucha's first sci-fi novel, but we're sure it won't be his last. He is masterful at creating a scene that the reader can easily imagine and be drawn into and you care about the well-defined characters he has created in The Silver Ships. Also, the story premise of an explorer-tug captain who encounters conflict while harvesting ice asteroids for water-hundry clients is a compelling one,  just as the resolution to Captain Alex Racine's dilemma is a humane albeit exciting one.  The Silver Ships will prove a satisfying adventure for any fan of futuristic novels.

We are all for anything that inspires people to learn more about wines and enjoy drinking them. Read Between the Wines is not only a great ice breaker for any party, it makes a great excuse to set up a wine tasting for you and seven of your friends. Very creative themes offered to inspire wine descriptions, such as comparing the wine to a fictional literary character, or describing exactly what type of fashion this wine would dress in.  The wine charms included in this kit make it easy to keep your glasses separated, especially after the drinking begins! Read Between The Wines is the perfect old-fashioned, party-game style non-tech way to enjoy the art of witty conversation again and learn about previously unfamiliar wines in the process.

We took these for 30 days in conjuntion with Uptime Maximum Energy Blend but didn't notice any signifcant increase in our energy levels, sorry to say. Information panel on the side of the bottle is extremely small to read. Pills were easy to swallow, with no aftertaste or side effects, but we were disappointed not to get a better result.

Easy to swallow, no aftertaste or bad side effects, and bottle easy to handle. Information on side of bottle much too small to read. Didn't notice much of a difference in my energy level after taking these for a month.

By using the guidelines and recommendations set forth in this book, the reader has author Warren Honeycutt serving as their personal weight loss and motivational coach. The book is written by Honeycutt, a disciple of the legendary Jack LaLanne, in a very optimistic tone that emphasizes and accentuates the positive. After just a few chapters, you will ready begin to believe you can achieve your fitness goals.  Not only does this book explore the 7 keys to keeping excess pounds off for good, it will also reveal the two main foods to eliminate from your daily diet in order to accelerate your weight loss. Unfortunately, there are no meal plans or recipes included here  which would have made this a 5-star guidebook. But the case histories and guidelines offered are well worth putting into place and Get Lean for Life is an excellent place to start changing your life and the shape and health of your body.

Fire is such a fascinating subject, due to its ability to transform, melt, heat, create as well as destroy. A tragic gas fire is at the heart of Lesia Cartelli's personal story of tragedy, challenge, confrontation and redemption. She is a masterful storyteller, devoid of self-pity, and you will be inspired by her courage, her ability to adapt, and her ability to reach beyond her own issues and problems to help change the lives of others. Cartelli is definitely a person of interest you will want to get to know better and how she handles the challenges presented in her own life may provide some answers for yours.

This water, sourced from a volcanic island off the coast of South Korea, has a very pure and refreshing taste. It doesn't taste dull like tap water, and we like the fact that it's not effervescent or sparkling, but simply still. We also love the shape of the bottle, which is easy to carry and also easy to store in the refrigerator. This brand is a winner!

With so many of the commercially prepared products filled with unknown substances and toxins, this well-researched volume by Mar Gomez can help to ensure that you are using the best creams, blams, shampoos and other cosmetics for skin and hair care because you will be creating them yourself using authentic ingredients. Many of the recipes take a commitment of time and investment in quality ingredients, but there's a very helpful Resources section at the back of the book. But there are also quite a few simple concoctions that you can whip up without spending too much time and money, like an insect repellant using tea tree and andiroba oil or a gentle healing oil for skin irritations made using argan oil and a drop of lavender essential oil. It was also fun learning about some oils we had never heard about before, like Baobab, Babassu and Pequi Oils. Even if never try out the large majority of creative concoctions illustrated in this guidebook, it's worth the time to read about the kinds of ingredients you should insist on when you spend your hard-earned money on health and beauty products.

Much has been made in the news media about athlete Bruce Jenner's transition into Caitlyn Jenner, but there are a lot of gaps left out of that story. For an authentic look at how one professional man decided to honor his true self and make the journey from male to female, you need to read Nicola Chase's very compelling story. It is a tale told with utter honesty about the mix of emotions affecting transgender individuals, and how not only their lives are forever changed but also the lives of their family members and loved ones. Chase's tale of transition isn't at all sensational, but simply one individual's amazing journey told with candor and sensitivity.

It is always fascinating to learn about the foodstuffs of other cultures to gain insight into a better method of making dietary choices for optimum health and energy. Whole Body Reboot is a beautifully designed guide to  those superfoods discovered by the Incas long ago that are still available today, including purple corn, sweet potatoes, avocados, cacoa and yuca. For those willing to go the extra mile and track down all of the Peruvian Superfoods mentioned, author Villacorta provides a 5-day  smoothie detox diet focusing on a nutritious daily beverage, one for every color in the rainbow. The remainder of the book offers assorted menu suggestions, along with 135 recipes, each beautifully illustrated with a full-color photo, ranging  from easy to prepare chicken and fish dishes to more complicated selections like Pichuberry Quinoa Chili using more than 20 ingredients. Your meals will never be boring when you opt for one of Whole Body Reboot's colorful, nutritious and very creative offerings making the most of 21 nutrient-dense Peruvian Superfoods.

Even thought it's been 25 years this year since this book premiered, the advice that actress Lansbury offers about maturing in a healthy and graceful way continues to hold true. Partly common sense, and part advice, her suggestions are all easy to incorporate into your life without a lot of fuss or any cost. Her exercise routine is also among the best we found for staying limber and eliminating those aches and pains. There are a few recipes sprinkled throughout one chapter - only wish there were more. But overall, Positive Moves is like sitting down over tea with a warm and generous friend eager to help you live life to the fullest on a daily basis!

PCH Films has done a brilliant job of examining the heartbreak and challenge of Alzheimer's disease in this poignant remembrance of Glen Campbell's musical talent, as seen through the eyes of his spouse, children, musical associates, friends as well as Campbell's own observations. Very heartfelt and engaging interviews, without being sentimental or maudlin. This is a documentary that is must-see viewing, whether or not you are a fan of Glen Campbell, because it shines a spotlight on one of the biggest health crises facing all of us in the 21st century.

This book reminded us of what President Woodrow Wilson once stated -- "I not only use all the brains that I have, but all I can borrow." Author Walker does an outstanding job of inviting the reader to get valuable advice, suggestions and encouragement from other trailblazers in the business world whose attitude, actions and mindset didn't leave their futures to chance. He maps out six specific practices , from knowing yourself to responding to reality, that can help to shape your future into a place with limitless opportunities where you will feel empowered spending time. You don't have to agree or adapt to all of the suggestions presented in this book, but if allow your mind to be open to a different perspective, this guidebook will help you to arrive at a future that proves fabulous.

This cookbook deserves to be on everyone's kitchen shelf. It's a fun read in and of itself, with contributions from many of the stars of the golden age of silver screen and television. The recipes also tend to be featured because they are affordable and relatively easy to make,  can often be made ahead of time to serve later, and are crowd pleasers. Despite being more than 30 years old, the Official Special Olympics Celebrity Cook Book has never gone out of style. This one is a winner!

This comprehensive volume will appeal primarily to the hardcore vegan, since most all of the recipes are very detailed and use a multitude of ingredients, many of which are likely to be specialty items for regular kitchens. These are serious vegan recipes rather than 1-2-3 quick cooking.  We are amazed at how author McNish has managed to turn traditional recipes upside down and inside out to present creative twists that capitalize on the use of fresh fruits, vegetables, herbs and spices. How about a borscht soup that uses quinoa and lentils as a complement to red beets? Or burgers made from quinoa and sweet potatoes, or snack chips created using cashews, kale and bell peppers rather than potatoes? Even if you just decide to observe meatless Mondays and are in need of inspiration, Vegan Everyday gives you more than one new recipe per day to try without repeating the same recipe once throughout the year!  With the popularity and selection at local farmer's markets growing, this is one cookbook that will  help you learn how to enjoy previously unfamiliar foodstuffs in delicious, healthful, nutritious colorful dishes without spending a penny for beef, poultry or chicken!

This book is a lovely introduction to the photographic talent of nature photographer Rebecca Webb Wilson. Many of the stunning color images will take your breath away, while others may make you smile, tear up, or want to reach out to a long lost friend. No matter what season of this book you choose to focus on, and no matter what season of your life you find yourself in, Wilson's visual as well as written commentary is sure to inspire you to believe that the world is filled with miracles. This is a wonderful volume to keep handy to restore your soul on gray days, and amplify your happiness when all is going well.

This charming tale about how a group of animals helps transform a dull, gray world, led by the colorful lion Guion, teaches one of the most important lessons that youngsters can learn today to make the world a more peaceful place. Everyone may look and think differently, but everyone has something to contribute, and when just one individual puts forth the effort to help another individual in need, amazing things can happen.

I like the effervescence, which makes this beverage refreshing. The size of the metallic bottle makes it easy to store and helps the product chill quickly. There was a bit of an aftertaste to this formula, but it was a nice change of pace from sugary soft drinks and juices.

In these stress-filled times, every woman owes it to herself to know about the affordable and effective natural remedies available to relieve a variety of medical conditions. Author Gilbert has done an excellent job of cataloging a wide range of medicinal herbs and the benefits they can offer in treating everything from depression and anxiety to fibroids, high blood pressure and low milk supply in nursing mothers.  Every featured medicinal herb also offers sections on further reading, cautions and risks, along with suggested usages and treatments. This is a well researched guidebook that smart women will want to keep handy in their medicine cabinet.

We were amazed at the kinds of food that can be preserved through the dehydration process. Authors Nutt and Mercer provide the reader with a user-friendly, comprehensive guide to skillfully drying and preserving almost any category of food, from fruits and vegetables to beef, seafood and poultry. Although we are not campers ourselves, we think this guide and the recipes it provides would be a must-have for anyone who wants nutritious snacks and meals while enjoying the great outdoors. You spend a large part of your budget on foodstuffs, why not use the power of the sun and the expert advice from The Dehydrator Bible to extend the lifespan of that food to enjoy at a later date.

Author Moran puts forth some very convincing arguments about why the reader should make a decision to shift their dietary choices to vegan and no longer consume anything that has a face!  Plenty of interesting good karma stories from people who have made the switch and the positive impact it's had on their lives. The recipe section is shorter than we would have liked, but offers a good variety nonetheless. We are for anything that makes this crazy world a much more non-violent place, and the suggestions put forth by The Good Karma Diet certainly support a more loving, kind and cruelty-free world.

I like anything pink and camo. This is a very cute way to drink coffee while traveling. It keeps my coffee hot while the camo wrap keeps my fingers from the heat. It's easy to use and just as easy to clean. I am thinking of getting a couple more for around the holidays.I did get this product at discount price, however all thoughts and ideas expressed are indeed my own.

This is a great oil and vinegar cruet set. It is great for home use or to give away as a gift. I use mine quite often and drizzle it on my sandwiches, bread, salads or sometimes pasta. I leave one plain and the other one I added herbs like rosemary to the oil. It gives home cooked food that restraunt quality.I did receive this product at a discounted rate however all ideas and words expressed are my own.

This smells amazing! I used it in my foot spa and it felt heavenly. It softened up the callius I have on the bottom of my right foot. My feet felt like I had a professional spa soak in the comfort of my own home. I totally recommend this product, I love it and want to try other products from their line.I got this product at a discount price, however all thoughts and words expressed are indeed my own.

I love using bamboo kitchen utensils. This set is very very nice. It comes with a slotted spoon, spatula, and a brush.Durable and hard under all sorts of use. Silicone is heat safe up to 400 F. Hand-wash with warm, soapy water, so they are easy to clean. Beautifully sanded down, you will not get splinters like the cheaper ones that do. Silicone part is well glued on, it doesn't come off. I use one piece if not more of this set daily, so it gets a lot of wear and they still look as nice as when I first got them.I received this at a discounted price, however, all thoughts and words are my own.

This is a great, beautiful knife set. It comes in a nicely crafted handmade wooden case with the name of the company on it which is great for storage or gift giving. These steak knives are stainless steel with extremely sharp serrated edge that will never need sharpening. They are comfortable and balanced with riveted carved pakka wood handles.I am extremely happy with this set, I didn't have to sharpen them, I just washed them and used them right away. I even went out to buy more steak, pork chops, and chicken breasts to try these out. I was impressed, they worked just as good if not better than name brand expensive knives I have owned.I received this product at a discounted price, however, all thoughts and ideas expressed are indeed my own.

This is great for single cups of tea. I use it quite often and even more when I have a cold. It is very easy to use: take top off and glass infuser off. Fill with boiling hot water add infuser back, then add desired loose tea, honey, sugar and cover. Let it steep and then enjoy. I love the design of this tea cup, the double wall allows tea to be hotter longer and you can add whatever fruits you want to it, honey or sweetener; you can make it however you want to. It also makes a great gift for any occasion or to add to a get well basket. It is very well crafted and meant to last a lifetime.I got this product at a discount, however, all thoughts and words are my own.

These peel and stick wall stickers are great. I can put them in whichever room in the house I want to. I put these on my bathroom walls which the décor is black and white. It adds a bit of classiness and fun at the same time. I like these because as I add more décor to the bathroom, I can move these stickers around. In addition to the walls, I added stickers to the shower, the cabinet doors, and the mirror. These are a fun decorative way to accessorize your walls without any real long term commitment.

I love the size and shape of this silicone spatula. It really is helpful in stirring and scraping whatever food your preparing with ease. I have used it from mixing brownies to potato salad and didn't have any problems at all. It's really easy to clean, either hand wash or put in dishwasher. I would recommend this spatula to every home cook.I received this product at a discount however all thoughts and words expressed are indeed my own.

I really like the formula in this mascara. It defines the lashes, gives them volume, and is waterproof all at the same time. I also like the wand this mascara comes with, towards the end it's smaller which is perfect for getting into the hard to reach corners of the eyes or the bottom lashes. I even like the bold yellow color of the tube, it's easy to find in my makeup bag. I have bought some high priced mascara that couldn't compare with this mascara, that's how much I like this oneI received this at a discounted price, however, all thoughts and words are my own.

This is a fun sequin devil accessory kit. It would be a great Halloween costume, just pair it with a red leotard and skirt and you're dressed to kill as a sexy devil. This accessory kit is very well made and stayed intact even when I pulled the tags off. The ears are simply a headband, that comfortably stays in place. The bow tie, ties around the neck with easy on/off velcro. And the tail which has bendable, posable wire inside, attaches with a safety pin onto your clothes. If you want a fun, classic costume then this is for you!I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

Nice wooden, bamboo gripping balloon whisk. This is great for whisking up eggs and pancake batter for a nice smooth consistency. The wooden handle lets you grip better and helps prevent your hands fro hurting when using for a long time. This whisk is well crafted and definitely intended for a lifetime of usage. It is nice to have cool touch handle while cooking. I like the fact that  each piece of Zeroca kitchenware with 100% recycled stainless steel and farm-managed bamboo, so it's environmentally friendly.  With this whisk you will get the performance you need.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.
Nice song!
Nice song!

I just recently moved from a small apartment to a much bigger house. I was using a swiffer to clean up the floors but having to go back a lot to scrub the floors where it was still dirty. Part of my agreement of moving in earlier was cleaning and previous owners had a bird which they let poop all over the kitchen/dining area. I was skeptical that this mop could clean it up; it was quite disgusting and had been sitting for who knows how long. Anyhow, with some pledge floor cleaner and a little elbow grease it came up. This is an amazing mop system, it can pivot under furniture so I don't have to bend which is great for my bad back.The mop head is designed that it can be rotated freely through 360 degrees to evenly and easily clean any corner. The hurricane mop gets hair, dirt & dusts so you don't have to sweep, bend over or touch a dirty mop again! This unique mop and bucket come with micro-fibers used in the mop head resist wear, fight bacteria and clean without scratching floors or delicate surfaces. Special micro fiber material absorbs 10x its own weight & leaves no streaks or smears: it does what it says it does! I was skeptical at first but seeing it in action made a believer out of me.I have recommended this mop system to family and friends because it does work. I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

This is a great set of four beer glasses, We have company a few times a week and we now serve beer with these glasses. They are good for serving company, it makes it much nicer than can or bottled drinks. My husband actually prefers his beer in a glass as opposed to a bottle or can. He says you can taste it better that way. I agree, drinking from a glass opens up so many new characters to a good beer. From the appearance to the smell there are so many more qualities to appreciate. I have enjoyed good beer for a long time but have really gotten serious about tasting in the past year. I always go for a glass now. These glasses are great for anytime you want to enjoy the taste of a good hearty beer. They are the right size to hold a full bottle of beer, and love the double thick bottoms on these glasses,it makes them nice quality glasses.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I am a short and plus sized and I find capris to be hard to find that fit comfortably on me. I read some of the reviews for these pants and they stated that the sizes ran short so I went with the bigger size. When I tried it on, it fit in the waist just fine, however if I was taller than my 5' 3" height the calf area would not fit me as the area is too tight. I got the grey/black color because it would match most shirts. I do like the fact that there are pockets and drawstring. Made of nice. breathable material; 60% Cotton/40%Polyester.These are comfy to wear around the house, sleeping, or exercising, all of which I did. I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

This is a very nice and thick leather leash. The clasp is made out of brass and very easy to open and close, definitely not cheaply made.  I like the brown and cream, dual  colors and the braiding on the leash, it enhances the look and the quality of the leather. This leash is 6 feet By 3/4 inches long. It is a great lead for training, walking and running medium and larger breeds of dogs. The best thing I like is the padded handle, it really helps and comes in handy when you are walking larger dogs for added comfort on your hands. I have gotten lots of compliments on this leash and refer them to this one.

One of our cats seems to be sensitive to the kitty litter we have used for awhile.  We usually use clumping Tidy Cat for multiple cats. It was awful, messy, and stinky.  This is much better than that ever was.  There are no terrible smells.  There is no tracking of kitty litter everywhere.  It clumps.

I really like carrying salads with me for lunch.  Using a jar is a great idea.  I have a number of this size mason jars that I can pre make-up 6 salads or so for fast food meals.  That way, anytime someone wants a quick meal, they can just grab one.  I prefer those jars.  I have small Tupperware containers that I can carry dressing in.  I know there is a convenience to plastic jars and that they are less worrisome to carry; however, I still like glass for food, not plastic.I have found that it is useful to chop things up to smaller pieces when putting them in jars and to layer them.  I usually just put things in that I like.  I have a lot of interesting recipe books but a salad is often a salad.  It is best if you put the things in you know you like.

My husband likes a really plain planner.  He doesn’t want any fancy sayings or designs on it, no thought for the day, no funny business.  This one has some yellow highlights throughout but it is mostly pretty simple.  My husband also only uses it a planner for two or three months before he leaves it somewhere and forgets.  It’s not rocket science, but he keeps most information in his head.  Well, he did.  He has learned I feel no obligation to go along with anything that isn’t on the family calendar.This calendar is exactly right for him. He does not have the problem with the Sunday starts the week of the month and Monday starts the week in a weekly calendar.

I tend to need to make plans while I am out for the day and it is handy to have the right size calendar in my purse.  It lets me see general information but to make more particular decisions. I tried to use my phone calendar for a long time but it really is useless:  it mostly just told me places I was supposed to already be at.This is the right size for quick notes on the weekly pages.  That makes it great for a purse.

I like dimmable lights as much as the next guy but a part of me has to wonder why they bother.  It takes sooooo long for one of the low wattage light bulbs to get any where near being as light as a, well, light, why on earth would anyone want to encourage it to stay dimmed?We still have track lighting from the 80s and it is wonderful with all like 3000 watts all lit up. As you can see, it is a process.The lower electricity bills, though?  I love those.

While I was India, I was taught that Paisley was invented by Mumtaz Mahal, who looked at the impression her elbow had left on the grass and said that was the design she wanted on cloth.  She is remembered for many things but sadly, not paisley.This is a pretty cover.Anyway, the boxes on this calendar are backwards.  Every hour in the weekly calendar is boxed but not the days in the month.  I like boxes on my days of the month.  And why is Sunday the first day of the week on monthly calendars, but Monday on weekly?

This is my favorite design of all the calendars that I looked at or selected this year.  The color is bright and fabulous.  I have used Franklin Covey planners for years and the issue has become same old, same old.  I have been using the same binder anyway, and it about ten years it may amortize.  Until then it is the holder of much useful information that is not allowed with me in the car.I like these calendars for several other reasons, one being cost.  It is easy to have several calendars for different uses.  I have a calendar for workout schedules that is rather detailed, and another for children, as between band and soccer and football, it can get rather complicated.I did not especially like the inside design of this.  The monthly calendar is not boxed and it starts with Sunday, as most do.  The weekly calendar starts with Monday.  I do like the columns for the days of the week.  I wish that they gave an actual column for Saturday and Sunday as, well, some of us work on these days.
