The text that attempts to describe the processes of these basics isn't even clearly written and uses terms that are not defined or explained in any depth. Important basic topics are given minimal coverage, yet the book spends time on techniques and skills that would not be needed until the new knitter reaches an intermediate or advanced level all the while jumping from one topic to another with little logical organization or focus. An example of this would be the short section describing how to do a cast-on, then jumping to how to cast-off without first having the beginner learn the actual knitting part that goes in between the two: the knit stitch and the purl stitch.There is no discussion of even the basics of choosing appropriate yarn and needles for a beginning project beyond a mention that there are different kinds of yarn with different textures and weights. There is no mention of what any of these are or what differences there might be or how it would effect the results of a knitting project. There is no suggestion of how to choose the correct size needle for various weights of yarns and yarn types.In addition there are no patterns given, not even for a simple beginner's scarf. Certainly there is no guide here for a beginner to help in creating any sort of patterns much less amazing ones.There are many more useful, well-written ebooks to help beginners learn how to knit. I would recommend that those wishing to learn take a look at How to Knit for Beginners: 9 Free Tutorials eBook by Prime Publishing, The Beginners Guide to Knitting: Learn How To Knit The Easy Way by Lilly Jones, or the (3 BOOK BUNDLE) "Beginners Handbook of Knitting Stitches" and " How to Knit Scarves" and "How to Knit Socks": Learn How to Knit Quick and Easy knitting series written by Chloe Thompson. All of these books contain close-up photographs and diagrams plus detailed step-by-step instructions for each part of the knitting process. Any of these would be more likely to help a beginning knitter learn the needed skills for successful results and to start off with an enjoyable hobby with fewer frustrations and misunderstandings of essential techniques.Not recommended.

A quiet summer weekend becomes an effort to survive when the metro Seattle area is hit by a major earthquake. Rescue efforts swing into action, aided by a network of ham radio operators and a mysterious helicopter whose owners have their own agenda.The prime focus of this book is the devastating effects that would be caused by a major earthquake, especially in the downtown and surrounding areas. There is also a parallel story line about the search for a long-missing person by a detective agency that seems to be bolted onto the earthquake and recovery action simply as a device to explain the presence of the agency's team and helicopter in Seattle at the time of the earthquake.I have never had the pleasure of visiting the Seattle area, so I can offer no opinion on the accuracy of the descriptions of the downtown area or surrounding terrain, but I am an amateur radio operator, so I feel qualified to comment on the major plot device concerning the emergency radio net that helped in the recovery effort. The activity described in the book is fairly representative of the types of radio traffic handled during emergencies by amateur radio networks and their volunteer operators. Perhaps reading these fictional accounts of what real radio amateurs do during emergencies will motivate some readers to investigate more about this useful hobby. I do have a major nit to pick about proper protocol though that was glossed over in the story. A net control operator cannot simply identify herself as "Net Control" constantly while handling traffic, but is required by regulations to use her call sign and to identify by that at least every ten minutes. Ironically one ham operator character was called out by another character for not identifying himself properly on a check-in, so that made the net controller's oversight even more obvious.The mystery of the missing person that was a sub plot in the book was very contrived and a rushed explanation at the end of the book of why the person had chosen to go missing was unsatisfying and confusing. It seemed as though it was an afterthought that was quickly wrapped up with little regard to whether any of it was well explained or logical. The book would have been better to have been separated into two books, one a disaster scenario of the earthquake where the detective team just happened to be caught and helped with rescues, and a second book that could have been about the missing woman and her background and could have been developed in an more orderly manner.Editing of the book could have used some improvement, especially in the over-use of capitalizations. Amateur radio operators, net control, dentist, and many other terms and titles used in the book are not proper nouns and should not have been capitalized. There were so many of these it got to be an irritating distraction to the flow of the story.In spite of the shortcomings, I'm giving the book four stars. Raising readers' awareness of the importance of being prepared for this and other types of emergency situations is a major reason for the rating plus there were many characters in it worth following in their struggle to get out of the danger zone safely and to survive. Yes, the book could use some cleanup and some improvements, but the basics of a good story are still in there and worth the reader's time.Mildly recommended.

Negative campaign ads, dirty dealing, and sometimes even murder. Any tactic is fair game to capture the prize of a congressional seat or even the White House. Political campaign consultant Frank Miles finds out the hard way just how far some of his clients and their opponents will go when one of his partners is found dead in his office and campaign files are missing.This book has the elements of both a murder mystery and a complex political thriller. There is a peek into the world of political campaign advertising and spin, but the main focus is the tracking down of a political operative who has been committing murders, and following the leads to find who is pulling the strings for the cover-ups.There are plenty of characters to keep up the reader's interest including the main character Frank Miles, failed political candidate Ozzie Olson, and a pair of DC police detectives Randolph and Grimes. There are plenty of bad guys around as well, including an elusive killer and less-than-ethical politicians and their minions. Add in fast paced action to the mix of characters and you've got a winning combination that will keep the reader up late.Highly recommended.

Detective Frank McKenzie goes out on a call that at first seems to be a shooting and homicide near a local beer warehouse. It soon becomes a more complex case when the DEA gets involved because the warehouse contains bales of cocaine behind the cases of beer.Except for the bloody murder scene, this story could have been filmed as a modern day version of the Keystone Kops comedy. It's not that the story was written for laughs, it's just that the whole setup of the cops versus DEA agents versus the drug lords leaves the reader shaking his head at the seeming incompetence of the ones supposed to be the good guys. There is a lot of action going on in the story, but to little effect.Mildly recommended only as a quick distraction rather than as an engaging mystery or thriller.

The news is controlled by the government with only a limited number of approved television and radio networks allowed to operate and only disseminating approved content. A piece of highly damaging information about the current federal administration is passed along to a former highly popular news anchor, Brian Everett, who now needs to find a way to get this information out to the public ahead of the coming election. The President's staff will stop at nothing to prevent that from happening.This book paints a picture of a United States that is controlled by a number of amoral people in positions of power. Luckily it also contains characters who are willing to fight the status quo, who still remember the guarantees specified in the Constitution, and are also willing to put their lives on the line when it matters.The reader is taken on a wild ride back and forth across the country as the baton of information is passed along with merciless agents hot on the trail as the puppet masters control the search from Washington. Even if political conspiracies aren't your thing, this story is also a fast-paced, page-turner of an adventure thriller, and should appeal to anyone who enjoys the old spy thriller type of tale as well.On another level, this story is one of the people who put their lives and careers on the line to do what they know is right regardless of personal gain or loss. The duty and personal integrity of one set of characters battles the cruelty, greed, and overpowering desire for power of the other set which makes for a classic good versus evil morality tale.For those who have read the author's other political thriller, The Blood of Tyrants, please note that this novel is not a sequel of that book; this book takes place in a different setting and with new characters.Highly recommended.

The First Family is having issues; the First Lady Rebecca Gordon Tufts has received a blackmail note from her husband's mistress demanding a half million dollars in hush money. Not trusting members of the White House staff to deliver the money and keep quiet, she asks an old friend, retired policeman Dan Powers to come to DC to take care of the job as a personal favor.It's rare to find a book where almost every character presented is someone with no redeeming features, but this book manages to turn that trick. The only character the reader can actually cheer for is Dan Powers who ends up being the whipping boy for almost every one else in the story no matter which way he turns.The story itself is complex with a lot of twists, turns, and surprises with Powers using his experience as a big city detective to follow the clues and sort out these bad guys from the other bad guys. He suffers being shot, beat up, lied to, and betrayed by just about everyone yet he keeps on the case to root out the truth and identify the ultimate culprit amongst a whole cast of culprits.The real problems with the book are in the execution of the plot and the mechanics of story telling. There are many grammatical and typographical errors in the book which increase in number as the book progresses, as though the proofreader or editor gave up halfway through the job.Another glaring error is a disconnected plot point that seems to have gotten lost between one draft of the book and the final version regarding an apparently abandoned subplot of a drug problem that Rebecca Tufts had at one time. The drug in question, Librium, was mentioned twice as though the reader should already know the backstory and the character's relationship with it and how it caused another problem to occur, yet there is no such subplot to explain it. An editor should have caught this and corrected the problem either by omitting the references or directing the author to insert an explanation of the references possibly by restoring the original subplot to the book.The timeframe of the book is also a problem. There are hints in the text that make it seem to take place in a time just after the millennium without specifying the exact year, and yet there are technical points that would tend to indicate that it is not a present-day setting. There are mentions of a few popular personages such as Tom Brokaw and Oprah Winfrey to give it verisimilitude, but there are other details that make a major plot point difficult to believe if the story took place in a time after the year 2000. Information that would be common knowledge by that date and afterward was not known by the main character, and this lack of awareness put him at a disadvantage. I call foul since there is no way an experienced former detective would NOT have been aware of this specific fact and not have taken the necessary precautions to counteract it.The ending also is unsatisfying and incomplete with several plot resolutions left hanging.Not recommended.

Reporter Kat Archer is getting very tired of being assigned restaurant reviews for her newspaper, so she jumps at the chance to do an investigative piece when an anonymous caller asks her to meet him for a big breaking story. She gets more than she bargained for when she finds her informant dead at the meeting place. What was the information, and who killed the victim to keep him quiet?There are plenty of fun, likable characters introduced in this book, and each is a believable character rather than an exaggerated caricature as happens in many cozies.The book's mystery is actually two mysteries that are interwoven and makes for a complex set of relationships amongst the characters and possible suspects. There are lots of clues, lots of possibilities, and lots of possible perps to keep the reader off balance and sorting out the motives and and identity of the murderer or murderers.The one thing in the book that I found questionable as far as believability was that a small town could support not just one, but two daily newspapers. It's a minor suspension of belief the author asks the reader in which to indulge in return for a very engaging cast of characters and a challenging mystery.There is a sample of four chapters of Death by Pink Flamingo: A Pink Flamingo Hotel Mystery Book 1 (Hatter's Cove Mystery Series), a cozy mystery set in the same town as this book and featuring some of the same supporting characters.Recommended.
What can you say bad about a bag of candy? My students loved it.

Another great segment of the Landon series. The characters are so realistic. The interactions between them are natural and can be funny or serious. My only thing is I wish there was a bit of background from previous books to remind me of what happened. I forgot all about Wyatt and how Josie and Cooper got together. Don't need a lot, a few sentences would help. This story had plenty of bullet flying action, some really bad guys and a teaser for the next book.

Good story that kept my interest. Very emotional for main characters. The only thing that kept getting under my skin was that awful Cindy. There was plenty of action, ranch life scenarios, horses and steamy bedroom scenes. Some spelling errors but all in all, a good read.

These are nice earpods. They stayed in my ears while riding my bike. Definitely not the same quality as Apple brand but we seem to lose/break these at an alarming rate so they'll work fine as back up. I received this item at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

This is a really nice spatula. It works for pancakes as well as flipping stuff in hot oil. The spatula part is flexible and the whole thing is very sturdy. I received this item at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

This story seems to be getting back to the old Jess. The best part was having Reedy and Bodine riding along. The interaction among the three was touching at times with a good deal of humor. Hopefully they will be together again. This was Jess at his finest.

The first part started out okay but the more disasters they faced, the more you had to suspend reality to get through it. It started with her being super rancher woman after only spending like a month there. Then it went downhill with the whole snowstorm thing or her feeding the cattle by herself or worse, the bear in the cave. I'm not sure if the glaring impossibilities in the story are a result of horrible research or stupidity but I won't be looking for more from this author.

I love this little thing and it works great. I use it with calm breathing oils or something like that to help us sleep at night. The different lights it has are really fun. If you'd rather not have your room lit up, you can shut that part off.

I'm really satisfied with this set. For seven bucks, I wasn't sure what to expect but I needed something that would hold up to the kids in my class. These are sturdy plastic and so far they're doing what they're supposed to. I think they're better quality than the PlayDoh brand.
Good characters, lots of action. I would recommend reading previous books so you know the background and story on the characters in this book.

I was a little surprised at the direction this one was going and had to take a peek at the ending to see what happened. Shouldn't have been surprised that Jess took the high road to protect someone dear to him. This story showed Jess is still a caring person on the inside, even though he keeps knocking off the bad guys. He's got real feelings and concerns and was looking to the future when life got in the way.

This story was too boring for me. There was too much of the same things from previous books. I felt like I knew what was going to happen before it ever did. Still like that Jess always get his man, or men, but there was just nothing in this particular story that drew or kept my interest.

Four stars overall for the set. This was a good selection of books from various authors that allowed you to get a sample of their writing style. I didn't read Haunted Knights because the description did absolutely nothing for me. My Noble Knight and The Whispering Knight were solid four stars. Lots of action, kept my interest, good characters. I found A Knight's Seduction to be kind of boring. The story revolved around their time after he takes the castle and his angry storming around got old fast.

This book kept me up into the wee hours of the morning to finish it. It made me cry which I rarely do over a book, and was filled with the usual intrigue, suspense, terrific romance, gallant knights that KLV is known for. It was wonderful reading about old friends from previous books, especially Devereaux and Davyss. The main characters had so much emotion toward each other and internally. Good story, great characters~Now to figure out where to begin if I wanted to read the books about de Lohr, de Winter and de Wolfe in order....

This is a great moisturizer. I was so pleased as it doesn't leave my face greasy, oily or shiny. It has a cool little pump thing that dispenses the product. It spreads nicely over my skin and leaves my skin really soft. I received this item at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

This is a really nice mask. It's light but left my skin feeling moisturized. This was a totally new way to use a mask for me. It didn't turn colors or become stiff. It was a soft feeling that you couldn't even tell I had on. When it was time to wash it off, it was so easy. It was just like washing off regular facial cleanser. I received this item at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

Very pleased with this item. They go on smoothly and are easy to wipe off with a damp cloth. I used them on the classroom windows and chalkboard. The colors are really bright. My students love them. I received this item at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

This could have been a good book but it lacked character development and had no real excitement. It's squeaky clean, as advertised, but too short. Charlotte left the orphanage, met her future husband and that was pretty much it. It needs a touch of action or intrigue or something to keep the reader interested.

I didn't get this for the anti-cellulite properties but instead for the way coffee scrubs make my skin so much softer. I could tell right after I used it that the skin was much smoother and looked brighter. I was especially pleased my legs were so much softer and not dry. Maybe the best part was that it didn't leave a greasy feeling to my skin as other scrubs have. Trying to get it out of the package was not the best. I received it at a discount in exchange for an honest review

Our Papillon started biting his back feet to the point there's hardly any fur on one. After ruling out any medical issues I knew we needed something to stop him from chewing on them. Decided to give this a try and one spray on each foot is all it took. I watched as he got ready to chew and it was literally one bite/chew and no more. I kind of felt guilty for the poor guy but it was for his own good. I received this item at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

This book was so ridiculously simple and elementary, it was painful to make it to the end, and it was only 70 some pages. It had nothing to do with the fact it was a novella, it was the writing. I'd say it was written for a seventh grader, but that would kind of be an insult to seventh graders.

Two stars only because the story itself is different and there's a message in it. The writing was difficult to follow because there was little or no background to the characters until you get well into the story and then things come out here and there. Characters are introduced and then you have to wait and find out who they are.Find an editor or have someone proofread it at least! There were way too many missing words, spelling errors and even Matt's name was misspelled. It's an insult to the reader. There's a good deal of preaching and scripture in the second half of the story.I found the whole story to be unrealistic and unbelievable.

Bandages. Lots and lots of them. They come in a handy little, very sturdy pouch. All the common sizes are included, the round dots and tiny rectangle ones we rarely use and then lots of the bigger, standard size. They seem to be of good quality.I got this item at a discount in exchange for an honest review.
These are nice little building pieces. I also use them for counters and bingo markers in the classroom. Took quite a while to get them from China and they're plastic but they do the job.
Good product. I like how it smells, it washes off easily and leaves my skin smooth. Takes off eye makeup, too.

I don't know how to say this gently, so here goes. This is one of the worst stories I've read in a long, long time. The characters were one dimensional, it was beyond predictable and cheesy as all get out. It was more like a history essay was written and then someone decided to put in a bit of a romance between the chapters. Seriously, it was chock full of history, which is fine, if it were a history text! And it jumped around so much, it didn't make sense.  I went back and looked at the five star reviews and it's so obvious several are friends or family of the author. Even though it was short, it wasn't worth the time it took to read it.

No problems with the figures. Got them for my students to play with during free time and they were affordable compared to the name brand. Didn't have any issues putting them together and they were all different.

Terrific game. Got this for one of my adult kids and their friends. It was a good deal because you get expansions along with the original game. They love it. We've been playing it as a family for years.
Good quality. Just the right height on my ankle.
What can I say? They're addictive. Dogs love 'em, too, but they give them bad breath.

The description sounded good but the delivery wasn't what I was expecting. There was entirely too much miscommunication between the main characters. They fought too much after she was an adult and it just got old. The ending felt rushed. I wouldn't recommend it.

Decent story. Good action, intrigue and hero. Chance Thorne, good guy, hunting down bad guys. Story line kept my interest and the plot was not the typical shoot 'em up, ride off in the sunset. There was a Native American aspect to it that brought light to how they were cheated out of their hunting grounds.It didn't get a higher rating because the book needs an editor. There were too many phrases that felt forced to make it sound like the old west. Hotel rooms in 1869 Oregon would not have cost $26. Brood cow was highly overdone. If I read the term brood cow one more time I was considering flinging my Kindle. Well, not really, but they could be referred to simply as cows. These gripes may sound trivial but I like things to be accurate when I read it.

These are good quality, bath poufs. They work great to put in gift baskets and use for stocking stuffers. They seem to be made well and are very colorful! I received this item at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

The kids in my class now have way more area to build and play. You really can't tell a difference between these base plates and Lego brand.I received this item at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

This is a terrific item! They work just fine with Legos and make way more room for the students in my classroom to build and play. It even comes with extra bricks.I received this item at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

These are terrific teethers. I actually got them for a student in my special education classroom who chews on everything and they work. They're colorful and easy to wash.I received this item at a discount in exchange for an honest review.
Seems I'm not as enthusiastic about this book as so many others. I found it to be boring, drawn out and just not that great. Didn't hate it, didn't love it and wouldn't recommend it.

This was one of the most difficult books I've ever read. It jumped all over the place and the characters were flat and boring. The time was kind of mixed up. One minute you're reading about Alexandra doing something and the next page it's someone else doing completely with no transition, no build up, just jumping around. Potential Spoiler *** The ending was crazy with the whole deal with Thomas' mother and the grandfather.

I think I've found one of the worst books ever, or set of books or whatever it's marketed as. The books end at 59% on my Fire and then you get a freebie and some excerpts from other books. When I began reading the first story, it sounded familiar and about three pages in I realized it was offered as a stand alone and I already read it. Or make that tried to read it.If you set aside the above and look at the writing, it's awful. There is no character development, the story is all over the place, there's no background and it's not true to the period. For example, they did not call them a police force whenever this was supposed to have occurred. Add the many spelling errors and you have a really terrible book.I skimmed them all, which was easy since some pages had only four or five lines. I can't stress enough how bad the writing was. I'm amazed that anyone would even put it out for others to read.

This is a really a terrific product! It's rechargeable, which is a huge plus and it really works. It's so easy to use and easy to clean. You can rinse it under water.I received this item at a discount in exchange for an honest review.
Had this on a back country hike and if we weren't so hungry, probably would have pitched it. The flavor is so so but the texture is beyond disgusting, kind of like runny paste. Won't try it again.

I was very skeptical of this product because it did sound too good to be true. I'm pleased to report it's working great! We have these awful cricket-like things that have huge legs. My kids used to call them the jumpy bugs.They practically invade our garage about this time every year. With dogs and kids, I didn't like spraying too many toxic things so I've tried all kinds of 'natural' and organic stuff with no luck. I sprinkled some of these pellets near the garage door into the house and haven't seen a single one. I just sprinkled more on two ant hills in my yard and they're already diminishing. Can't wait to try them on the gophers.I received this product at a discount in exchange for my review.

I needed something for my computer chair and this cushion works great! My legs don't get tired when I sit for long periods and it's so soft and comfortable. It's a good size and snaps back to the original shape when I'm not using it.I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

I'm obviously in the minority for not really liking these books. I read the prequel and although it very predictable, I was curious what the boys' stories were. They had too much of a modern feel to them for me. Even though the descriptions were of the time, I didn't get the feeling it was the late 1800s. I think it was the way they talked.I liked the boys, handsome, strong, cowboys but felt their mother was crazy, but she was described as caring and loving. She was overbearing, manipulative and controlling. I forgot which other woman was portrayed as weak and having to take to her bed when anything happened, maybe Grace's mom. I didn't care for either of them.There were many misused words sprinkled throughout. Finally, there is no book 1 that I can see. It goes from the prequel listed as 0 to book 2. In the description for book 3 Ashley's name is Adam. May not be a big deal to most, but shows lack of attention to detail.

This thing really works. The cats don't care for a brush that much, but love to be petted. Removes lots of hair and with three of them, it's a never ending battle to keep the hair at bay.I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

This is a great example that a romance doesn't need lots of graphic bedroom scenes to be a very romantic story. If that makes any sense. The story was realistic and the characters were like real people. There wasn't a lot of misunderstanding or ridiculousness often associated with this genre. It was enjoyable to see Kurt realize what he had right in front of him and to watch Penny understand she was more than her mother's daughter.

I don't know how else to put this but this book was terrible. There was no character development and it made no sense. The worst part was that it jumped around with no lead in between chapters. It was painful to try and get through it and it was only fifty pages.

Well written, highly emotional story of intrigue and suspense set during the Civil War. It would have been a five star read but it dragged a bit at times and some of the scenarios were a little out there. I live in Northern VA and have visited many of the Civil War battlefields mentioned as well as the areas Cassie traveled. The historical aspect is highly accurate.The author gave the reader a glimpse of the tough life soldiers endured when injured. She was able to put the reader in the story with larger than life descriptions. I'll admit about half way through I had to read the epilogue to see how it turned out because it took an unexpected turn. Can't say more for fear of giving too much away. Recommend to historical fiction and Civil War fans.

I didn't like this book at all. It wasn't that horrifying and it was far too unbelievable. Fortunately I got it free or I would have been really upset considering it ended at 75% and the rest was a preview of another book.
Decent tasting, easy to prepare. We wrap these in tortillas and it makes a great breakfast to start the day hiking.

I got this book because I run a business from my home and as you may know digital technology plays a major role in reaching your target audience around the world.  I had heard about Periscope, but I didn't know exactly how to use it in a beneficial way for my business.  Periscope Your Biz gave me the run-down from A to Z on how to use it.  Shanda Trofe writes with enthusiasm about how she has used it in her business and how others have been successful using this tool.In Chapter 1, Trofe gives a detailed overview of what Periscope is, its roots, and what it can do for my business.  I learned that I can use it to promote my products and services in a way that is more personal and defined.The following chapters takes you step-by-step through the process of downloading the app and preparing it for use, including the settings and credentials and such.  This book is a superior guide because it literally holds your hand throughout the whole process from:Getting viewersSetting up your cameraHow to handle trollsBroadcasting tipsAnd mistakes to avoidI recommend this book to anyone who wants to educate themselves in order to take their business to a more visible and lucrative level.  Trofe's writing style flows and is easy to comprehend and she gets right to the point without unwanted fluff.  Two thumbs up from me!

There is a pond in our neighborhood and my son and I go there quite a bit to spend some time together, however, fun can always be kicked up a notch.  I received the Ginzick 4ch RC Remote Control Boat and we set out for an afternoon of high speed fun.  Installation of the battery was easy and it t took us a little less than and hour and a half to charge.  The instructions are enclosed and were detailed enough to where my son could operate the boat all by himself.This remote controlled boat is a blast!  We really enjoyed using all four speeds and using the controls was a no-brainer.  The ducks on the pond didn't know what to do (no harm came to the ducks during our play).  The other kids were so excited and interested that they just had to know where we bought this speedy little boat from.  We even had a man come over an inquire about it as well because he said it looked like we were having too much fun.This is a nice toy that I think is wonderful for any fun-loving kids and adults alike.  Easy to set up and a blast on the water.  Two thumbs (one from me and one from my son) up!***I received this product in exchange for my honest and unbiased review

If you are trying to get pregnant and don't want to spend a ton of money on ovulation tests AND pregnancy tests, then this is the product you should buy.  I received three bags of product in one order, which is more than enough to make sure you safely and accurately plan a healthy pregnancy.  The test strips for both tests read fast and clearly, and you don't have to urinate a ton to get an accurate result.  The enclosed instructions are simple to read and follow, so they is no room for human error and you can do this in the privacy of your own bathroom.The amount that you receive is great for those who, like myself, have irregular menstrual cycles.  You can test and test again and not have to worry about running to the drug store to buy more.  This product saves time, money, and disappointment.  Great quality for the price, worth every dime.***I received this product in exchange for my honest and unbiased review

I read book analyses and companions because they always give me a better understanding of the book and more insight into things like symbols and motifs, which I seem to totally suck at recognizing.  To Kill a Mockingbird has been one of my favorites ever since I read it in middle school.  It is one of the greatest pieces of literature, but I never really grasped its true meaning.To Kill a Mockingbird AfterRead has helped me get a deeper and clearer understanding of this prolific novel.  What I liked about this book analysis is that is uniquely looks at specific parts of the book such as:- Possible Storyline for a Prequel- The Evolution of Rape Law in the USWhat really got me thinking was the chapter titled, "Imagining Alternate Endings" in which it provokes deeper thought.  Like, "...what if they found the defendant Tom Robinson not guilty?" or what if Tom were left-handed instead of being cripple?I know I have more clarity into a book that I have loved for decades and I recommend this book to anyone that may be in a book club, a fan, or even a student.  Two thumbs up!

I started my spiritual journey over two years ago and although I have growth and learned quite a bit, I know there is still much to be attained.  This is the very reason why I purchased The Art of Living, because there are no accidents in this Universe because when the student (myself) is ready, the teacher (Kelly Ashley in this case) always appears.My daily meditations often seek the guidance of my angels and/or spirit guides and as Ashley experienced in her own journey, she did not know the meaning of some of the messages that were related.  Ashley's account into her spiritual journey has lit yet another light unto my feet along my path.  I really liked how she presented her experience in a conversational manner, it made the reading flow so that I could really ascertain.In Chapter One, when she says, "I've wanted to have someone to talk to.  I've wanted to have someone to guide me, and above all I've wanted to believe that I'm not alone."  I understood exactly what she meant because that is what I have been grappling with for so long.There are nineteen chapters of enlightenment that will help anyone willing and open to learning and I have most certainly grown in leaps and bounds since reading this.  Infinite gratitude to Ashley for writing such a open, clear, and concise writing of just a slice in her life's journey!  A great read!

Jackson is back at it again with another book crammed with all the things I love about romance novels, except with "When a Taker Dreams,"  it kicks thing up a notch quite a bit.Cierra is character that has a common dilemma that many women have and that is finding Mr. Right.  Her mom, Ada, is like many moms wanting her daughter to find security first and worry about the love later.  With this kind of pressure, Cierra decides to take a leap of faith with a wickedly sexy man named Ryker that "seems" to be up to no good.No spoliers here, but this tales get better by the chapter and before you know it, you are caught up in a whirlwind of hot lust, passion, desire, danger, a bit of humor, and best of all intrigue.I thoroughly enjoy Jackson's novels because her characters and story lines are so relateable and the plots are beautifully twisted.  If you love novels that keep you wanting more, then check out this one...it'll leave your fingers steaming!

I have a son that is about to start applying for his first job, so I thought a book like this would help guide him on this journey that can be quite daunting.  I run a business from my home and do not have much experience with applying for jobs, so I was delighted to see that this book details every aspect of how to get a job in 30 days or less.This book is good for those who may be new to the job market (such as my son) or those who may have been out of work quite a while.  I found the most helpful chapters of the book to be:- Top 3 Mistakes Job Seekers Make- 3 Key Steps to Get a Job- How to Set Job Goals & Develop Your Plan- How to Write and Format an Effective Resume & Cover LetterThis book has helped put the job market in perspective for my son and I was glad to be able to read through this book with him.  I recommend this book to other mothers and fathers like myself who want to put their kids on the right track and to those who may be lost in their search for a job.

Talking about pulling an all-nighter...this book had me up until the wee hours of the morning, untangling this tantalizing tale of betrayal and deceit.  Deception is the name of this game and Jackson wasted no time laying out a well-written plot that will leave you on the edge of your seat.  His development of characters like Nicholas, Lacey, Kienan and others was a reflection of the level of talent Jackson has in his literary art.I do not write spolier reviews, but if you like intrigue, suspense, seduction, betrayal, drama, and complexity, then Lovers, Players, and the Seducer is a must read.  I truly enjoyed this book and look forward to reading other twisted tales from Jackson.

3:59 Mins The Zen Mama Diaper Changing Kit will most certainly keep you Zen while you are out on the go with your little one.  Normal diaper bags can be big bulky, so this is perfect for a short shopping trip or visit.  My favorite features are:1. The really roomy pockets2. It repels dirt and is waterproof3. Holds four diapers and all the accessories you need while on the go4. The changing surface if huge and it guards your baby away from germs5. There are two way to carry it; either on your wrist or by the handle at the topMakes a great baby shower gift, or makes a great addition to your baby tool arsenal.  I like it because it is highly functional and you can even detach it into two sections for easier use.  I like to keep this in the trunk of my car for emergencies just in case I need extra diapers or wipes.  It's just really great to have and I give this a ten star mother's recommendation.***I was gifted this product in return for my honest and unbiased review.

4:48 Mins The Hercules Multi-functional tool has everything you need for a vast array of everyday uses in the palm of your hand.  It came with a pouch that can be worn along your belt or fits easily in a purse or the glove compartment of your car.  It has really cool features such as:- (3) Flathead screwdrivers (small, medium, and large)- Phillips screwdriver- A bottle opener- A saw- (2) pliers (regular and nipper)- Wire cutters- Awl- Knife- Can opener- RulerIf you like living off the grid or camping this is a must-have.  It is also ideal if you like having a set of tools on hand without lugging a heavy toolbox around.  I liked the fact that is it well-made with quality materials that do not rust or corrode over time.  It's lightweight and very easy to use.  The tools easily fold in and out when needed.I highly recommend this product and makes a great gift for either man or woman.***I was gifted this product in exchange for my honest and unbiased review

My job requires tons of verbal and written communication and my bread and butter rests on my effectiveness in this arena.  Mastering the Art of Effective Communication is one of those guides that will help you iron out all of the communication kinks in your life.  From Ineffective Communication to the Importance of Respect and a Good Attitude, Binary Codes, and How it is Isn't Always What You Say, But How You Say it, London covers it all in a way that is both engaging and easy to comprehend and implement.I recommend this to anyone, because we all have to learn how to communicate properly if we strive to be successful in anything that we do.  Two thumbs up for a very informative and helpful read.

5:36 MinsArgan Oil is the oil of all oils, so when I had a chance to review this product, I jumped on it!  What I love about W.C. Trading's Argan Oil is that it is 100% all-natural and organic.  This is top shelf Argan Oil that is not diluted like many you find on the market.  Argan oil is a super oil that nourishes, moisturizes, and promotes healthy cell production for both hair and skin.  I've used this product as:- A skin toner for my skin (which is instantly hydrating)- A moisturizer for my skin (adds a youthful glow)- A moisturizer for my cuticles- A massage oil for my scalpThis oil leaves my skin incredibly soft, supple, and it has a youthful glow.  It is neither heavy or greasy, so it is perfect for your hair.  This Argan oil is great alone and it can be used with carrier oils such as olive oil and coconut oil or combined with your favorite essential oils.  I used this oil with tea tree oil for my skin, which helps keep adult acne at bay.  I truly love this product and will be buying more in future.  I highly recommend this Argan oil to anyone who wants to a way to take care of your hair, skin, and nails the way Mother Nature intended.***I was gifted this product in return for my honest and unbiased review.

I use fresh dried herbs in my cooking, but I usually used kitchen shears to cut up the herbs to make my own spice/herb combinations for my dishes.  The blades are very sharp (be warned) and grinds herbs with magnificent ease. The result are herbs ground to the consistency comparable to herbs bought in a store. While grinding, I did not have to make the extra effort to keep the device together to prevent spillage, due to the magnetized closure...big plus in my book.  What I really liked about this product was that it has three chambers in which the herbs are ground, so I was able to use this on both fresh and dried herbs.  And the scraper included in very efficient and effective when it comes to gathering the resin or pollen.  The scraper gets right into all of the grooves and nooks and crannies.A great investment for anyone who relishes in fresh ground herbs.  I give this two thumbs up!***Product was received in exchange for my honest and unbiased review

It is always important for me to find the most natural supplements when it comes to my health and well being.  Ultimate Garcinia Cambogia by Pure Herbal Living has been a good addition to my health regimen.  What I have noticed since I have started taking this supplement is that:- My energy levels have increased (which is great because I still have enough energy at the end of the day to workout) - I'm not starving all day- I haven't craved my daily allowance of chocolate chips cookies- My overall sense of well being is positive and upbeatI believe this is because this formula is very potent.  I like the fact that there is enough pills in the body to last 45 days, rather than the normal 30 days.  I give this product a thumbs up and I recommend this product to anyone who wants to give their diet a very positive and productive boost!***I was gifted this product in return for my honest and unbiased review.

The title is a very good description of these earrings.  Simply marvelous...the flower design of the earrings are beautifully set with crystals that dazzle in the light.  Great quality and fit comfortably in my ears without pinching and they are rather light, so they do not weight the ear lobe.  The black crystals make them easy to go with almost anything you wear and jazz up the simplest of outfits.  To accompany the earrings, there is a cute little insert that details the care so they can last you quite some time.Overall, the earrings are gorgeous and I recommend them to any woman that loves beautiful jewelry at a price that doesn't break the bank.

Pure Vibrant Life's Colon Detox is the bomb!  I have been using it for the past week and I feel fantastic.  Sometimes your colon (like any other part of your body) needs to be cleansed, purified, and detoxed to maximize its function.  Since I have been using this product I have noticed that I have more pep in my step (meaning more energy) and I've lost a couple of pounds.This is just the beginning, but what makes this product really awesome is that is it packed with goodies from Mother Nature such as:African MangoFlax SeedPumpkin SeedAnd much, much more (19 all-natural, body-loving ingredients in all).  This product gets an A+ from me and I recommend this product to anyone who either; wants to lose weight in a way that naturally detoxes the body and to those who desire to lead a healthier life that is vibrant and lively.***I was gifted this product in return for my honest and unbiased review

3:43 Mins The Euro Spa LED Shower Head is a great addition to any home.  What I liked about this product from the start was that it will keep your children (and loved ones) from getting scalded in the shower using some pretty cool LED lights.  This can be especially helpful if you have gas water heater.  Installation was super easy and it comes with everything you need to have it hooked up in less than 10 minutes.  My son found this shower head to be highly entertaining...I had to drag him out of the shower.  The shower head turns red when the water is too hot and blue when the water is cool.  It also turns green when the water is nice and warm.For those who live in areas where the water is hard, this shower head included a filter that filters out all those icky impurities, leaving your skin soft.  There's no need to buy batteries, because this bad boy is powered by hydro (water) and the LED lighting lasts for ten years (or 100,000)...that's amazing.I highly recommend this product to anyone that:1.  Has children2.  Has an elderly loved one3.  Needs help gauging the temp of the water before entering the shower.Two thumbs up and a mother's glowing recommendation to a product that allows you to say, "good-bye" to scalding showers.***This product was gifted in exchange for my honest and unbiased review

This is one of my favorite accessories thus far for my 42mm Apple watch.  This sleek and stylish stand/charger is sturdy and it allows me to view my watch while it charges just in case a message, alert, or call comes through.  It holds the watch gently in place and allows you to route the cable along the backside of the charger so it does not get in the way or make you nightstand look cluttered with a wire.  It is mobile and compact enough for me to take it anywhere I choose.I recommend this charger to any Apple watch owner who loves cool gadgets.***This product was gifted in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

The Burley Brush is by far one of the sturdiest and strongest grill brushes I have yet to encounter.  Cleaning a grill WAS hard work, requiring lots of elbow grease, but this brush makes cleaning a breeze.  The handle itself is strong and extended so you can reach all the nooks and crannies on the grill, and there are three extra strong rows of bristled steel that no dirt or grime can withstand.I used the brush and it made my grill gleam like it did when I first bought it.  Superior quality and easy to use.  A must have for any grill enthusiast or anyone that owns a grill.  I give this two thumbs up and my highest recommendation!***This product was gifted in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Wonderful infusing water bottle.  It is easy to use and a great way to give your water a vitalizing vitamin boost.  I have used watermelon and cantaloupe in my bottle so far and the water is simply delicious! I love the way the fruit is suspended within the water, making every drop you drink flavorful and healthy.I highly recommend this product to anyone who is health conscious or just wants to give their water a little twist.  Plus, the bottle is made from 100% recyclable plastic and I love any product that is kind to Mother Nature.  Ten stars for a fabulous product!

Some say that this piece is a virtual follow-up to AMT's 'In C' (see my review) disc released awhile back on the Squealer label. Could not -get enough- of the sonic opener "In 0" as well as the awesome "In Z" or the wonderful ..... simply ambient / searing psychedelic closer "In Infinity". Duration: 74 minutes. Don't believe I've ever seen a CD like this one - with four tracks + all four clocking in at just over the eighteen-minute mark. Couldn't help but to notice that 'In 0 To Infinity' is rather a dark album - plus it possesses a good electronic drone vibe. A bit different than all the other -numerous- Acid Mothers titles out there. Maybe that's why I haven't heard many fans mention this particular AMT disc - when the subject comes up. Perhaps it's over (some) patrons and follower's heads. Don't get me wrong - still a fine CD to have.

Similar to the Acid Mother's 'IAO Chant From The Cosmic Inferno' (see my review) that was released awhile back. Another must-have CD title on the Riot Season label. Two tracks - clocking in at just under the twenty-minute mark. This piece most assuredly has AMT paying a most honorable heart-felt tribute to the cosmic entity - we know as Gong. Line-up: Kawabata Makoto - guitar, speed guru, voice, tape & tambour, Higashi Hiroshi - synthesizer, Cotton Casino - space whisper, Tabata Mitsuru (Boredoms, Zeni Geva) - guitar, synthesizer & maratab, Tsuyama Atsush - bass and Shimura Koji - drums.  A must-have / own / hear / experience effort to say the very least.

Here's an Acid Mothers Temple compilation that until here very recent, I wasn't aware of. 'Psychedelic Fiction Sauce Book' gives loyal fans a worthy collection of unreleased and alternate edits of some of the long-running noise-space rock band's better known tracks. For example, I got plenty out of the brain-sizzling "Dark Stars In The Dazzling Sky" as well as the awesome "Chinese Flying Saucer" (one of AMT's more recent fan favorites), the innovative (to say the least) "Nam Myo Ho Ren Ge Kyo, Part II" and the mind-altering "Cometary Orbital Drive" (absolutely dig the CD by the same title). Highly recommended.

'Benzaiten' is Acid Mother's 'In C' style personal tribute to two musicians - Kitajima Osamu and modern experimental classic music composer Takemitsu Toru (1930-1996) with over seventy recorded titles to his credit. Starts off with the awesome opening title cut "Benzaiten" that completely draws you in with it's wonderfully-presented sitar by Kawabata Makoto. Also was able to thoroughly enjoy the tripping "Benzaiten / Reprise Benzaitenshu" [written by the previously mentioned Kitajima Osamu]- perhaps the CD's best track, at least in my opinion. To bring this cosmically superb sixty-nine minute sonic journey to a close is the mind-altering "Benzaiten Coda". Whew! Truly, another very cool - happening trip brought to you by AMT. Definitely, a must-have.

Live - Acid Mothers CD that was recorded on tour when AMT was over here in the states during their 'The Other Side Of The Sky' spring, 2006. That was my second time of seeing the band. Just two tracks here - as I remember Kawabata Makoto and crew playing three actual songs in (clearly) a shorter length set than they often do. Regardless, it's all good - with the mind-frazzling "Dark Stars In The Dazzling Sky (aka Dark Star Blues" (14:29) and the so-typical Acid Mothers Temple concert staple "Pink Lady Lemonade" (24:49). Definitely, a should-have.

Being a limited edition of 500 physical copies - trust me when I tell you that this live LSD March disc is often hard-to find an actual copy of without spending an arm and a leg. Tunes here that I thought made this ~experimental psych~ CD worthy of purchasing were the eight-minute ass-kicking [psych] opener "Black Bouquet", the somewhat inspiring "The Lamp - Tomorrow's Goddard", the jamming "Yellow Sea", "1997", "Nude And Bizarre" and the earlier recorded (from a '97 gig) live version of "Black Bouquet" - personally I like it better than the first edit - which is from a live LSD March performance. Liked this CD more than I did their 'Uretakumo Nakunarutorika' effort (see my review). 'Live' features material from the 'Kanashimino Bishounen' and 'Shindara Jigoku' discs. Enjoy.

Earliest CD title by The Black that I was able to locate a physical copy of. Initially released on vinyl in 1994 as a limited edition of 668 copies on the Black Widow label - then umpteen years later - was reissued on CD. Loving this piece as I couldn't get enough of the one heck of a stunning opening title track "Refugium Peccatorum", the awesome "Mortalis Silentum", the -way- too short ass-kicking "Animae" (clocking in at just 2 1/2 minutes), the earth-shattering "Javunum II Versione", their superbly-played - Saint Vitus cover "Hallow's Victim" (most certainly did not expect this) and "Obscura Nocte". Highly recommended.

Released in 1996, and at least as good as The Black's later efforts - that I'm a bit more familiar with. Tracks here I was the most impressed with include "Primo Et Secondo Angelo", the six-minute rocker [hold onto your hat], "Inutile Pentimento", "La Bestia Che Sala Dal Mare" and the fist-pumping (so to speak) title cut "Apocalypsis". Line-up: Mario Di Donato - guitar & vocals, Enio Nicolini - bass, Massimilani Terzoli - keyboards and Gianluca Bracciale - drums. Also available on 12" vinyl lp with the collectable gatefold cover treatment. Overall, a nice find.

Definitely, The Black's lengthiest CD offering - clocking in at 77 minutes but then again, it is a 2-on-1 where we get two of the Italian doom metal band's lp's on a single CD - 'Peccatis Nostris' and 'Capistrani Pugnator' (see my review of the lp edition). Both titles were released in 2004. As for 'Peccatis Nostris' (English translation: Our Sins), I got the most out of the bootie-stomping opener "Pigritia" (obviously a strong Black Sabbath influence present), the rocking eight-minute "Superbia", "Luxuria", the heavy and [truly] inspiring "Gula" and the well-played seven-minute "Ira". Healthy dose of prime Italian doom metal. An absolute must-have.

Here's a title by those Italian doom metal merchants - The Black - that I initially was not even aware of. Believe it is available on vinyl lp only. Tunes here that definitely managed to lure me into the band's realm as to what they're all about were the cool instrumental opener "Kardiophylax", the eight-minute (stunning) "Praetutii", "Miserere" and the ass-kicking fifteen-minute title track "Capistrani Pugnator" - in which happens to take up the entire side two of the album. Through out all five of this lp's foundation-rattling cuts, I for one really dug the several fine instrumental segments that definitely add something great to this must-have lp.

I actually had the privilege of experiencing Huw Lloyd Langton playing live here in the Midwest when he was support for Nektar and Brainticket on the historic 'Space Rock Invasion Tour' a couple of summers ago. Personally, I got more out of disc one - with his two re-working of a couple of Hawkwind gems - "Rocky Paths" and the (always, great to hear) "Hurry On Sundown" as well as a handful of his tunes from his two lesser-known post-Hawkwind bands he was in - Magill ('73) and Jawa ('79) with Nic Potter and Simon King. Also dug his cover of a tune we all know from Eric Burdon "Don't Let Me Be Understood". Disc two is nearly as good - with all instrumentals  which gives us -key- tracks from his 'Night Air', 'Chain Reaction' and 'Hard Graft' CD's as well as six all-new acoustic tunes. An astounding two-and-a-half hour piece of the late Hawkwind / Widowmaker / Lloyd Langton Group guitarist work to thoroughly enjoy and remember him by. Definitely, a must-have.

More, like an expanded 2-CD reissue of the (often hard-to-find) Hawkwind's 'Space London 1972' or the 'BBC Radio One Live In Concert' (see my reviews of both) only better. Looks like this must-own 'At The BBC - 1972' 2-CD piece has an entire disc of this essential HW live material that has never been released before. Comes with a 10-page CD booklet - with several vintage concert pics - that I don't remember seeing anywhere else. Highly recommended - especially for the completists and die-hard fans. Irresistible cover + I just still much prefer a physical copy of such.

Corpus Christi - garage rock band's only full CD that is most likely their complete repertoire or (at least) a good most of it. Compilation features tracks that are from 1967-69. Tunes that did it for me are the familiar-sounding rocking "I Can See", their well-done Yardbirds cover "The Nazz Are Blue", the foot-stomping "Big Boss Man", the bluesy ass-kicker "Al's Blues", "Look For Tomorrow", the inspirational title cut "Reality Is The Only Answer" and "Naw, Naw, Naw". Liberty Bell was notably launched by their record label back then Cee-Bee Records to be that of a Texan styled Yardbirds. Recommended for fans of Mouse & The Traps, Blues Magoos, Chocolate Watchband and Barry And The Remains.

Initially released in 1980, as this was the band's sole record that was notably put out in a limited quantity of 500 copies. Best described as well-produced well-played instrumental jazz rock - to thoroughly soak in. Couple of tracks worth mentioning are the soothing "Kernein", "Vurz Im Morgangrauen", "Paulchen", "On My Way To Ubermorgan" (awesome keyboards), the eight-minute "Seiben Plus Bossa". Also dug several of this lp's CD reissue's nine added bonus cuts - like the "Sir Jerry", somewhat innovative "Schmalzer" and "Rush Hour In Madrid". CD duration is clocked in at 80:33. Something I haven't seen too often. Original vinyl album copies of 'Ubermorgan' is said to be in fair demand among connoisseurs and collectors. Have to admit that this piece isn't exactly my thing, but it's definitely consistent.

Initially saw the light of day in 1970, as this was the Oxfordshire, UK's folk rock collective's only record. Maybe not my cup of tea, but I have to admit that 'Midsummer's Night Dream' is much better than I was expecting. Tracks here that most assuredly did it for me were the beautifully arranged opener "Nottanum Town", the really nice acoustic piece "Peggy", the nine-minute jazzy "The Hunt" (good violin solo), "Time Past, Time Come" which - respectfully employs stellar flute, bass, violin and acoustic guitar and the eight-minute "Minas Tirith". Recommended for fans of Broselmaschine, Eela Craig and possibly Annexus Quam.

Originally released in 1979,  as this was Pancake's third and final lp - see my reviews of their first two records 'Roxy Elephant' ('75) and 'Out Of The Ashes' ('77). Best described as progressive. Liked the first couple of tracks - I especially thought that "Just Miss Your Smile" and "Fire And Rain Song" were well-played, as I thoroughly enjoyed the nine-minute "Dream Delta Land" and the rocking "I Try". Plus, the six added bonus cuts (notably unreleased material from 1980 perhaps an unfinished Pancake fourth lp) are definitely a fine addition to this welcomed CD reissue. Check out their live cover of "Hey Joe". Recommended for fans of Eloy, Soft Machine and perhaps Anyone's Daughter or Hatfield & The North.

Live show from the band's final tour in 1972 of Italy. Nice to hear this previously unreleased live Out Of Focus CD - especially after taking in the first two German jazz / fusion /psych lp reissues 'Wake Up' ('70) and their self-titled record ('70) - see my reviews of both. Tracks that notably did the most for me were the somewhat innovative opener "Whispering", the twelve-minute rocking (so to speak) "I Want To See Your Face No More", the twenty-minute epic "Fly Bird Fly / Television Program" and the astounding closer - definitely possesses an early '70's feel to it "I'm Kissing Right" - as the cut progresses, some unexpected and somewhat annoying (?) vocals take you by surprise - but rest assure 'Palermo 1972' is still a fine pick. Might appeal to fans of Eiliff, Pierre Moerlen's Gong, Univers Zero or Brainstorm.

To avoid any and all confusion, this is the short-lived German band that released two lp's during their brief existence - 'Revelation' (early '71) and 'Thoughts' (late '71) then later - Garden Of Delights put out this CD of their unreleased material. Although they've so often been tagged as krautrock - Virus is actually more in the hard rock psych vein. Didn't realize it at first, but 'Remember' was recorded at a live shindig in Koln on April 28, 1973 for WDR radio show. It looks like all of the nine tracks on this CD are exclusive to this piece. Starts off with "Everybody Knows That I've Got This Feeling", the awesome "There Is No Anarchy", the title track "Remember" and "In Any Way" are basically - very high energy - well-played rock 'n roll. Some of the vocals sort of maybe remind me of early Traffic and the guitar brings to mind - perhaps Ten Years After. "Rock 'N Roll" is a very good bluesy tune. Also got a lot out of "King Heroin" and the ten-minute instrumental "Woods Fun". This disc would've made a great soundtrack for the first 'Fritz The Cat' movie. Should draw in fans of Frumpy. Gomorrha, Uriah Heep and 2066 And Then. A definite should-have.

Another must-have archive live CD release on the Garden Of Delights label. Show was recorded live on November 4, 1972 at the Assembly Hall in Wiesbaden, Germany. According to the liner notes, an appreciative crowd of about 300 shows up. Three lengthy tracks to thoroughly absorb - as with most early live Guru Guru performances. First, there's "Oxymoron" (28:32) which is great to experience but after around eight minutes - the trio goes into another song - I cannot say for sure what tune of theirs it is - but it's more in the bluesy progressive vein. Still brilliant, rest assure of that. Next, it's the awesome "Baby Cake Walk" (23:50) which is a true -classic- Guru Guru trip out and this disc's final cut is the band's staple "Ooga Booga" (22:05). Believe that to this very day, founder Mani Neumeier and crew still plays this krautrock gem - live. Comes with an irreplaceable 30-page CD booklet - written in both English and German. Highly recommended.

Looks to be Spirits Burning's tenth actual CD. Tracks that I thought made this title a worthy pick include "Infinite City" (sort of reminded me of Gong), the rather inventive "Cool Can Of Cola On The Forehead" (as if the song title say enough), the beautiful "The Kingdom Of Music (Bons Sens Revisited)", "In Search Of Friends On The Day Of Masks" and "Bring It Down". Check out some of they -key- personnel for the making of this piece - Don Falcone - organ, bass, bird calls, electric piano, synthesizer & strings, Daevid Allen - mouth bass, guitar & vocals, Fabio Golfetti glissando guitar, Uto G. Golin - drums & vocals, Jerry Jeter - guitar, Adrian Shaw - bass, Don Xaliman - chimes & gongs, Daniel Todd Carter - table and Dan Romeo - synthesizer & tapes to name a few. A should-have.

As the price of good quality XL training pads continues to climb, I am happy to find a decent brand that doesn't wreck my budget. It is not the best on the market but pretty darn close considering the price of the 4 pack. The Iris pads look and feel a bit thin but don't let that fool you. Whatever they are made of still absorbs urine quickly (little to no pooling depending on the size of the dog) and holds as much as some of the costlier, thicker pads I have tried. I've noticed fewer edge spillovers and underpad wicking compared to my other favorite pad All Absorb, which is frequently out of stock.  Thankfully, odor is nicely controlled.

This nothing like I expected. I don't normally care for lemon in tea, but I love this blend. The mate flavor is very smooth and the lemon is very subtle. The is no bitterness or tang, just a gentile invigorating cup of tea. I drink it hot with a touch of sweetener. It has become my go-to afternoon pick me up in place of the caffiene harshness of late day coffee. If you are a Numi fan or already like drinking mate, this is yet another great blend to try.

This Belkin 4' cord works as expected. It both charges and syncs like the Apple cord that came with my iphone 5. The cord and insulation is thicker and seems more durable though. The 4' cord length works well for overnight charging where I don't need much length and won't be using the phone during charging.

I have used this brand of safety eyes in several of my crochet projects. The backs are easy to apply, and so far none have come loose or pulled out even with vigorous play by my grandchildren. There are various sizes sold separately. Just be sure that the backs are bigger than the spaces between your stitches or they will pull through. You could always pierce through the yarn itself if thick enough to be sure the eyes won't pull out.

This color play, Woods, is a dark combo of the earth tones black, browns, and grays. There was no green in my skeins. it handles and feels like the other Vanna's Choice yarns. It is a soft and easy to work with acrylic. There was very little splitting and no knots in the skeins I received. I would order this variety again.

I purchased this coffee on a lark when my usual kcup brand was running out. I was very surprised at how good it tastes. I use the medium cup size on my Keurig, and the flavor is full and robust, not watered-down like expected. There is a slight tannin bite, and a very slight bitterness found in most dark coffees. It stands up well to cream and sweetener, and if you like a good strong iced coffee, using the small cup setting this brand will not disappoint. I like it so much that I've added it to my monthly subscribe and save order.

This product performs well for its intended purpose. Up front the description notifies the user that the paper is thinner than the standard used for official documents and records. I use it at home for receipts and other documents for my own use. I find it perfect for the many crochet patterns I print. Seems like I am always finding new projects that I want to make "some day." With the thinner paper I can keep even more pages in my project notebooks.I have an Epson Inkjet printer. So far there have been no paper jams. The ink dries well and does not bleed. If.a pattern has a full color photo of the finished design, it may show through to the other side of a double-sided print, but for most jobs, especially gray scale printing, this is not an issue.

Cute and handy, this fits right on the front of the stroller and gives my grandson something to look at and play with. The only thing is that the dish is shallow but wide open so that if I fill it too full of light weight snacks like Cheerios they bounce out when moving along. It is well made so I'm not worried about it coming apart or having any piece break off.

My dog is nuts over these. You would think he was starved nearly to death and this was a prime rib roast the way he goes after them. He's shown no GI distress so far. The ingredients are few, and the chicken is sourced and processed in the U.S.  No imports from China or other nations. The strips are crisp and chewy but easy to break into smaller pieces if needed. I give them to him whole. I will be buying these on a regular basis.

This yoga towel is well made - no frayed stitches, unraveling, or patched pieces. The edges are stitched nicely and lay flat.  It is very thin. Don't expect any padding from it. However, it does absorb moisture well and keeps the floor dry. Mine does not wick the moisture away and lock it in. When I press on a damp area, my hand, foot, knee, or whatever body part I'm  using gets wet. I don't like that feeling, and I don't like a wet bum. The little bumpies on the back do keep the towel in place so I'm not slipping around. The surface is soft and smooth. I don't smell any lingering odor. Overall I think it does a good job. The small towel is a nice touch for keeping your face and hands dry.

I tried out the Kelty Cosmic 21 Kelty Degree 550 Dridown sleeping bag on an overnight hike. All I can say is wow - how manufacturing has changed for the better since I bought my last mummy bag. There is no comparison to anything I've owned in the past, plus I love all the attention to detail.It had recently rained heavily along our trail so the terrain and weather was cold (around 50*), and damp at night. We travel without a tent on overnight hikes so we were in the elements. The sleeping bag performed as promised. I was warm and dry, very comfortable even in those damp conditions. The claims to dry 33% faster than regular down are pretty close. The very damp exterior dried quickly in the sunlight in time to pack dry for the day's travels. Detail: there are a couple of small and large loops on the outside that can be used to hang the bag to dry.The bag is very lightweight and rolls back down to fit in the nylon cinched pouch provided. It takes patience and pressure but it can be done. Just be sure the bag is completely dry first. Detail: the storage pouch doesn't cinch all the way closed. There is a nylon flap that covers the opening from the inside. That way the bag can breath during storage.The down is very soft although not super thick. It feels luxurious, not lumpy. It does not bunch up into rock hard balls like I'm used to, and there are no sharp quills poking through that would wake me up at night if I wiggled too much.The zipper is nylon but sturdy. It won't rust = I won't get trapped inside. Detail: it is insulated on the inside along the track of the zipper by a thick down-filled panel. It shields out the cold and dampness that can migrate inward along the zipper line. The zipper opens on the right side on both the inside and outside from the top. Detail: there is also an outside pull about mid calf that opens upwards to vent the feet/legs if desired. I really appreciated that option because I'm one of those people that like their feet cooler off and on than the rest of the body, even when damp and chilly outside. It kept me from feeling trapped or overheated.Detail: there is a down-filled collar around the inside front of the neckline that further insulates again cold and dampness when the head cover is cinched down. It can also be folded down inside the bag on temperate nights when you're not fighting the cold or dampness so much.Overall, it's the attention to detail and versatility as a three season bag that impresses me the most. I'm not locked into a pure cold or warm weather bag. I've owned several down-filled sleeping bags in my lifetime, and this one performs the best by far.  Here are some specs from the tags and wrapper:Regular is 78" x 31". It's filled with sterilized 81% duck down and 19% polyester fiber. Inner and outer lining is polyester. Made in China.Funny thing, it's cold rated for 21* F for men but only 35*F for women. I never new women and men tolerated cold differently. Disclaimer - temperatures did not reach that cold during our outing. It's almost summer here. We'll see this winter how that claim holds up.

So far the 6.6 ft Belkin Lightning cable in black is working great. It charges as rapidly as any other lightning cable I own, and I can sync my iPhone 5 to iTunes without issues. The cable sheath seems a little more flexible and thicker than the Apple brand cords I've owned, so hopefully this one will last longer. We all know these charging cords can separate from the connector ends or short out, so if and when that happens, I'll update this review. Until that time, I am pleased with this product.

This is a good lubricant and does the job, but I don't see what all the hype is about. There is no extra special arousal, no heating, cooling, or tingling. It is not as sticky as most brands, and it washes clean, but that's about it.

Finally a dipping sauce that has a little heat, a lot of sweet but no garlic. Minor's Sweet Chili sauce is not the gelatinous goop you get at the local Chinese buffet. It is a smooth pourable sauce that's just hot enough without going overboard. I like it with fried foods best, like egg rolls and fried shrimp, but I tried it with the naked wings we had delivered from a pizza place last night, and it was perfect. Tonight I'm making hawaiian chicken with it, sautéing chicken breasts with bell pepper, red onion then adding pineapple, a little broth, and this sauce. I bet it would be good on grilled shrimp too.This is a large bottle that lasts only a week after opening but I'm going to freeze the leftovers in small portions to use later. There's a chart that comes with it for mixing this sauce with everyday condiments and with other sauces from this line. Some look like great ideas, especially with ketchup or BBQ sauce. I'd like to try it with a little vinegar and olive oil to dress a fruit salad or coleslaw. I wonder how this would work with cool whip in ambrosia. Hmm.

Oh so luscious. The 41% milk chocolate bar is just the right blend to keep the bar creamy and smooth but not so milky as to minimize the cocoa flavor. You can definitely taste the chocolate, but it still melts in your mouth. Yummy.

This product does a good job of absorbing pet urine quickly, especially for the price. All pads will wick moisture up under the plastic if the pet wets too close to the edge. This one does the same. However, the urine doesn't pool, and their is no residual urine odor. One pad lasts for one urination for my large adult dog. There are a few brands that absorb more, but the price for them is insanely high. These have become my budget go-to pads.

I'm using the Unstoppables Fresh scent from this new line, and it works perfectly for my problem - pet odor. I keep my dog and carpet clean, but he's just one of those breeds that gives off doggie body order no matter what. One short burst of spray in each room, and I mean short burst, keeps the air smelling fresh for several hours. This is a powerful product. The Fresh scent smells like clean linen, like that fresh powder detergent scent when you do laundry. Not flowery or perfumey or like a fabric softener - just fresh. I highly recommend this one for pet owners.

I'm pleased with the taste and versatility of Minor's Stir Fry Sauce. Besides using it as the sauce in my chicken/veg stir fry,  I've added it to meatloaf instead of tomato sauce and to meatballs and thinned with broth to make light sauce to go with the noodles. I also used it as a basting sauce for grilled chicken. In stir fry it gives me the taste of restaurant Chinese food that I just couldn't get by mixing ingredients myself. Mixed with hamburger or basted on meat it gives the dish an Asian twist. A little goes along way! Plus watch your salt content. I don't use much salt, and there's enough in this product that I didn't need to add any to my meat or other dishes. I decided against using it as a marinade because the sugar content might cause the meat to burn when grilling.There is a very useful chart for mixing this sauce with everyday condiments and with other sauces in this line. Imagination going wild here ....This is a large bottle, and unless you plan to use it all in a week (manufacturer's safe time limit), you may try to freeze some. I plan on freezing leftovers in ice cube trays and then putting the cubes in a ziplock bag until I need it, just like freezing stock. I don't know how well it will freeze but it's worth trying and better than letting it go to waste. At the rate I'm using it, there may not be much left.

I wouldn't say my dog is a picky eater. He'll eat just about anything I put in front of him, but for some reason he turns his nose up at these. He literally turns his head to the side away from me when I offer him one. If I set it on the floor he will eventually lick it and eat it. They are a little crunchy but not hard. He's a big dog, and these are large enough so that it takes him about 30 seconds to eat one. He can't gulp them down which was one concern I had.I had planned on using them as a reward for his letting me groom him each day, but he just looks at me with those big brown eyes like saying, are you kidding me? Is this what I get for holding still? There hasn't been any GI upset, which is good, but these are not the reward treats I had been hoping for. I'll keep looking.

I absolutely love this pet gate. I've been using it for several months and have no problems. Our apartment complex does not allow screen doors, so we needed something to keep our dog in while leaving the door open for air circulation. This was the only brand I found that met all of our needs. It is easy to set up and take down, it does not require any drilling or screws into the woodwork, and it expands completely to fit our front door space. We do not use the small pet door included but I tried it, and its fully functional for small dogs, such as terriers, yorkies, Chihuahuas, etc.I position the gate in the doorway on the threshold itself. The gate expands sideways to fit up against the door jam on both sides. There are 2 soft rubber pads on each side that hold it in place without damaging the door jam. The gate also rests up against the front edge of the door jam, giving it extra security. Please see the photos.The mechanism that holds it in place is a plastic knob that expands as you twist it to lock the gate in place. It takes seconds to set up and take down. This gate does not have a door for people to pass through, but I didn't need that feature. All I wanted was a tall, sturdy gate that would keep my large dog indoors but could take the many ups and downs it would have to over the spring and fall seasons when I'll use it. My dog isn't a climber, and he doesn't try to crash the gate, so I can't speak to that part of it, but it is very windy here, and the locking mechanism has never failed to hold in it place.
