Gives a close, smooth shave several times from each blade without razor burn or nicks.

This is the strongest, stickiest tape of any kind that I have used. The adhesive is so strong that it bonds to almost anything. A small piece of plastic broke off my dustpan/broom combo. I fabricated a new piece from the duct tape and then used more tape to attach it. Now it works like a charm. I covered a crack in one of my favorite flower pots, and it holds water without leaking. You can't beat that. I've repaired binders, a hose, and a patio chair leg. I'm on a roll. Nothing can stop me now. The backing is so strong that you need scissors or a knife to cut it. Repeated use does leave a trace of adhesive on the blade. Also, if you have sensative skin, repeated use pulls at the skin on your fingertips.A surprise use is to remove pet hair and dust from fabric. My dog sheds a lot, and I can go through a lot of regular tape to remove it from my clothes and sofa. This removes it all, even the residue left behind by the vacuum. Just remember that it is very strong and may be too harsh for delicate fabrics.

We've been using these cords for about a week, and so far they work great. Charging is as fast as any other brand, and they sync also. The fabric wrap is really protecting the cord well from the wear and tear of daily use. There were no duds in the bunch.

I use several Avery products, but this by far is one of the more useful ones. The dividers themselves are made of thick semitransparent plastic and have diagonal storage pouches on each one. You can use the sheet of sticky labels provided to print out tags for each divider at once or you cann simply write the name in the divider tab.The pouches are what make these special. The possibilities are endless. I'm using some to hold info cards, color chips, and bits and pieces that go with projects I'm making, and another for recipe cards for a weeks worth of new menus I want to make. They could hold handouts or business cards, fabric swatches, yarn samples or threads and needles, kid's stickers, a couple of crayons to color pages you've put in a binder to keep kids busy - you get the idea. Anything you need that doesn't actually fit in a binder might just fit these pouches. They don't close so keep the binder upright, and they don't actually hold 70 pages. They are a real handy way to organize ideas and activities with parts and pieces that go along with but are beyond the paper in your binder.

While the two step application by brush is like that done in a salon, I found it too difficult to get the appropriate coverage by myself. It is nearly impossible to see and cover the root areas on the back of the head by oneself. That is best done by a second person who can see the entire head. This is especially important for short hair or those with large areas of gray.I've given this product 2 stars because the medium red does not cover gray well at all but fails to address this with a disclaimer or warning. If you have only scattered strands of gray, you will get light red/pink highlights. If you have sections of gray at the crown, top, sides, etc or any large areas of continuous gray, you will have solid patches of non-red light color, anywhere from strawberry blond to dark pink, that does not match the red cast on your darker hair. This is the problem with most red hair color on gray hair. If you've experienced this before, you know what I'm talking about, and this product is not the answer.If you don't have any gray and can manage the two step application perfectly, you will have very nice results. The red takes beautifully on non- gray hair with a nice sheen. But again, as with all red hair color, it fades quickly after a few shampoos.If you love red, your hair has only a few scattered strands of gray, you have the patience and ability to apply it correctly or have help with the application, and you are willing to reapply frequently, this is a great product for you. If your hair has solid sections of gray, you don't want to reapply frequently, or you'd have difficulty applying this evenly to the roots in sections of your hair all around, this is not the product for you.

The Keystone USB fan actually delivers on its promises. If you've tried any number of small, portable fans like I have, you know there are a lot of stinkers out there on the market. Either the fan blade is ridiculously loud, the fan vibrates on the desk, or there is barely any output. Not the Keystone. It's the real deal.The listing says it is a 6" fan, but the diameter is actually 8". The height of the fan is 9 1/2". It is made of lightweight plastic. It comes with a 48" USB cord and an electric adapter. The fan works equally well with both, which I found surprising. I also decided to hook the USB cord to a female USB extension cord that I use with my iPhone. Works great, and it added an extra 3 feet to the cord. The power button turns to adjust the fan speed along a continuum instead of one or two "high" or "low" settings. There is a difference in speed but not a huge amount of range. The fan blade tilt range is very small. The description says 15* but I wonder if it is even that. The blade guard comes off to clean by using a Phillips head screwdriver in the bottom front. There is very little clearance there. You will need a long, narrow screwdriver shaft.The output on the highest setting is a little weaker than the 9" Lasko I purchased from Amazon a few years back. I'll be using it at night while I sleep so that won't be a problem. I'm sitting 27" from the fan, and I can feel I nice, light breeze on my face. Perfect. But the main thing that blows me away is how quiet it is. There is NO sound. None that I detect. This is the first fan I have ever owned that is virtually silent. Perfect for sleeping.

I'm surprised at how well these absorb urine. My dog weighs 90 lbs so that says a lot. I purchased them because the Wee Wee brand was out of stock. I actually need the extra large size but this brand was out of that size too. So I made a patchwork layout of 4 of them. These appear thin and they feel very soft compared to the other brand, but somehow they absorb all the liquid. Also I've noticed that the urine does not wick back up under the pad from the edges and onto the floor underneath as much as every other brand I've tried. Im switching to these when the extra large size gets back in stock.

The Artaste 46861 Juicer, Slicer, and Corer is a pretty handy 3-in-1 kitchen gadget. It is a large device that's for certain, but since it does the job of 3 appliances, I can forgive that. Each function has its overall pros and cons which I've listed below. I suggest you at least read the cons before making a decision about purchasing this gadget. I can live with them all, and for me the pros outweigh the cons, but one or more may be a deal breaker for you. Please look at the pics that illustrate some of its functions for additional reference.I'll start with the size and description since that is pretty important. The base is 9" deep and 7 1/2" wide. The height with the handle closed is 19" and the depth increases to 17 1/2" due to the handle length. The height increases to 31" with the handle raised. It's heavy at about 15 lbs +/-. The base has a rubber mat that can be removed for cleaning.The interchangeable blades are easy to install. However, the plastic "pusher disc" could be trouble for those who have difficulty manipulating small objects. It is attached by perfectly aligning and then inserting two small black oval discs up from the underside into the metal plate at the same time and then twisting. It was very stiff at first but became easier with time. Also, the outside rings of the blade plates are rough and even a little sharp on some edges. One is not completely round as if a small chunk was cut from it. All metal plates are lightly scratched. It's easy to see that quality control is not job #1. But they work.Juicer -Pro: the juicer diameter is about 5" which means I can actually juice medium sized grapefruit and large oranges. I own a pricey Hamilton Beach Professional manual juicer that is amazing, but I can't fit even a small grapefruit in that all the way. Both extract about the same amount of juice, but the handle on the Hamilton requires almost no force while this brand does.Cons: it lets a little pulp through. If you absolutely cannot stand pulp (me), then think twice about this unit. HINT: The larger diameter is more important to me so I simply strain my grapefruit juice before drinking. Also, the distance between the spout in the bottom pad is about 7" so using a small glass has the potential to cause splashing. You need to hold it closer.Slicer -Pros: the french fry grid makes fries a little wider than 1/2". Yea! I'm so tired of other slicers maxing out at 1/4" or 3/8" slices. The slicing is fairly easy, not too much force needed, but leaving the potato skin on makes it harder. HINT: the slicer may work for other firm vegetables with tough skin like cucumbers or zucchini. I haven't tried it. It does just squash tomatoes.Cons: you have to buy or cut potatoes to about 3 1/4" to fit. Short fries are ok for me, but if you want them long, forget it.Corer -Pros: it does an amazing job of coring and slicing apple wedges. Whack! HINT: I've also used it to wedge potatoes for making thick steak fries, home fries (I chopped them in half again by hand), roasted potato wedges, and for boiling for potato salad or mashed potatoes. I've also chopped a couple of hard boiled eggs at a time with it. Pretty useful gadget. Don't try tomatoes. Squish!Con: the apple wedges are too thick to use for making pies, which was the main reason I wanted this appliance. You can still bake them or eat them raw.So there you have it. I'm really pleased with this device. I continue to find non-traditional uses for the blades which makes cooking fun.

I've tried so many brands of shower washes from generic store brands to organics to moderate priced brands such as Olay to premium high dollar brands such as Perlier, Elaria, Dior, Chanel, etc. Nivea's coconut body wash stands right up there with the best of them. My dry skin is left absolutely soft and moisturized from the first few uses. The coconut scent is initially strong but not offensive, and it fades rapidly. There is barely any scent left on the skin after the shower. It makes a good amount of lather using a shower poof, and the best thing - it does not make the bath tub slippery.If layering scents is your priority, go ahead and pay a fortune for designer gels and washes. If you want soft, smooth skin and a fun fragrance in the tub at a reasonable price, try Nivea Coconut Body Wash.

These are the perfect filters for my Bobble Sports bottle. They remove the chemical and chlorine smell and taste from my water, leaving it tasting clean and fresh-smelling. That says a lot, because our water supply is rated in the 500 particle range - pretty bad. Just understand that this is all these filters remove - chlorine. They do not remove other contaminants, chemicals, spores, microbes, etc., but that works for me. Our water supply is safe - just loaded up with chlorine.The filters are rated to last me about 3 months. I'm into month two with my current filter, and it's still going strong. I've had no problem with leaks. The soft plastic cap that came attached to the Bobble bottle is a perfect fit. I'm reaching my daily water consumption now soley due to the portability of the Bobble bottles combined with these filters.

Although I was skeptical of the value of this book when I ordered it, "Getting a Big Data Job for Dummies" turned out to be a great resource for those that understand this field, those that are clueless, and those who are not quite sure whether or not it is right for them. The book follows in the tradition of the other "for dummies" books and is an easy read. It assumes the reader knows little or nothing about this field. By the time you are finished reading it, you will know whether or not this is the field for you."Big Data" contains simple, concise descriptions of work in this field, a breakdown by industries, suggested educational paths, and job seeking tips to help reach one's goal of employment. This is no easy task as the field of big data is vast and extremely varied. The book examines work in the public and private sectors as well as great information about tackling one's own startup."Bid Data" peeks into careers in pure science as well as opportunities in retail, consulting, government, industrial, medical, theoretical and applied fields, and much more, all with the focus on if this is the right career for the reader. There is a section that helps breakdown job listings to get a clear idea of what the companies are looking for. There is also a section that examines analytical tools and software one should be familiar with and lists a few free versions to try.Once the reader has decided that big data is the career to pursue, there is advice regarding various educational pathways. There are also tips on writing the perfect resume, nailing interviews, and using social media to your advantage that would be helpful to job seekers in any field. These sections are tremendously helpful.I particularly liked the social media section as I had not considered this easily searched information as content that could affect an applicant's success. It brings into focus our public persona, our own personal "brand," that is out there for all to see whether we realize it or not. "Big Data" provides tips for scrutinizing ones public face, cleaning up that which might not advantageous, and establishing a positive profile on professional networking sites as well as general social media. This chapter was eye opening to say the least.There is also a comprehensive glossary, which is my favorite part of the book. In this field, understanding the basic terminology as well as the latest catch phrases is key to success and is absolutely expected. The glossary does a great job of familiarizing the job hunter with the secret language of data speak. I have a background in medical informatics and data analysis, and even I learned some new terms. I'll be keeping this book handy, but out of sight, for future reference.

I've been taken the entire box of these and have seen no improvement in my digestive issues. As far as building my immune system, I've stayed healthy while others around me have been hit with the "stomach bug." That could be luck, good hand hygiene, or these supplements. How does one know? They are easy to swallow and have not caused any nausea or other tummy upset. I believe they are worth taking for an extended period of time to see if my digestive issues resolve.

Everyone's body chemistry is different, so this EDT will have a different scent for each one wearing it. I'm happy to read many reviewers like this scent. For me, it simply does not work.For those familiar with the fragrance Ambush by Dana that was so popular years ago, on me ROMA initially follows that same scent line. My immediate first impression was, Wow! This is Ambush all over again." It has that bright, sweet, floral-ish vanilla overtone at first, but unlike Ambush, a lemony fragrance studded with faint licorice soon begins to emerge. The sweet vanilla top note fades quickly as does the citrus, replaced by a strong alcohol/soap scent. Once that is gone, the bottom note is woody - not spicy or musky wood - just plain 2x4 wood beam. Although the scent is quite strong and aggressive when first applied, it fades to almost nothing within two hours. It is an EDT after all. They just don't last like cologne or perfume.I do like the cute, chunky bottle. It is easy to grasp and spray as well. However, I will not be wearing this fragrance. Unfortunately, it does not mix well with my body chemistry.

This is not an expensive, professional chef model, but I am a home cook that doesn't need the latest and greatest version of every kitchen gadge. I just need dependable products that do what they are supposed to, that last, and that make cooking easier and fun. That is exactly what I get with the Swissmar Borner V slicer.I am very pleased with the quality of this mandolin. The blades are very sharp as advertised. I've had no problem slicing anything from potatoes to celery, eggplant to hard boiled eggs. The thickness is adjustable from thick down to nearly paper thin by simply sliding the knob on the outer edge of the mandolin and adjusting the blade plate to the proper position. Very easy to do. Like all mandolins, you have to use some elbow grease to slice the food, but this brand is so sharp that it is much easier and smoother to use. I appreciate the safety guard for the blade slicer when not in use and the hard plastic container for the menacing-looking julienne blades. Being able to store them straight into that container when still wet to let them drip dry while still being protected is awesome.The handle is thick and has ridges which makes it easy to grip. The bottom grips the counter and cutting board much better than other brands I've tried. The safety food holder is better than most. The prongs that grasp the food are long and the recessed cap area deep so you really get a good grip on the food you are slicing. But it is small by necessity to fit the width of the mandolin, so some items just don't fit. Use safety gloves always!I'm able to make a great chop or mince of my vegetables once I got the hang of the technique using the julienne blades. It is so much faster and easier than using a knife, and my eyes are thankful for less time exposed to onion fumes!My only complaint is with the width of the julienne blades. The are great for shreds and thin sticks, but the widest width slices potatoes the size of shoe string fries. I had hoped to use this to cut at least medium french fries, but there's no way. If they had included a wider-spaced blade, even for a few dollars more, I would have given it 5 stars.I always wear a safety glove when using  a mandolin. This is my current pair that I bought on Amazon. These saved my finger once already.http://www.amazon.com/gp/aw/d/B007TSJHGO/ref=pdp_new_dp_review

My grandson just loves these trucks, but they are not what I expected. There have sharp and pointed edges, and the plastic is hard and not that thick. I thought they would be softer from the various reviews and descriptions. Also, the colors are not really bold. All the parts articulate and the wheels turn. They should last him a good while.

EDIT: one week after writing this review, it stopped working. Returning it. Purchase at your own risk.******************This cord works every bit as well as the Apple version at a much better price. The 6' length is perfect for charging at night while keeping the phone close by. The wire is covered in fairly thick insulation, better than I expected. I've purchased so many charging cords from so many companies at all different price points over the years we've had iPhones, and this one is better than most.  I've had no problems charging or syncing.

The Fellowes 5 mm laminating sheets do an excellent job of protecting documents, photos and other important papers. Since they are open on three sides it makes it very easy to place multiple pictures, cards or whatever you choose to laminate into the correct positions. It is so much easier than using a pouch closed on three sides like the ones we use at work. With Fellowes, I can place everything exactly where I want it.So far, I've laminated photos into a few collages that I can frame, some important documents, and crochet patterns that I know I'll be using repeatedly. The laminate surfaces become clear and glossy once heated, and all sides close completely. I'm able to make notes on the crochet patterns with dry eraser makers, such as row count, then wipe them off once done. My Fellowes laminating machine has had no problems handling the 5 mm thickness.I highly recommend this product. The 200 count box assures me that I will have plenty on hand whenever I need them.

These decorating tips are very easy to use, but the containers are so small. This is my only complaint. Otherwise I really, really like this 8 piece set. Two containers are ok if you only have a few dozen cookies or cupcakes to decorate, like one batch, or if you aren't going to need much frosting to detail a cake. But if you have a lot to decorate, say for a big party or bake sale, you will be refilling them all day. The steel tips can always be placed inside a pastic bag and used that way for large batches, but that kind of defeats the purpose of purchasing this set.I really like how easy it is to fill these with the wide-mouth openings and how easy they are to clean. The tips are a good quality steel but not quite as thick as professional tips. The silicone is so soft and easy to depress. It's almost like second nature, and you only need one hand to decorate. That leaves the other hand free to manipulate the item being decorated if need be. It is so easy to control the frosting output by depressing with only your thumb and moving the tip that rests between your first and second finger By flexing and rotating your wrist. It is so much easier than twisting and moving a bag with two hands, at least for me it is. It's so similar to writing but on a larger scale that even an amateur like myself picked up on the technique pretty fast. Having the two containers lets me change between flavors easily if that's the way I'm going.I've had no problem opening or closing the lids when my hands are dry and I get a good grip. I can see how somemay have difficulty since the lip you must grip is small.It would be great if you could buy just the containers themselves to load up with extra frosting ahead of time. Maybe some day.

These cotton pot holders are usable but disappointing. They are the style I like, the type that have pockets to slip your hands into but are not full mitts. One side is made of heat-resistant material that does protect my hands when removing items from the oven. But the top side has no real protection. Overall, they are very thin. Seriously thin. So much so that I'm a little afraid to use them on a regular basis. However, they are perfect as heat pads for protecting surfaces from hot dishes. We like to serve famiy style from hot bowls and pans, so we can always use another hot pad.

I began reading "The Evil Hours" by David H. Morris not knowing what to expect. I live with PTSD and have been searching for insight beyond what my past counseling had provided. I was initially pessimistic, believing this book would be either a sappy, whiny, poor-me bio or just another cold, clinical regurgitation of knowledge I already have. It was neither. "The Evil Hours" is a look into the author's personal journey to understand the PTSD he now lives with. Being a journalist, he was able to pull himself out of the picture and focus his investigative and analytical skills in a third party manner. I appreciate the research that I would never have tackled.Morris' research is impressive yet not intimidating. The result is an impassioned yet logical approach to understanding PTSD today. His journey uncovers both the history of the disorder as well as the current  inconsistencies in understanding, classification and treatment; however, his story does not stop there. While coming to grips with the enormity of this condition in modern society, the author turns conventional understanding and coping mechanisms on their ears. From the basic assumption that PTSD  causes a break in time for those that live with it to the unconventional belief that one can actually grow emotionally and cope successfully precisely because one endured severe trauma and yet lived, the author challenges the reader to examine the research, apply it to one's situation, and to draw one's own conclusion.Reading "The Evil Hours" has been cathartic for me. I was challenged to step out of my fear and into a new understanding of what happened to me, how time is now broken, and the opportunities I now have to move on. I also realize that I am not alone in this, I am not crazy, and I no longer need to be ashamed. Don't misunderstand what I am saying: this is not a therapeutic manual nor does Morris claim to have discovered a miracle cure. What I am saying is that this book challenged me to take a look at PTSD from a new perspective - a different angle - and then act on that perspective. Knowledge is power, and that is what I personally have gained from reading this book.

This sign gets the point across perfectly and looks great while doing so.With the sign being 18" x 12", it's plenty large and easy to see all the way from the street (60 feet away). The pictographs are a great addition as I have found that some individuals just don't understand what "No Soliciting" means. It's also perfect for those who are (or at least seem to be) illiterate and can't read, or just have a poor lack of the English vernacular.The sign is made of thick aluminum and is sure to provide many years of great service.With out a doubt, one of the best purchases I've made!

I've been shaving my head for the last 5-6 years and have been using a single bladed razor and a highly concentrated shave cream (Cremo Cream) with amazing results. But I being one who is quite satisfied, I enjoy trying out new things.This AHAVA Foam-Free Shaving Cream looked like it was going to be a good match for me as it is similar to my Cremo Cream that I have been using.Initially the smell was a bit off putting for me. Too strong and it seemed to linger a bit. Since the ingredients aren't listed, I was quite disappointed as I like to know exactly what I'm applying to my face and head.Lathering up went well and the initial few strokes with a brand new blade was awesome. Nice and close, smooth, felt great. HOWEVER as time went on (about two minutes into shaving), the blade started to get really clogged up with the shave cream. The cream was no longer a cream and was acting like a soft layer of wax all over my face and head. In addition, it took forever to wash the residue off. Not the best shaving experience I've had in years.So thinking that it was how I used it (for my head), I tried it on a smaller area, just my face. The results were better. Just a little bit of razor clogging and it didn't turn into the waxy state that I had experienced before.So I learned one thing about this product, it's definitely not for shaving your head with! Stick with smaller areas and you will not experience the horrible waxy situation like I did.

The Dragonfly design is by far my favorite Iron Stop spinner!Right from the get go, this one was the only spinner that wanted to spin and with the least amount of wind, let alone it was also the easiest to bend and get the required angle on the lily-pads.I also prefer the design of this spinner over most due to it's shape and while it's in motion it's much more cleaner/smoother in motion because of it's more spherical shape.As with many spinners, I highly suggest that you snug up the acorn nuts that hold the spinners together as they tend to be loose right out of the box (don't over tighten them either!).Installed near out bird bath and with the sun hitting it just right, it's a beautiful sight on a summer evening.

Just like the other Iron Stop Kinetic Wind Spinner (the Hummingbird version), location, location, location. Minimal amount of wind is needed for it to spin, but sustained wind is when this baby just takes off. It's almost kind of scary to watch this thing spin when the wind picks up, almost saw blade like.With this design of spinner, I found that extra care was needed while bending the butterflies to the necessary 30 angle due to the thin leaf like formations that hold/are attached to the butterflies. If you don't pay attention, you can easily bend them out of shape.The quality of the piece is great. When it catches the light it looks amazing and once it starts spinning it's just gorgeous! Very pleased with it.

I honestly can't say that 'I Love It", but this product works as advertised.My initial thought was that it would simply mask the smells like some sort of toilet Febreze. In addition once I took the cap off to give it a smell, it was very pungent smelling.However in use (a spritz or two) over the surface of the toilet water the product works wonderfully. It doesn't just add to the poo smell, but it actually blocks it leaving a nice wonderful scent.Wouldn't believe it unless I used it. Great product!

I had this Iron Stop Hummingbird spinner out for a few weeks with little to no effect. Didn't spin worth a darn.Finally on a nice and windy day I decided to pick it up and move it around, sure enough the location I had chose was a dead zone for wind. Sure it LOOKED as though wind was coming through the area, but it was dead.So after weeks of disappointment from this spinner, a new location and it came to life! So don't be a complete idiot like I was, try out a few locations to find the best spot.Putting it together was easy. Just bend the hummingbirds a little bit and you're good to go. The acorn nuts on my spinner was a bit loose right out of the box so a small amount (1/2 a turn) was needed to insure the spinner wouldn't come off.My only complaint is the paper cutout gauge they provide to insure you get the correct angle on the spinner. A cardboard gauge would be a lot better and easier to use.As this thing spins and catches the light, it looks beautiful. VERY pleased with the quality and hope to enjoy it for many years to come.

We recently had our garage door replaced and installed with a new garage door opener (a Raynor model). However it seems to be a bit on the loud side at 70db during operation. With a bedroom wall right up against the garage, opening it early in the morning is simply a wakeup call for the person in the bedroom.Installation for this Chamberlain 1 1/4HP door opener went smoothly and was straight forward. If you are a DIYer, plan on taking the entire afternoon with you and a buddy (or two) to get it done. Alone and it will take almost all weekend.Adjustment for the door travel allowed for a perfectly tight seal along the bottom of the door with zero gap.What we really liked the most was the wireless outdoor control panel. This was something that our old garage door opener lacked and is a huge plus.Battery backup works like a charm (Chamberlain recommends testing it several times a year) and the lighted wall panel with clock with temp is a nice touch.As for the quietness of the opener, it is quieter... WAY quieter. No more rude awakenings for anyone in the house!Overall, I am sold on the quality and performance of the garage door opener. Just need to order up a few more remotes so everyone has one.

I have used and still own many sanders. Two Black & Decker, two Hitachis, a Porter Cable, a Mikita, as well as a a rather old Delta. Of all of them the B&Ds have never performed well nor held up over time. However this one seems to crack that mold.First off is the build quality. This is right on par with the higher end sanders like the Porter Cable and Mikita. Well weighted, good materials used for the construction of the sander, very pleased to see this! The on off switch is sealed so dust doesn't get inside and start causing issues.The hook and loop pad again follows this trend of quality. All of the different brands of sandpaper stuck like glue to the pad, even the sandpaper that has a tendency to want to come off by itself stayed stuck. Over the next few weeks I'll find out how durable the pad really is and whether it will still be holding up.The actual action of sanding went smoothly and produced a great finished product. With some of the lower quality sanders, I've noticed that they can develop or rotate in a manner that is predictable which leaves an unwanted design of swirl marks, not with this B&D.What stops this from being a 5 star sander are only two slight issues.First is the noise level, it's a bit loud and fairly high pitched. This is an obvious statement with most sanders, but there are some that are just quieter.The second is the dust collection. Not a fan of their canister system. With only a few hours under it's belt, the canister has already become loose despite having a sealing O-ring. In addition it has a small dust port which without a lot of fiddling with does NOT accept a vacuum hose (my preferred method of dust collecting when sanding!!).I am glad to see B&D stepping up their game with this sander. It's been years since a I've used a B&D tool without setting it back down in anger or disgust!

These Ammex gloves are great!The medium size fits much better than another brand we typically use which allows for better dexterity when handling objects.The fingertips are textured and provide adequate tactile feel and grip.However the most important thing for us is how long they last before they tear and these lasted quite a long time. They are only 4mils thick (not the thickest), but with normal usage they seem to last long enough.Reason for docking them a star is due to the fact they (the manufacturer) does not list the thickness and I had to go track it down. In addition, the price. Comparable gloves of thicker material can be bought for about two-thirds of the price.

I've been using another brand of nitrile gloves for several years (ShieldGloves if anyone was wondering) and I thought I'd give these a try.First impressions were underwhelming. Immediately upon slipping them on my hands, I could tell they are too small (I wear an XL, these fit closer to just a large). Although they say they are 4mil and 5mil in the fingertips, they seem thinner. This may be due to the fact that they fit tight on my hands thus they are stretched out a bit thinner.During my testing period I was working on my cars and ended up using four gloves due to tearing. With my normal gloves I NEVER have this issue.And price wise, once again they fell short for me. Purchase price for the gloves I use is only ¢6 a glove, whereas with these they are ¢15, two and a half times the price!I'm willing to pay more for a better, stronger glove that will protect my hands, but when they tear easier and I use twice as many of them for the same task, there is no way I can justify making the switch to Ammex gloves.

Honestly, the ring pictured here on Amazon doesn't look as good as the actual ring.The Claddagh ring looks amazingly beautiful. Very intricate and well weighted (doesn't feel as cheap as it is).Ring size was spot on for a size 7 (17.3mm), no slop and easy enough to get on and off.Whether or not you have some Irish or Ulster Scot in you, this is a beautiful ring!

Well it seems odd reviewing toilet paper, but to be honest it's probably one of the items that we use daily (if not multiple times a day) without any consideration or really any thought.Charmin's Ultra Mega roll lives up to the hype. Not only does the roll last a long time (due to it's thicker construction which leads to you needing less) it is much softer than most. And by lasting longer I'm talking at least twice as long as our normal bathroom tissue (AngelSoft Jumbo roll). We usually use a roll per week and we're only down about half way through a roll and and we're almost pushing two weeks.So the combination of more sheets and stronger/thicker tissue is working out nicely. :)I thought what we had been using was just fine, but it's nice to know there is something just a little bit nicer out there. Great stuff!

Zero complaints!The Vornado personal space heater is wonderful. The amount of space it takes up on the desk or floor is very minimal.A single on/off switch with a second high, low, and fan only switch makes using the heater intuitive and easy without any fiddly dials to play with.On the low setting, its great for taking the chill off or keeping you nice and comfortable. On the high setting, it will warm you and your personal space quickly.The heater is nearly silent at 3-4 feet away. And with it's ability for throwing heat about 10-12 feet with ease, you can set it far enough away so that it IS silent.Combined with it's stay cool grille (no matter how long you run it, it only gets warm to the touch!), tip-over auto shut off, blocked air flow shut off (inlet or outlet air gets block, it will shut off), and it's tight grille fins (to prevent tiny wondering fingers from getting into things), this is one safe little heater!

I've been eating another brand (Nutiva) for a while now and this is a good alternative.Nutritionally compared to Nutiva, it's about the same, a good combination of fat, protein and fiber.Taste wise, very nutty and enjoyable. I love making waffles with it. For lunch I like to mix about a 1/4 cup with some water, rice and/or beans with spices (cumin preferably). Cook that up for a few minutes, makes great vegan taco filling!The only reason I removed a star is it's texture. This seems to be quite a bit grittier than other brands and does not seem to absorb as much water/liquid either.Overall a great hemp protein. Easy on the stomach and tastes great!

These were purchased as gifts and both individuals love them.The colors are bright and vibrant and very well painted. There is ZERO discrepancy between what is pictured and what was received.These can used both indoor or outdoor, but bring them in during the winter as that can be quite harsh on the paint.I would be more than happy to purchase these again as more gifts for anyone who loves gardening.

These are great beginner mechanical pencils.The bold colored lead is great for school work and normal every day home stuff (note jotting, doodling, list making, etc.).The triangular barrel design is great for holding, amazing control and comfort.The only issue is that about half of the colors are just too faint. The yellow, light blue, pink, light green, and the peach colors are difficult to see on plain white paper.But overall, great to have around and for school!

WypAll's X70 towels are just awesome!Instead of using countless shop rags, these have become the go to towel. They are strong, absorb a ton of liquid, and are without a doubt are reusable over and over.In addition to being tough, they are lint free. So for intricate part assembly (such as electrical items, brakes, etc.), a final wipe down with these towels and some solvent and assembly can proceed without hesitation.So no more laundered shop rags, just a few boxes of these!

This DII kitchen starter set is fairly good for the price.The quality of the terry cloth is slightly above average, definitely not the softest or most absorbent but they work well.The print on them is actually pretty good and doesn't affect the absorbency like other towels I have/have used on the past.The oven mitts are much too small for me, but fit normal sized adults just fine. That and they offer good protecting from handling hot objects. Same with the pot holders (which are my favorite of this set).The only reason I gave them four stars is that the towels aren't hemmed all that well. They have a lot of loose threads and on some the edges are not completely stitched.For the price, a good starter set and nothing more.

Right from the get go I knew this tumbler was going to be an issue.First off was the double walled portion, it was only half sealed and loose. So the inner portion of the tumbler wiggles around.The tumbler is listed as BPA free, great! However it has ZERO markings as to what it is made of OR if it is made with BPS or BPF (both of which aren't really any better than BPA). Being made in China without any symbol as to the composition of the plastic (PET? HDPE? LDPE?) is quite worrisome.The only positive thing about the tumbler is the straw and the tight sealing lid. The lid seals very tightly, enough so that it can be used as a shaker bottle.So with the double wall portion of the tumbler only half sealed (thus water gets in between the two walls) and not knowing what material this is made from, this tumbler can only receive a marginal 2 stars. One star for the nice straw and one star for the tight sealing lid.

Really can't say too much more about it other than it works well.It takes very little to get the job done so this 4.0 ounce bottle is lasting a VERY long time.The only complaint is that if you have either combination or oily skin it seems to leave your skin a bit oilier than other cleansing oils/cleaners. A quick cleanse afterwards works well and prevents oil buildup.

Picked this up for a senior male lab who has an issue with grains (causes ear infections) and sure enough he loves it!The pieces are just the right size, not too small and not too big, so smaller breeds shouldn't have an issue with eating it.He seems to digest it well without any issues. No unpleasant odors coming from him which is a plus since some of the higher protein dog foods don't sit well with him causing us to clear the house...There is a bit more 'pep' in him, but can't tell if that's because of the food or just because of the weather... we'll see.Comparable in price with the other brands of grain free, so no issues there.A great grain free formula that he is loving!

Top Secret's Sleep Formula is one of the few sleep products that works for me with no side effects.For me, I typically take this when I feel stimulated from either working too late or not quite ready to go to sleep or when I can't quite seem to shut off from the day. So I take one of these and in about 30 or so minutes I start to feel calmed and less hyped from the day and go right into a nice sleep state.I wake up feeling quite rested and without a sleep hangover like I experience from a few other natural sleep products.No real downside other than they are addictive simply for the fact that I get really good sleep when taking them. :)

These are absolutely delicious!Nice and crunchy snack for when you're feeling peckish. Low calorie and made from nothing but apples, couldn't be simpler.I've been adding these to my morning oatmeal and cold cereals for an added bit of sweetness and crunch, just lovely!The only thing holding these back from receiving 5 stars, the price. At the current price of a little over $7 for a 2.1 ounce bag... that's almost $1.50 an apple... OUCH! Still delicious though. :)

Hands down Lenox makes the best hole saw kits out there.I had previously purchased their smaller 7 piece construction kit (1815140) for general purpose hole making as you never know when you need to put in a new junction box, ceiling fan, etc.. With the addition of this plumber's kit, I am good to go for many years.One of the best selling points is that this set comes with two of Lenox's amazingly fast quick change arbors (3/8" and 1/2" shank). This allows for tool free 5 second blade changes. Just pull down on the mandrel, screw the hole saw on, and pull up on the mandrel to lock the saw in place. On top of that, they include three pilot drill bitsThe kit comes with a dozen hole saws including 3/4", 7/8", 1-1/8", 1-1/2", 1-3/4", 2-1/4", 2-9/16", 3", 3-1/2", 4", 4-1/4", and 4-1/2".In terms of performance, I have not once been let down by these hole saws. Their thin kerf design allows for faster, smoother, cuts in everything. Whether you are cutting drywall, douglas fir, plywood, MDF, you name it, it just cuts like butter. Even on laminate surfaces it leaves a fairly clean hole (though I did have to clean it up a bit with a trim router afterwards).And if you have ever used a hole saw of years past, you know removing the plug from the hole saw is a pain. But with Lenox's Speed Slot, you just jam a screwdriver in the slot and pop the plug out with ease.If you plan on doing some heavy remodeling or construction, I would not hesitate one second in getting this kit, it will pay for itself in minutes!

These Cole Haan Zerogrand snow boots are extremely functional and look great.Fitment seems to be a bit on the small size. This size 11 is tight on someone who wears a 10-10.5. In addition they are narrow. Anyone with a slightly wide foot will find these nearly impossible to wear.The materials used are top-notch. The canvas and leather combo is stylish and is wearing awesomely which gives these boots some awesome character.They aren't all that warm to be honest. Thick or heavy socks are recommended.The most impressive thing about these boots are their flexibility and traction. The soles contour nicely to most surfaces providing you with confident foot feel. And the deep ridges in the tread allow for easy trekking in snow, even on a bit of ice they allowed for good traction due to the soft rubber sole.I would not recommend these for the mountain man, but for the urban and suburban doers and go getters, these are some fantastic winter kicks!

I honestly wasn't in the mood for watching this show but after just the first two minutes I was hooked.The cast of characters and actors whom portrayed them kept me laughing the entire way through, all while staying true to the book with it's rhyming.Kevin Michael Richardson as Santa was the clincher for me. His partial of the iconic man in red was just awesome!The musical numbers where well written and almost too catchy.Young or old, most anyone with a slightly twisted or silly sense of humor will find this delightful!

I honestly wasn't in the mood for watching this show but after just the first two minutes I was hooked.The cast of characters and actors whom portrayed them kept me laughing the entire way through, all while staying true to the book with it's rhyming.Kevin Michael Richardson as Santa was the clincher for me. His partial of the iconic man in red was just awesome!The musical numbers where well written and almost too catchy.Young or old, most anyone with a slightly twisted or silly sense of humor will find this delightful!

Not sure who enjoys this puzzle map more, the adults or the kids?The quality of this T.S. Shure Wooden Map is superb. Quality plywood, laminate, and magnets are used to insure many hours of use. Only on the larger states (California and Texas being the most obvious) is there some bowing/warpage that prevents them from sitting completely flat against the board or magnetic surface (fridge).The smaller states on the east coast are grouped together due to their size, which is fine. And I like the fact that the great lakes were also included as pieces. One important note that I think is important is that Alaska is NOT to scale which is disappointing.There really isn't anything I would change other than possibly making the pieces out of slightly thicker plywood to prevent the warpage that some of the states are experiencing. Other than that, this is an awesome teaching tool for the young and old!

My expectations for this game were fairly high due to it's subject matter (I love Americana!!) and the overall look and feel of the game. However it was kind of a letdown...Timeline Americana (as well as the other Timeline cards/games) is quite a simple and straight forward game.Game play doesn't take too long which is nice as you can cram a quick game in before dinner or durning a lunch break. So for me the gameplay is about a four. After a few rounds some of the dates are easily remembered, we noticed this after playing it the third or fourth time.I guess the biggest letdown for me, is as many other reviewers have pointed out, the size of the cards... they are TINY. Coming from a company that prides itself in having industry leading talent and artists, I find it odd that they showcase them by producing cards the size of postage stamps. The cards themselves are of quality and well laminated, but whats the point when you can't really see the detail of the art on each of the cards?

I just recently purchased several new non-stick pans (Anolon Advanced Hard Anodized) to replace some old ones and this OXO pan ranks right up there.OXO is well known for their ergonomics and comfortable grips/handles on all of their items and this is no exception. Well balance and fits large and small hands with ease.The non-stick surface works well thus far. Only time will tell as to how well it remains non-stick. I'm a stickler for properly cleaning my pans, so I'll be updating this review if this changes at all.The reason I docked it a star is it doesn't quite stack up to the Anolon Advanced pans I purchased. The Anolon pans heat up nice and evenly and remain really hot due to their thicker construction and heavier bottom.

Before I got this newest Panasonic razor,  I've been using three other razors for a while now.  So the past two days, I've been determining which gives the best shave. The one on the left in the photo is the razor I'm reviewing, the Panasonic ES-RT97-S model.  The next one is a comparably priced Philips Norelco Model 7300 Shaver. The next one is a Panasonic ES8103S Arc3 Electric Shaver I purchased in late 2013. And finally there's a 5 blade King of Shaves conventional razor.I shaved each side of my face with different razors two days in a row and asked my wife to tell me which felt like the closest shave feeling my face with her hands. She was in the kitchen when I was shaving, so she had no idea what I did. I went through a complex sequence of comparisons that is best not to bore you with details.  Basically, I shaved and re-shaved both sides of my face with different razors and created a process of elimination. I’m a career engineer as you might already have guessed.  On the second day, I went through a different sequence – each time asking my wife to independently judge which side of my face had the closest shave by feeling my face.So here is the unbiased results in order of best shave over my two day test.Panasonic ES-RT97-S model (Winner)King of Shaves 5 Blade Shaver (Very Near Tie to Winner)Philips Norelco Model 7300 Shaver (Very Good)Panasonic ES8103S Arc3 Electric Shaver (Quite Good)I admit the blade razor was very nearly the same as the Panasonic ES-RT97-S model, but my wife still insisted the side of my face with the Panasonic ES-RT97-S model got the closest shave.  She did not know what razor I used or at what stage of my experiments, so this was absolutely an unbiased test.  The Panasonic ES8103S is nearly two years old and may not be as sharp as it was on day one, but it still gives a good shave.The edger on the Panasonic ES-RT97-S model works much better than my older Panasonic razor. The main reason is you can more easily see what you are doing.Even though this Panasonic ES-RT97-S model is substantially more expensive than the original Panasonic I purchased, I think I would pay the higher price now that I know for sure it can shave virtually the same as a blade razor. I have a fast growing tough beard and it is easy to do a quick touch-up in the afternoon with an electric shaver if need to do it.  If I used a blade razor twice in a day on a regular basis, my skin would break out with pimples or rash indefinitely.The Philips Norelco was a very close second, but it was not difficult to determine it was not as close a shave as this Panasonic ES-RT97-S model.  The footprint of the Norelco’s cleaner and charging station is a little larger footprint.  I’m not such a fan of these charger and cleaner stations for either one because of the space they require.  And I don’t much see much value in them either.  That’s just my personal opinion. You can charge the razor directly if you prefer in both the Norelco and the Panasonic models. You don’t need to use the charger/cleaner bases – purely optional. One thing I miss on my older Panasonic razor is the numerical display that showed the charging level in 10% increments.  I knew at a glance how much charge I had remaining.  Now there are just three orange dots instead of a numerical display on the new Panasonic razor.  I wish they had not abandoned the numerical display, especially considering the new one costs a lot more.The final consideration is the style of the shaver heads. The Norelco uses its traditional triangle of three circular cutting heads instead of a traditional rectangular cutting head.  I have a mustache and goatee beard and the rectangular configuration of the Panasonic razor makes it a lot easier to shave closer to the edge of my beard.  Also, the Norelco razor doesn’t have a built-in edger.  You have to pop off the triangular head and attach a special edger head.  It’s not well suited for trimming and edging breads and mustaches. For shaving wide open spaces, the Norelco works fine.So in conclusion, I believe this Panasonic ES-RT97-S model is an excellent razor.  I’d find it difficult to justify spending any more money than this for a razor. There are lots of less expensive razors to consider, but I have doubts you’ll find one as good as this one for a close shave. So I give my endorsement on this model as a good investment.  If you want to spend less, then get a different model Panasonic razor. The less expensive one is still quite good.

This is a great companion to my wife’s Tumi Backpack.  This luggage is surprisingly lightweight, yet it’s exceedingly sturdy and so cleverly designed.  In the past, I’ve briefly owned luggage that opened down the middle and it’s not in the least bit fun when it’s opened and half the contents spill out onto the floor.  But Tumi largely solved that problem with a full zippered partition on one side.  Just remember which side.  There are numerous handy pockets and compartments all through this luggage. It has the distinctive bright large gold Tumi zippers to help you identify it on the carousel.  At this price, it’s not so likely it will look like all the other luggage, although I will have to be more observant for the same reason.It’s close to the legal size limit of carry-on luggage, which is actually just what I prefer.  It has a zipper expansion capability if you need to push the limits further or even use it as your checked in luggage in full expansion mode.  I especially like the trolley strap to make it quick and easy to pull an additional bag behind it in tandem.  On my first around the world trip twenty years ago, I had three identical pieces of luggage that I pulled in tandem.  It was amazingly convenient, except on stairs, and this is the first piece of luggage I’ve owned since that time that has a snap-in trolley strap.  Now I want to get another one for my next overseas trip.  Of course, you can use it domestically just as well – no rule about that.I really like the dual rod pullout handle where I can strap the Tumi Backpack on top.  Or alternatively, I can strap my laptop computer case onto it as well.  Now that I’m retired, my wife and I can travel together and she can help with the backpack.  The corners are heavily protected and the wheel wells allow the wheels to freely rotate.  The wheels are large enough diameter not to sink into every small crack in the sidewalk or parking lot. I prefer even larger diameter wheels for that reason. It rolls easily and quietly. The sides appear very stiff and shouldn’t be crushed with a big pile of luggage on top.Admittedly this is quite expensive luggage.  However, if you do a lot of traveling, especially overseas, you will benefit in the long term to own sturdy well built luggage.  I’ve purchased several pieces of luggage in Shanghai that only lasted a one-way trip to San Francisco. Eventually I learned to invest in well built luggage.  I owned one piece of luggage that was a bit costly that just would not catastrophically fail .  It looked beat up after 23 round trips to China, but it still held up far longer than any other luggage I purchased. In the long run, you can spend more on cheaper luggage than one very good piece of luggage that lasts and lasts.  Appearance may not always hold up as long unfortunately.If your budget is in alignment with luggage in this price range, then I believe you will be more than satisfied with Tumi’s luggage product line.

This superb Breakfast Burrito Makers also makes a great tasting pizza from scratch in only 6 or 7 minutes cooking time depending upon how much cheese and other ingredients you use in your recipe. There's a couple of minutes of preheat time. It's like a thin crust pizza when finished and you can mix the ingredients to your personal taste. I didn't show the onions in the photo, but we chopped some up and added that to the mix as well. The next time we cook pizza, we will fold it over or roll it halfway through cooking and finish cooking it Burrito style. It will be less messy to eat that way. There are six recipes in the booklet to get you started.  We were in the mood for pizza when we unboxed it, so that's what prompted us to start that way. This is a good snack cooker and just the right size for the two of us. Of course, if you are cooking for a half dozen people, it will take a while longer to feed everyone.  They can take turns preparing it to their own personal taste.Both the top and lower halves have heating elements, similar to standard hamburger cookers. There's a platter in the center that swings out. The height is just under six inches and the diameter is just over six inches, so it's fairly compact. All the pieces that touch the food are non-stick surfaces. I used a paper towel that I cut into four pieces to wipe it down. The first paper towel piece got most of the cheese off and successive pieces wiped it cleaner and cleaner. It looks clean when finished wiping the surfaces. It says the removable pieces are dishwasher safe, but that doesn't constitute the main pieces. I would assume bacteria will get killed during the preheat and cooking stage. So cleanup is fairly quick, about the same as cooking time.We plan to use it often, especially for a  quick snack.  I’m very pleased with this Burrito Maker and I think you will be pleased, too.

The first thing that captivates your attention are the two bold gold colored zippers on the Tumi backpack. They are equally attractive and functional with their smooth action. The size fits my petite 5’ 2” wife’s back perfectly.  Of course, the straps are adjustable for different sized people.  Normally, I would have considered this a unisex backpack, but the gold zippers and petite  size are more becoming on a woman.  I got a laugh from my wife as I tried it on my back.  She said it looked much too small on me.  So much for the unisex backpack category.You shouldn’t have much difficulty finding overhead bin space on an airplane if you use it as your carry-on luggage, even if it is stuffed full. But it’s still a useful size.  You can probably get a 14 inch laptop computer inside, but a 15.6 inch is probably not going to make it.  I tried my 17 inch that has a secondary numeric keyboard for fun.  I was surprised that it fit inside widthwise, but stuck out the top by about five inches.There’s considerable space inside.  The bottom measures about 11 X 6 inches and the height is about 14½ inches, but the sides taper inward as it approaches the top. There is a zippered compartment on one side. In addition there are two pockets below the zipper, one of which is wider than the other plus there is a small width for one or two pens in the middle.  On the opposing side, there is an open pouch going across the full width and is about 11 inches in depth.  You can see it better with the photos I attached.There is some padding on the shoulder straps, but not a lot. And there is a wide band to slip over your carry-on luggage handle extensions. The shiny black nylon material contrasts quite well with the wide gold zippers. It has a look of elegance, which at this price, you’d expect it.  Tumi makes a very wide assortment of luggage, a style for everyone’s unique desire.  It appears to be very well constructed and I expect it to last a very long time. If your budget permits, I believe you’ll find this a very worthwhile investment for your future travel needs.

I bought this strictly for lower fan noise.  While it is still not as quiet as I want it to be, it is much less noisy than the one I replaced. I think my current issue is because the CPU fan controller is running it at maximum speed. The heat sink feels like it is room temperature.  I've gone into the BIOS settings and I can't see any reason for it to be running at this high RPM.  I know it would be a lot quieter if the fan controller was working properly.

Now this is something I didn't even know existed and I have needed it so many times. It is exceptionally well built and rugged in appearance. It is made of high quality food grade brushed 18/8 stainless steel - 18% chromium and 8% nickel. That is an expensive metal alloy, so no corners cut there. The snap on clamps grip the lid and seals it air tight.  Unless it is purposely abused, I think this will never fail even with daily use.I took the lid off and put both the container and the lid into the refrigerator overnight to prep it for a day trip. The next morning, I put some cold sandwiches inside along with some other snacks.  I even packed a few Techni Ice HDR 4 Ply Reusable Ice & Heat Packs 3 Sheet Special inside for extra measure.  These are amazing and if you don't already have some, I strongly recommending buying them. I have a Stanley Classic Vacuum Bottle 1.1QT Hammertone Green already, so this Vacuum Crock food container is a perfect companion item - both liquid and solid food storage together from a great company.It is almost like having a portable refrigerator with this combination. Everything inside stays nice and cold (or hot) for the better part of a day.  I forgot to take beginning and ending temperatures versus time.  I'm going to do that and put that in this review when I finish. Nothing like real data to prove the point. I receive a lot of Vine products and this ranks among the most practical I've ever received. I know I will get a lot of use out of this Vacuum Food Crock. I expect to use it primarily for cold storage, but it can be used for hot foods equally as well. I'm very pleased with this to say the least.

This is a professional home or business security system just like you would see in the movies.  There are many more configurations than this 10 camera system from which to choose. In fact, this security system and video recorder has 16 camera inputs, so you can add another six cameras if you choose.  Quickly to the highlights, you can record  16 simultaneous channels at once and play back all 16 video recordings at once as well.  It says it is high definition, but it is not 1080 lines of resolution – it’s 720 lines.  It’s still technically high definition.  They do make a full 1080 version for a higher price.  Unlike most of the low cost wireless systems, this produces a high quality image that you would have little to no difficulty identifying people in the video recordings.  I have three wireless systems, and they are no match to this system for image quality.  Not only is the resolution better, but the lighting is far superior to my other systems.  In my wireless systems, it drops to gray scale quickly when the lighting is reduced.  These cameras stay in color much longer.  Each camera provides its own lighting.  There is a power and separate video to each camera.Setup is mostly intuitive. Unlike the other reviewers, I actually set my system up and used it. There is a very detailed manual online. I glanced through it, but it was easier to just explore the menu by right clicking my mouse.  The software is quite intuitive, too. If you want to set up the email, that will require getting down into the details, a lot like the early XP days using Outlook.  You’ll have to read enough to find the default logon password. You’ll need to change it because it is too simple.  Otherwise, you don’t really need to read much of anything to know how to connect things together.  You will have to provide a computer monitor or even a television set with a HDMI cable input. Bigger is better for the monitor if you have 16 cameras connected to it.  They supply the HDMI cable and the wired mouse.  There’s no keyboard, but it would be nice to have a keyboard for setup, although it’s not at all necessary.  A short Ethernet cable is provided, but unless you are lucky, you will likely need a longer one.  Heed the warning not to arbitrarily shut down the power.  You need to click on the lower left hand book symbol and select the shutdown button and allow it to shut down in an orderly fashion.  Remember that this is essentially a computer inside with a lot of analog camera cables connected to it.  They supply a remote control, but I didn’t see any need to use it.You do not need a Wi-Fi wireless network to set up and use this security system.  In fact, within an hour of opening the box, you can set up a test bench on your dining room table and connect a half dozen cameras to test it.  There are 10 rolls of 60 foot video/power cable for each camera.  You’ll be surprised when you lift this box and realize how heavy it is.  That is mostly the cables that weigh so much. In addition to a hard wired system, there are smart phone apps you can download and see all the cameras remotely.  At first, I used a power line internet adapter, but today I decided it was better to use a hard wired Ethernet cable to connect directly to my cable modem.  That way there are two less components (transmitter and receiver) to get in the path of the internet. Getting access to this security system via my smart phone took a long time before I finally saw the images.  Yesterday when my wife installed the app, we had no difficulty getting connected, but today we couldn’t get any image to come up after logging onto the system remotely.  We installed the app on two other smart phones and still couldn’t get the image.  We got onto the site, just couldn’t get an image like we did yesterday. We are probably doing something wrong.  I’m not concerned yet because we did see it work yesterday.  And the video was pretty good.  If you have a large screen phablet, it’ll be an asset.Obviously, this is a hard wired system, so that can be a downside to residential property that is already constructed. On the other hand, you don’t have to be concerned about linking all the cameras together wirelessly and be dead in the water if the network goes down. Business installations have more flexibility with drop ceilings and the likes.  And often you don’t mind some cables that are exposed.  Wires are much more reliable than a wireless system – except perhaps for the connectors sometimes.  Even if your home is already constructed, you can usually drill and drop cables in the interior walls if there is no insulation or fire blocks inside the walls. It takes some careful measurements and finding good reference points. I installed wiring in my walls for my 7.1 channel home theater system and my measurements worked perfectly.  In my attic, I specifically used insulation batting and not blown in insulation so that I can lift up sections and drill into the walls  and I can still get to the eaves of the roof to install some cameras at strategic locations on my two story house.  I will hire somebody to do that – too dangerous for me. Also, it’s still too hot in the attic here in the Houston area.  I can still install some cameras in the meantime, however.Pros:1. Okay, I show several cons, but except for one item, they are in the trivial department. The pros are well covered in the marketing literature.2. I’ve already mentioned most of the pros in my text above. It’s a very good system and these days you really do need security monitoring.  It’s costly, but safety always comes at a price. I live in a gated community as an extra layer of security, but living next to the lake still seems to attract too many undesirables.  I plan to sell and move anywhere except next to a lake but still don’t know a place that is better.  I left Dallas because my home was burglarized while I was taking a shower and two other times an attempted burglary occurred while my wife, young children and I were actually home.  Nice neighborhood, but too convenient to freeway getaways. Three-fourths of the homes had been burglarized at least twice, some three times.  Sorry for getting off subject.3. I’m planning to build a custom home starting next year. I will buy a more expensive version of this system and install it instead of this model. There are lots of variations of cameras, so I might end up with a different configuration. But absolutely, I will build in a Q-See security video surveillance system during the construction phase.Q-See QT8516-8Z8-2 16 Channel HD 3 MP/1080p NVR System with 8 High-Definition IP 3 MP/1080p Cameras and 2 TB Hard Drive (White)Almost All Minor Cons:1. I’ve got only one significant complaint and that is the surprisingly noisy fan inside the recorder unit.  I don’t know why that fan has to be so loud. I’m tempted to take it apart and replace it with a quieter fan – but it’s probably not practical. The air being blown out is cool, so there can’t be much heat being generated inside.  I want to install it above some cabinets upstairs in my home theater room, but it is just too distracting to put it in the open area.  You can easily notice the noise across the hallway and into one of the bedrooms.  So if burglars break into the house and see all the cameras, they can easily follow the noise trail to the video recorder.2. The 16 BNC connectors in the rear are spaced much too close to each other.  It is a real challenge to both twist the connector on or off after the first column is filled. I had to use long nose pliers to do it and even that was difficult.  There isn’t a huge amount of space on the rear, but they should have used all of it so that spacing is better. Granted you shouldn’t have to do it all that often, but it should have been done better than this. If it had been RCA plugs, it would have been easier.  I do understand that BNC connectors lock in place, but I think a lot of people will just push the connector onto the receptacle and not lock it.  And that’s not a good thing to do.3. Best for new home construction and businesses. It just takes more work to install it in preexisting residential homes.  People who install alarms systems may be good people to contact to get the more dangerous outside work done.  It will cost significant money to do it right.  I’m contracting the external dangerous work.  I am installing the inside cabling myself.  I’m 71 years old and I don’t expect it to be so terribly difficult.  I’ve already installed wiring inside the walls for my four rear speakers for my home theater system. It does require a lot of careful planning however.4. Minor point. It says it can record at 30 frames per second, but the only options I could find was 15 frames per second.  Movie theaters use 24 frames, so it appears 15 frames is okay.  I didn’t see any difference when I walked past the cameras.  Maybe it defaulted to 30 fps somehow. Whatever the case, it looked fine.5. Minor point. The resolution of 720 is okay, but you can readily see the difference in quality compared to 1080P.6. Minor point. I wish the color had been white instead of black to better blend with the white ceilings.  They do offer cameras in white color on other systems they manufacture.

My wife has her home office set up in our breakfast nook and in the summer, it gets uncomfortably hot there on the southwest corner of our home. I’ve opened the air register fully open and tried to balance the other vents, but it’s just the way the house was built. I rolled this DeLonghi Portable Air Conditioner next to the corner window, opened it up a little, placed the adjustable vent inside and finally got the flexible hose inserted and turned it on. It has a nice remote control that includes all the functions found on the main unit.  It was 77 degrees when we turned it on and after 1½ hours, it was down to 74 degrees. It adjoins a large open living area so I wasn’t expecting the temperature to change rapidly. It rained today, so it was much cooler than usual. So this isn’t the example I’d hoped to use.  I will try to remember to update the test in a few days when it returns to seasonable Houston temperatures.Also, for a very long time, I’ve wanted a way to cool my garage enough to work there sometimes during the hot Houston summers.  My two car garage is little bigger than the 500 square feet the manufacturer says it will handle.  But I just need the air temperature in my work area to become more tolerable.  The windows in my garage are fixed and I don’t want to modify anything yet.  So I opened my garage door a few inches – just barely enough to place the rectangular hose reducer under the garage door to exhaust the air from the DeLonghi Portable Air Conditioner. I plugged the 20 foot long air gap under the garage door with a long piece of doubled over 3½ inch thick fiberglass insulation.  The garage door still leaves a gap at the top, but it doesn’t matter much because the displaced hot air can escape out of it because the hottest air rises to the ceiling.Even though it isn’t the most efficient arrangement, it does cool down my local working area in the garage. A few days ago, it was 83 degrees when I started and within a little over an hour, it was already down to 78 degrees as measured on the air conditioner unit. Now if I walked away from the air conditioner, it warmed up quickly. It needs much more time than an hour to cool a large area.  However, there was plenty of refrigerated cool air blowing toward where I was working and it felt quite pleasant. I checked the exhaust air coming out of the hose I put under the garage door and it was definitely hot as you’d expect.I planned to calculate the cost of operation, but we have a rather complex electricity billing system locally with split peak and off-peak and even seasonable adjustments.  For residential areas, it costs 14¢ per kilowatt hour during the summer during the peak cost. This is likely the time I’d use it the most, so 14¢ times 3.8 kilowatts comes to 53¢ per hour.  From 10 PM until 6 AM, it becomes much cheaper – so cheap I can hardly believe it is correct.  But the website says it is only 2.5¢ per hour, so it would cost less than 10¢ per hour to use it late at night.  Of course, electricity cost varies greatly across the United States, so these figures only apply here where I live.This DeLonghi Portable Air Conditioner is kind of noisy, certainly not quiet.  If you plan to use it while sleeping, it might take several days to acclimate to the fan and compressor noise. If you’re a light sleeper, you may need to double check if you can tolerate the noise.  I wish the exhaust hose was a little longer for my garage application, but the supplied length works quite well for indoor rooms. I found it very difficult to get this accordion style stretch hose to go into the fittings they supplied – kept coming out.  I had to balance it just right for it to stay put.  I think I’ll have to drill some holes and use screws, washers and nuts to make it stay put, assuming I can even get it inside the fitting.I think I read somewhere that it only takes ten minutes to get it set up and working. Maybe that’s true if you’ve already done it a few times, but at least a half hour is needed the first time and maybe double that. When I received this, it was double boxed with no apparent damage. However, the bottom of the manufacturer’s original box on the inside was almost broken out, so I just laid the box on its side, cut some tape and removed the Styrofoam bottom. When I set the box back upright, all I had to do was lift off the box – ready to roll. The delivery person cautioned not to lift the shipping box by the bands because they can sometimes break and the sharp edges of the straps can slice your hands open. So I cut the bands off with scissors before I did anything. The box is definitely on the heavy side – team lift label.In summary, this DeLonghi Portable Air Conditioner appears to be very well built and I think it fully performs as advertised. I certainly plan to make good use of it in the coming years, so I have no hesitation to give it a five star rating.  I particularly like the portability aspect and the overall appearance.  I read a review or two comparing this to a window air conditioning unit. That is a different application – fixed unit hanging out of your window.  This  DeLonghi Portable Air Conditioner is one that you can roll around to different parts of your home or business and you only need 110 volts via a three prong receptacle, not 220 volts.  You do need a place to exhaust the hot air, but otherwise, it is quite portable. It does not roll around on carpet easily, but tile floors like I have make it easy to move.  Don’t consider taking it up stairs. It’s quite heavy – 76 pounds shipping weight according to the Amazon product details spec.

It was really, really difficult to spend this much money on a seat cushion, but it is very comfortable compared to the others I tried and wasted money. The gel seat cushion is not very thick, but it is deceivingly comfortable. The back side is non-slip and that is extremely useful to keep it from sliding around on the seat. It just stays put in the original spot.  So that allows you to scoot around a little to readjust your bottom periodically.  It is considerably heavier than you'd expect of a seat cushion. I purchase both this model and the car seat version with the seat back cushion and both are inside our 2014 Honda Accord.  The seat hardness of the Honda Accord was one of my pet peeves when I purchased this car, so now that has been solved for about $200.  I may even purchase another of these seat cushions for airline travel. The car cushion is wider and I don't think I can fit it inside my carryon luggage outside pocket. I kept looking for this cushion in the photo with the young woman and her leg kept capturing my attention. The cushion is against the luggage handle in case you couldn't find it, either.

In 2009 I purchased a  TRENDnet SecurView Wireless Day/Night Pan/Tilt/Zoom Internet Surveillance Camera TV-IP422W (White) for $160 and I never could get it to work via the internet or even wirelessly.  This new model appears to be a significantly updated version of the surveillance camera I originally purchased.  So I was very hopeful I could finally get some use out of my prior generation surveillance with more advanced network control software with this latest generation surveillance camera.Getting this to work with a smart phone is not particularly difficult if you don't make any mistakes along the way, but really pay close attention as you go. The image from this surveillance camera appears to default to grayscale quite often even in fairly well lit rooms, but it does provide color in better lighting. The image quality via what they call the Cloud Camera is quite poor and generally everything is surprisingly blurred. You absolutely could not make a positive ID on anyone if that ever became a requirement. And that's here in my room using my desktop computer on the same network. It's about the same on the cell phone except smaller image size.  I’ve gone into the profiles and set every parameter I can to improve the video quality and nothing makes the image quality any better.There is a separate application for Windows 7 (quite likely works on Windows 10 as well) that provides a multi camera view like you would see in a central security control room of a commercial building. I installed it, but I cannot get an image – apparently multiple network setup parameters I haven’t entered or entered incorrectly. If you are a network specialist well acquainted with all the network buzzwords and terminology, then you are probably comfortably in your domain.
