But for mere mortals, this is out of our league.If you want a simple installation that is easy and quick to set up, you will be far more satisfied with a Summer Infant Baby Link Wi-Fi Internet Viewing Camera, Link Wi-Fi Series.  Even though the title has the word baby in it, it’s still basically a surveillance system. It will give you a view of what's happening in your home and it will be in color most of the time with moderate lighting and complete with two way audio. And you can remotely pan the camera up and down and side to side.  If you want a video surveillance system that sounds an alarm and sends intruder alarms to you via text messages, then the Guardzilla GZ502B All-In-One Video Security System (Black) may be what you prefer. It provides you with a nice image usually in color in decent lighting. However, it has a fixed position and the camera cannot pan around the room like the other products.  I have all three of these products.  I use the Summer Infant Baby Link the most - and there are no children living at home. So just disregard the word Baby in its description.This Trendnet HD Wireless Day, Night Cloud surveillance camera also includes an application called TRENDnetVIEW PRO.  It is clearly a professional grade application. While it has an extensive user’s guide for every aspect of operation, you'll still need a vocabulary of network buzzwords and know exactly what they mean and how to enter all the hieroglyphs of network language. If you are comfortable in this environment, then this is for you. If I had about a week to study up on all this and made a series of phone calls to customer support, I could probably get this to work. However, I'm just not that inclined to do it at this time, especially when the video image is so blurred I can barely recognize my own wife.  If I get it to work someday, I'll update this review. I don't give up very easily.Here is the jargon you can expect from customer service below. If you understand this, then you'd probably be able to get the professional software to work. I want learn enough to get my old TrendNet surveillance camera to work with this application, but it appears not to be compatible so far.  Maybe if I understood all the lingo and terminology much better, I think I might be able to get my old one to work on the same network and control both surveillance cameras.Okay, here is the exact text from customer support so that I don't mislead anyone. Maybe it is just my ignorance of network terminology that is the issue - although I've been setting up home networks for a decade without too much difficulty. But I'll freely admit that I'm no expert with networking.  I'll copy their much longer first response as a comment so that I don't waste a lot of space here in the main part of this review.----------------------------When you add the TV-IP862IC to this software you cannot use the camera URL.  You must use the IP address that has been assigned to the camera.  You should be able to find this in your router’s DHCP client list.  We would recommend that you use your router’s DHCP reservation option to ensure the camera is always assigned the same IP address.  For example, if your router assigned the camera an IP address of 192.168.10.105 you would add it to the TRENDnetVIEW Pro application using this IP address and not the http://xxxxxxxxx.cam.trendnetcloud.com address.Each camera is essentially an IP address and a port number with a username and password.  Please provide a phone number and an available time Monday ~ Friday 6:30am to 5:00pm Pacific time and we can have a third level support representative assist you through this process.  Difficulty is relative and if there are issues, we have support avenues to help.

After agonizing over the price for weeks, I finally decided to buy this for my 2014 Honda Accord and I have not regretted it for a minute. I have it on the passenger side as my wife does most of the driving nowadays. The seat height cannot be adjusted.  I am six feet tall and with this cushion, I really have to duck my head to get in the car and that's difficult after major neck surgery last year.  I have bumped my head countless times.  It's not all that thick, so that came as a surprise. But once inside, it is much more comfortable that the factory car seat. I bought a smaller version for my wife, so I've been out close to $200 on two car seat cushions - worth it as it turns out.  Of course, I still think it is way overpriced.I am less enthusiastic with the seat back cushion.  It is different than the seat cushion - not nearly as good.  I'm using as a leg rest on my recliner instead of the originally intended use.  If you don't specifically need a back rest, you can save considerable money by getting only the car seat cushion.

Not much to say except it is right angle power cable that allows me to push my monitor further to the wall. I wish there was a version that pointed downward.  I would have preferred that direction over the right angle.

0:20 Mins I am very impressed and also exceedingly pleased to own this carpet cleaner.  I included a short video so you can see how it sucks up the dirty water from the sample carpet that I've been using at the front door to my home.  My wife slowed down on the back and forth strokes after making this video.  I pays to go slower and give more time - especially to suck up the dirty water.  It does a very good job of removing the water from the carpet and it dries within an hour or two, but it will vary depending on the type and thickness of the carpet.  I should have taken a photo of the dirty brown water in the catch reservoir. It was very brown - almost shockingly so.  The carpet looked like new when we finished.  There are some brush strokes in the after photo, but that was just because of the direction of the final passes.  It disappeared after we walked on it.I've had an small thin area rug over the large tiles in our kitchen for six years and even though we vacuum it often, it really needed to be wet cleaned. It was getting to the point I was planning to put it in the garage to catch foot traffic before it got inside the house.  Needless to say, it looks like new now.  There was one three inch food stain I thought would never come clean - been there for years. Gone. I did prep it with an enzyme cleaner beforehand, but it didn't seem to make much of an effect, if any.There were three small mysterious stains in an upstairs bedroom that were there before we bought this newly constructed home. You couldn't see them with visible light, but when I used a strong UV flashlight, I could see them.  Thanks to this Bissell carpet cleaner, the spots are completely gone now.  Impossible to know now, but their origin may have been pet stains.  From what I have discovered thus far, the more you go over an area, especially sucking up the dirty water, the better. Don't expect magic by whizzing over the rug or carpet in a fast motion.  Go slow and give it time to wash the carpet.  There is very good brush action and I like that they made the head transparent so you can see when you've gotten most of the dirty water removed.The instructions say to use 1.25 ounces of their soap concentrate for the quick clean. I wish they would use volumetric units instead of weight.  I had to measure a small plastic container of their concentrated soap with kitchen scales to know how much 1.25 ounces was.  After that, it was easy and no need to measure it by weight.  And if you have a large area of carpet to clean, I think you'll need to purchase more bottles of the concentrated soap before you start.  It really works well, but there are limits, even to magic. I am glad they supplied the two samples with the carpet cleaner.  The instructions say to run your hot water until it gets to 140 degrees F.  I have my hot water heater limit purposely set to 130 degrees to help reduce the risk of scalding.  But even at this starting temperature, it works very well.When you get this carpet cleaner, do pay very close attention to the instructions on how to assemble the handle.  My wife is normally pretty good with mechanical assembly, but she ignored the little sign and snapped the orange plastic piece onto the carpet cleaner before she tried to insert the handle.  A few days passed and she told me there was something wrong with the handle - wouldn't stay attached.  Well, she didn't mention that she had already snapped the side plastic piece onto the cleaner.  I was baffled for a while until I started reading the instructions.  Then it was not so easy to remove that orange plastic piece.  I gambled on how to pull it off and fortunately nothing broke.  I do think they could have make it more clear about the assembly sequence.  For one thing, don't color that orange piece blue and show it going on, not already in place. Anyway, that is all history now - mostly forgotten.  There are some advertising signs that they glue on that is terribly difficult to remove.  It leaves an ugly glue residue that I had to apply with Goo Gone to get rid of it.  Use tape, not industrial strength glue. There is a substantial hose accessory kit, but I don't have an immediate need to use it yet, so I haven't tried it.  But I'm sure I will.I've sometimes rented carpet cleaners similar to this in the distant past. I don't have good memories of their performance - nothing approaching this level or I'd remember it.  I think this carpet cleaner is well worth the current asking price.  It appears to me to be a bargain if you consider what it costs for standard dry vacuum cleaners these days.  You should still use a dry vacuum cleaner to remove as much dirt as possible before using this wet carpet cleaner.  However, you'll soon realize how much dirt you are leaving behind after you use this carpet cleaner.  I wouldn't hesitate to spend this much money for this hot water carpet cleaner.  I'm just surprised I hadn't already purchased it.  Bissell is a great brand - very good reputation.

Once you get this Guardzilla security monitor set up, it works quite well.  However the setup process is less than ideal as you can see by the number of frustrated people giving it a one star rating.  My wife set this up a couple of weeks ago and followed the instructions to the letter and still had difficulties for whatever reason.  She had to start over several times or redo certain entries but eventually it worked.  She didn’t really do anything differently each time that I can recall.  So we’ve been testing it to determine how it behaves during normal everyday situations.It has a setting for an alarm whenever somebody walks in the path of its coverage.  I chose 5 seconds which is the minimum time. And if you choose, you can have it send a text message to your phone or an email or both.  And it will give you a short video clip of the intruder event so you can see who or what it was that set it off.  I think I recall once where the intruder (wife) walked past it quickly and the video clip missed her entirely even though the alarm was triggered.A few days ago, we started having problems with our cable internet modem and it had to be replaced – nothing to do with this Guardzilla security monitor.  Of course, the new Wi-Fi unit had a different password which was its serial number.  So my wife started trying to set up the new password in the Guardzilla monitor. After about 45 minutes, she was ready to throw it on the floor. She could not get Guardzilla to show up on the wireless network list in her smart phone.I noticed the small reset button, but she said she already tried that numerous times.  So with that information, I decided upon a more thorough way to reset the Guardzilla monitor.  I’m a retired electrical engineer and back nearly half a century ago, I dealt with reset circuitry and know how it should work.  I pressed the reset button continuously while pulling out the power plug, waited about ten seconds with the reset button still pressed and then plugged in the power plug – but still holding the reset button for yet another five or ten seconds.  Just to reiterate, I pressed the reset button continuously while removing power, waiting ten seconds for internal capacitive voltage to dissipate and still held it another five or so seconds after plugging the power back into the connector.  The number of seconds doesn’t have to be exact.Now I’m not saying this will universally solve all the problems people have been having.  Maybe it was just a little luck or even coincidence with my particular unit.  My wife was rather disgusted that I got it to work so quickly and I don’t blame her. If she had gotten a good power-on clear or reset, maybe she would have gotten it to work without any assistance. Power reset (initialization) is often a culprit with electronics that doesn’t have a bulletproof startup or reset design.  When you plug in the power, the electronics states are unpredictable how they will initialize.  Normally, there is a master reset circuit that initializes all the components inside to a known starting state.  Nowadays the electronic circuits are integrated at such a high level of sophistication that it is difficult to get off to a clear start. Again, this is speculation on my part.  The problems others are having may be something unrelated, but it’s still worthwhile to try – only takes a few seconds.So back to how well it is working after it was set up.  I tested most all the modes in reasonable detail and everything works as it should.  The lens is very wide angle and there is considerable distortion of the image – significant curving of the image on all four sides. This is quite common for cheap low cost wide angle lenses. However, I think they need to find a better lens because the distortion is so much it affects how well you can identify anyone.  The alarm emits a steady tone and is fairly loud, but not deafening.  Periodically, the Guardzilla unit makes a series of annoying clicking noises which sounds like an unusually loud mechanical relay inside.  I don't know what it is doing while making these annoying clicking sounds, but one benefit is I know when my wife is spying on me with her smart phone when she’s out shopping.So for the price, this is a good device definitely worthy of consideration.  I knocked off one star for the clicking sound and the difficulty in setting up the network. And it should have a better quality lens, too. The instructions for network setup appear to be correct, but some electronics inside the unit appear to be getting hung up during setup and it won’t display the Guardzilla on the network list.  Hopefully a good thorough reset will clear it before you start trying to set up the network. I only have one unit, so I can’t speak for the other people.  Somewhere it says a second Guardzilla security device can be added. Usually you do need more than one camera for adequate security monitoring.  So it is good that their app can accommodate a second security camera.

I put these female connectors on my three outside water faucets.  You can purchase the Hoselink Garden Hose Connector Starter Kit, but you'll probably still need to buy one or two of these female connectors.  I put Hoselink connectors on every hose sprayer I own.I was testing two pairs in my kitchen before actually going outside and connecting them to the outside faucets and water hoses. At first I thought it would be very difficult to completely twist lock the pairs in place.  But to my surprise after I connected them to the outdoor faucet, they snapped right into place without much effort - even the first time. It was hot outside, so that may have made a difference. Now they disconnect and connect easily - but still takes a firm grip. However, it feels good to hear them snap in place.  Gives a nice feeling of confidence they are going to stay locked in place. Maybe I've gotten used to it now because I don't even think about it anymore - second nature now. My petite 5' 2" wife handles them with ease, too.We worked outside for about five hours pressure washing our concrete driveway.  We used three pairs of the connectors during that time and none leaked even one drop of water - very tight seal. Previously, I had purchased some brass quick connectors and I was very disappointed with the constant leaking.  That is what motivated me to try these quick connectors. They are made of solid nylon - no metal parts, which is good in my book.Once you attach them to your faucets or sprayers, you just twist the pair together and you don't have to bother threading them onto a hose. It makes really quick work of it and I don't even hesitate to swap heads if needed. Before, I probably would just keep using one head rather than unscrewing it and screwing another one on. I do put an inline brass valve on my hoses so I don't have to go back to the main faucet to turn off the water.  You can hot swap these, but you'll probably get wet if you do.  I tried it just to see and it wasn't nearly as bad as I thought it would be. I tried to keep out of the spray stream. I think if I practiced it enough, I could minimize the spray better.Although it is purely optional, I did use the yellow locking tabs. I wondered what the purpose was because the connectors I got certainly weren't going to twist loose on their own in my lifetime. The yellow tabs work fine.  I haven't had any difficulty with any of them.  They click in and pull out with little effort. I did notice that most of the yellow tabs were loose and not inserted in the twist lock quick connectors, but at the time I didn't realize they were optional.  There were a considerable number of spare O-rings included . It seems like the o-rings are extremely well embedded into their grooves on the mating connectors, so it is difficult to believe they would ever get damaged under normal use. It seems like they would last a lifetime. However, I do like having spare parts on hand.I tested three pairs of connections in-line at full pressure.  I think I remember the house inspector saying my water pressure was quite high - about 60 psi. I left the water on with a brass stop valve at the end for at least two hours - not a drop of water leaked on any of them.I was impressed that the white locator tabs all ended up facing directly outward on the outdoor faucets on my house. I was expecting the white locator tabs to end up facing the house where I couldn't see them.  Maybe I was just lucky. This seems like a rock solid design to me.  I really like them.  I bought several female connectors to balance the set.

I have four computers and two DVD players on Actiontec power line adapters throughout my two-story house.  My main complaint is that they drop the download speed quite dramatically depending upon the branch wiring.  If I measure the download speed of a hard wired laptop computer directly to the cable modem, I get 50 mb/s download speed very consistently, never less.  Usually the best I get with these Actiontec adapters is 35 mb/sec, which is far below the specification. Oddly, sometimes I can get 50 mp/sec on an electrical outlet on the very same AC circuit about 10 feet away. But most of the time that same outlet only gets 35 mb/sec while the direct connection off the back of the modem is 50 mb/sec. I don't understand why it changes speed.Otherwise the nominal download speed elsewhere in the house is only about 25 mb/sec, which is half what I get at the modem.  So I have wasted a lot of money buying these 500 mb/sec power line adapters.  I should have purchased the cheapest ones, 200 mb/sec. I can get a better download speed using wireless to the modem - 35 to 50 mb/sec.I had one Actiontc 500 mb/s Power Line Adapter module hard fail last month after about a year of service, so I thought I needed to replace it.  A few days ago, I bought this on a one-day sale for more than one-third off the normal price. So it was worth it at that price. I had a price trigger at camelcamelcamel that alerted me via email. So my three star rating is for one hard failure but mostly the major drop in Ethernet speed from the modem.The main advantage of this unit is the quad output, which is useful for my home theater system.  I have multiple electronics that need Ethernet connectivity.  I now have a surplus of Actiontec power line adapters, so I will have spares if any fail.

This is a very good concept, but it needs to be longer and wider to be more universally practical.  Most especially it needs to be longer - double length for starters.  And it needs to be wide and tall enough to handle the wall wart power supplies.  This covers only the most basic and simple televisions, and definitely not complex home theater systems with a computer attached. It isn't big enough for a complex computer system. Hopefully they will change the size someday and if they do, I'll buy it again.

Since April 2015, our family has been pure Blu.  As soon as we got our first Blu Unlocked Smart Phone in late February, we were hooked.  We sold off  all our Samsung smart cell phones. Blu simply gives you far more bang for the buck than any other cell phone. It may not always be as fast or have hundreds of options or features you’ll probably rarely if ever use, but it still has an abundance of features – certainly more than most people need.  And this Blu Studio 7.0 II is no exception.  Here is a quick list of pros and cons.Pros:- Excellent Display and Size – 7 inches diagonal screen (3 X 6 inches viewable)- Approximate Overall Dimensions – 4 X 7 X ' inches- Good signal sensitivity – 3 bars versus zero to one bar for Samsung Note 8 cell phone- Surprisingly good photo quality. Excellent light sensitivity on rear camera.- Although big for a cell phone, still narrow enough to hold to your ear- Can work as a tablet without a SIM card inserted. Connects to WiFi.- Very good battery life, especially considering it has a large 7 inch display.- Almost goes without saying it is unlocked.  Standard on Blu phones to my knowledge.Cons:- Weight –  A bit heavy, but not too much:  8.7 ounces, barely over half a pound.- No 4G.  Only 3 G reception. Seems like an oversight.  Should have 4G.- Front camera image resolution not so great – VGA only.- Needs tiny screwdriver to access the SIM card. Not so quick to change SIM card- Already had three SIM cards get stuck. Scary. Not changing SIMs anymore.Blu Wish List:- Wish it had 4G, including LTE and keep under $200 for everything below.- Higher speed CPU such as Blu Vivo Air:  2 GHz and 8 Cores.- Better camera resolution like the newest Blu Selfie camera with Sony Camera.- Offer Selfie style monopods for all Blu Cell Phones.- Quick Change Replaceable batteries.- Robust Quick Change SIM cards that don't get jammed or stuck.My wife is an avid user of a BLU phones. Even though she uses her cell phone for hours each day, she still insists staying in budget for high tech gadgets – and that includes cell phones.  That’s why she is such a fan of Blu cell phones.  Otherwise she likes Blu phones because they come with the complete package: Headset, case and screen protector. She says this Blu Studio 7.0 II smart phone is easy to use, but I should point out that she has been using Blu cell phones for several months now.She owned a big heavy 8 inch Samsung Note 8 cell phone for about a year before giving it to her sister.  So she was familiar with the phablet size. However, this Blu Studio 7.0 II phone is much easier for her to hold to her ear (more narrow) compared to the Samsung Note 8.  The Blu Studio 7.0 II is unquestionably fits her hand much better. She is petite, 5 feet 2 inches tall. It fits in her purse nicely and compared to small phones, it is very easy to find it when she gets a phone call.One thing she especially likes is that she can use this Blu Studio 7.0 II phone as a tablet only.  It’s even a good price for a tablet only - very good size, image quality and affordable.  Photos when using the main camera are very good. The image on the screen is very near that of seeing it live in person, including the lighting. It is not overly saturated with color and the light intensity did not overly darken when taken indoors with natural lighting. What you see is very nearly what you get, but we haven’t tested it exhaustively. She also listens to music with the included earphone and has watched several full length videos. She is so pleased with the bright image and the clarity of the sound.This phone has numerous nice to have features.- It is unlocked phone and has a good 7 inch size with Android 5.0 Lollipop.- It has 8GB internal storage 1GB RAM. You can expand up to 64GB with a micro SD slot.- The main camera is 5MP and is more than adequate for most photography.- Consider the BLU Selfie cell phone for more demanding photos and videos.Photo left to right: Blu Studio 7.0 II, Energy X Plus, Life One, Selfie and Vivo Air

Everything would have been excellent if it had fit me.  The neck size and top of the shoulders are just about right, but the rest of the shirt is enormous on me. I am exactly 6 feet tall and weigh 188 pounds as of today. I have slightly wider shoulders than average. I'm about ten pounds overweight. This size Large is made for a person much heavier than I am - trying to be tactful.The fabric is not quite as soft as I prefer, but as you'd expect for cotton material. There is a gray liner around the inside of the collar which, although it can't be seen, is a nice touch. The sewing is very high quality with no loose threads, missing stitches or the likes. It should last a long time. The red color is about the same as the image on my computer monitor, so no surprises there. The length of the sleeves are longer on me than the photo - almost reaching my elbow when I bend my arm. It's another indicator I got a size that's too big. So consider ordering a size smaller than you usually wear.I checked the sizing chart and I still couldn't have known what to order.  I often buy my clothes from Penney's just so I can try them on for fit. If the price is reasonable, that's where I buy it.  If it isn't a good price, then I'll try to find it here on Amazon, but only after verifying the fit and material in a brick and mortar store.Anyway, depending upon the manufacturer, I wear anything from small to a large.  For the same actual fit, the sizing label can vary from Small to Medium to Large - no way to know without trying it on for fit.  I have a 16 inch neck, 43 inch chest and the arm length doesn't matter too much since this is a short sleeved shirt. The chart says I need a size Large. What the chart is missing is the gut or stomach size. The shirt is 50 inches at the waist and I'm 38 inches. Obviously I can wear this shirt, but I really dislike a shirt billowing out around my waist – makes me look fatter than I already am. I think I may need a size Small, but then I run the risk of it being too tight in the shoulders and chest.So depending upon your body build, you may need to adjust the size you order accordingly and maybe order one for a trial sample.  That’s what I do. Then if it fits, I order one of every color and two of my favorite colors.

Superbly sharp.  I gave away dozens of my old scissors after receiving this pair of Clauss titanium scissors.  This is the only brand I'll buy anymore. I bought four different Clauss scissors so far and I like each and every one of them.

Thank goodness I had a preexisting solid AMD back plate!  The universal plate they include is universally impossible to ever mount because the screws keep getting pushed out before you can ever get them threaded - assuming you don't count cross threading them and ruining the threads.  If I had not purchased some other mounting kit which had the real AMD plate with permanently mounted screws, then I would have rated this cooler much lower.  In my particular case it is next to perfect.The main thing I like is the flexible hoses.  My previous piece of high priced junk failed and sprayed antifreeze inside my case.  I was so extremely fortunate that it sprayed the fluid against the side cover and drained into the bottom of the case and onto my tile floor where I saw it before burning up my CPU.  I wish they had shown the air flow direction on the separate fan they enclosed.  It took me a lot of time searching on the internet to find consistent opinions of the air flow direction. Most fans have the air flow direction and rotation molded into the plastic frame, but not Antec.I wanted to use a different quieter fan for the separate fan, but apparently Antec's controller wants its brand connected to it.  I tried to connect the separate fan directly to the motherboard pins, but the Antec controller noticed that and ran the fans at an extremely noisy speed continuously. Once I finally gave up and used the stock Antec fan, the fan speed dropped at least in half to a manageable noisy level. I don't know how anyone can stand the fan noise in the so called Performance Mode.  Maybe if you had a noise canceling headset with the volume turned up loud, it wouldn't be quite as objectionable.The CPU cooler comes with thermal compound, but good luck trying to keep it from getting messed up while you are trying to get the mounting screw nuts screwed onto the main mounting plate.  I know my compound is really messed up, but I wasn't about to redo it after finally getting those mounting nuts in place.  I am running a high performance AMD CPU at 4.6 GHz.  It's base speed is 4 GHz.  I'd run it at base speed except it doesn't seem stable there.  I used the Asus utility to find the optimum speed and that seems to be 4.6 GHz is the magic speed for some reason.The ambient temperature at my desk is 78 degrees and the CPU temperature is 40 C or 104 F.  The fan speed is 1022 RPM.  The fan speed was well under 1000 RPM back when the outside temperature was not so hot.  The fan noise is noticeable now, but when it was about 850 RPM in the spring, it wasn't bad at all.  I wish I could install a quieter secondary fan on this water cooled assembly.  I really do not like fan noise.  My wife's desktop computer is virtually silent, but it also is less than half the performance of my computer.
My wife loves this song and so did I until she played it over and over and over again.
Rather thin, but perfectly adequate for covering a slot while allowing air flow.  I like the black color because it matches my case.

My favorite shirts ever in my entire 71 year life.  They are soft and fit perfectly.  They come out of the dryer without needing ironing - except maybe the collars need to be pressed to keep their original shape.  I bought one of every color and two of colors I wear more often.  I originally found these shirts in JC Penney and fortunately found they are exactly the same on Amazon.The size is way off in my opinion.  I am exactly six feet tall and weigh 185 pounds and I have to wear a size small. I don't like a loose fit. These fit me perfectly in the small size. Not tight with a little room to spare.  The arms are a little tight, however.  That's why I'm glad I discovered them in JC Penney so that I could try them on first to know with certainty that they would fit me.These shirts have about the most scratchy tags I've ever seen sewn into a shirt.  But a few quick snips with sharp scissors rectifies that rather quickly.  I will never understand the logic of why tags need to be sewn into clothing in this day and age.  And why manufacturers pick the worst possible material to use as tags is another thing I'll never understand.  This is not unique to these shirts.  They are all that way.
Small and completely functional.  A great bargain if you have the time to wait for delivery from China.  It took about two and a half weeks if I recall correctly.

I've owned a full set of Oneida Michelangelo flatware for over 40 years now.  I just recently gave my old set to my daughter and purchased a full set just like it.  I bought this particular pair just to get the clamshell spoon that wasn't available anywhere else that I could find.  The servall piece was redundant to one I already had.  The new version of Oneida Michelangelo flatware is not quite the same pattern as the original set. In fact, they have modified the pattern and shape of all the pieces multiple times over the years.  So if you want to buy a few replacement pieces from an old pattern, it won't be exactly the same.

This cell phone would be almost ideal if it had a replaceable battery two or three times as high capacity.  I don't care how thin the phone is as long as it doesn't sacrifice a reasonable battery life between charges. I haven't owned a phone yet that didn't require a battery replacement within a couple of years and my most recent Samsung required a battery replacement in less than a year.  I hope this battery is different, but I very strongly doubt it will last long considering I have to recharge it a couple of times per day.  So now my wife carries a big thick battery pack with a long cable connected to the skimpy battery in this Vivo Air Smartphone. That is the realistic scenario.The other thing I'd like to see improved is inclusion of 4G LTE.  But truthfully, it's really fast just as it is.  Regrettably I very recently purchased two of the new BLU Life One 4G LTE Smartphones with LTE.  With the Blu Vivo Air phone, I get 4 bars signal strength throughout my home, but both of the BLU Life One 4G LTE Smartphones get zero bars signal strength.  I'd return it except I can't find anything actually broken. If I drive directly under the cell tower, I do get 4 bars.  The cell tower is direct line of sight only one mile away across the lake.  I can see it from my windows.  So now I've moved the SIM card back to this Vivo Air phone.I will sell the two Life One 4G cell phones. I have a BLU Studio 6.0 HD Smartphone as well.  I like it except it is so big.  I wish they'd keep the display and trim off the top and lower parts of the phone to make it smaller. It's too long.  I've been a Samsung lover until I got this phone.  Then I sold both of my Samsung phones immediately.  Blu is a great value overall and the reliability has been very good so far.  So I'll probably keep buying this company's products.  Blu will probably introduce a cell phone eventually with my ideal set of features - especially longer battery life.I do l

I bought a Norelco razor analogous to this about 14 or 15 years ago. Back then, it just didn’t give a very close shave, so I changed to Remington, then to Braun 7000 Series razor and then to my much more recent Panasonic ES8103S Arc3.  This new Norelco razor is two to three times as expensive as any razor I’ve ever purchased.  Mentally, I had a lot of reservations about how well it would compare to my Panasonic razor, which provides a very close shave. After being used to listening to the high speed Panasonic shaver, the Norelco sounded very slow in comparison. So mentally I was equating sound to performance.  Well, to my complete surprise, this Norelco shaves very nearly as close as a blade razor and definitely better than my Panasonic electric razor.  But this Norelco is about twice as expensive as the Panasonic model I have – not that there is always a direct correlation between price and performance.The first time I tried this Norelco razor, it had been at least two days since I shaved – more likely three days.  I was curious how well it would perform under those conditions because the Panasonic doesn’t handle two or three day beard growth very well.  The Panasonic razor seems like it has to gnaw its way down to the skin level – just takes a longer than usual. The Norelco definitely outperforms the Panasonic razor in this situation, but it also tugs on a few hairs along the way.Wet vs. Dry:I shaved for about four days straight with a dry shave.  And again, the result seems very comparable to a wet shave with a razor and shaving cream.  I won’t go so far to say it is exactly equal to a regular razor, but it’s surprisingly close – except on my neck where there are significant contours and wrinkles from age.  A standard razor does better on my neck. This razor claims it has multiple degrees of freedom to contour to the shape of your face and neck.  And on my cheeks, it works great.  And it does a good job on my neck as well, but not quite as good as a razor shave with water and shaving cream.  In my opinion, this Norelco shaves closer overall than my Panasonic razor.I inserted the liquid container into the base of the Norelco shaver and plugged in the charger unit and watched and listened to it go through a series of strange sounding grinding and gnawing noises.  It takes a short while to finish its cycle.  So after I saw it puddle up the blue liquid under the razor’s head, I started shaving not knowing what to expect. It felt slightly oily on my skin, lacking a better word to describe it.  It didn’t seem to have much, if any odor.The base unit will take up a fair amount of space on your countertop.  You charge it with the shaver heads facing down and then you press the upper structure to start charging the shaver.  Press it again and it raises up to remove it.  At first, that wasn’t so obvious since I don’t tend to read instructions unless I get into difficulty. After I shave, I pop off the shaver head assembly and use a can of compressed air to blow out the beard dust before returning it to the charger unit.  If you need to trim your sideburns or mustache, you have to remove the triple rotating head and press on a separate edge trimmer that is included.  I still use my aging Braun shaver for that task, so it’s not an issue for me.  I have quite a collection of razors that all seem to have one specialty that is better than any other shaver.Anyway, if you have about $150 or so in your budget for an electric razor, this Norelco gives a very close shave that I haven’t personally experienced with any other razor. Admittedly, my closest competitive razor is the Panasonic razor at almost half the cost.  But you can’t always judge a product by what it costs.  But in this case, it seems to matter.  There is the potential inconvenience of popping off the razor’s head to use the head to use the edge trimmer.  It’s quick and easy, so it doesn’t take long to switch heads. It’s up to you whether that makes a difference. On a positive closing note, it does provide a surprisingly close shave.

This is my first Dyson and seeing is believing.  I've been reading about Dyson for years and I just couldn't get past the price to actually buy one.  Well, I finally got my wish and got one on the Amazon Vine program.  From the moment I first pulled the trigger on this vacuum cleaner, I became a instant believer. It puts all my Black & Decker battery powered vacuum cleaners to shame.  I almost didn't believe it and yet it was right here in my hands experiencing it first hand.  I looked in the dust collection chamber and there was so much stuff there - almost as good as my AC wall power vacuum cleaner.I really like the feel of the hand held unit. It fits my hand so well and the trigger feels so natural.  It doesn't feel heavy and it is not at all tiring to use it - very ergonomic design. After using it a while, I can feel the heat from the motor. I hope the battery holds up long term. For now, it holds a good charge for quite a while. I haven't used it long enough to run down the battery.  I ran it over 15 minutes and it showed no indication of the battery getting weaker. There's a power boost button for temporary tasks and it really works well. It's a little noisy, but different than the noise from a standard vacuum cleaner.  It's mostly noise from air being blown out of the head. It's not annoying to me.  When my wife uses the standard AC powered vacuum cleaner, I can't stand it and go to another part of the house until she finishes.The unit snaps together very easily and is disassembled just as easily. There is a dump lid to discharge the accumulated trash and it is fairly easy to use, but I think the release mechanism could have been designed better. Maybe with practice, it will become easier. There is an included wall mount with an attachment for the charger connector.  Be careful to route the wiring before you snap the connector in place. I was just experimenting with how well the connector would be retained and before I knew it, the power connector was permanently in place - and I had not routed the wire cable properly. I finally had to use a screwdriver to pry it out and was worried I might break the plastic retainer.  Now I know that power connector is never going to pulled out.I am going to sell off all my other vacuum cleaners and standardize on Dyson. I know the Dyson vacuum cleaners are quite expensive, but they have the performance to justify the price.  I read the brief history book that was included with this vacuum cleaner and I'm glad to see the engineer who designed this line of vacuum cleaners is still the owner.  Usually the inventors of any new technology end up being pushed out of the company once the financial people get their claws on the company. I have an even dozen patents myself and all I got was my photo hanging on the wall and a few patent plaques that I had to buy myself.  So I commend this rare man who reinvented the vacuum cleaner and is still thriving in his own company.  It means he is not purely driving by profits, but driven by his reputation and skill as a world class engineer.I did receive this vacuum cleaner on the Amazon Vine program. but I will use my own money to purchase some more Dyson vacuum cleaners now. I frequently end up buying additional products that I review on the Amazon Vine program. And this will be no exception.  So I clearly endorse this Dyson vacuum cleaner as being the best handheld vacuum I've ever used by far.  It's even better than some AC powered vacuums I have used. There is real modern engineering behind Dyson products - not just incremental improvements to units that have been around for over 50 years.

I purchased this for one of our teen daughters who is not only a fantastic cook, but also quite intellectual and as a wonderfully insatiable appetite for how things work and why. This book is a wonderful blend of some science, chemistry and cooking mixed together perfectly. This entertaining but absolutely educational book is neither a full-fledged cookbook or science book, but somewhere in between with some definite technical writing throughout that may stretch your brain a bit, at least it did mine. At any rate, both she and I have enjoyed learning some very cool things that we never knew before as well as some tasty recipes that are sure to please, while the science portion feeds your brain well!

I have always been drawn to Japan, it's culture and its people and it is in my top 5 list of places I want to visit one day. Naturally, I have read much over the years about Japan and its culture, but this has to be one of my most fun reads to date. The author touches and expounds on things from the very distant past to the modern present day seamlessly, with humor, insight and elegance that makes this a joy to read. The many photographs (with thoughtful yet to-the-point accompanying captions) dispersed throughout are such a pleasure to view and nearly transports the viewer into that moment. There is not a dry or boring passage in this book, it is thoroughly entertaining with many educational aspects as well. One of our teens, who is studying hiragana and katakana, as well as the spoken Japanese language, loves this book equally, so there is a lot of sharing going on both with this book and through discussion. I recommend this to anyone interested in gaining a deeper insight and perspective into fascinating Japan presented in a unique way both through words well-written and engrossing photographs.

I had ordered this as a wrap/shawl for one of my daughter's upcoming formal events rather than using as a beach cover up. While the measurements of the wrap we received were slightly off (ours is about 37 1/2" by 56"), she tried it on and it will still work for her purposes. The quality is nice, it has a suitable weight, not too light and not too heavy, and looks elegant when added to her black formal dress. This wrap is simplistic and classic, has a very, very slight sheen, is just sheer enough, and for the quality and very fair  price point at under 8 bucks a very good deal. I would definitely recommend this wrap/cover up.

This Chibi Miku Tote bag is much better than advertised. The material this is made of is much more sturdy than we had expected, not the cheap, expendable "non-woven material" that so many inexpensive totes are made from. The top portion is zippered, and the inner portion is nicely lined and has a zippered inner pocket as well. The outer graphic is true to the photo and looks like it will hold up very well and not crack or peel easily at all with normal wear and tear. This tote bag is really cute and very well-made, I recommend it!

I spent a lot of time researching various mandolins and reading reviews while needing to stay within a modest budget to get one of our daughters the best mandolin we could afford. I came across the Rogue mandolin and had decided that we'd get the best quality for the price point, but when I saw that for a small amount more, we could also get an extra full size guitar, which we very much need because all 3 of our daughters and I play guitar to varying degrees. This was one of the best musical instrument deals around in my opinion, because you just can't beat the price on these very nice quality instruments.The mandolin: this is simply a beautiful instrument both to my eyes and ears. The workmanship is very good, the action on the strings is better than I've seen on some much higher-priced mandolins. The strings that came with it were better quality than I had expected, and have not yet needed to replace them with the strings that I had purchased at the time I had placed this order. The first several times this is played, it will need to be somewhat re-tuned, but we expected that and now holds it's tune much longer in between. We are very, very pleased with this mandolin, it's just lovely all around.The guitar: this is a full-sized guitar, the sunburst finish was much prettier to me than in the photo, and is a well-constructed instrument. We have other guitars, and so are a little more picky and familiar with what we want/need and what to look for. We were not disappointed, this guitar is hard to beat at this price, even some I've tried in person at higher prices at my local music shop. The action is suprisingly good, and holds a tune very well. Again, I ended up not replacing the strings on the guitar that I assumed I would need to do, as the strings that were on it are just fine. The tone is fabulous, and does not sound, look or feel as inexpensive as it is. I am quite amazed that we were able to get both this guitar and mandolin together for under a hundred bucks. While the saying that "You get what you pay for" is true more times than not, in this case, we got way more than what we paid for and couldn't be happier with this purchase. I highly recommend this to anyone that is looking for terrific package deal of a quality mandolin and quality guitar at this price point, this is a very good bargain!

The fragrance of this lotion smells more (to me) like the Olay Total Effects Anti-Aging Body Wash than anything close to cucumber-scented. I was surprised at how I didn't smell even a hint of cucumber, just a very strong (almost too heavy) fragrance of something not cucumber. I've used a variety of different cucumber lotions and washes, and this is the first one I've encountered that doesn't even come close to smelling cucumber-y. The scent of this lotion does not wear away easily, which will make those who do like it happy and then those like me, not so much.However, that being said, I do like the way it is immediately absorbed without leaving any greasy film whatsoever and does make my skin feel softer and lightly moisturized.Five stars for the lotion itself, but only two stars for the fragrance. To be fair, I gave it three stars because Olay really has made a good quality and affordable body lotion, but the scent is really strong and lacking anything resembling cucumber, to my nose (and my family members' noses, too).

This electronic dictionary and thesaurus is compact, making it nicely portable, but I feel it is rather dated, like something that would have been manufactured about a decade ago. The dictionary words are rather limited, and the user interface for other options can be rather confusing and not very intuitve. Having owned an electronic Franklin dictionary/thesaurus product some 20 years ago, it was superior in every way to this although not as compact. Sadly, that product is no longer made, and I feel pretty let down by this particular model. Family members enjoy using it occasionally, so at least it's getting some use. I wouldn't recommend this particular product, it's very limited in words/definitions and not user-friendly.

I had originally gotten this for our daughters, but I have to admit I have been reading it more frequently and enjoying it myself. I wish that this had been on my bookshelf when I was in school, it would have saved me so much time in trying to find ways to memorize many groups of things that I had found bland and unmemorable at that time.Everything is nicely laid out by categories, making it very user-friendly and quick to reference topics of interest. While not every subject in this book may be relevant to everyone, I feel that everyone will find something in this book that is useful to them and help them to feel just a little bit smarter, even if it is done with the help of some creative mnemonics.

I bought these charms/spacer beads as well as "Pandora-style" bracelets and beads for our daughters to make their own personalized bracelets, and these were such a hit! These charms look very nice when placed between beads and are surpisingly nice quality for the price point. Each charm/spacer bead was different and unique, and the "antiquing" really brings the design out where applicable.It's been about a month or so since our daughters made their bracelets and have worn these, and the finish has stayed true and without any skin irritations (one of our daughters has a nickel allergy). I love that the company offers a bonus charm, making it 13 charms in all. I am very pleased with this purchase and recommend these charms/spacer beads.

This is one of my favorite small kitchen tools, it's great for not only slicing pizza with ease of course, but I also use it for easily cutting sandwiches as well as quickly slicing through very large batches for dumplings. The palm rest makes it very easy to hold onto and apply as little or as much pressure as needed. Clean-up is ridiculously simple by pulling off the cutting wheel and washing it and the housing--both of which wash and rinse very well. Then, after drying, I snap the wheel back into place and it's ready to go again. The wheel, although it is some sort of plastic, is still quite sharp and tempered in some way so as to not bend or warp under pressure. It rolls smoothly within the housing while the palm rest is sturdy and secure in my hand allowing me to easily slice through thick or thin crust pizzas, sandwiches without tearing, and (dumpling) dough safely, cleanly and effectively.

I picked up a few packs of these Knorr Roasters Roasting Bag and Seasoning Blend for Chicken, (Buffalo flavor) packs at my local grocery store to try something quick and different than my usual chicken recipes.PACKAGE: The compactly folded roasting bag comes packed in a little area sealed separately in the top of the package, while the seasoning blend is at the bottom.NUTRITION FACTS: (At 1 1/3 Tbsp serving size): 25 calories, 450mg of sodium, 5g carbohydrates, 0g fat, 0g protein. Package also states that this is made in a facility that processes milk, egg, soy, wheat and anchovies.PREPARATION: Put 1 1/4 lbs. of chicken breasts into roasting bag, add seasoning, seal with provided tie, turn bag over several times until pieces are evenly coated, place flat in baking dish, bake in 350 degree preheated oven for 35 minutes. Let bag sit for 5 minutes, open and serve. (Serves 5)APPEARANCE: The chicken didn't have the rich orange-red appearance as on the packaging, it was watery and paler orange in color.FLAVOR: I felt that the seasoning could have had more of a "kick" to it. There was a very, very mild buffalo flavor making it taste kind of plain, and we found that the chicken still needed additional seasonings and sauce after tasting the chicken to give it a more noticeable, well-balanced flavor.TEXTURE: The chicken breasts were very moist, but the texture was somewhat chewy-tough.CLEAN-UP: The roasting bag truly does make clean-up very easy.CONCLUSION: I would add additional seasonings of my own to the chicken prior to roasting when I use up my remaining packs of this. It's not a bad flavor, just not enough, making it taste kind of plain and boring. I'll use up what I have already purchased, but won't get anymore of this particular flavor.

Our daughter said she saw this, immediately thought of me and got me a copy, which I'm thoroughly enjoying. "This Is Not a Book" is an experiential exploration into random, sometimes thoughtful, other times downright silly (but always imaginative and fun) activities. Some of techniques involved in the "missions" include drawing, doodling, writing, cut and paste, or just daring you to do something quirky.The free-style writing, art/doodles and photography in this (not a book) say, "No pressure" and encourages you to just go with it, imagine/daydream, take creative or outside-the-box style chances, (thankfully none of which involve the endangerment of any animals or possible legal repercussions). Certain pages within this work, however, will be mutilated or otherwised damaged if all of the assignments are completed.There is a lot of fun to be had with this publication, if you are willing to "lighten up" for just a little while and be playful. "This Is Not a Book" is like a "playdate" with your imagination, and I can't wait to check out more of Keri Smith's works!

I bought this for our oldest daughter, who has been using this nearly every day, and her thick, long, healthy hair really has held a very nice curl where it wouldn't before using regular clamp-style curling irons and hot rollers. A marcel-style iron does hold a curl in her often stubbornly straight hair pretty well, but she was not comfortable using those, so this has been a great alternative/addition to her hair styling collection.The learning curve takes some practice, but after a few tries, she achieved beautiful, consistent results, curling her hair section by section. The included heat glove is an essential component to using this wand, in my opinion, and the cool tip helps aid in maneuvering the wand through the hair safely. The glove itself (and hand) will get hot if it is in contact with the wand for more than a very few seconds, but with proper use of the wand and glove, prolonged contact between the two is not necessary.The tapered wand gets quite hot (heat adjustable from 270 degrees to 410 degrees) quickly and evenly with a wonderfully sleek surface that makes her curls look smooth and finished. The tapered end feature lends a "naturally curly" look to her normally straight hair, and what she and I love most about this is how very long her curls last--ALL DAY! Normally, within an hour or two, her curls from regular irons/hot rollers would droop and disappear, but not with this curling wand.Finally, the digital controls are easy to read/use and well-placed. The temperature lock feature is wonderful, which keeps one from accidentally turning it down or up during use. I have been extremely impressed with this curling wand/glove set, and will probably end up getting one of my own so I won't have to borrow my daughter's. I highly recommend this product, it's been the answer to helping our daughter put beautiful curls in her straight hair that LAST ALL DAY LONG!

I bought these for our children for general doodling and shading in minor projects, and for those purposes these are fine. However, these are not particularly suitable for serious art, such as fine art competitions or major projects. The variety of colors is good, but the depth of color is very light and not heavily pigmented or rich-looking. But, for general, everyday use with a wide spectrum of colors, these are okay. This would be a nice starter set for someone to practice their coloring in/shading techniques before moving on to a higher quality but more expensive set of colored pencils. Not bad, not great, just okay. I'd give 3 1/2 stars if I could, because of the variety of colors in this set.

These eye makeup brushes are really soft and each brush's bamboo handle is labeled: shade, highlight, blend, smudge, and crease. The pouch these come in is a really nice convenience and perfect for organizing and travel. The brushes are quite fluffy, almost too fluffy for very fine/precise application. However, these are good quality, especially for the price point, and with proper care, should last a long time. Overall, I really like these, but do wish that this set included one very fine, somewhat stiffer brush for finer, more precision application. With that in mind, I recommend this set for general, everyday (especially the natural look) eye makeup, and EcoTools is a brand I'd be happy to buy again.

This is a very basic set of 6 clay tools, which are actually like 12 tools due to each piece having 2 different modeling/sculpting ends. I like that each tool is numbered, (#10, #13, #19, #24, #36 and #37), as I couldn't tell in the product photo, although some of the numbers are difficult to read. Each of these hardwood tools were nicely smooth, with the exception of the #37, (with the rounded blunt end). This one was slightly unfinished and raw-feeling, but thankfully not splintery. Although I've seen the flat #10 combing tool in various sets with teeth even and uneven, and in this set, the teeth are not perfectly even. I think this is a pretty good, although slightly flawed set, and expect these tools to last me for several years with normal use.

This Elmer's Washable All-Purpose School Glue Stick 30-Count Class Pack has proven to be a great buy. This pack of 30 has lasted us a good year before we ran out- (even with 3 children having frequent school projects and several art/craft projects at home) -and every one of the sticks have been fresh and ready to go, with no dried-up duds.I have found that while one can get the same or equal quality with some generic/no-brand products, when it comes to glue sticks, the Elmer's brand has never let me down like some off-brands have. These glue sticks have effectively glued everything from tissue paper, scrapbook paper, construction paper, cardstock and photos to various items from plain copy paper to poster board and canvas with no problems. The glue goes down easily and holds extremely well, and is a product I highly recommend.

This "My Little Pony Friendship is Magic Spa Pony Set" contains the 3 figures, Lotus Blossom, Zecora, and Pinkie Pie. They are about 2 inches tall (average), and are solid plastic (not brushable hair). One of our MLP-collecting daughters was especially tickled with Zecora, as Zecora doesn't seem to be as easy to find in a single pack as many of the other characters. This is a cute little set and having the elusive figure, Zecora, (which we've had trouble finding separately at a reasonable price) in it makes it extra-special.

While this Willow Tree figurine, "Prayer of Peace," is small at only 4 inches tall, for me, it's message is huge, and is a beautiful and gentle visual reminder for yourself or a loved one to make meaningful time for prayer, no matter how hectic life gets. The carved detail of the dress is intricate but with a nice contrast of white and neutral tones without being too busy. This figure is well-made and because of the muted tones, it should work well in just about any decor setting. Beautifully packaged in it's trademark gift box with it's own title card, this is a wonderful piece ready for gift-giving or just as a special gift for yourself.

I purchased two of these ecoTOOLS Make-Up Kabuki Brush Sets (one for our daughter, one for myself) after comparing several different brands and reviews, and I'm so glad I did. To begin with, this entire set of a concealing, bronzing, contouring and buffing brushes cost less than what I normally pay at a brick and mortar store for one Kabuki buff brush alone, and the quality of these brushes is as good, if not better.The bristles are soft and each of the bristle's end tips are finely tapered, which results in a more natural, softer application with regular pressure, but probably not suitable for theatrical makeup application/stage makeup or where much heavier application is desired. The brushes hold their shape well, and feel so nice against the skin with no prickly bristles. To give a good test to the bristles, I have tugged and pulled from the middle and outside of the bristles (which is my way to predict if they are prone to shedding) and have not had one single bristle come out, so I am very pleased.As a former makeup artist, I have used several different brands and types of brushes, and these are surprisingly good quality for the price, (but only for personal use because of the short handles, which would make it very awkward when doing another person's makeup). I like that the handles of these are short, because they are perfect for travel, stow away nicely, and the shorter length doesn't adversely affect my personal makeup application at all. These brushes are so very butter-soft are a pleasure to use.I highly recommend these brushes for anyone looking for a nice quality brush set at a very budget-friendly price.

This is a fantastic product and one I use regularly when making sweet treats for family and friends. Using the entire bag, I was able to make 48 chocolate-coated/dipped (overstuffed) peanut butter-filled Ritz crackers, a family favorite in my home and among our friends. This melts very well in a microwaveable-safe bowl, and I always stir in just a bit of vegetable oil after melting the chocolate down to give our treats a nice gloss. This has a good flavor as a hard-when-set coating, and I prefer this over the Make and Mold brand small chocolate-flavored candy wafers that I used before I found this product years ago for it's flavor, meltability, consistency and ease of use. Also, this is very good for making chocolate-covered pretzels and chocolate-covered nuts.

I bought the 4 ounce bottle of this lavender oil and have used it in several different mixtures for topical use. This has been the main ingredient in my "after sun" mixture in an almond oil carrier. I have also used this for treatment of an itchy skin irritation, and I have had no issues using this neat (w/o carrier oils and undliluted) on my skin. Also, I've included this in various homemade cleaning sprays and mixes, and it makes a clean and calming aromatherapy freshener for the home (I use this primarily in the bedroom and bathroom).The lavender scent is strong, so a little goes a long way and lasts for hours. This Now Foods Lavender Oil is suggested for external use only, so keep that in mind when making a buying decision. It's also worth noting that this bottle does not include a dropper, so I recommend that if you do not already have a supply of droppers to be sure to purchase those as well. This is a good quality for the price, was a great purchase for my purposes, and I plan on getting more of this when I run out.

I bought this at our local hardware store to use for quick, around-the-house jobs, and it has to be one of my favorite tools/gadgets. I like this very much for a few reasons. First, it's a two-in-one tool, so it saves space and time. Second, this is very well-made and function as well as the day I bought it (at least 4 years ago). Third, the rubbery grip makes it very easy to keep a good (and comfortable) grip on. But, the list goes on:The long-nosed plier side is long enough to get the job done when my household repairs have called for one. Additionally, the wire stripping portion has come in handy the couple of times or so that I've needed to use it, so that's always a plus and kind of makes this 3 tools in one.The flat nose jaws on this open about an inch or so wide, so has been useful for most all of the projects that I have had to work on. The teeth/ridges on both of the pliers have helped me to keep a good grip on whatever I'm working on and have never worn down.There is a small metal button on one side that you can slide up or down to unlock these and switch from one plier to the next, and stays put quite well. Transitioning from one plier side to the other couldn't be smoother or easier. I absolutely recommend this Allied 30578 SwtichGrip Dual Action Plier Tool to anyone who does occasional, small household repairs/projects to those who use tools daily in their line of work.

This is an older book, but with information on all things needlecraft-related that never lose their relevance. For me, this is the best book I've ever found for all levels of skill sets (beginners to experts) for instructions and techniques involving a needle and thread. The writing is very easy to follow and the photos, illustrations and diagrams make it very understandable, especially for visual learners (such as me). This is truly the most exhaustive and interesting needlecraft book that I have ever owned, (or looked at, for that matter) and have used it often throughout the years. From basic sewing techniques for the absolute beginner, to textile artistry, to the most advanced expert, there is something in this for everyone. This book is an absolute pleasure to read/study/reference and I just love it!

I began taking probiotics several years ago after my local herbal/natural medicine store owner and friend recommended I incorporate them into my diet. The ones I started buying and using were great, but didn't fit well into my budget. I discovered these and have been taking them for at least 3 years now, and I'm very happy with them.I must warn you, these are not coated tablets and smell absolutely disgusting. The odor is awful and nearly caused me to not take them at all in the beginning. But, I'm glad I did because I have very little bloat since incorporating them into my diet, even after eating raw veggies. I used to get terrible pain from trapped gas, but I have found that the probiotics I took before as well as these (much less expensive but equally effective) Spring Valley Multi-Enzyme Probiotics has greatly reduced this very uncomfortable symptom.Although the suggested use/directions on the bottle says to take 3 tablets before or after each meal, I generally have had good success with 3 pills nightly after my evening meal. Additionally, I also take Nature Made High Potency Magnesium 400 mg - 150 Liquid Softgels which has helped me tremendously with other unpleasant digestive/regularity issues.

I typically try to keep ginger root capsules in my medicinal supplies at all times because it is a natural and pretty effective way to help with a few things. First, when someone in my family starts having that sick tummy/nauseous feeling, this is often easier to tolerate than sipping ginger tea (which I prefer) to help with the nausea.Second, if I feel at all like vertigo or a dizzy spell is trying to creep up on me, I like knowing I have these pills on hand to assist with the nausea that can come with it. Additionally, this can help improve certain digestive issues as well as assisting in keeping one's cholesterol in check (in conjunction with a heart-healthy diet and exercise). These capsules are sort of large, but we haven't had any problems with that and am pleased with this purchase.HYPERTHYROID SUFFERERS: It may be of interest for hyperthyroidism sufferers to note that ginger is "hot" so if one is dealing with an active "hot" condition such as hyperthyroidism (high/too fast thyroid issues), mint -(which is considered "cold")- may be a better option for aiding in treating nausea and other associated symptoms that can accompany those with hyperthyroid issues.

I bought this to see if it would be able to remove the (small but noticeable to me) spots/stains on our older, white gas stovetop, but this product didn't do much of anything for it. My Mr. Clean Magic Erasers did a much better job at getting most of the staining, so I'm going to roll up my sleeves and show those few remaining spots no mercy...This Astonish cleaner is a finely gritted white paste and I can see how this would be suitable and effective for many things, but just wasn't (effective) for my primary purpose of the stove top. It does appear just a little of this will go a long way, which makes it a cost-effective product. I did test a small area on some (vintage) mustard-colored cookware, but quickly stopped as it appeared to be causing some surface damage (slightly removing the finish). I'm sure that I will find some other use for it at some point, such as stainless steel, oven interior, vehicle wheels/rims, etc. or something that can handle the grit texture.

I bought this locally for one of our daughters who likes "Rainbow Dash" of My Little Pony. This plush version of Rainbow Dash is complete with her "cutie mark" and is really sweet, soft and a fun change from the little plastic figure collection of MLP figures that our daughters have acquired. This plush is stitched well and the legs are sturdy enough so that she stands on her own nicely. Our daughter likes it and I'd recommend this as a great little gift for any Rainbow Dash fan :)

I bought this Manuka Honey primarily for aiding in wound healing, and have found it to work quite well. In addition, I have found it to be useful as a preventative aid in helping to keep me (about 1 TBSP a day until I feel the threat has passed) from getting sick when I've spent time around others who are sick (cold/flu). The taste is not bad, it is slightly grainy with a different, but not unpleasant (to me) flavor.As an aid in wound healing, I use a Q-Tip to get out what I need, then immediately close the jar. When used in this way, the product lasts a very long time. However, when I take it by the tablespoonfuls, obviously it will not last very long. Although this is expensive, I feel the cost justifies the benefits for both external and internal use, and I recommend it.

QUICK SUMMARY OF MY LONGER REVIEW BELOW:Pro's:*most tasted fresh**salt amount was just right**Planter's Customer Service is good*Con's:*mostly peanuts and almonds, with a few token variety nuts**had some gnarly-tasting nuts in one can, had to dispose of**generic-brand mix and brand-name prices*LONGER, EXPANDED VERSION IF YOU WISH TO READ:Having not bought these for a long while, we picked up a couple of cans of these at our local warehouse club thinking they would be as good of a mix as they used to be, but they weren't. There is hardly more in this mix than peanuts and almonds, both of which I like from time to time, but I was hankering for more of a variety mix. There were a few of the cashews, brazil nuts, hazelnuts and even less pecans, which are currently my favorite. There were a few nuts in one of the cans that tasted gnarly and had to be disposed of. I have never knowingly had a rotten nut, so I don't know if some were, but it was unpleasant at best.The amount of sea salt on the nuts was just right in both cans, so that was good. Several years ago, I did buy a can of Planters Mixed Nuts that was so salty no one could eat them, even after trying to shake the salt out. I knew we must have gotten a bad batch, called the Planters telephone number on the can and spoke with a rep about it. She was very nice, apologized and sent out a coupon/certificate for another can, which was fine (both in salt and mix). However, I believe that the amount/variety of nuts included in both cans we recently bought was very limited, except for peanuts and almonds. Frankly, I feel like I paid brand-named pricing for store brand/generic mix/quality -(and generic is what I'll be buying next time so I wil actually get what I paid for).In closing, the reason I gave this 3 stars instead of 2 is because like many food items, product size/quality/variety is shrinking while the prices are not, so it doesn't come as a huge suprise that Planters is among them (with the amount/variety) and probably (and sadly) to be expected in this economy. Second, the one time I did call (about the excess salt issue), Planters customer service was prompt to make it right, and I believe they would have done the same again if I had chose to call, I just didn't. I just don't plan on buying this anymore.

I like this necklace for it's unusual look, and it is a nice alternative to the traditional cream strand of (faux) pearls to wear with my earth-toned outfits. It is well-made and has a nice feel to it. The two-inch extender is a nice touch and allows me to slightly adjust it according to my tops' necklines. This is a nice addition to my jewelry collection and adds interest to my outfits--very pretty!

These replacement brush heads are great and exactly what I expected. These are so soft and I wish I hadn't waited so long to order the replacement heads for my Olay Pro-X Cleansing System. I love that this 2-pack of replacement heads is fairly inexpensive and makes my skin feel like I spent a lot more money (and time) on my skin care routine.I also purchased the Olay Pro-X Cleaning System and a pack of these replacement heads for one of our teen daughters as one of her birthday gifts, and she absolutely loves it too! I think the Olay Professsional Pro-X Cleansing System and a pack of these replacement heads make a great gift (for male or female) at any age who a wants cleaner, clearer face!Another great thing about these is that one can take a permanent marker and color-code (or initial) the top of the replacement heads if multiple members of the family want to use the handheld cleanser without needing to buy multiple units.

I bought this for one of our daughters (middle school aged) who is quite petite, and I thought this delicate-looking necklace would look very pretty on her.While it is quite dainty and feminine, there are a couple of things I think could be better. First, the wings could be a bit more defined. Given the very small pendant size, they just need a tad bit more definition. Second, the small necklace chain itself is so very lightweight -(it's the kind that tangles easily)- that I feel the need to replace it at some point soon.Other than those two things, I like it. More importantly, she likes it, so it was a good purchase.

I bought 3 sets of these necklace sets for our 3 daughters (middle to high school aged) for Christmas gifts, I thought they looked really pretty online, and have always been quite pleased with every Amazon Curated Collection item I've purchased. However, these are just way too chunky and blingy for adding a subtle/simple touch to their wardrobes.*The finish on these necklaces is shiny with no tarnishing or discolorations.*The simulated (large-ish) pearl necklace has a nice tone and weight, but is suitable (in my opinion) for wearing with thicker sweater tops, not lightweight clothing.*The wheat chain looks way too thick/chunky and not delicate or feminine at all, just awkward-looking.*The (textured) links in the link chain are also much bigger than what I think consitutes "pretty"--but upon looking at it further, I realized that with a few charms added to the links here and there, it could make a cute charm necklace. With a bit of work, I could probably make them into charm bracelets...In all fairness, I did get these sets at a great price, and although these chains aren't as versatile as I had hoped they'd be, the pearl necklace is wearable with heavier knits and the link chain has possibilities. But, I'm stil trying to decide what to do about the wheat chains. This was not one of my better purchases, but they were not bad enough to send back.

The only brand of marcel curling iron I've ever used has been Gold 'N Hot, but when I needed to replace my old iron of many years, Gold 'N Hot was out of stock. Since I wanted an iron that day, I took a chance on this Helen of Troy model. I use this moderately (not every day) and have had it for at least 2 years with no problems. The barrel spins pretty well (I've noticed a very slight barrel drag at times, thus taking one star off of my rating) with the option to lock the barrel, but I prefer using it unlocked. The cord swivels freely with no troubles. The temperature control is great when I'm working with our daughters' different hair types, allowing me to adjust with higher or lower temps. However, I find that I still prefer the style of the Gold 'N Hot barrel, it fits in my hand better and spins very well with no drag ever.I love the fast, ridge-less, smooth curls that are easily achieved with marcel irons in general, and this is has been a viable alternative to my regular brand. I recommend this for home use since I have not used this brand in a salon setting, I can't say one way or another if this would hold up to that constant kind of use and hot storage in between clients. However, this has been a good (and quick-heating) iron with consistent, steady, even heat distribution. The finish has stayed true and I've never had any problems with residue on the curling rod.As an aside, if this is your first time using a marcel-syle iron, I recommend you do some practice runs with the heat off and the barrel unlocked until you get the feel of it, as well as getting used to having no cool tip on the end of the rod. Additionally, experiment with the lower temperature settings before going into the higher settings, finding the right temp for your hair type, as the higher temperatures have the ability to literally fry/burn your hair off. It is important to learn to work quickly and smoothly with this type of curling iron for less damage and smoother, truer curls. After you get the hang of it, you will no longer want to use a standard clip iron!

I use these to keep various sketchbooks, cardstocks, and packages of photo papers stored neatly on a bookshelf. These have been very handy in helping keep these items at hand and organized. Anything that helps me stay organized is a winner in my book! These are made of flimsy plastic, but I knew that when purchasing them, and for my use, these are exactly what I needed.I wouldn't even try to store them (with magazines and other flimsy items) on my desk on their own, because they would most certainly bend and fall down. But, when these are fairly snug beside each other on my bookshelf, along with other books to the end of the shelf, they work fine.I like the happy colors and the little metal ID plate in front of each one to label the contents. The metal studs help to prevent the organizers from falling apart. I found these very easy to assemble in very little time. I would liken the thickness of the plastic material to that of a cereal box's cardboard thickness.These plastic magazine organizers are just right for my uses, fit well on my (almost 10" deep shelf), and would like to purchase an additional set later on for placement on another shelf.
