Be aware, however, that these are not going to stand up well as in the item's product description photo; I tested these on my desk for this review to be sure, and they bend and do not want to stay up on their own, and when I was able to balance them, the slightest bump made it fall over. For that reason, I am giving this 4 instead of 5 stars, because I feel the photo is somewhat misleading.

I have never given very much thought to our surge protector strips until one (different brand) had a dead outlet, which had me in a panic because I thought the device (whose cord) occupied that outlet was dead, until I decided to plug my device in another outlet, and the device was fine. It was at that time that I gave much more thought into my next surge protector strip purchase.After narrowing down the search results on Amazon by rating and price, I found this to be fairly inexpensive, had plenty of outlets (6) on the strip, a green indicator light to let me know it's protected, a 4 foot cord, and that this strip helps filter out "line noise"--something that didn't cross my mind before. Also, knowing they offer a lifetime guarantee was icing on the cake, so I bought it, have had it several weeks, and have been very pleased with no problems.This has 2 keyhole slots in the back of it for mounting, although we sit our's flat. I may end up replacing all of our older surge protectors with the Tripp Lite brand, as these seem to have more features/benefits than our older (different-branded) ones, lifetime-guaranteed, and are budget-friendly.

I bought this for one of our daughters who primarily is interested in becoming a graphic artist, but I thought this sketching set would help her to expand her talent beyond the graphics tablet she uses. I knew this Royal & Langnickel Deluxe Sketching Artist Box Set was suitable mainly for budding artists, but I really thought that the quality of the materials inside the case would be better.It's true that the case the supplies are stored in is nothing special, and I expected as much. It's also true that the design of how the inset plastic tray (that the sketch supplies are in) will fall out when you try to close it. Again, not a big deal. However, the minature mannequin is so poorly made, the arms are quite stiff and not fully poseable, the connecting wire in it is so tight rendering it pretty much useless.  Additionally, unless it is posed in a very specific, awkward manner, it will fall.The 12 graphite pencils themselves are really bad quality, and I would not suggest this set for a new artist, because using these pathetic pencils will only be discouraging to use. The several other materials provided are just okay, but not horrible, and I do plan on getting our daughter a nice set of (higher quality) sketching pencils to replace the 12 graphite pencils provided in the set, as well as a better (functional) mannequinn.I struggled between giving this product 2 or 3 stars, but gave it 3 stars, because despite the mannequin and 12 graphite pencils, the rest of the items are (just) okay and useable.

I purchased this cook book after the main portion of my beloved (vintage and new) cookbook collection had been so severely water-damaged that I had to throw them away, including a much older copy of a much used and referred-to Better Homes and Garden Cook Book. While this doesn't replace the prior BHG edition I had, it does have many of the same helpful features (equivalents, cooking basics references, cuts of beef, etc.) that I had before to refer to, which is great for not only me, but also our children (middle school through high school ages).The 5 ring binder makes it easy to lay flat and read/follow the recipes. The tabs for each section make for easy and quick referencing, which is very nice for our needs. There are several of the basic recipes that make this a great cookbook for beginners, as well as some more advanced recipes.I have some other cookbooks that were not damaged, but this book is the one cookbook that I find our daughters referring to the most, from which they have found recipes to make our family some lovely meals and desserts. As a mother, there is something special about seeing our daughters sitting at the kitchen counter planning a meal or dessert from that familiar red and white plaid BHG brand that I used to plan many meals and treats from when I was younger as well.I have found this book to be of sturdy construction and very easy to use. I recommend this for learning and referral for basic cooking and somewhat beyond.

One of my friends recently rescued an injured kitty and has been treating his wounded paw and ear, while giving him lots of tender, loving care. However, whenever she would have to clean and apply medicine to his hurt places, he would get stressed out for hours and not want to eat (and he was already skinny to begin with). She was certain that the stress the cat was experiencing was also impeding his healing.I wanted to help in some way, and I searched Amazon to find something, anything, that would help this little guy feel better and calmer. I found Pet Naturals Calming for Cats and had it sent to her. A few days later, she told me that these herbal softchews are amazingly effective, and that it has made such a huge difference in him during his wound-cleaning times and just in general. His healing process is progressing well now, and not only the kitty, but also my friend, are doing so much better now.If you, or someone you know, has a kitty experiencing abnormal stress or irritability, I highly recommend giving this product a try--I'm glad (we) did!

I'm not sure how to review a decorative pillow, but I'll try.This is a cute pillow. It's got a nice chalkboard type look to the front, and a red plaid backing. The stitching seems high quality, as does the stuffing. It's not lumpy and seems uniform throughout.It's got cute, decorative balls along the stitching. The cover can be removed with a zipper so it can be cleaned.  The cover is a hair magnet, however. I have 2 cats and 3 dogs, and after a week this was totally full of hair. Due to the nature of the fabric, the hair is actually hard to remove. I had to use a sticky hair roller to get all the hair out.I wish there was a bit more stuffing, but overall this is a cute, decorative pillow that is perfect for the Christmas season.

I'm not normally a huge fan of Invicta, mainly due to their drastically inflated MSRP. Setting that aside, this is a beautiful watch that would suit most women's wrists very well.It comes in the typical yellow Invicta watch box, which is fine. It's a larger than average watch face, with a nice contrast between the white face and blue dials. It's quite striking, and comes with a synthetic sapphire crystal to reduce scratches. Thus far after using for 2 weeks, I have not seen any scratches.The watch comes with instructions on how to set all the dials. It has a date, day of the week, and 24 hour clock. 2 of the 3 dials are useful, and they're easily visible.The band is nicer than a typical Invicta band. It's tightly linked, and once sized appropriately, quite nice. It does scratch a bit, as all metal bands do, but it's pretty light and comfortable.This is a nice casual watch, but nothing I would consider extremely elegant. It's great for every day use.

I run a veterinary clinic, and we have tons of secondary containers. With the new GHS standards, it's essential we're keeping up with OSHA requirements. These labels, along with the templates provided, are absolutely fantastic.Just go to www.avery.com/ghs, type in the item number of the labels you have, and up comes all the possible templates you can use.  It has basic OSHA labels, GHS approved labels, and blank ones to make your own design.I easily created labels for all the medications/chemicals we use in secondary containers. Some are greasy, some are wet, and all the labels stuck to the bottles easily despite spillage. No smearing, no ripping, and no peeling of labels.My staff love these labels. Highly recommended!

I run a veterinary clinic, and we have tons of secondary containers. With the new GHS standards, it's essential we're keeping up with OSHA requirements. These labels, along with the templates provided, are absolutely fantastic.Just go to www.avery.com/ghs, type in the item number of the labels you have, and up comes all the possible templates you can use.  It has basic OSHA labels, GHS approved labels, and blank ones to make your own design.I easily created labels for all the medications/chemicals we use in secondary containers. Some are greasy, some are wet, and all the labels stuck to the bottles easily despite spillage. No smearing, no ripping, and no peeling of labels.My staff love these labels. Highly recommended!

This is a huge cat tree. I have another one that is about half this size, but this one is a beast. It came shipped in an enormous box labeled "two person lift". It is HEAVY - definitely a two person job to carry it inside and place it where you want it to be.It's heavy because it's made from MDF (particleboard). Not my favorite stuff in the world, but it's cheap and used in lots of cheaper furniture.All the parts come labeled, and there's a pictogram for assembly directions. The directions aren't extremely detailed, and it definitely took me some time to figure out how this went together. You assemble it from top down, which was odd. I had to lay it on its side to get some of the pieces together, but it all came together nicely.My two cats seem to like it enough, though neither one has spent a significant amount of time in it. There's plenty of room for cats to use their claws, which is a nice feature.  Finally, this is less than 1/2 the price you'd pay in a pet store for a cat tree. For that, this is definitely recommended.

I've used Mediabridge products in the past and have typically been pleased with their quality. These cables, however, fell way short of expectations.Overall, I've ordered 6 Mediabridge micro-USB cables of various sizes. The quality seems good at first, and the cables work for a while. But after a couple months, all the connectors have become loose and fall out of our phones. Both my wife and I have used a total of 4 different phones, and it's most certainly the cables that fall out. It's super frustrating to wake up in the morning and realize your phone didn't charge overnight.I recommend you avoid these cables, unless they change the way they make them. Super frustrating.

I've always wanted a food dehydrator, but could never really justify the cost. I was eager to try this one, mainly due to the higher quality parts (stainless steel) and almost no plastic.It comes in a large box, and is about the size of two countertop microwaves. It's pretty quiet to operate and doesn't take up enormous amounts of counter space. That being said, this isn't something I leave out all the time because of its size.Thus far I've dried a lot of fruit, and it's just as good as the stuff you buy in stores for a lot more money. We are very organic and our daughter loves dried fruit, so this has been a blessing. It takes a while to dry the fruit but you can do so much at once that it hasn't been a problem for us.The filter behind the machine is washable in case it gets gunked up. We had to figure out how to work the machine on our own, because as others have said, the manual is just terrible. Few details, but lots of specs on the unit in case you want to know how many watts it puts out.Overall, my family loves this dehydrator. I feel that it's overpriced, but then again, I haven't owned other dehydrators. We love the results and this is quickly becoming an indispensable appliance for our family.

I have a number of paper shredders, and use this one in my veterinary clinic. This is the first Sentinel shredder I've tried, as I typically use Fellowes. Overall, I'm pretty impressed.It came packaged well in a very large box (it shipped in the original box, FYI). Instructions are minimal - just plug it in, turn it on, and off you go. The first time I tried it, it paused for a second before advancing the paper. The paper shreds at a pretty slow pace - slower than the Fellowes I use. The shreds are longer than I'm used to with Fellowes, as those shred into confetti. This is supposed to be security level 4, so I suppose it's safe enough for office use.It's moderately loud - something you definitely don't want running when you are answering phones. It's on wheels, which makes it easy to hide under a desk and pull out when needed. It does shred quite a lot of documents at once, and thus far, it hasn't jammed.The paper bin pulls out the front, while the unit stays stationary. The shredding head is attached, so you cannot use this over a larger bin. I find that the bin fills up about once a week with moderate use, which isn't too bad.Overall, this is a good shredder, not great. I'm spoiled with some higher end Fellowes shredders, but for the price, this is a pretty good value.

Like another reviewer here, I too compared this Epson 1040 to my BenQ W1070 DLP projector. I was quite surprised by the results, given the BenQ is 3 years older than this Epson.The Epson is small with a nice footprint. The remote is larger than expected, with buttons for advancing PowerPoint slides. This is a nice feature to have when using this as a business projector, but an odd inclusion for a projector billed as "home cinema".The fan, in a word, is LOUD. I thought my BenQ fan was loud until I turned this one on. It simply is far too loud to have it mounted over your head - you will definitely want this mounted far back in the room. That's actually what I had to do anyway, because this has such a longer throw distance than my BenQ. Mounted 12' away, I can get a 120" screen with the BenQ, and only a 100" screen with this 1040.The picture was just "OK". I'm spoiled by the BenQ, even though it's a "budget" PJ. This Epson uses different technology (LCD), which suffers from washed out colors and very poor black levels. No matter how I played with the settings, I could not get blacks to look black. They consistently looked dark gray, which is annoying to say the least. The colors also didn't "pop" as much as the BenQ, which was disappointing.I will say this is the brightest PJ I've ever owned. It's definitely brighter than the BenQ, but in a dedicated home theater where light can be controlled, it just isn't necessary. In fact, I ended up moving this PJ into my living room that has a lot of windows due to its brightness. I talked my wife into letting me get a screen that rolls down, so that when we aren't watching TV, you'd never know anything was there. The only issue I had is that the 1040 doesn't have vertical lens shift, so you have to have it as far down so that it's in the center of your image.The 1040 works very well in bright rooms, which is very different than your typical projector. Don't expect a movie theater quality picture, but it works good enough given the right situation. As a dedicated home theater projector, the BenQ is far superior in image quality and placement flexibility.

I love boxing for exercise, and am always on the lookout for new equipment. I have a cheap Everlast vinyl 100# bag that I've had for years, and it's hasn't held up super well. Like most heavy bags, the weight has shifted all to the bottom and it's now like punching granite.This Ringside bag is completely different. The weight is spread out over the entire bag, so that it doesn't settle in the bottom. You get an even feel no matter where you hit the bag, as long as it's below the Ringside label.The bag is leather and has great stitching holding it together. You can just feel that this is a higher quality bag, especially when compared to the cheap Everlast bags.It comes with very heavy duty chains, but you still need something to hang it from the ceiling. I use the Everlast wood beam heavy bag hanger, and it works perfectly.The bag is only 70#, per the label. It does move more than I'd like, as I'm 205 pounds and hit the bag hard. If this bag was at least 100#, it would've been absolutely perfect. However, it does move less than I thought it would, but keep in mind you can't really wallop it.Overall, I'm extremely impressed with the quality of craftsmanship of this bag. My Everlast bag cost about $100, but is way cheaper quality than this bag. I wholeheartedly recommend this Ringside over the Everlast, for sure.

I have a lot of animals and have owned countless vacuums over the years. This is the first canister vacuum I've tried, and I am pleased with the results.It comes in a moderately sized box, but was not as heavy as I would've thought. It maneuvers very easily, and I haven't been able to tip it over yet. The head is smaller than I would've liked, but I'm sure they did that so that it maneuvers easily. It literally turns on a dime and really hugs the corners where debris sits. It slides easily into crevices, like the area between the fridge and the counter. That part really was impressive, as it picked up a whole bunch of stuff that been trapped there for years!The brush roller is very soft and picks up dust on hardwood floors very well. The hose is long and so is the cord, so I never have to move the plug halfway through a room. The wand extends for reaching higher places, such as the dusty areas on top of curtains.This vacuum works very well on hardwood floors and rugs, but clearly struggles on carpet. I have very thick, newer carpet, and this just couldn't produce nearly the results as upright vacuums I own. The head is small and the brush speed is too slow to keep up with a thick pile. It's clearly designed for rugs and hard floors.Overall, I love this vacuum and will certainly keep it in my rotation. There are better, upright vacuums (even cordless ones) that produce better results on carpets. However, this works very well on hard floors and low pile rugs. It's very light, maneuverable, and it easy to use. Oh, and it's super quiet!  Definitely recommended.

We have a lot of animals, as both my wife and myself are in the veterinary field. I have used countless vacuums over the years, and have fallen in love with cordless vacuums. I've been happily using the Hoover Air Cordless over the past year, and wanted to try out this Bissell to see if it produced better results.It's very small, lightweight and highly maneuverable. The head turns on a dime, making it able to hug corners easily. It did jackknife itself a few times because the head was turned so tightly I couldn't push it forward, but that wasn't too big an issue. It's so light that you really can pick it up and put it wherever you want.The Li-Ion battery took about 4 hours to charge, and lasts just about 45 minutes. There are two speeds, normal and high. To my ears, they sound more like super low speed and medium-low speeds, but it performed better than it sounded. I was actually impressed with how quiet it was, and was surprised at the results.We have a mixture of thick carpet, hardwood and tile floors. I have been faithfully using the Hoover Air Cordless 3.0 over the past year, which produces fantastic results. This Bissell did superbly on hardwood and tile floors, but did not perform as well on carpet as the Hoover. The Hoover is a bit bigger and clearly has more suction power, so it wasn't surprising it performed better on carpet.However, the Hoover didn't produce as good results on hard floors. This Bissell is so light and maneuverable, and with the brush roller, got up all the dust and debris on our hardwood floors. It struggled with my thick carpet, at times getting stuck and making it tough to push.It's a cinch to empty - just remove the canister and push a button. The attachment is mediocre, with a bit too much wobble for my liking. It's a small crevice tool with a brush head that slides out, but the suction just wasn't great for use on a microfiber couch covered in dog hair. The hair got caught up in the brush but never quite got suctioned in through the hose.In summary, this is a very good vacuum for hard floors, and is nice for light duty carpet work. It's not super heavy duty and does not have the best suction when compared to other cordless vacuums. The Hoover Air Cordless is much better on carpet, but this Bissell is better on hard floors and rugs.  It just depends on what your needs are. That being said, it's very quiet, light, and extremely convenient. Once you go cordless, you'll never go back to regular vacuums!

Being a veterinarian, I've always had pets and have used countless carpet shampooers over the years. Two of our dogs currently have health conditions, so we've had tons of urinary accidents over the past year in our basement. I have tried 3 different carpet shampooers over this last year, including a Rug Doctor Pet commercial carpet shampooer ($400), and this Bissell cleans better than all of them.It's super easy to put together. Simply slide the handle in, use the one provided screw to attach it (taped to the orange handle), and you're good to go. It comes with small samples of anti-bacterial deep cleaning solution, and a professional deep cleaning solution. Just fill the tank to the line with hot water, screw in the anti-bacterial solution, and fill to the next line. There's a switch where you can do a deep clean or a quick clean, so make sure you choose deep. Quick cleans are meant for very mild debris and dry in one hour.After turning it on, I immediately appreciated that this is about half as loud as every other carpet shampooer I've ever used. Hold down the switch while going forwards and backwards, then release and allow it to suction the water going forwards and backwards. The brush definitely digs up the hair, despite me vacuuming prior to using. It leaves wet clumps of hair in a variety of places, but I've actually found this to be consistent with higher end machines I've used. Once the carpets dry (a few hours), just vacuum them up and you're done.I'm not sure how much is the shampooer vs. the anti-bacterial solution, but I definitely got better results with this machine than my commercial Rug Doctor. The urine stains are gone, and so is the smell! It's also half the size, half as loud, and is much more convenient. The tank is smaller, but I got through about a 20'x15' room on one tank. It's super easy to fill, so it wasn't an inconvenience for me.It has an attachment for upholstery that easily attaches to the front of the machine. I used it on my couch (vomit stains), and it took them right out. It dried quicker than the carpet, which is always a nice thing.I'm really impressed with this machine. I can't tell you how many machines I've used over the past 10 years, but this is definitely my favorite. It's light, maneuverable, quiet, and produced fantastic results. I love how you can easily put the cleaner in the tank, and the waste tank is emptied by just opening a rubber seal.  I am not at all affiliated with Bissell and have no agenda, and I highly recommend this shampooer.

I've used numerous Otterbox cases over the years and have always been pleased. This was one of the first cases available for the S6 Edge+, and was recommended by a Verizon employee.  I thought I'd give this a shot along with the Spigen ultra thin case. After two days of using this case, I returned it.It certainly provides adequate protection, as all Otterbox cases are known for. It adds a lot of bulk, however, and turns this one-handed phone into a definite two-handed affair. The way it wraps around the edges really detracts from the beauty of the "edge" screen, almost making me question why I bothered putting it on.Once it's on, it makes the buttons nearly impossible to press (on/off, volume). I literally have to dig my finger in to wake my phone up, which made me use my phone less. It was a huge pain, and I'm surprised more people aren't bothered by this.It's very slick, and actually made me drop my phone more than without a case at all. Due to the bulk, you definitely need to be focused with two free hands to use it comfortably.My last issue is that this is about $25 too expensive. $50 for this case, when others are half that price, is just ridiculous.Overall, this is the first time I've been disappointed with Otterbox. I now use the Spigen ultra-thin case, and it's perfect. Super slim, easy to use, adequate protection but doesn't detract from the beauty of this phone.

I have used about 12 different wireless printers over the past 5 years, all with mixed results. I find using wifi on printers to be one of the most infuriating things on this planet. I cannot fathom why it is so difficult to get a wifi printer to work EVERY time, rather than have to disconnect/reconnect, turn it off, hard reset, chant with prayer beads, etc. It's totally ridiculous.I jumped at the chance to review this Epson, even though I haven't liked any of the Epsons I've tried in the past.  I am extremely pleased with this printer.It was fairly easy to set up. I tried using the software, but of course connecting to wifi gave me an error (why?). So I manually used the touch screen on the printer, which went fine. It uses 0-9 numbers to enter passwords, which is really annoying and takes way longer than necessary.So far, I haven't had any <gasp> wireless connection issues. It prints every time, though it takes longer than other wifi printers I've used to send the document.It's got a small footprint, but it's deceiving. It opens a tray on the front when it prints a document, and you need room for that (about 6"). So while it fit in my cabinet, I can't keep the doors closed when I print or else it gives me an error. It's rather annoying, and kind of a "gee wiz", but not necessary, feature. You can then press a button on the touchscreen, and the tray disappears again. While neat, I fear this is just waiting for a mechanical failure.This comes with a feature that will print labels on CD/DVDs. There is a separate tray where you can put the CD/DVD, and it prints directly to it. While this would've been great to have 10 years ago, I feel it's an outdated feature in this day of digital music and video. I suppose photographers would like it, but can't really imagine using it myself.The paper tray is very tiny, and only holds maybe 30 sheets of paper. It's really not a "small office" printer, and more along the lines meant for home/personal use. However, the touchscreen is amazing. I've never really paid much attention to the small, cheap touchscreens on printers, but this is definitely the best I've used. It's big, responsive, and bright.The print quality is just superb for an all-in-one printer. Keep in mind that when printing through Google Cloud Print, the quality is not nearly as good. This is a known issue with Google Cloud Print, and may get fixed in the future. That being said, the quality is simply fantastic for pictures and documents.At the time of this writing (9/14/15), the only place that has ink refills is directly through Epson. They are expensive, as they all tend to be. Epson is one of the worst printer manufacturers for allowing generic refills, so I wouldn't be surprised if no generics become available. For my light printer use, this isn't too much of an issue. But for a heavy user or small office, it's definitely something to consider.Overall, this printer has been reliable and has provided superb quality. There are some quirks, as all printers have, but overall I've been happy. I will keep this review updated if any issues pop up.

Our daughter loves Paw Patrol - it's one of the few shows she actually sits through. She also happens to love slides, so this was a no-brainer.One really nice thing about it is that it all gets packaged up in the center tower circle. We have endless amounts of toys strewn about her play room, so having a place to store these is great. The blocks are big and fit nicely together. Her small hands don't have any issue putting these together.The one design flaw is that the slide has to attach to the truck. So, she can't actually detach the truck and play with it without the slide collapsing, which is kind of a silly idea. It would've been nice if the slide was supported separately but dumped Marshall into the fire truck, then allowing the fire truck to pull away on its own.Besides that, she really does love playing with this. Recommended for all Paw Patrol lovers.

My wife and I have always been curious about these swings. They are pricey, but after using it, totally worth it if you have the money to spare.Spend a few moments watching the video that Amazon provides - it shows the movement perfectly. It sways back and forth, up and down like a natural mother moves. It doesn't swing like everything else, which is not natural. Our baby personally hated every swing we put her in, but she loves this one.The important thing is that this swing adjusts position easily, from practically laying down to sitting up. So if your baby is gassy, fussy, etc. you can easily change positions.It works off AC power, thankfully. It's heavy and big, so not really that portable. We just plugged it in our family room and leave it there, and have had no complaints.It has an app (for iPhone and Android) that allows you to control it via bluetooth. To be honest I thought this was a gimick, but my wife and I are surprised at how much we use it. We can slow/speed the swinging, change sounds, or stop it just from our phones. It's actually much more useful than either of us would've thought.The sounds are a little unrealistic/off. We find the waves most soothing, but you can provide your own music/white noise from your phone which is what we do most often. You can choose different motions, but they're all very similar. Our daughter cares little about the settings or the music, as most often we use this to help her nap.At first she was a bit fussy in the swing, but after a few times she really did take to it. She now falls asleep in it consistently, and the smooth motion keeps her sleeping for a good hour (thankfully!). It's a much smoother motion than a swing - no jerking issues have been encountered.Overall, we are very happy with this. It's a bit pricey and has some frivolous things, but the motion it provides is fantastic. It's the most realistic "swing" I've seen or used, and our baby really loves it. She's fussy, so that's really saying something!

My wife loves these earrings. I've always wanted to get her diamond earring studs, but have never been able to afford a decent enough sized pair. Enter these square studs, and now I have a very happy wife.These have a great contrast between the darker edges and the diamond centers. I'm not sure exactly how many carats there are, but the way they are cut they seem bigger and brighter than what you pay for. $50 would typically get you minuscule diamond studs, but here you get much bigger studs for the price.They're not the most sparkly studs in the world, but for the price they are quite nice. I don't know what the darker stones are around the edge - it's not listed anywhere. But it's a nice contrast.It comes in a very plain black box. There is no nice earring box - it's just a plain box with studs in it. The presentation was quite lacking, which made it feel like a "cheap" gift.They have secure clasps on the back, though they do loosen over time so make sure you check them. They're sterling silver, which allows for a cheaper price. I wish they were platinum or white gold, but they definitely would've been much more expensive.Overall they're a very good value, and I had low expectations. Definitely pleasantly surprised!

I've owned a number of steam mops, including a Shark (leaked everywhere, drove me crazy!). This Bissell is by far my favorite steam mop.It's ergonomic and comfortable to use. It heats up in 30 seconds, which is fantastic when you need to use it quickly. I found with my other steam mops, I wouldn't use them as much because it took so much to get them going. With this Bissell, you just fill the detachable canister, let it heat up and you're good to go.The best part about this mop is that the floors are DRY when you're done! No more walking around on towels to clean up puddles, like I had to do with the Shark. It's also not as loud as the Shark, which is always a welcome benefit. The cord is super long, so you can get great coverage.I was nervous about using this on my hardwood floors, but it did just fine. Because it leaves no residual water, you don't have to worry about water ruining your wood (as long as the floor is sealed, which they all should be). You definitely can't use this on porous surfaces, such as cork or unfinished wood, but for 95% of people out there, that's not a concern.I love that it is so versatile. I've used it to steam clean my shower grout, my kitchen faucet, and door dams. It has a windows attachment which I've found produces great results. You can steam your wrinkled clothes, crevices, etc. It has so many functions, that this is worth way more than the price listed. I have an individual steam cleaner for faucets, etc. that cost $100. So for $50 more, you get a much more versatile tool.Highly recommended.

These are really cute dolls. They have some heft and realism to them, which makes it more life-like for my daughter. They come with caps, shoes, bottles, pacifiers, and blankies. She loves giving them a pacifier or bottle, rocking them and pretending to be a mom. The pacifiers and bottles both fit in their mouths, so they stay put quite nicely.The shoes are a bit challenging to put on, so she needs some help. She loves giving them their blankies and singing them songs. It's really cute watching her take care of these twins (what we call them, anyway).Word of note - like most children's toys, the packaging is like breaking into Fort Knox. It's absolutely ridiculous how hard it is to open these things. She was so excited to play with them, and then threw an absolute fit when it took me 10 minutes to unpackage them. There are twist ties, plastic attachments, tape, and more tape securing these dolls. I am at a loss for words as to why they are secured so tightly.Beyond the ridiculous packaging, the dolls are cute and my daughter enjoys playing with them. And that's all that matters!  Recommended.

I use this in my veterinary clinic, and it's perfect. For some reason I couldn't find these through our normal distributors, but of course Amazon had them!  Too bad only one was available, but I am grateful for that.These are stainless steel, so they can be autoclaved without issue. They hold a lot of gauze (if that's something you want to do), and it can all be wrapped up in an autoclave package without any problems.Recommended!

I used these sleeves to hide some cables to a monitor that was hung up on a wall, and they worked very well. You can hide a lot of cables in these sleeves, as they are made of neoprene which is stretchy and forgiving. The zipper is easy to engage and zips up easily.The only downside is the enormous, bright white "Captive Cables" written on the side. I get that you have to do some branding, but does it have to be SO obvious? Especially on a product that is meant to conceal something?Besides that, these are great and I would gladly pay full price. I did receive these at a very discounted price in exchange for an honest review.

I have a number of Bosch laser levels, and this one so far is my favorite.It is typical Bosch quality - well made, light and durable. It comes with a nice case and a positioning device. It has a 1/4" female screw on the bottom for attaching to a tripod (I use Bosch's tripod, but it also fits on my camera's tripod).What I love about this level is that it projects a 360 degree horizontal line. This is perfect for:hanging a dropped tile ceiling (what I used it for)hanging cabinetsaligning window rough insmake sure picture frames are all hung at the same heightcrown moldingwainscottingpainting half walls a different colorhanging chair railYou get the idea. It has a vertical line that also acts as a cross beam, or to make sure you are plumb.It easily locks the lines in place once level, and lets you know when you are no longer level.I highly recommend this laser level. It's pricey, but you get what you pay for.

I own a number of laser levels, and this is my favorite one. Bosch makes high quality products in my experience, and this feels like a premium device.It comes in a rather large box (with an L-BOXX container). The L-BOXX container is part of Bosch's cases that all stack/fit together snugly. This is great for people/contractors that own a number of Bosch tools so they can travel together well.The level itself is relatively small and light. It can attach to a tripod by itself, or to the 3 legged mounting base. The mounting base is very versatile, allowing you to pan/tilt this in any direction you want. I used it to attach to a door frame and it was perfectly snug.This is a 3 line laser - two vertical, one horizontal, and one down point to make sure you are plumb. It's the most useful, all-in-one laser level I've ever used.The level works like all others - keep pressing the button to get more lines, and press it again until everything turns off. It's extremely accurate in my testing, spanning a 30 foot room without any error that I could detect.I absolutely love this laser level. It comes at a premium price, but for contractors or the serious DIYer, it's a no-brainer - just get it and never have the need to get another one.One word of caution - I could not see the laser lines outdoors at all. This is best used indoors only - keep that in mind.

This is a handy device for those that don't have enough HDMI ports on their TVs or receivers. I use this with my soundbar, so everything connects to this device, outputs through the soundbar and into the TV.  It provides audio out for both HDMI and optical, so it will work with either/or.It has a remote, which is about the size of a long book of matches. It comes with a power cord, and will not work without it.It has "automatic switching", where it'll switch to the input that's currently active. However, in my testing I have found that it is not always reliable. At times I've had to manually switch to the input I'm watching.It's made of metal and has a nice heft to it. Still, it is a bit overpriced compared to competition.  All in all, it's pretty good for those that need more HDMI inputs.

I got this to house my new Asus Zenbook UX305 13.3" ultrabook, and it fits perfectly. There's adequate padding and plenty of room on the inside for a thicker laptop. However, this would definitely not fit anything larger than 13.3", as it barely closes around my laptop.

My wife just had knee surgery and wanted this for extra support. She's average build, and it fits over her knee very well despite the swelling from surgery. It keeps her patella in place (kneecap), but allows her to comfortably move her knee.It closes with 3 large velcro straps, making it quite adjustable. I don't feel this would fit someone with an extremely large or small (child) knee, but will fit about 90% of people.I was provided this item in exchange for an honest review.

In this set you get one full sized, cookie sheet mat, along with two smaller ones. I used the larger one to bake cookies, and it was great having them just slide off the mat.I used the smaller ones to reheat a piece of pizza in the oven and a cinnamon roll, and nothing stuck to it! It's great to have something like this so I don't have to scrub the pan afterwards.I was provided these mats at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

I own a number of laser levels, and all of them have a variety of uses. This two point laser level has only one use - to point a laser below and above it while level. This kind of tool can be used, for instance, when roughing in plumbing from floor to ceiling. It has a number of other uses in construction, but isn't quite the tool a weekend warrior would find most useful.I used this to hang a ceiling fan in our master bedroom. I wanted it centered, so I found the center of the floor and marked it. I took my Bosch tripod (BT150 for $35) and connected this laser level. I pointed the line below to match up with the center of the room, which then projected the center of the ceiling. I marked it and installed the fan so it was perfectly centered in our room. It turned out beautifully.This is magnetized, so it can hang on any kind of metal. You can use any kind of tripod, I just happened to like the Bosch tripod.The nice thing about this level is that it comes with a hardshell case. You don't realize how important this is until you crush one of your tools in your toolbag when a plumber's wrench falls on it.Overall, this is an excellent 2 point laser. However, make sure this is the kind of tool you need before purchasing.

This is my second laser level, and I am more in love with this one compared to it's smaller sibling, the GLL 2-30! It comes very well packaged, all tucked nicely in a hardshell CASE! My one complaint about most of my tools is that the cheaper ones never include a case or a bag, but thankfully this has a case. You literally have no idea how essential it is until you destroy a tool that's just sitting in your tool bag (got crushed by my plumber's wrench).This is super easy to use. Turn it on and it beams a cross hair beam up to 50 feet. Hit the power button again, and it just shows a horizontal beam. Hit again, and only vertical. Hit again and it turns off.This laser is definitely not strong enough to use outdoors, so keep that in mind.Once it finds the level point, you can lock it by sliding the red switch. You can use it horizontally, vertically, or at any weird angle you want.  It connects to any tripod, but I use a Bosch tripod (the BT150 for $35).  It also comes with a BM3 positioning device ($27), which allows this thing to literally connect to anything.  You can stick it on a pole, a ladder, a wall, or anything that has an edge. It makes it extremely handy to use.You really don't know how much you need a laser level until you have one, then realize how much less hassle you would've had in past projects. I highly, highly recommend this one!

I have oily skin, and this has worked very well for me. It smells very pleasant (citrus-like), goes on smooth and rinses cleanly.It has helped with my oily complexion, and I've had no breakouts or any ill effects.This is 100% organic, which is something that's very important to me.A little goes a long way, remember. And this does not suds up like a soap - it goes on smooth and rinses smooth.I was offered this product in exchange for an honest, unbiased review.

I have used a number of shredders over the years, and this is one of the better ones I've used. It has a small footprint, so it fits under a counter/desk very easily (about 18" high). It can handle up to 8 sheets at a time, but definitely can jam with more than that. Lately I've been having issues with it jamming with only 4-5 sheets of paper, which is frustrating. There is a reverse switch, but it's manual so you have to be watching your shredding to make sure it's done correctly.It cross cut shreds for added security, and can shred credit cards which is a nice feature. It's louder than others I've tried, but most people expect that from a shredder. For the money, there definitely are quieter options.Make sure to keep the coils oiled occasionally, to decrease the amount of jams. Fellowes recommends applying a small amount of oil after each use. Overall, it's pretty good, but useful for light duty only.

This is my first laser level, and I am in love! It comes well packaged, but easy to open as long as you have scissors (disregard the other review that complains about packaging). It comes with the unit, a multi-clamp, and two AA batteries.  Sadly, no case is included.This is super easy to use. Turn it on and it beams a cross hair beam up to 30 feet. This is definitely not strong enough to use outdoors, so keep that in mind.Hit the power button again, and it just shows a horizontal beam. Hit again, and only vertical. Hit again and it turns off.Once it finds the level point, you can lock it by sliding the red switch. The nice thing about this feature is that you can use it at an angle. I put it on a Bosch tripod (the BT150 for $35) and used it to hang pictures going up my stairs.My only complaint is that it doesn't include a case. Therefore, I can't just throw it in my tool bag like I do with everything else. But beyond that, I absolutely LOVE this laser level. It's perfect for the weekend warrior.

My wife does a lot of gardening, and was excited to try this out in her garden. This is a cute little speaker with a footprint about the size of a coffee cup.It collapses so that it's about 2" thick, which is very convenient for travel. It opens up to add "more bass", but that really doesn't help all that much.It's easy to pair with your phone, and really does have a 12 hour battery life. My wife used it for the majority of a day working outside, and it didn't need to be charged.She's certainly no audiophile, but even she commented that the sound wasn't that good. It's thin, lacking in bass/mids, and tinny. It sounds similar to listening to music through your laptop speakers. And it doesn't get all that loud, which isn't surprising for a speaker this size.Overall it's OK, and I like how portable and weather resistant it is. But don't expect top notch sound quality from this device.  For $39, it's "OK".

This is a pretty decent charger that has some features that a lot of other charges don't have. Mainly, it is water-resistant and shockproof. That's a great feature to have for those that want to use this outside.Speaking of which, this can be solar charged. Do NOT rely on this. It takes FOREVER to charge, and when you think it's sat in the sun long enough, you'll see that it's still dead. I literally kept it out in the sun for 3 days, and it barely charged.It comes with a carabiner, which is a nice touch. It's small and about the size of a card (playing deck). It's very thin.Overall I was very pleased, but disappointed that the solar charging takes forever.I received this product in exchange for an honest review.

There are two tunnels included - one about 2 feet, one that's longer with a hole in the top. They both include a ball with a bell in it, hung from a string. My cat loves these and bats at that constantly.The tunnels are very crinkly, meaning that they are loud. However, my cat absolutely loves them! He rolls around in them, making as much noise as possible.These are great tunnels for the right kind of cat. They fold up for easy storage.I received this product at no cost in exchange for an unbiased review.

These are fantastic bluetooth headphones. They come nicely packaged, connect very easily, and are very comfortable. They are open ear headphones, so they obviously don't encompass your entire ear. They let your ears breathe well but still have really good sound isolation.The sound quality if very good for bluetooth headphones. Bass is great, which is usually a challenge with open ear bluetooth headphones. My ears do get a bit sweaty when working out, but that would happen with any headphone of this nature.My only complaint is that they don't fold like some others I have. It's not a huge deal, but something worth noting.Overall, I've very pleased with these and would recommend them to anyone.I received these headphones at no charge in exchange for an unbiased review.

I have a lot of experience with networking and absolutely hate it. It's enormously time consuming, frustrating, and unrewarding. This HomeScreen is the complete opposite of that.This unit is small - about the size of a piece of bread. It's attractive (for a router), and is dead simple to use. You plug it in, use the included stylus (or your finger) to navigate setup, and your'e done. I use this as a range extender, as our master bedroom is a dead zone for wifi. We get a very strong signal now.  It renames your wifi and adds "ext" on the end, so make sure you connect to that to get the stronger signal.This has been totally reliable, and has sent out a stronger signal than I had anticipated. We have 2 acres of property, and we get signal throughout our entire yard. It hasn't once dropped a signal or restarted, which is more than I can say for my Netgear Nighthawk R7000 router.This router also includes "apps", like weather, sports, etc. You can set the homescreen to display the time, so my wife uses it as a clock on her nightstand. It gets frequent updates, and the customer service has been outstanding.They called me after a week of using it, and I had a great conversation with a rep about their company and their goals. I was on the phone for over a half hour, just chatting about this product. It was clear to me how seriously they take this, and how much they depend on input from their customers.Another bonus is that this comes with a $25 Amazon gift card. You can't beat that, as it makes this a $75 router/range extender.I received this product for review purposes. I would not hesitate to purchase it, and plan to for friends and family.

I own about 12 vacuums, and 5 stick vacuums (I LOVE vacuums). This is the lightest, most maneuverable vacuum I've ever used.I have an older Electrolux stick vacuum, with a 12 volt battery and no handheld vacuum. This one picks up more dirt and dust (essential for hardwood floors), and doesn't kick around debris as much as my other Electrolux. I absolutely love the button you press to get rid of hair on the brush roller - genius idea.This has two speeds, and defaults to high speed when turning on. It's actually much quieter than my older Electrolux, but picks up better. It is insanely maneuverable - it literally turns on a dime. It weighs next to nothing, so this would be perfect for elderly relatives that are looking for something light and simple.The handheld vacuum is a very great feature (think DustBuster, except better). It's a bit oddly shaped, with a blunted front end and the vacuum portion on the lower part of that blunted end. It has a strange attachment with a brush head at the end. I found the attachment only frustrating to use, and really didn't help at all. It connects on the vacuum itself, in case you ever do want to use it.The battery lasts longer than any other battery in any stick vacuum I've used thus far. It easily lasts to do my entire first floor and then some. My only concern is that it has to plug directly into the wall - there is no stand to set it in. My older Electrolux has a stand to place it in, which looks better and is sturdier. This is just a plug you have to push into a random hole in the back of the vacuum, which seems a little cheap for a $130 vacuum.Overall, this is one of my favorite stick vacuums. Most highly recommended.PROS:LightTurns on a dimeBattery lasts foreverGreat suction for a stick vacuumHandheld is very convenientCONS:No stand to set the vacuum inOnly 2 speedsUseless attachment for handheld

I own a ton of Contigo stuff, and this is the cheapest feeling bottle I own.What I LOVE about Contigo is that I never have any of their bottles leak. I use coffee mugs, insulated water mugs, sport bottles, and none of them leak. All my other Contigo bottles are stainless steel. This is the first plastic bottle I own.My daughter is 3, so I figured this would be perfect for her. Sure enough, it's leak proof and easy for kids to use. They have to squeeze/suck on the opening in order to get water, but she quickly figured it out.  It has a small flip-top straw from which they drink the liquids.I am really surprised at how flimsy the plastic bottle feels. It almost could be confused with a disposable water bottle, that's how thin it is. It's loud when squeezing, and reeks strongly of a chemical smell when you open it. Even though it's "BPA free", the chemical smell alone is enough to make me question my child drinking out of it.Overall it's OK, but I question the durability and materials from which it's made. It's certainly handy for kids, but I suggest washing it thoroughly prior to letting them use it.

We own a number if strollers and this is the nicest one we own. It's made of premium materials, which is clear to see the moment you open it.It's straightforward to put together as long as you follow the directions. At first I tried to wing it, but didn't get too far. The directions have detailed pictures though and were easy to follow. Mine also came with a USB stick with how-to videos, which was very helpful. It's clear a lot of thought was put into making this easy to assemble.The stroller is big, but folds up nicely. It's more compact when folded than I would have thought. It fits in the trunk of my Sonata, which surprised me.It holds up to 100 pounds, so our 3 year old fits with our 2 year old nephew perfectly. The wheels glide easily and turn very smoothly. My wife just had knee surgery and said this is still incredibly easy for her to use.Overall this stroller is fantastic and very useful. You pay a premium, but definitely get what you pay for in this case.

This is my first experience with a Seagate drive. It was very easy to hook up. Just plug it in, connect ethernet cable directly to your router, create a username/password and you're good to go.There are ZERO instructions with this drive. So, I figured I'd just wing it. I have to say, it's been a very frustrating experience thus far.I tried backing up my laptop, as I have 1 TB of pictures on it. It said it was backing up, took FOREVER (overnight), then said "failed". I tried again, and "failed" again.I tried backing up my phone's pictures. It said "can't connect to drive", even though my drive is on the exact wifi network my phone is on, and I can access it from my laptop.It seems as though a lot of people are having the same complaints. Almost as if the software is half-baked, but you do get a 5 TB hard drive for storage.It can connect to Google Drive, Dropbox, and Windows online storage solutions. I tried backing my phone up through one of those services using the Seagate backup app, but it kept freezing and closing.I really can't explain why my phone, laptop, and work computer are having issues with the drive. I truly believe it's a software issue and not a hardware problem.  I hope Seagate can figure this stuff out, because this has a TON of good potential. But thus far, it's been very frustrating to try to get anything to work.

I love Contigo products and own a number of their water bottles and coffee mugs. This mug is great for keeping water cool (not just cool) for 8+ hours. Personally, I never let water sit around that long because I drink a lot, but it's nice to know it's a feature.It's a nice looking bottle. The brushed blue is a nice color. It's 20 oz, so it holds quite a bit. It keeps water cold, which is really nice - I absolutely hate drinking room temperature water.The lid is plastic, and has a flip up ring to carry it. It's a bit of a clunky, uncomfortable way to carry the bottle, so I never use it. You push a button to flip open the lid, and snap it back closed. I'm not sure if my bottle is defective or if the lid is extraordinarily difficult to close, but the lid pops up easily unless you really slam it shut. It can lock, but it's very difficult (you have to use your fingernail).Overall it's a great way to keep water cold, but the lid needs some work. This is a common issue with every single Contigo bottle I own - they always have issues with their lids. They're making progress, but still need some work.

I have the Porter Cable version of this kit, and this is basically identical. It's a 6 gallon pancake compressor with a brad nailer, finish nailer, and crown stapler.  It includes a 25' hose, though you'll likely want to get something longer and one that doesn't kink.It has two brass fittings to attach up to two nailers, which is nice. There's a valve to release pressure that works just like any other pancake compressor.I used this to build a chicken coop, and it worked beautifully. I have a large framing nailer, and this would let me shoot about 10 nails before turning on. It's just as loud as any other compressor I've used before.I'm always perplexed why these kits include crown staplers, as no one I know uses them. They have a niche use, mainly to attach thin pieces of wood trim on furniture and the like. It'd be nice if they included a framing nailer, though that would significantly increase the cost.Overall this is a nice kit that has brass fittings, instead of zinc, which is what you want. Recommended!

I typically use Kenneth Cole Black, but opted to try this scent.  It's very light, masculine, not overpowering yet lasts about 8 hours or so.  My wife absolutely loves it. One full spray is all it takes, and it'll keep me smelling good for the entire work day.It's masculine, light, and "clean" smelling.  Definitely recommended!

I own a number of air purifiers, so I feel that I have a discerning eye (and nose) when it comes to these units.  This Frigidaire is the most bare-bones unit of them all, priced higher than some other models that have more bells and whistles.It comes shipped in a massive box. It's not heavy but it is cumbersome, so keep that in mind if you're by yourself picking it up.It unboxes easily and is a breeze (no pun intended) to set up. Just take the plastic bag off, open the filter door, unwrap the filter, pop it back in, plug it in and you're good to go.It is a manual dial unit - no remote is available, unlike my other purifiers. It has 3 speeds - low, medium, and high. It does NOT oscillate, which is also different than some other units I own.This air purifier is as loud as a fan. No joke - I turned it on next to my Vornado fan, and sure enough, they are equally as loud. You definitely can feel the air being blasted out the front on the highest setting, but you will not want to turn it on while watching TV, for instance.This is NOT a HEPA filter, so keep that in mind if allergens are a serious problem in your household.Overall, this unit is just too loud to use in a room where people want to talk, watch TV, or entertain. The only rooms that would be acceptable would be a bedroom, assuming you like white noise. It's far louder than any other air purifier I own, and offers less bells and whistles for more money.

I have a very large shop vac, and got this one for smaller projects. It's not built like a tank by any stretch - almost all plastic.  It comes with all the attachments you'd need, which is nice.What I don't like is that the cord, like most shop vacs, is super short. The exhaust blows dust everywhere, so you have to really be careful when you're vacuuming. It comes with a dust bag that apparently can be replaced for about $14 a bag, which is excessive.The small diameter hose plugs up, and it definitely can't pick up nails or any kind of metal. It's really only useful for sawdust and shavings, but nothing heavier than that.Overall, it's a decent little shop vac with average suction. It's good for smaller areas, but I would certainly get something much more powerful for a garage or large workshop.

This is a very strange pillow. It came shipped in a small package. It's rolled up and vacuum sealed. Just break the seal and it expands, but not by much.  It stays very flat. One side is shredded memory foam (the lumpy side), and the other side is flat memory foam.This is a very firm, unforgiving pillow. It really doesn't have any fluff at all, and neither side is comfortable. Neither my wife nor I found it to be pleasing to sleep on.It is now relegated to our guest bedroom.  I received this pillow for free in exchange for an honest review.

This is a generally nice looking card. It is VERY heavy, as most pressboard furniture is.Mine came with damaged pieces of wood, unfortunately. With pressboard, any time there is a crack, it becomes useless. I had to use glue to get some of the pieces to hold.I'm using this in the waiting room of our veterinary hospital. On top we have a Keurig and K cup carousel. There is plenty of room for items such as that. There is a paper towel dispenser on the side that is a nice touch.You get what you pay for. If you want something really nice, you wouldn't order it from Amazon. For the money, if it didn't come damaged, I would be pleased.

I was looking for a comforter that is light that wouldn't spew down feathers all over my bedroom. I wanted to like this one, but unfortunately it ended up being a cheap piece of junk.It smells when you open it - must let it air out for a few days. It has a shiny, crunchy texture to it. This is certainly not 1000 thread count material here (maybe 100 thread count is more accurate). It's not soft, nor does it provide a great amount of heat.My wife and I use separate comforters because she tosses and turns all night. I typically buy twin comforters and have no issue, but this one barely fit. I literally feel like I can't move at all or else I become uncovered. It's not wide or long enough, which is odd considering every other twin comforter I own fits me just fine.I suppose this would be fine for a child. But as an adult that appreciates quality bedding, this was a no-go for me.

I have multiples of these switches all throughout my house. I seriously don't know how I lived without them.  They are insanely convenient.They install easily, but you have to pay attention. SHUT OFF the breaker - don't be a hero. I zapped myself really bad the first time I tried putting one of these in. They come with easy to follow instructions with pictures. Just connect the appropriate wires, pop in a faceplate (not included) and you're done.This is a motion sensor with dimmer. What that means is that it will automatically turn on the light when it's dark. When it's light, it doesn't turn the lights on. When it's dark, it does. And you can set the dimmer so that the lights turn on at a brightness you want. You can manually dim the lights on the switch, and manually turn off the lights as well. You can set it so it turns them up to the brightness you want, which is nice.This works with LED light bulbs. It will work with CFLs, but it won't dim them and you can burn out the switch (it hums badly). So you should only use this with LED bulbs.You can set the timer so the light stays on for 1, 5, or 10 minutes. Super easy to program. Love these switches!

Trying to get a 3 year old to pay attention long enough to learn a game is impossible. Luckily, this required no set-up - just open and play.Rules are simple. Pick 5 animals (your "cards"), and take turns playing each one. Skunks are "skips" and farmers are "wilds". There are no reverses or draw 4 wilds like the regular Uno game.The animals are easy to stand up and manipulate by little hands. My daughter loves playing with them and carrying around the barn. She actually has sat and played several rounds of this game with us, and she NEVER sits and plays an entire game.The games are short, which is good for short attention spans.  Cute, fun, small amount of educational value.

We've owned a number of swings over the years, but this is far and away our favorite. Fisher Price makes solid baby equipment, and we have been very pleased using this swing.It's very, very easy to assemble. It comes with well written, easy to follow instructions. And once it's put together, it's a cinch to use. Just hit a button, make adjustments with other buttons, and you're set to go.We love that it rocks side to side or front to back. We found our daughter actually preferred front to back, and it's very easy to switch between the two. The motion is smooth and adjusts for your child's weight, which is pretty ingenious. The rocking motion is very smooth and not at all jerky, which is very important with a newborn!It comes with music and toys, but we use our own white noise and didn't hang up the toys. We use this strictly when our baby can't sleep but we know is overtired, so we don't want distractions.It's one of the nicest swings available and blends in nicely with any decor. It doesn't have a bunch of "kiddie" stuff all over it, screaming to visitors "WE HAVE CHILDREN" as soon as they walk in the door.The swing takes up quite a bit of real estate, so I suggest keeping it near an outlet. It runs on batteries, but it's such a pain to move so we just keep it stationary next to our couch.We could not be happier with a baby swing. This is our favorite piece of baby equipment!

This is the 5th stick vacuum I've used, and it ranks somewhere in the middle. It is super easy to put together - just a screw and you're done. It's very lightweight and easily maneuverable, so it gets under sofas and tables quite well.It has the option to turn on/off a roller bar, for rugs and carpets. I find if using the roller bar on hardwood floors, it just kicks up debris all over the place. However, the suction without the bar just isn't quite strong enough to get much beyond hairballs and other light stuff. It definitely isn't strong enough to pick up dust, so I still have to use my Swiffer.It comes with only 1 lithium ion battery, which is a pain. When it runs out of juice, the vacuum just shuts off. So you have to charge the battery before using the vacuum again. It would be nice to have some kind of warning.The canister detaches so you can use it like the old "dust busters" from the 80s. The suction is not that great, so it's only good for light stuff. I found it wouldn't suck up shredded cheese that was on my countertop, for instance. It comes with a really great roller ball attachment for the dust buster part, which is great for vacuuming a couch or the stairs.Pros:LightweightEasily maneuverableVersatileDetaches to a dust buster for handheld dutiesCons:only one battery, doesn't last that long on a chargeSuction is not the best

I love vacuuming. Seriously. Love. I jumped at the chance to try out this vacuum.I own a number of Hoover vacuums, along with a Dyson (all corded). So this review will be in comparison to those vacuums.This is very easy to put together. One screw, attach the attachments, and you're done. It comes with TWO lithium ion batteries and a separate wall charger, which is nice. When the battery dies, the vacuum just turns off. It doesn't lose suction, slow down, etc - just shuts off. I actually like this, because if it lost suction and then died, I'd have to change the battery and go back over all the areas I just vacuumed.It's got a small, easily maneuverable head. It can reach under sofas and tables easier than any corded vacuum I've owned. The main cylinder detaches so you can easily vacuum stairs - a wonderful feature. It's got basic attachments (nozzle, brush), and they fit easily on the vacuum.The suction is good for a cordless. It has a "boost" button, which I have on at all times. You can turn on/off the brush roller. It gets along baseboards far better than any other vacuum I've ever used because it has side brushes. I LOVE that feature.If the vacuum roller gets stuck in a rug, the vacuum shuts off and won't turn back on. I had to remove the battery and wait a minute, then it would work again. I'm not sure if it's a safety feature, but it was rather annoying.The cylinder is easy to empty, and the filter is washable which is a nice touch. Everything is very easy to operate.Due to the fact that this is cordless, this makes me vacuum much more than I used to. It's easy just to do a room here and there and not have to worry about a cord. Due to this fact alone, this is well worth the price.  I highly recommend it!Pros:Very lightweightEasily maneuverableConvenient - makes me vacuum more2 batteries, last a long timeVersatile - great on stairsCons:Suction not quite as good as corded vacuumShuts off if roller bar gets stuck on rug and doesn't turn back on for several minutesCanister is small for size of vacuum

I have an older Windows desktop and needed to upgrade the wifi capabilities. I have a number of TP-Link products, and while they are the "bargain" line of wifi products, they usually provide a pretty good value. This card performed very well for me.This needs a PCI-express adapter, which is on nearly every desktop motherboard produced within the last decade. It's super easy to install - remove the door to access the inside of the computer, slip this card in the slot (it only fits one way), put case back on. Easy, breezy.It comes with all the necessary drivers on a disc, but if you don't have an optical drive, everything can be downloaded from TP-Link's website.This worked beautifully with my Windows 7 desktop. It instantly found my wireless connection, and connected as soon as I entered our password. It matches speeds of all my other AC wireless devices, and I have not yet lost a connection.  Thus far, it's been quite reliable.I'm a bit surprised at the price of this card, as wireless USB AC dongles are less than half the price. But this is a more permanent fixture, doesn't have the lag time that USB dongles have at establishing a connection, and doesn't take up a precious USB port.  I feel that the antennas also provide a much better reception than a USB dongle. This is a great option for those with desktops looking to upgrade their connection.

We used this cup to train our 2 year old daughter how to drink out of a "regular" cup. We've tried a number of training cups, all with some fatal flaws. This one is no exception.The idea is great. It's easy to grip, spill-proof, and should allow an easier transition to a regular cup. We found that our daughter really struggled to suck on the lip to get her milk, which is the only way this cup releases liquids. It's also very difficult to clean and requires you to remove the insert inside.  And at times if it spilled, milk splashed out from the center valve for no good reason.We liked this cup better than the one that requires your toddler to press his/her nose on it in order for it to release liquids. Just know that this has some issues as well.

This is a great idea for caring newborns or toddlers. Our daughter is 36" tall and fits nicely in this. She loves being able to be strapped to our backs and see everything that's going on.It also works great for newborns. The straps are very secure and keep them nestled closely in front. It easily unbuckles for nursing and changing without problems.This is way more useful than I thought it would be, and I absolutely wouldn't hesitate to buy it. At first I thought it was overpriced, but considering how long you will keep it, it's totally worth it.

This is my first bath caddy, and I'm very impressed. It's 100% plastic, which is not surprising given that it's going to get wet.It's very customizable. It extends to any length to fit almost any sized tub. You can put the dividers wherever you'd like, or remove them completely if you don't need them. There are holes throughout the bottom to drain water, so no gunk grows in it.The undersides are rubberized, so they grip well to the tub.We use this in our 2 year old's tub, and it holds some toys, a loofa, and soap. It's become very handy!

This is my first experience with any of the Far Cry games. Though I'm a bit lost on the characters, the story is still compelling.This is played from first person perspective. You are Ajay Ghale, returning to the country in which you were raised to spread your mother's ashes. It is in civil disarray, ruled by tyrannical Pagan Min (he's pictured on the cover). You join rebel forces Golden Path, with the help of Sabal (voiced by Naveen Andrews, who played Sayid in TV's Lost).The game is absolutely beautiful. This is the most gorgeous video game I have ever seen (I'm playing on my 120" projection screen with 5.1 surround sound). The sound is amazing as well, as gunshots whiz by my ears based on the location in which they're coming from.It's an open world game play, meaning that you have <some> direction with your missions, but are free to explore as you like. There are unending side missions which were fun at first, but get a little tiresome after the 10th time doing the same thing.You can ride cars, elephants, boats, snowmobiles - basically whatever you want. A lot of the gameplay involves stealth, which can be fun but also tedious. Replaying the same mission over and over because you keep getting busted gets a little repetitive. But overall, it's still very fun.It's a very long game (about 15 hours for just the main missions, but 40 hours if you wanted to complete everything). There is a ton of replay value here, as you can make different choices each time around which can alter the game a bit. Overall, I was pleasantly surprised by this game. Don't hesitate to pick it up, even if you've never played any of the Far Cry games before.

These are super ugly and cheap looking. I was extremely disappointed. They have a very plastic look to them - they look like an off brand that you can buy at Wal-Mart.The fit was as expected, and I'm sure they're useful. But I returned them because they are some of the ugliest boots I've ever seen.

This was a huge letdown. The nylon is so thin it's like it's made of tissue paper. The zippers get stuck and don't close properly. And it's horrifically ugly.I ended up getting an Adidas medium sized gym bag that was WAY better in every way.

I needed something for snowblowing my 150' driveway, as I was tired of getting snow blown directly into my face. This, coupled with snow goggles, has been a dream come true. I don't get ANY snow on my face/neck anymore while snowblowing.It's very lightweight and slips on and off with ease. It protects very well, and has some stretching properties to it so it fits well. It's easy to breathe through, which is something I was concerned about prior to trying it.I have a size 7 5/8 head, and the L/XL fits perfectly.  Highly recommended!

This is an intriguing concept for those that find monitoring HR during a workout useful. I hate using chest straps, even though they're most accurate, mainly due to the discomfort and pain-in-the-you know what to take on and off. These monitor your heart rate through the ear buds, which is a really cool concept.I've used these with a Moto X, and they work well. You have to download and install Runkeeper Elite in order to take advantage of the HR monitoring feature. You get ONE free month with these buds, but to keep using the HR features, it'll cost $10/mo or $30/year for the app. That's something that should be included for life with these ear buds, or at least highlighted on the box. I think people buying these may be a bit mislead about this issue.The HR function worked well for me, though I had a few workouts where it would either cut out and not work, or say my HR was 134 bpm the entire workout without changing. I usually had to quit the app and restart it, though at times even that didn't remedy the issue. They seem to be buggy, and I'm guessing it's a software issue.The sound quality is decent, but because these are not in-ear-monitors (IEMs), they do not provide a good seal to your ear canal. Therefore, bass is weak, sound is thin, and outside noise affects sound quality. They are nowhere near as good sounding as my $30 IEMs that I usually use to workout. That's disappointing, considering these cost $150.There are no volume/skip controls on the wire, which is also disappointing. There is a mic, however, so you can use these to talk. I can't say I've never felt compelled to make phone calls while working out, however.Overall, this is a niche product that is buggy with mediocre sound quality. It's innovative, however, and I'm hoping more products like this are made in the future.
This is my favorite alarm app. Never fails. You can set a different alarm for every day and you can label it for whatever you want. Has a gradual wake function too.

I've used Blistex for most of my adult life, as I frequently get chapped lips.  I recently learned that many of the ingredients in Blistex are potential carcinogens and some are actually toxic. I'm not eating the stuff, but you can't help but be a little freaked out by hearing that.I was happy to try Tom's of Maine lip balm, as it's all organic and made of natural ingredients.  I absolutely LOVE it! It gives you that tingle I'm used to with Blistex and actually heals your chapped lips, as opposed to Burt's Bees that just coats your lips with wax.It's light, lasts a long time, and totally takes care of my chapped lips. And it smells good!I know this is just lip balm, but it has made me SO happy to find a safe alternative to Blistex.  I hope this becomes more readily available, because as of this review, it's unavailable.

This is half the price of the Chamberlain garage door opener gateway, but has the SAME FUNCTION.  Save yourself $30 and buy this over the Chamberlain one!It's super easy to use and comes with very clear directions. Just plug it directly into your router, and follow the step-by-step instructions.  Download an app to your smartphone, and you're off and running! Works great!

This is a bigger than average pocket calculator. It's solar powered and has all the functions you'd need on a day-to-day basis. But, it doesn't fit well in my shirt pocket and I constantly feel like it's huge.If this is something you carry around in your briefcase or backpack, then it would work fine. If you're truly looking for a "pocket" calculator, look elsewhere - this one is too big.

I've wanted one of these for a very long time, and finally decided to splurge.  Boy, has it been a headache.The level is NOT ACCURATE. I routinely hang up pictures that are crooked, but it shows that it's level with this tool. I have to use a different level to actually determine how level it is.The sticky putty on the back is terrible, and after 2 months doesn't stick to anything anymore. So it consistently falls off the wall and crashes to the ground.The idea of this tool is great, but it has become useless.  Caveat emptor.

This is a high quality nylon that will not rip, which is nice. It opens completely so you can stack up a bunch of wood. The handles are comfortable and don't make you feel like they're ripping through your skin.My only complaint is that it's too small. It can hold maybe 5 splits of wood, but not much more. It's enough for one fire in the fireplace for a few hours, but any longer and I have to make repeated trips.

Certain composers seem to be known for only a handful of works (sometimes only one or two), even though their actual output may be far larger; and it seems that way with Charles Gounod.  For many, he is known for one of the great French operas of the 19th century in “Faust”, and for his surprisingly jolly but nevertheless macabre “Funeral March Of A Marionette” (which gained extreme fame by being appropriated for TV in the late 1950s by a portly British filmmaker named Hitchcock).  And for others, there is his “Ave Maria”, actually based upon the Prelude No. 1 of J.S. Bach, and henceforth known as the Bach/Gounod “Ave Maria.”But what many people didn’t realize until just the last few decades was that Gounod also wrote a pair of very well-constructed symphonies which are really French extensions of the Viennese style of the late 18th/early 19th century, primarily Haydn and Mozart, but also Beethoven and Schubert.  The First Symphony, in the oft-used key of D Major, is an efficient and largely unheard work of the winter of 1854-55, with a very clever use of the woodwind section; it is said to have inspired a student of his, Georges Bizet, to compose his own symphony (which, after being subverted for 80 years, finally emerged in 1935 to much acclaim and a place in the repertoire that the work it was modeled off of hasn’t yet received).
