My teeth grinds a lot at night, and it has caused some very frustrating jaw pain. I have used this for about 2 weeks now and love it! It makes my jaw feel so relaxed and comfortable when I wake up in the morning. I suggest this to anyone with jaw pain, or grinding teeth when they wake up in the morning.

I sometimes have trouble sleeping at night because my pillow becomes dull, and it gets flat. Like it's no longer fluffy and comfortable. I've been able to fall asleep quicker simply because it does not any longer put my head in pain. Happy with this purchase I have made with OB. Thanks for the great product.

Such a great an invention. Our baby drops his food a lot, especially when it's larger items, so it's great to know that it wont fall on the floor and go to waste. He is always happy to wear this. It puts him in a good mood. I guess he likes the color? It's comical though. It's the perfect size,

Got this very quickly in the mail. It was untouched and clean. Was attending a sporting event, and brought some booze with me. It was great to be able to pop em open in just a few seconds. This flask was also shipped with 3 additional funnels which came very handy, and made me happy to make this purchase with Weku. They did a great job in providing me great service, the least I could do is write a review about their proficient work.

It is refreshing to read an author with some new ideas that are well developed. I enjoyed this book and look forward to the next one. Keep in mind that I am usually a complaining curmudgeon, and that puts my praise in perspective. And I thought there was some real insight into some of the human dynamics of the unusual situation explored.

The exterior of the device is well-made, it's not easily breakable. It is to install to my dog's collar with the assembly clip that came with the GPS tracker. One challenge that I had with this tracker is installing the SIM card since the screws were pretty small and had to make sure I install the SIM correctly or the device won't work at all. Battery life of the device is expectantly okay since it normally last a day or two using the phone app. Using the on-demand tracking which basically calling the tracking when you want to track it saves battery life and saves you on prepaid credit as it does not require data connection. All in all this is an ideal pet tracker for pet owners who don't want to be stuck on monthly contracts.

It fits perfectly in my standard light socket. I just turn it on and leave it every time I go out of the house and no one would ever suspect that there is a surveillance camera. The video is in high resolution and the audio is really clear. You can easily configure the settings of the camera using a software application. It's convenient to use for security surveillance.

The camera does not record in HD but it records decent videos in good lighting condition. Very clear 15-minute interval video, not too bright. The videos are clear enough to show to your friends. The laser light of the camera also helps in getting a spot-on recording. I'm got nothing to complain about my camera, just loved using it. High recommended product.

A friend lost 22 pounds taking Forskolin over a few months, so I decided to give it a try. I am suprised how well it effects my appetite. I like to eat sweets after dinner, but lately I don't feel like havingf dessert. I drink the capsules with a lot of liquids and feel good. I have more energy. Maybe because I'm eating less. I hope it continues for the rest of the month.

I needed this to help keep my neck in position due to a recent injury, and it has helped a lot. The shipping was fast, and this was easy to start using immediately. I am happy to have found this traction device. I was unable to find anything else online. Being the only 1 item that I found, I am excited that it's the one item to work!

I have lately been having some mouth problems, and was unsure why. I went to the dentist and I was told it's because my teeth grind a lot during the night. I purchased this last week, and using it the first night I have noticed the pain has gone away completely when waking up in the morning. The piece also fits just right in my mouth, so it's not too small or big.

I've been having sleep problems lately, especially with snoring. My wife ordered one of these for me to try it out, and so far she likes it. I haven't snored since I have been using it which is great for me, since I know I ain't waking her up in the middle of the night. This strap works very well.

Such an amazing pillow. Sleeping at night has never been better. It's very cushiony and is relaxing when you are sleeping. This is a pillow to invest in. I've replace all the pillows in our home, and so far the attitudes from everyone seem to be changing for better!

I love the back and strap fabric. It's super stretchy and smooth on the skin. Cup shape is good. Washes well. I use a lingerie bag in the wash and hang to dry. I do think the price is high, though. I'd wait for a sale. The Asset Red Label ones are also great and much more affordable. Not sure if this one is worth spending the additional money.

This is a 5 star for sure. I was looking for some new googles for me and the family, ones that specifically did not fog up, since that seems to occur with every purchase we make for a new pair. The goggles fit nice and snug, and are easy to adjust. They material is nice and cushioned on the inside so it' not hurting your face to. I am happy I went with Structure for these Goggles. I think I would still be looking for a pair like this if I had not came to amazon.

What are 2 things I like? Girls, and bikes. This book has both of those. I was looking for another book to read in the spare time, something that kept me engaged and interested for time to pass. I read this book a few times since it's so well written, that it always keeps me reading it each time. Shelly has not failed me as an author. I am very proud, and will be buying more of her books in the future.

A very interesting book this is. I love to read books, but I don't often go about saying what I feel about them. This one in particular sparked my interest and kept me reading through out the entire thing! There is no doubt that this book can't keep you sucked in. You're missing out on a good read if you decide not to purchase.

Never have seen such a unique desk lamp. It's nice and sleek, so it gives it a whole different feeling then an average lamp to use at a desk. The light is nice and bright and is very functional. The dimming feature is great when you need some light, and not a full light. Great job lampat. I will be investing into these lamps for my upcoming office.

I've spent some time looking for an efficient non sticking grill mat, and I thought I was really going to be out of luck. The one I bought from the store last week was not very good. So I checked online and I found this one. I was really crossing my fingers hoping the reviews were legit, so I went ahead and made a purchase. This grill mat is amazing! It doesn't stick whatsoever, and comes with more than 1 mat of course, which is great for making food. Happy with this purchase. You can't go wrong with this one.

I really think that this is a stylish and great looking watch.  It is not complex.  It has a simple buckle.  It keeps time well. It's easy to read the face of this watch.  I have another Lucien Piccard watch that has a complicated band...this band is so much better!  The watch is a bit big and chunky.  But my husband loves watches that are big.  It's easy to see the time.  I love the blue circle on the watch face.  It's water resistant...which is nice...no scuba diving but it can get wet!  It's not expensive at all and it is a nice watch to wear in a relaxed casual manner!  It's nice to have lovely watches at this price point...you can have more than one!

Love this book...I just took a break from coloring in it...it's beautiful!  It takes time and concentration and very fine point colored pencils but it is delightful to work in.  The only minor flaw is that I hate two sided pages...but only because I press so hard when I color.

My cats love this tree even though we were just a bit frustrated trying to put it together.  I called IRIS and they offered  invaluable help.  They told me to put it together from the top to the bottom and that is what we did...once we understood what that meant.  It wasn't hard to assemble.  My cats are Tonks and they love all of the moving parts...one has already been in the "kitty cave" as well as the swing and the hammock!  And my older Tonk actually used the ladder...so cute!  It is sturdy...all parts were provided and all parts are well made.  Speaking for my kitties...I think that what they love best are the top platform as well as the bottom and the sort of middle cut out one.  We have this in our sunroom and when the sun is out this is covered in sunlight giving my babies a warm cozy place to stretch out and nap!  See photos!

We'll Never Be ApartByEmiko JeanWhat it's all about...This book is a reasonably cool psychological thriller about Alice and her twin sister Cellie.  Various foster homes and issues of abandonment have led to a total disastrous life for Alice and Cellie.  Alice is now in a mental hospital after being involved in a fire that caused death as well as injury.  She is pretty much a mess.  She is also being charged for this fire even though she swears she didn't do it.Why I wanted to read it...This book sounded interesting...intriguing even...that is what brought me to its pages.What made me truly enjoy this book...Alice is a mystery as well as being a mess.  The events in her life are sad as well as chilling.  My question was always this...can she be saved?Why you should read it, too...It's difficult to say much about this book without giving the heart of it away and I don't want to do that.  There were surprises within this book but this book was sort of predictable toward the end.  However that didn't really detract from the book's thread.  It was still an interesting book.  The epilogue leaves one with a bit of a question, though, about Alice and Cellie.  But that could also be a teaser into another book.  So...YA readers who enjoy this kind of thriller...should enjoy reading this book.

NeedByJoelle CharbonneauReally should be 3.5 stars...What it's all about...This is one fast paced fun scary and just a teeny bit predictable book.  It started off with a really fast pace and just kept on getting more and more intriguing.  In a few words...a high school students are targeted by this online group called NEED...you type in what you want and NEED determines if your need can be fulfilled.  However...the demands from NEED get more and more dangerous and harmful.  There are a number of suspects who could be behind NEED...I had ideas but no real clue.  Kaylee and Nate start the book off but many of their friends are also involved.Why I wanted to read it...This book sounded really intriguing.  I liked the pace and the writing and it was sort of scary fun!What made me truly enjoy this book...I liked Kaylee and her devotion to her ill brother.  I loved her "almost" relationship to her friend Nate and I loved the way she fought for the truth.Why you should read it, too...Readers who love YA as well as a fast paced thriller...should enjoy this book.

The Rest Of Us Just Live HereByPatrick NessAn almost 3.5 star book...What it's all about...One thing that I have learned from reading this book...I should have read his other books first...or at least one of them...perhaps A Monster Calls?  This book is good but just a touch confusing.  There is a real world and then there is a terrible other world...there are normal kids with issues and "indie" kids with issues.  It's always been this way...apparently...however different eras have had different issues/monsters.  The indie kids get the monsters.  The monsters can be vampire deer...cops with blue lit eyes...and lots of explosions.  Mikey and his friends just want to graduate and finish their school year without their school blowing up.  The indie kids just want to stay alive.  So...every chapter starts off with the monsters and the indie kids disappearing or dying.  Then we get to Mikey and his friends and family...each with their own issues. Anorexia, alcoholism, having OCD, sexuality, being gay, being straight...domineering mothers running for political office...it's all right here in this book.  Oh...and there's Mikey's gay friend Jared...who can cure cats big and small and cure people, too.  Cats...all cats flock to Jared...he is the Cat God.Why I wanted to read it...I wanted to read this because it just sounded really amazing.  Reviews for it were all over the place...readers either seemed to love it or hate it.  I think that readers who were more familiar with this author loved it best...appreciated it best.What made me truly enjoy this book...I loved the contrast between the indie kids and the other kids.  I enjoyed reading about the issues...I loved Jared...the Cat God.  I appreciated Mikey's thoughts.  I loved the way he protected his sisters.  With the first paragraph I was taken away into this bad fantasy disturbing world of monsters and kids disappearing...and in a second back to college applications, lunch, and working after school watching Mikey wash his hands a hundred times.Why you should read it, too...Again...readers who know and love the books written by this author should really love this book.  I just would not start with this one...but that is just me.

I have been taking another magnesium supplement but have happily switched to this one.  I have faith in Viva Labs and I use many other supplements made by them.  I have always known that the right amount of magnesium is essential to a healthy body.  I like that it helps muscle aches.  I like that it helps with sleep.  I like that it helps protect my body.  Since my body is used to taking these I have not noticed any real changes in my body but I am mostly concerned with keeping my body normal and staying healthy.  These are just a tad smaller and easier to swallow...which I love.  The ingredients in these are fine with me and I have read that chelated magnesium is better...so that is all good!  I try not to take tons of supplements but there are certain ones I feel that I need...for me this is one of them.  I do also eat foods that help me to put magnesium in my body...dark leafy greens, bananas, soy beans, fish and avocados...I do use a magnesium oil for aches and pains, too.Personally...I only take one pill...not two...I received my bottle from the manufacturer for my honest thoughts and that is what I have done.

These headphones are great when your body is moving and also great when you are sitting still.  I didn't mind the longer cord.  Setting them up was a no brainer and the sound was good...probably even great.  There are times when I like this sort of wraparound fit much more than wearing earbuds.  It's nice to have a pair of these tucked away for walks, workouts, road trips and flying.My set was sent to me by the manufacturer for my honest thoughts.  That is what I have done.

I think I am on my way to becoming an earbud expert?  Not really but I have tried so many sets that I think I know more now about what I like and what works for me.  These fit nicely, look great and work great.  The sound was clear.  These " buds" do exactly what they say they will do and are extremely comfortable.  The sound was really beautiful...everything worked and I can watch programs on my iPad while my husband watches football!My set was sent to me by the manufacturer for my honest thoughts...and that is what I have done!

Night time water glasses...that's why I bought these.  My husband and I both like glasses of ice water on our night stands at night.  Thee glasses keep water very chilled.  They are just a bit smaller than I hoped they would be but I didn't want to buy the largest ones.  These are great, though.
Love this!  I love having a lipstick case in more than one purse!  These are perfect.  The mirrors add just the right touch!
Love this!  I love having a lipstick case in more than one purse!  These are perfect.  The mirrors add just the right touch!

I wanted a pan similar to the one my grandmother and mother would use for Sunday dinners.  My mom cooked everything in a roaster like this.  Mine is a much smaller version but it is almost the same.  It might be a touch lighter...the lid is a touch wobbly but I really like it.  Today I made round steak swimming in gravy in my roaster.  It was amazing!

Sometimes I think that the fairies who fill my queue have the ability to read my mind!  This plate is beautiful!  I will use it throughout the holidays.  It is not bright white so it's more of an eggshell color.  The cardinal in the center spot is elegantly painted.  The side decorations are really just enough!  It is a perfect extra platter for cookies or other treats.  My Christmas dishes as red so this fits in beautifully.  I will not dishwasher wash it but I will wash it by hand.

The Way I Used To BeByAmber SmithWhat it's all about...Eden is raped in her own home in her own bed in the  middle of the night by her brother's best friend.  Her parents are there.  Her brother is there.  The rapist tells her if she ever says a word about this that he will kill her.  He tells her no one would believe her anyway.  So...Eden does not say a word.  Instead she becomes promiscuous and wild.  She has sex with at least 15 more boys and she is totally out of control.The book is unique in that we see the drastic way Eden changes as she goes from her freshman year until her senior year.  It's sad, distressing and heartbreaking.  It's sad because if Eden could have been strong enough to tell her parents what happened...so much grief and pain could have been prevented.Readers should gain insight and knowledge about this kind of sexual crime and what it might do to individuals as well as families.  Eden's story is truly heartbreaking.

What it's all about...This book is about entwined family members...wrapped up in the same restaurant business and financial issues.  A call tells them that both daughters...cousins...are in an accident at school.  Someone...a friend...dies...the mystery is set up and slowly we learn what happens.Why I wanted to read it...I love the way this author writes...I have read and loved her other books.  The story unfolds in such a totally addictive way for me...that I really have to pace myself or I would just let everything go...and sit and read.  Sigh...which is mostly what I want to do anyway.  The two girls involved...Rory and Arden...are cousins with issues and secrets.  Financial issues threaten their parents.  There is the mystery of the fire in their room.  These two cousins seem to play with danger.What made me truly enjoy this book...The mystery of this book was intriguing.  Bits of everyone's lives are revealed a tiny piece at a time.  The girls are both in intensive care while flashbacks and more and more questions about what happened surface.  How well did these parents really know their daughters?  Hmmm...Why you should read it, too...Readers who love this kind of slowly evolving mystery filled story...will really enjoy this book.

The Swans Of Fifth AvenueByMelanie BejaminWhat it's all about...This book is a unique historical fiction book about Truman Capote and a group of NYC society women that befriended him.  He was gay, clever, funny, whimsical and quite outrageous!  He got them to share things with him.  These "Swans" also yearned for his admiration and attention.  However...his favorite Swan of all was Babe Paley.  They were infamous besties.  Tru and Babe...the best of friends...until someone shared too many secrets.Why I wanted to read it...I wanted to read this book because I loved this author's other books...especially The Aviator's Wife.  The cover is a definite attraction, too.What made me truly enjoy this book...This book is not a page turning fast paced book.  In fact I read it slowly.  I used Google and Wikipedia to further my knowledge of these people and this era.  Old Hollywood stars hung out with Babe and her husband at one of their summer homes...Kiluna.  Clark Gable, Bill Powell, Gary Cooper, Lucille Ball...even Ernest Hemingway...hung out with this group.  Truman was quick to share secrets...Marilyn Monroe was afraid of her mother in law...and didn't have great personal hygiene.  Babe's husband Bill Paley was a known womanizer with a voracious appetite for women and food.  Babe and Truman were often just with each other...but...should she have placed so much trust in him?Why you should read it, too...I loved this book.  Readers who loved this author's other books and who love historical fiction...will love this book!

First of all...this jar is HUGE!  Thank goodness I have tons of uses for it.  I love that it is organic...and pure.  It does have a subtle mild coconut taste that my husband and I love!  I give a bit of it to my two indoor Tonkinese cats...just to help with digestion and those unmentionable litter box issues.  We use it in cooking, on toast, to sauté certain foods...eggs, chicken and even grilled cheese sandwiches.  I also always put some in a smaller container and take it with us when we travel.  I just believe that it's healthy...and good for you.  I have not used it as a moisturizer for hair and skin but I know tons of people who do!My massive jar was sent to me by the manufacturer for my honest thoughts!

This is a lovely and strikingly beautiful set of artist brushes.  They are carefully and meticulously packaged.  I was almost afraid to use them.  But I did and I also had my artistic friend try a few.  He loved them.  I believe that these are great for an amateur as well as a professional.  There is a brush for every need, use and desire!  I especially love that the more fragile brushes were carefully protected.My brushes were sent to me by the manufacturer for my honest thoughts.

This is a fun cute brightly colored jumping rope that I am certain will get kids moving!  I loved the colors and the counter...as a former teacher...I know kids will want to compete with each other when they jump for fun and exercise!This is a perfect motivating tool.I was sent my rope by the manufacturer for my honest thoughts!

I am not sure about these tweezers.  I need to be able to extract really fine eyebrow hairs or perhaps even an in grown hair and I think that these tips are not good for that kind of use.  I am used to a finer more precision end point and these were just a bit too thick for me and it was difficult to grasp fine unwanted hairs.  Perhaps they would be better for men's eyebrows?I was sent these by the manufacturer for my honest thoughts.  I was a bit disappointed in these.

I have only applied this a few times but I love the way this lightweight cream feels.  It has a light gel like texture that I love.  Even though the photo shown says eye treatment my product...the one I was sent...says that it's a facial treatment which I actually love even more.  I tend to use products that contain Vitamins A, B, and E as well as free radicals.  I love anything that promotes cell renewal and this product feels great on...it  adds a bit of plumping and I love that it does.I will return with more comments if it's performance on my skin changes.

I used this product recently and I really love it.  There are tons of BB and CC creams out in the lovely world of cosmetics that are far more expensive than this one.  They say they are going to do anything and everything but many of them are very drying.  You can actually see your skin flake as you apply.  I don't need tons of coverage but I love that this is a 30 SPF and I like the way it smooths on.  It wasn't drying at all and I did not feel as though my face was encased under a heavy product.  It is light and moisturizing.Again...light and moisturizing and left my skin feeling very refreshed.

I have the women's version of this cologne and I love it.  This men's version is delightful.  The problem is how to describe a scent.  Ok...it's light, refreshing, perhaps a tad woodsy...and it has a light scent that lingers.  It's a young and beautifully vibrant scent!  I would buy this in the future.  My husband smells amazing with this one!  It's masculine without being cloying and overdone!

Bradstreet GateByRobin KirminKey characters...and what is going down with them...Professor Storrow, Alice, Charlie, Georgia...all meet at Harvard...where most of this book takes place.  All are truly dysfunctional...from bipolar incredibly unlikeable and totally weird Alice to Charley...innovative "entrepeneurish" smart Charley who has major father issues.  That takes us to Georgia...who probably has her own parental issues and then becomes sexually involved with Professor Storrow.  And then we have Professor Storrow...accused of murdering another Harvard student...Julie.  The trauma occurs near graduation and then follows these people for the next ten years of their lives.  During these ten years...Alice spirals out of control, Charley becomes a major yet unfulfilled achiever...Georgia functions yet seems lost...and memories and issues surrounding Professor Storrow seem to haunt everyone.What I thought about this book...This book is different...very character driven...and for me...these characters were interestingly unlikeable.  Alice was so out of control that she was scary.  And again...Charley and Georgia just seemed sad.  Georgia might have been the golden girl that everyone wanted to be with but...she never seemed confident or comfortable in that role.  Charley always wanted to be with Georgia...but Professor Storrow was always in the way.  And then we have Professor Storrow...deceitful, weird, pompous?  I think a combination of all of that.Why you might want to read it, too...I can not say that I loved this book or any of its characters...even Georgia's new born baby was annoying...crying so much and so often that neighbors complained...is this possible?  But...it was fascinating...written in a really unique voice...a clear mesmerizing voice...one that made me want to know about these people...but only from afar.My copy came from NetGalley through Amazon.

A Good FamilyByErik  FassnachtWhat it's all about...This family is a mess!  Henry has left his wife.  Julie needs pills to get through the day.  Charlie...back from the mountains and battles of Afghanistan...is pretty much a mess...be prepared for him to toss his cookies at the table just before dinner!  Barkley...youngest son...doesn't really know what he wants other than to write bad killer zombie novels...and teach?  Henry...mid fifties and searching for thrills?  He reminded me of that creepy guy buying drinks, taking viagra and looking for someone to take home with him to his red sheeted black pillowed condo...doing anything he can to hold on to the glow of youth!  Until he can't any more...Why I wanted to read it...I love dysfunctional family novels and this one certainly fit into this genre.  No one was likable at all...in the beginning.  Will that change?  I know what my answer is.What made me enjoy this book...I think what I like most about books like this is that their dysfunction is not my dysfunction.  I can look at it from afar and sort of feel better about me than they feel about themselves...or I can simply say a quick pray that it's them and not me!Why you should read it, too...Readers who love big fat books where the characters have tons of issues...should love this one!  Everyone is certainly having major issues.  The question is...who will be happy at the end?  Or...will anyone be better off at the end?  Hmmm...

Wolf By WolfByRyan GraudinWhat it's all about...Yael...Yael has moved from the trains into the Nazi Concentration Camps...to being chosen by Dr. Geyer for his evil experiments and then using what she has become to walk out of the camps and eventually join the Resistance.  The wolves tattooed on her arm cover her camp number but stand also for the lives lost...the important lives in her life that are no longer there.  Yael can shift within her skin.  Show her a photo and she can become that person...that was Dr. Geyer's gift to her.  Now she is obsessed with one thing...pretending to be Adele Wolfe in order to win this amazing motorcycle race.  This will put her within touching distance of Adolf Hitler.  This will get her to the Victor's Ball.  She will dance with Adolf Hitler.  She will kill him.  She must.Why I wanted to read it...I though this book was a treasure.  Beautiful writing...lovely yet sad storytelling...and an exciting plot made this book a really awesome reading experience.What made me truly enjoy this book...I think it was the pace.  The pace was so perfect.  The story was very sad, though, but it was good to have these horrors surface again...lest we ever forget.Why you should read it, too...A unique combination of history and fantasy made this book very special.  YA readers should really enjoy these events.

The Emperor Of Any PlaceByTim Wynne-JonesWhat it's all about...OMG...what a book...at times I was frightened and at other times just totally freaked out.  And at other times I was just sad for Evan...very sad for Evan.But here is what went down.  Evan's father dies rather suddenly.  Evan finds a yellow notebook on his desk that tells the story of a Japanese soldier stranded on an island during WWII.  Terrible things happen on the island..scary gory things that are kind of ghostly and ghoulish and otherworldly...dead and half dead creatures are involved.Questions that arise for readers are...why did his father have this book and what does Evan's retired military grandfather have to do with any of this?Evan's father and Grandfather are estranged...so much so that Evan has never even met him.  When Evan's grandfather travels to see him...eventually all of the secrets are revealed.Why I wanted to read it...I am not really sure why I read this.  The idea of it was interesting enough...but even though it was beautifully written it was not my favorite kind of book.  It was told through Evan's life and also through the words of the Japanese soldier.  It was truly haunting...the creatures on the island were...well...not good.Why you should read it, too...I am not sure I enjoyed all of this book but I did enjoy parts of it.  Readers who have an interest in historical fiction should enjoy this book.

The Scorpion RulesByErin BowWhat it's all about...Greta and the other Children Of Peace live in an isolated situation.  They garden, they milk goats, they make cheese, they study world affairs.  They are the children of the kings, queens and rulers of countries.  If any of these countries go to war...they are the children that are killed...the children who live together away from their families.  This is a dystopian society and this is the means they use to stay peaceful.  If Greta and the others stay alive until they are 18 they get to leave.  They go off to rule their countries.  This society is ruled by weird human like robots and discipline is key.  There are ways to keep Greta and the others under control.  They don't even think about another way of life until Elian comes along.  And then things get messy...very very messy.  And then there is the Talis ( the master of the world ) and the Wing Riders and all of the AIs...and always the threat of death that is even more prevalent for Greta because her family is the most powerful and has the most control over things...especially things like water.  And then everything changes.  Greta changes.  But I can't tell you why.Why I wanted to read it...There was lots of hype about this book everywhere and I thought that it would be a book that I would love.What made me enjoy this book...This book was good and interesting enough but I did not love it the way I thought I would at first. It was so hard to get into this book...I am not even sure why...sometimes the vocabulary was weird...sometimes the situations were difficult to read.  It was sort of a typical dystopian breakout book...mean rulers, unfair rulers, persecuted people.  There is a sort of not typical love triangle in this book too.  Greta and Xie?  Greta and Elian?  At about the 40 % mark...the book got intense and I had a difficult time putting the book down.Why you might want to read it, too...Readers who love world building dystopian books will enjoy this one...I think.  It was kind of iffy for me at first but then it was also kind of mesmerizing...different...unique.

This watch is incredibly beautiful.  The time face is really gorgeous.  It seems to have so much going on within it...it looks more complicated than it really is.  I love the black rich looking leather band.  I love the distinguished circle of red on the face.  I love that it winds when you move your wrist.  Now to the iffy and uncertain part.  Another reviewer was very frustrated with his watch.  There are no specific directions about how to get it on.  It is odd.  We called Lucien Piccard.  They were very kind and very apologetic about the clasp and we were able to follow their instructions and open it, put it on and close it.  It is a big watch but it's a fun watch.  My husband won't wear it everyday but if you are a bit of a watch collector...this is a cool one to have.  My husband has very expensive watches and this one does not look inexpensive.  It's fun to wear and it's fun to change out watches.

There are a LOT of 1 star reviews slamming this program because it is not true security, however I see no claim by them that it is.A vault is just a place to store something.  The password is just meant to be a minor deterrent to the casual user of your phone.I wonder if those that lost their photos really lost them or if the app just started looking in a different location and they were unable to find them or if their FAT table became corrupted, for I find it hard to believe that the writers of the software would intentionally delete any files unrelated to the app itself.All this does is rename the file name extension of your photos so that other "photo" viewer apps do not think that those files are photos to be viewed.I have a large variety of photos on my phone.  Kids, family, events, serial numbers, comparison shopping, documentation, articles to be viewed later.Those first three want to be seen my friends and family, but the latter do not and this allows me to easily keep those latter photos out of the Android Gallery app, but still available to me.Yes, one can easily rename the files back and forth manually, but that is a pain and this app makes it easier.

I love the light weight, long battery life and readability in daylight and the fact that my kids cannot play games on it while using it unsupervised. Tho I do wish there was a way to limit which books they can access and still have my books on it.My main disappointment however was in how many of the 200+ Kindle books I have "are not formatted" for the Kindle Paperwhite.On the Amazon product page for the books in question, they list compatible devices and the Paperwhite is not listed. I am talking about chapter books that are just words with 1 small picture per every other page with no words on the picture.Since this Paperwhite displays graphic content quite satisfactorily (tho a bit slowly), I am not sure why that would be the case.Before purchasing this, I assumed that Amazon would make sure that all Kindle books would display on their signature Kindle device.

Unlike my Samsung S4, the HTC Droid DNA seemed to have no option for displaying your information on the lock screen or letting someone who found your phone simply dial another number of yours to let you know they have it.This app solved that problem.I actually went looking for this after I myself found a phone on the ground at night at a 4th of July celebration and had no way of contacting the owner of the phone.It did allow both identification and calling my wife's cell and/or my office voicemail without entering the password.It allows several phone numbers to be called as well as a bunch of medical information and notes that can be accessed without entering the password.

I got this for my Tetra 3i filter.It is substantially more powerful and quieter than the motor that came with the 3i.I can now keep the lip a bit higher over the water and the flow is strong enough to get a lot more use out of the filter and if it clogs up, it is strong enough to keep on flowing thus oxygenating the water, unlike the old motor, which nearly suffocated my fish. The water flowing around the filter may not be filtered, but at least it is being oxygenated.

I read all the Ramona books to my kids (6,8,9) and they all loved every minute, every page and all three agreed that my youngest was very much like Ramona.  They identified with her well and were sad there were no more books. Good wholesome story telling dealing with a good range of issues in the real world and should not offend most any parent's sensibilities, tho there were a couple of paragraphs that I skipped over that my kids did not need to get any ideas from.

It is perhaps the most realistic racing game out there which makes it a lot of fun to play and pass the time.  I have tried many Android racing games, but this is the only one that has been able to hold my interest.However they make it needlessly difficult and annoying in their ploy to get you to pay real money.To date I have spent over 300 hours racing in RR3.Like everyone else, I first started with minimal money and worked my way thru the races and cars, but after a point, the cars and upgrades became too expensive and I found myself re-racing the same race way too many times trying to beat cars that were far better than mine.There are a few cheats out there, but the one I decided to use was simply copying over the saved files on my device with files that let me start fresh with a billion R$ and a billion Gold Coins.Suddenly the game became a LOT of fun as I always had the best car in the race as I was able to immediately fully upgrade every car and I did not have to wait hours for my car to be repaired in order to play again.  When I had time to play, I played, but it cost me 10 gold coins every time to expedite the repairs.When they offered a free $4,000,000 hybrid car I went back to my 1st identity because I was now able to generate a good amount of R$ and gold coins every day, but that soon fizzled out as it became too difficult to win those races and I quickly ran out of money again.So I went back to my 2nd identity with the cheat.I enjoyed racing very much for a long time.  I only raced when I had time to race and I did not find it very frustrating at all... until they suspended my account for cheating.  I was able to play after the suspension, but only for 1 day and I found myself suspended again.By the way, if they catch you cheating, it can be a bit of a hassle to clear that flag from your login.So once again, back to my 1st identity I went.Once again, I found myself racing the same races over and over again more often than I'd like and keep having to wait hours between races for my car to be repaired and I am only able to afford minimal upgrades and it takes forever to accumulate enough money to afford to buy the next car I need.Instead of playing strictly for fun, racing became a bit of a chore at times.  In short... frustrating.Again, I stopped.This time, out of curiosity, I created a new 3rd identity starting from scratch.Starting a new game gives you a slightly different interface.  The most telling is that my 3rd identity can only repair 3 cars at a time and the 2nd repair man cost be 10 gold coins and the 3rd one cost me 50 gold coins.  Before now, there was no concept of a limited number of repair men.  I have very frequently had more than 3 cars being repaired at the same time before now, so this is a big drawback to starting anew.I decided to go back to my 1st identity to get this new F14-T.  Maybe it will allow me to generate enough gold to stay afloat.----Note that it is a HUGE program (over 2GB) and after you perform the initial install, it will want to connect to a wifi connection to install the rest (it does allow you to use your 4G signal if you want).  There is a button to force it to download everything at once and it puts that 2GB by default onto your external MicroSD Card which is nice.My tips:I spent $5 on the starter pack to pay the developers for their time and another $4 to VIP a car to get rid of the pop up advertisements - with only some success - it does lessen the ads for a time, but before too long, you are back to ads.I would suggest starting with the attitude that you will NEVER pay to speed things up and NEVER part with a gold coin when there is a R$ option. This strategy will take you a long way towards minimizing your cost.My identity with the cheat has every single car and fully upgraded, but for those that do not wish to cheat and risk being banned, I found that nearly all of the cars that cost a lot of gold are not really necessary. You can get to 75% without them and 100% of all the other series.In fact, to get from 75% to 100%, the most you will gain is about 30 gold coins and spending more than 30 gold coins to buy and upgrade a car in order to achieve 100% makes no sense.If you start out without much money, know that you will often race some of the races over and over again until the game finally gives you opponents you can beat, but you can keep progressing. It is just more time consuming.The cost to fully upgrade is generally more than the initial purchase price of the car.I seldom get that last upgrade or two for each category as it generally costs a lot of gold and does not make a huge difference and seldom will the payout cover the cost for that last upgrade.Cars I only plan on racing in their respective Showcase to get the 100% bonus only get 1 tier of upgrades, while most other cars get 2 or 3 levels of upgrades (depending on what I can afford and the cost/benefit ratio).I upgrade every car when I first purchase it, before I race it at all. Might as well have it upgraded while you wait for it to be delivered.On of my goals has been to collect as many gold coins as possible and then convert them to Racing$ in large amounts. Every time you win a race that rewards the most you have ever won so far and you think you can easily get first place every time, then remember that race and choose it for your morning daily 100% Bonus Race and pay the Manager a gold coin to double your earnings (and for 2 races I pay the Agent as well). Normally gold coins have a rough value of R$3,000 to R$5,000, however, using this trick, you can easily convert a single gold coin to anywhere between $10,000 to $650,000, depending on the race.When you find a race that has a large payout and you want to rerace again and again (like the last races in Endurance Kings or Classic Ferrari Showdown) you probably want to win 1st place by as small a margin as you are comfortable with (I shoot for 200 yards) otherwise it quickly gets more and more difficult to win 1st place. If it becomes difficult to win, just race to lose big time a few times to reset it.As you progress, the prizes barely increase, but the costs of the cars and the upgrades balloon exponentially. The prices of the cars may be in line with reality, however you really have to spend a lot of time playing the game to earn enough money to afford them.  They have special races now tho that give you one of these cars for free... very nice.I planned ahead which cars I wanted ahead of time so I knew when to buy or skip a car on the spot and how much I want to spend upgrading it. You want to know ahead of time because you will generally be offered a 20% and occasionally a 40% discount to buy a car right then and there.I created a table here to help decide which cars were worth buying and which I would skip.  rr3. wikia. com /wiki/User_blog:ChicagoCPA/List_of_Races_and_CarsAs you win R$, you will be reminded left and right that you have enough R$ to buy another car and you need to realize that you want to always say no because if you wanted it, you would have purchased it when it became unlocked at that 20% discount.There are gold bonuses for reaching 25%, 50% 75%, 100% completion of a series plus there over 1,000 gold collecting levels with 10 to 100 gold coins per level.However, as you increase your level, you will find that it takes more and more fame points to advance to the next level.  You start out with 1,000 fame points per gold coin, but I am currently at a point (level 125 which pays 28 gold coins for about 170,000 fame points) that it takes about 6,000 fame points per gold coin.  At the moment, there are only 2 races that give you over 15,000 fame points for a win so paying the agent to double it rarely pays off any more.Know that if you DO have a ton of Gold Coins burning a hole in your pocket, you will often have a chance to unlock and buy a car ahead of time, which can make it a LOT easier to win races, but they generally charge you a significant premium to do so. You can also skip some series all together to more quickly get to the "fast" cars this way. With the billionaire identity, I would periodically browse all the cars in the Add a Car section to see if I could buy one early. Buying one often immediately releases another car and will also release the series that they are in.Pay attention to braking distance. You can lose a lot of time by not stopping in time and skidding out on a turn.Pay attention to acceleration when picking a car as it helps a lot if you can pass everyone when you first start the race.Acceleration also helps a lot because there are a lot of turns and the faster you can get back up to speed after each turn, the more likely you can win.Pay attention to Grip. If you learn how to maximize its usage it can make a big difference.When you have accumulated several cars thru several racing series, you can go back to win more $/G while you are waiting for your main car to be repaired/delivered/upgraded.Going off the track will wear down your car faster, so if there is no need to do so, don't. However cutting certain sharp turns to pass is by far the easiest way to get ahead and what good is saving R$ if you do not get a medal.Using going off track to brake is also a difficult to master tool when you find yourself heading into a turn going way too fast.Steering assistance will really slow you down a lot if you go off-road, so turn that off as soon as you can.Also turn off braking assistance as soon as possible.I have won 1st place in over 100 races without any assists (there is an achievement reward for that), however I still generally race with traction control on.There are a number of achievement rewards that are worth doing just for the fun of it, like winning the race by going backwards over the finish line.The time trials do not pay out much, so I generally run them with a car severely in need of repair and as slow as necessary to not have to worry about going off track.Playing without a gas pedal can be less stressful on your wrists and your device, however there are many, many times when coasting will give you much better control than constantly accel/braking will.Too bad they do not have a graduated gas or brake pedal. Even with coasting it is hard to maintain a speed less than your maximum when you are asked to not hit the car in front of you.Another way to make it a bit easier is to pay attention to the stats when you first start a race or the video of your opponents...RR3 will choose different opponents depending if you are on-line or not. If I do not like my odds, I will go back to the main screen and turn off my antennae and go back into the race and see if it chose easier to beat opponents. Endurance, Speed Record, Speed Snap and Autocross will often be an easier 1st place win your first try if you start it off-line.RR3 will usually, but not always, gradually make it easier for you each time you race the same race until you can eventually win 1st place.I often deliberately loose right away on the Elimination races to conserve my car and let the game remove the really fast car from the race the next time around.I frequently quit races before the finish line if I make a lot of mistakes and do not think I will achieved the position wanted (1st, 2nd or 3rd) to save time and conserve repair status to try again with different opponents.Remember to accumulate enough R$ and Gold before you need it because it is better to have a lot in hand when that discount window shows up. For the standard 20% discounts, you can generally tell how soon it will appear by clicking on the lock button to see how many races you have left before you are presented with that opportunity.Pay attention to the markings on the curbs, walls, buildings, posts as you will often find a cue to let you know when to start braking so that you do not skid out on the next turn, which costs you dearly. It may take a few runs to figure it out.Another trick is to save your progress on-line before starting a difficult race and do a restore if you made too many mistakes. One can even hack those 3 Drive bars for the time trials by doing so. You can keep restoring it and RR3 remembers your results on-line anyway. I never saw a need to buy more than 3 as they are needlessly expensive.One trick that does not work is changing your device's date/time stamp.  It will reset your daily bonus back to 20%.

I have the Samsung S4 in a OtterBox Defender Series Case and Holster for Samsung Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Black and the belt clip broke.It was not a huge loss as I was never enamored with the OtterBox clip.  I Love the protection of the Defender case, but the clip kept coming off my belt... the opposite of protecting my phone... and catching on things until it finally broke.I purchased this Kuteck pouch clip to replace it and the Otterbox Defender case fits perfectly. Not too loose, not too tight.  I thread my belt thru the 3 loops in the back so I never have to worry anymore about the entire thing coming off my belt.The magnet could be a little bit stronger, but it is strong enough to do its job.The one thing odd about it is that the loops at are the bottom instead of at the top.  Instead of hanging down from your belt, they are held up.  It seems instinctively wrong, however the loops are tight so it does not flip over, but it does tilt out just enough to make it easier to put your phone in and out of the pouch.The pen is useless and pointless.  If there were a place to put it in the pouch, I might carry it around, but there isn't so I don't.Update: I have now been using it every day for 7 months and it still seems well constructed and it fits all of my belts.  If it does come apart, I would probably purchase another one and so far, I have yet to have my phone fall out.  It is has been easy to get the phone in and out of this holster.S IV S 4

Compared to the many other options out there, we were disappointed by this one.The format is big photos with less than a half a dozen words in big type on each page meant for children just beginning to read.My 2nd grade daughter did not use it at all for her report on Mae Jemison.
Perhaps the most informative book we were able to find on May Jemison for my daughter's book report.  There are 10 nice b/w photos in the middle of the book.
This Double Hammock is 10' long and has a 3" long rope at the end with an S hook attached.Make sure you also bring extra rope and/or tree huggers.

We were not familiar with this series, but our daughter had to do a report on Dr. Mae Jemison, so we got all the books we could find about her.This is a 12 page 5.5"x8.5" booklet with lots of b/w graphic drawings and simple puzzles that take up half of each page with answers that tell you something about her.  In all there are few than 300 large type words in the book with a 6 word glossary at the end.It is a nicely done book, but it is a lot less substantial than we hoped for a 2nd grader's report.  It did give us one more reference however and we only paid $3 for it.

The Tetra 3i is a bit noisy, but tolerable. I picked it up at Petsmart after our daughter "won" a goldfish at a charity function.It works and there are not a lot of other options small enough to fit in a fish bowl.The suction cups on the side have held up well attached to the inside of our round bowl and it does not take up that much space inside the bowl (compared to other filters) and we did not want to purchase a full fledged fish tank for a fish that would likely die in a week.We have had it running for 9 months now.After about 6 months, even after changing the filter and clipping the ends of the tube to get a tighter fit, the water flow kept getting less and less until finally I purchased the 10 gallon Tetra Whisper Air Pump.I can now keep the lip a bit higher over the water and the flow is strong enough to get a lot more use out of the filter and if it clogs up, it is strong enough to keep on flowing thus oxygenating the water, unlike the old motor, which nearly suffocated my fish.  The water flowing around the filter may not be filtered, but at least it is being oxygenated.With both motors, I hung the motor about a foot above the top of the fishtank (on a hook) to avoid water getting to the motor.With the original filter, I had to constantly change filters to keep the water flowing. I do try to clean the filter most days, but I still have to replace the filter about once a week. I wound up getting the 6 pack Tetra 19550 6-Pack Whisper Aquarium Filter Cartridge, Small.

It comes with 2 CAT5 cables.I have a gigabit network at home and I routinely transfer files between my computers at 100 MB/s (800 mbps).The one place I am missing such speed is the 2nd floor where the bedrooms are, and I was hoping that I could fix that problem with this device without having to feed a CAT6 cable thru the walls, but alas this fell far short of what I was hoping.I tested it in steps.I first connected my notebook directly to my switch with a CAT6 cable and I successfully transferred a movie file at 100 MB/s.Next I put that same CAT6 cable into one of these adaptors and then plugged it into an outlet and plugged another CAT6 cable into the other adaptor and plugged that into THE SAME OUTLET and pushed the link button on both adaptors and then plugged that 2nd CAT6 cable into my notebook. Transfer rate = 25 MB/s. Far short of the 50 MB/s I was hoping for, but not too shabby.Next I plugged that 2nd adaptor into another outlet on the other side of my house (built in 1946 in Chicago, so the wiring is a bit old) but on the same circuit breaker and the transfer rate dropped to 5 MB/s. Not acceptable.Next I tried plugging that 2nd adaptor into an outlet in our 2nd floor bedroom and no matter what I tried... no connection at all. But it is on a different circuit breaker.Looks like I will have to pull a CAT6 cable to the 2nd floor if I want better transfer speeds upstairs. There is a coax gigabit adaptor which I might give a try (I already have a coax cable running down from the basement to the 2nd floor), however it is unreasonably expensive.

0:21 MinsI wanted to post a photo to show what you actually receive, but I guess a video will do (odd that Amazon removed photos).In an envelope, I received 5 blister packs just as if I went to the hard ware store and picked 5 off the shelf.  They are they rubber style that expands to make a tight fit with the sandpaper when you tighten the screw (and allows you to remove it by loosening the screw.I too wanted to use it to trim my dog's toenails and it worked like a charm.  I have bad memories of trying to use a clipper 30 years ago and have never tried again since.  Sanding them down is the way to go, however the odor was unexpectedly nasty.  I am glad I did it when the wife was not at home.  You would also need a towel as it can make a mess.Now that I have them and see what they are, I probably should have just gone to the hardware store and picked up just one of these and a pack of sandpaper Dremel 408 1/2-Inch Sander Bands, Coarse, 6 PackAbout the only way I would foresee needing 5 of them is if I had a project where I wanted 5 different sandpaper grits to be handy at all times.

This camera has been up an running for about 4 months now pointing at our back door.  It has been sending me an 3MB avi video file attached to an email every time motion is detected in the sections that I asked it to monitor as well as 2nd email without an attachment to a different email just to say that motion detection has been triggered (for a faster response time).  I am using the web-interface built into the camera for the video file and MyDLink for the other email. It is connected wirelessly.  So far, only once have I had to unplug it and plug it back in again to get it working again.  It is working exactly as it should.  MyDlink for Android has been able to access the camera just fine.  Day and Night mode both work just as expected.My reason for only 3 star lies mostly in it's fidelity.I can tell who is coming and going only because I know everyone coming thru that door so far, however if a stranger were to decide to enter, I doubt the resolution would be of very much help in identifying that person.  However, if I HAPPEN to check email when I know that no one should be home and it HAPPENED to not be a false alarm, I could call the police immediately and catch them in the act, in theory.On the flip side If it were a full HD camera, these video files would be HUGE.I get much the same effect, but Full HD, with our webcam using BlueIris, but that would need to remain within USB cable length from the computer.The other annoying factor is the motion detection sensivitity.  I am getting a lot of false positives even tho sensitivity is set currently at 25% -- mostly it is changes in sunlight intensity or the neighbor's floodlight.  I also seem to be only getting an email about 90% to 95% of the time I know there was movement.

After I ordered it (before receiving it) I received an email from the company suggesting that I could pre-install the drivers.  I replied asking if I needed to for the Microsoft Surface Pro 2.  They replied within hours that yes I did (the email was much more involved, but that was the basic idea).  So I went ahead and I preinstalled the drivers.When it came, I plugged it into my Surface Pro 2, connected to a Cat 6 cable connected to my known Gigabit network, turn on my Surface Pro 2 and sure enough, I was able to copy a 10GB file to my Surface Pro 2 within 100 seconds.An average of 100MB/s or 0.8 gigabit/sec.When I connected this adaptor to a Cat5 cable it averaged 10MB/s (as expected, which is still faster than wireless which came in at 8MB/s).

The two negative reviews here are on its solubility to limit its detection for human consumption.The packaging clearly states that it is intended only for animals (tho this point is not made clear from the description on Amazon)I measure out the proper dosage for my dog and mix it in with canned dog food and he gobbles it up.I alternate meds to keep him from it irritating his stomach (he will throw up if I keep it up for too long).  Right now I am using a rotation of 3 days of aspirin with 1 day off and 1 day of tramadol.

I purchased this to dose out powered aspirin for my 100lb dog and I needed to give him 900mg per feeding and no scale I had in hand (I do have a digital one that is accurate down to 1g, however rounding was a big concern).The tare functions works well.  You can tare it after you turn it on or you can put the cup on the scale before you turn the scale on and it will start up pre-tared.The ceramic cup I used weighs in at 94 grams on both scales, so I knew it was accurate enough for my needs and after 2 weeks of daily use and repeated re-weighing of the same cup, it does vary every time, but it has always been within 0.10 grams (and much of that variance could easily be moisture or oils from my hands).  I figure that as I pour in the aspirin, the relative change in weight should be far more accurate that my other scale and being off by 0.10 grams was not really an issue for me. At least now I know if I have 1.1 or 1.0 or 0.9 grams vs "somewhere between 1.49 and 0.51" as before.I would completely ignore that last digit for anything important.In fact, I would not use this scale for anything where accuracy of better than 0.2 grams is really important.The scale itself weighs 125 grams.  It is 5"x3"x.75" and the raised metal is 3"x2.5".It does g, oz, gn (grains), ct (carats).When you turn it on it also displays ozt (Troy ounces) and dwt (pennyweight), but I do not know how to access those while it is on. The display is probably also used on a more expensive version.The instructions are printed on the inside cover and it uses 2 AAA batteries.

I purchased both the Tupperware and the BananaGuard to keep our bananas bruise free during transit and we much prefer the Tupperware version for several reasons.The biggest complaint I see about the Tupperware is the size.  Granted it looks big, but in reality it does not take up any more space than the BananaGuard, but the thicker mid-section of the Tupperware allows for more variety of bananas to be protected.  All the bananas we purchased over the past week have fit into both, but the ones we have this morning ONLY fit in the Tupperware version.The other bonus for the Tupperware is that my 7 year old daughter finds it much easier to open at lunch at school (yes it fits into her lunch bag).  She asks me to not use the BananaGuard as she finds it more difficult to open.The third reasons I like the Tupperware version is the hinge.  They have a 2 piece hinge while the BananaGuard just uses one big mold for both sides and the hinge, using the fact that the plastic bends where the plastic is thin.  I do not see that design lasting as long.  Tupperware uses two different molds and the two sides snap together at the hinge.For both, I tend to cut off the top of the stem for a better fit.
