At times I thought we lived on an entirely different planet.What Atheists does well (in that absurdly long overview of theism) is discuss how derivative and how viciously violent the major world religions happen to be.  All too true but since when has the human race been so appalled by violence as to renounce it?  Indeed, the whole 20th century and the first part of this one seem to indicate we're dedicated to fine tuning our ability to kill.  Williams also seems to rely entirely too much upon (no pun intended) "the better Angels of our nature."  The notion that the ignorant and superstitious will suddenly have the scales fall from their eyes, or that multi-media and the internet is a match for the dedicated brutality of Shia or Wahabi narrow-mindedness is a lie.  It has been 35 years since the Iranian Revolution and the imams shows no sign of losing power.  Iraq is torn asunder with religious strife; Wahbism is regnant on the Arabian peninsula and we bogged ourselves down in Afghanistan for a decade to replace religious radicals with a drug cartel. Huzzah!!!After devoting more than half the length of his argument to a World Religion Intro Williams then spends another lengthy chapter arguing religions have an unfair advantage in schools, government support and social standing.  Dude, you are preaching to the choir.  We know the influence is pervasive--how and why is it going to die out I thought was the point of this far too long, off topic book.  Apparently it could have been a magazine article. Eventually the author gets to the point that education, media and virtual connectivity will diminish its advantage.  Thin gruel if you ask me.  95% of Americans are functionally literate and 90% believe in some diety or another.  Fundamental christians and bores again are pervasive and influential throughout our political system.  One can't teach Darwinism in half of our public schools.  Mazel tov Saudi women shaking off your shackles.The great strength of course of religious ignoramuses is a willingness to strap a bomb about themselves, push the button and expect to have a hundred virgins waiting for them in heaven.  Rationalist who KNOW there is ONLY this existence are far less eager to depart it.  It's hard to trump that.  Further, atheism is a world view acquired by education and reflection.  It is not a passion or prejudice I believe needs to be rammed down others' throats. Every atheist I know has wasted tens of hours of discussion with idiots who have NO counterargument to your points (don't even know what evidence actually is) but look at you dreamily and tell you it's their FAITH that guides them.It is impossible to counter such imbecility and since atheism is NOT a righteous path,  I am quite happy to allow the ignorant to wallow in their ignorance providing it is not imposed upon me. I will do my part to defend rationalism and science among family and friends but is the point of being non religious to NOT prosteltize.  Frankly, atheism is less formidable than religion because it DOES require education, reflection and the (initially) disturbing idea that this life IS all there is.  I am happy to wrestle with these difficult issues but if others wish to cop out I'm not counting on the worldwide web to overthrow god or  disprove the "comfort" of religion; the "bliss" of ignorance.  An oxymoron need not be untrue.I wish Albert's thesis held more promise, but I have lived in this world long enough to know the stupid and superstitious have a pretty good grip on it.  I don't begrudge him my $.99.  If you're looking for an overview of the topic this book is a bargain. I do begrudge him the 5 or 6 hours of my time he wasted as I waited for him to get to the point, he never really made.  Too bad.

I too disagree with the naysayers who are slamming this product.  I am in an area with decent reception but friends and family are avid boaters.  This is a big help (and a Catch--22 from a relaxation POV--why do we always have to have a phone and email?)  I do have a few reservations though:  I didn't find the instructions as easy as some.  In fact I found Kristen Bogren review more helpful and incredibly detailed, so thanks for that!  I don't get a big a boost as that paragon reviewer.  However an additional bar and sometimes a bit more is definitely noticeable.My last reservation is about "worthwhile".  This is effective but absolutely pricey.  For my occasional nautical use I would not consider buying it at a price point of almost $500.  As I alluded above, it's more neurosis than necessity that wants access to emails and phone all the time.  If though I was in the country I might reconsider.  An important factor I think when deciding.
I think this is a perfectly fine product (see headline above) but absurdly overpriced for what it is.  The fact that the musk scent isn't overwhelming also means it dissipates quickly.

Heather Graham seems to have (successfully) created her own genre: paranormal romantic suspense.  What will they think of next? Nothing, I hope. This book is just awful. My rule of thumb--if you can't identify a single interesting or redeeming quality about a book in the first 50 pages, chuck it.  It doesn't deserve any more attention than it has already been given.  I am confident in saying I could have read 5 times 50 pages and still have nothing good to say about The Silenced.  NOTE:  The paragraphs below contain story lines from the first two ghastly chapters.  To anyone who thinks the revelation of cliches might SPOIL their enjoyment, consider this your ALERT.Like so many at the bottom of the suspense genre barrel,  the author is addicted to both cliche and exclamation points! They seem to be on every page! together!  "Get out of Washington! It's a nest of vipers!" or, "It was just a suspicion and it could be unfounded!" or "...personal danger hadn't even occurred to her!"  and my personal favorite: "Anyone in politics was suffering from a mental disorder!" [guffaw].  This is the first five pages.  The problem of course is it's not so bad as to be funny.  Just appalling.  The author apparently forgets her previous paragraph: "She needed somewhere far, far, away from DC."  One paragraph later: "Baltimore?"  Apparently Ms. Graham can't follow the thread of her own writing or she flunked geography, blithely  unaware of the two cities' proximity.But there's worse. A serial killer who names himself, of all things, Slash.  The victim Lara, luckily has a BFF Meg JUST graduated from the FBI academy (top of her class) and MIGHT be invited to the special paranormal unit (you read that right, dude) Krewe Hunters--a 21st century variation of GhostBusters.  Matt Bosworth (who speaks to the dead, but wisely rarely tells his superiors) is a Studly Doright and heart-throb waiting in the wings for dear Meg (who's worked really hard, remember).  I've nicknamed Mr. Bosworth,  Dash.  Thought it would be fun to have a Dash chase a Slash...but I digress.  Some old fogies find corpses may (or my not) be communicating with them "before the light went out" and the whole Motley Krewe is headed up by a part Native American named Jackson who makes incredibly racist observations such as his heritage has been "sadly diluted," apparently by white folk.It is a testament to the government's ability to flush hundreds of millions of tax dollars down a toilet that I briefly considered this krewe of punters might exist.  The back book jacket promises a connection between Slash, political conspiracy and paranormal activity in (of all places) Gettysburg. Talk about desecrating national monuments (exclamation point).  It's The Trifecta Of Summer Trash with a splash--or is it Dash?-- of romance between the beefcake agent and dear sweet Meg.  How do I know if I haven't ready more than the first two chapters?  I am banking on the author's affinity for cliche.I have struggled mightily to think of single positive thing to say about the first 70 or so pages of The Silenced.  I have come up with only this: my copy was free.

Fairly good. For such an old model, it still works great with modern computers. The wireless receiver is really tiny and there is no lag. Everything works perfectly. I removed one star because they definitely should have (and could have) made the track pad larger and more responsive. But certainly the best choice at this price.
Much better than the larger size. While the dosage is obviously smaller, I feel that the body absorbs them much more naturally and wastes less. Great products.
Awesome investment for any guitar player. I have one on every guitar I own. Very accurate. Very affordable. Very low-profile. Truly a must-have.

This is easily the most perfect case for the iPhone 6 (if you are looking for minimal protection). This thing looks amazing, it fits the phone PERFECTLY, the rubberized material is just enough to make it easy to hold but not hard to get out of a pocket, and the cutouts are precise! plus the packaging it comes in is beautiful and it comes with stickers to protect the apple logo. I would have easily paid up to $20 for this case.

It's meh. They are good and the packaging it comes in is absolutely beautiful, but 2 things to note. 1. They didn't leave a cut out for the front facing camera. 2. There aren't perfect cut outs for the speaker and home button. They have big rectangle cut outs leaving much of the screen exposed. They will do for now, but I would recommend looking elsewhere.

This case is great. It really offers everything you want in a case.Pros:-Made of TPU (The best material for cases ever)-50% thinner than any TPU case I've ever owned-Feels great-Built in plugs that protect lightning and headphone jacks-Covers buttons without making them hard to press-CHEAP!Cons:-It fits great, but not perfect. It's not as snug as it could be, but nothing to worry about. It stays on just fine.
These things look amazing on my new 2012 Scion xD. I would recommend them to anybody interested. They are a super cheap way to make your car look like a totally different vehicle.
Awesome quality. There's not really much to say. Cheap. Great quality. Accurate. Beautiful design. Buy it.

This case is amazing considering that I got it for less than $6. And even with the price tag aside, the case is awesome quality! It's just as nice as some super expensive ones I've seen! VERY thin, pretty durable, and fits PERFECTLY. I bought this case so I could cover it with stickers instead of putting stickers on my Mac...but I don't know if I want to since the case is so nice looking by itself! Plus this was the only shiny hard case I could find. All the others are rubberized. I would totally recommend this product.Also, If you have the 2013 model, it fits fine but it covers the microphones on the left hand side. I just drilled two tiny holes for them so if you want a super cheap case that looks awesome and you're willing to do a little modification...you can't beat this price.

Pros:-Looks great both with and without your phone attached-Phone connects very sturdily in any configuration-Keeps phones out of your face when looking out the windshield-No need to stick anything to your windshield or dashboard-No chance of this thing falling down while drivingCons:-If you have a foam lining in your CD slot, this (very noticeably) leaves a whole bunch of lines in the foam that will never go away. If you never plan on removing this mount, or you just don't care about damaging the cosmetics of your head unit, this won't be a problem.-While I am sure this will not fall out of the CD player, it is pretty wobbly once inserted. My concern is not that it will fall, but I'm hoping this won't eventually damage the CD player after a few months of jiggling and wiggling around.4/5. Overall, I will never use another type of mount. Awesome product.

I've had this controller for a pretty long time now. I have to say that this is hands down the greatest emulator controller on the planet. One controller that can finally do it all. With this layout of buttons, you can program it to work with anything from NES to N64 without issue. Works perfectly with OpenEmu for Mac and has no delay/broken buttons. PLUS IT'S SO DANG CHEAP!!!
What's not to love? Awesome reliable memory, easy to install, and a great deal. Works perfectly with my late 2012 Mac Mini.
I've had this cable for about 7 months now and I've been using it almost 24/7 in my office. No issues. No complaints.

Superb audio quality. Whenever reviewing a set of speakers, you ALWAYS have to keep the price in mind. Even if there is minor sound improvements that could be made, I strictly compare to what is already out there for this price. As for these speakers, I would pick them over ANY option in this price range. Even if you could find a similar setup for a bit more money, I can guarantee they won't look nearly as beautiful as these. With price, style, quality, and (most importantly) sound quality taken into consideration...these are my top recommendation. They offer astounding clarity and richness while playing tunes, and a beautiful design while they are not. Highly recommended.

This headstand works like a charm. It's simple, portable, and sturdy. P.s. to the people complaining about it falling over...I have no idea what you're doing with your guitars, but mine is very stable. Plus all headstands are a bit wobbly and I've used just about every brand. For the price, you can't complain.

I installed this kit into my Mac Mini last Christmas. My machine has been running great ever since. Having so much power and two drives in such a tiny machine really makes me fuzzy inside. I'm a long time computer geek so installation was a breeze for me, but anybody should be capable of doing this as long as you are good at following instructions. Enjoy!
Much better than any over priced Dremel I have ever owned. All the features (plus more) of a very high end Dremel at a very low end price. I love it!

After my insurance company declined me for a real mouth guard, I decided to give these a shot. Very affordable and very affective. When I wake up in the morning my teeth feel great and I can actually see deep bite marks in them from me grinding in my sleep. They say to use each one 3 times before throwing away, so you get about a 42 night supply for this low price. It does take a few nights to get used to sleeping with something in your mouth though.

Genius idea that I wish I thought of first. I actually super glued mine to my work desk to make it permanent, but it has plenty of grip all by itself to securely hold your guitar in place. I would definitely recommend!
Awesome value. Everything you need to start using your dremel. Also, all accessories work perfectly with my Black & Decker rotary tool in case anybody was wondering.

For the price, you can't go wrong. I am a 6 foot tall, 140 pound, young adult. I assembled this bed all on my own in a solid two hours. The design is great, perfect height to sit under at a desk, and it's great quality. When I get in and out of the bed, it does wobble a little bit. But even so, it feels incredibly sturdy. It rocks a little bit, but not enough to make me feel unsafe. Very roomy and overall is worth the cash.

For what it is, I couldn't ask for more. Guitar racks that hold 9 guitars are usually over $100 or more from any other brand. This is a no name brand, some parts are a bit cheap, but once put together it's sturdy enough for me to trust it with my axes. I will never use the folding feature, but it works well. It's basic, sturdy, and gets the job done for under $40. I love it.P.s. No instructions were included, but I put it together in 15 min just by looking at the picture on Amazon.

Works perfectly. Pretty cheap, easy to apply, was to carry, and really works. I never use sun screen, but I wanted to protect my new chest piece. I put this stuff on my tattoo and didn't apply protection to the rest of my body. After a day at the beach, pretty much every part of my body was burned except for my tattoo. It looked a bit funny, but it protected my rather expensive body art. Would highly recommend!

This stuff is clean, affordable, and it works like a charm. I've been using it for years and can never see myself using anything else. No icky slick "greaser" look. It makes you hair look and feel as if it is just magically staying in place on its own. Plus the stuff smells AWESOME. Bottom line...put this stuff in your hair!

I'm going to keep this short and sweet.Much better than any solid state amp I have ever used (once you find the right tone).Easily the best bluetooth speaker (or home speaker in general) that I have ever played my iTunes through (at this price range).The iOS app is super intuitive and extremely fun to use.Design is drop dead gorgeous.More features than you even know what to do with.Also, as for the bluetooth connectivity problems people have been reporting...line 6 already released a firmware update that fixed this. If you people understood technology and learned to be patient, it would benefit you greatly.Wether you're a beginner with some money, home entertainer, or giggin' musician (who isn't a crazy gear snob) this amp is an amazing investment for the price.
This album is even more than I could have ever asked for. 14 songs of awesomeness written by the one and only PUSA. I love supporting these guys and you should too!

For me, it's awesome. I feel that most people will hate how soft, thin, and flimsy it is. It literally feels like it's made of cloth (which it is). If you don't mind that, I recommend this wallet. It holds plenty of cash and cards in a very simple fashion. Plus it's not made of nasty leather!

Pros:-Battery is good enough to fully charge your iPhone-Kickstand comes in handy-Very slim for a battery case-Uses the iPhone lightning cable to charge (this was the major selling point for me)-Easy to use one button functionality. Makes it easy to start and stop charging.-Very clean looking battery gauge tells you how much juice is left in the case-Looks AMAZING on the iPhone 5s-The rubberized plastic material feels great in the hand-Does not cause a haze when taking a picture with flash on in the darkCons:-Cutouts are a bit uncomfortable to use. The ones for volume aren't too bad, but the one by the sleep/wake is too deep, but you kinda just get used to it. It actually doesn't really fit the phone perfectly at the top. The case is like a millimeter too long.-It does muffle the iPhone's speakers just a little bit. Not too bad, but noticeable.-No lay on the table design so the screen isn't protected at all from drops. I personally don't care at all and I actually think it makes it look better, but some people could see that as a con.-You cannot use anything besides the apple earbuds while this case is on. Not a problem for me, but may be for some.Overall:Don't hesitate. Buy it. It works like a charm and looks great. I couldn't be happier.

I am absolutely thrilled with this purchase. I can finally make thousands of old memories into digital files. This thing works flawlessly and I'm simply amazed by the quality and simplicity of it. I have a MacBook running OS X Mavericks. Buy Now!!!
For the price, this case is awesome. And believe me when I say the ware drops look incredibly realistic!!! Awesome look, awesome fit, and awesome feel. Great quality.

Nice shirt but wow do these fit large.  I am 5'11" and 180lbs, no gut and I ordered a small, it fits more like a big medium.  If they had an extra small size I would exchange the shirt.The shirt itself is nice quality and looks great though.

Is it INDESTRUCTIBLE?  noCan it cook you BREAKFAST?  noHow about fixing a flat tire, can it do that? noWhat about walking your dog?  nopeTaxes?  no, it can not do your taxes either  :(Can you fill it full of molten lava, close the lid then jump off a 50 story building and not spill a drop or leak?  absolutely not.Why did I give it 5 stars then if it can not do any of the above mentioned typical uses for a travel mug?Because it looks better than the photo, it holds tea, coffee, etc and keeps it cool or hot a reasonable amount of time, the lid works great by not allowing it to splash out of the cup when I am carrying it out to my car and it is a big cup that fits in my cup holder and i can drink out of it (the cup not the cup holder).Some of these reviewers expect some crazy things from their cups but for me this is a really nice one and it functions as any normal person would expect it to.  It is a double wall GLASS cup that is not bulletproof, it can not survive being hit by a baseball bat or from being thrown onto concrete.  It will leak if you fill it up, close the lid then hold it upside down while shaking it.  BUT when does the average person ever need a cup to do those things?  I guess I just must be boring.Great cup, GREAT looking (much better than the photos) and it works great at holding liquids (but not lava) and it holds the temps well (but not for months or years)

Works great for a few weeks then the backlight fails on the screen making it unusable.  once the backlight fails, you can no longer read the screen, no longer change channels, use the 3.5mm jack or anything because you are unable to see to change the modes.

I always go back to Asics.  Recently I had bought a pair of K-Swiss Tubes and thought they were great but slowly I started to develop some foot problems because of them.  My big toe was hurting so bad I thought I had arthritis and the side of my foot started hurting as well.  After a few months I was walking with a limp.  I finally figured out it was the shoes when I put on my old pair of asics and wore them for a few days then the problems started to go away.  I ordered these since I have almost flat feet and knowing asics normally fit true to size for me I ordered the 2e wide and went a size bigger to 15 (yeah i have giant feet).  They are about 1/2 a size big on me (i assume where they are wide) but they do not slip at all and they are super comfortable so I am keeping them.  Now that I have wore them for a few weeks my foot is doing great and I no longer think about my feet all day and all night which means they are doing their job.  I am sticking with Asics from now on.  I have worn them on and off for 20 years and every time I have tried something new it has not worked out for me.
Pretty good quality but snags very easily and it is too tight at the top and too loose at the bottom for my wife.  She purchased a small and she is 4'11" 110lbs
Nice quality but a little too soft for the weight of a gopro/yi style camera.  Would work great for a camera 60g or lighter.
Love it, perfect fit and good quality.  Wife is 4'11" 110lbs 34D and it fits her PERFECT.  Looks better than the photo, great deal

The first time I plugged it in it searched for a gps lock for 35 minutes so I thought it was not working.  I turned it off and back on then let it sit for 10 minutes and finally it got a lock.  Now it obtains a gps lock in about 30 seconds so I assume the first time it has to search through a satellite database before it finds the right one.As for detection range it works great.  It also stays quiet so far and does not give a lot of false alarms. I have the filter on and city 2 on (no one uses xband except for garage doors) and I have the traffic flow monitor on.
Fits true to size, wife wears a 5/6, we ordered a 5/6 and it fits perfect.  Sh is 4'11" and 110lbs.Looks great, nice quality and nice color.

Great quality, breathable and works great on a motorcycle.  Baggy enough to fit over your motorcycle gear.  Wear it UNDER your motorcycle gear for a light insulating layer on chilly days.Folds down very small and fits in motorcycle tank or tail bag.
Wow what a deal!  Has almost any mount you could want and the quality seems to be very very good.  Very pleased with this purchase!

These work great and are breathable so they are not insanely hot like most rain gear.  We use these on our motorcycles, they fold down very compactly and fit in our tail bags.  They are baggy and fit over our motorcycle gear with no issues.Wear them UNDER your motorcycle gear as an insulating layer in the spring or early fall and they work great when it is a little chilly.
Great quality for a super low price.  I use this on my sony action cam for motorcycle riding. It is directional so the wind noise does not affect the mic in my helmet.
Just a little small but they work great.  I would purchase again, great price.

puddin.  Tastes like coconut and has the consistency of puddin.  Don't you love saying puddin?Say it 3 times with me:puddinpuddinpuddinNow go have a great day and think about coming home to a big bowl of jello puddin.
Looks great on the wife, very good quality!  Fits as expected, purchased a small and fits perfect.  She is 4' 11" and 105lbs.
Fantastic quality, switched from St. Tropez (expensive!) to this and it appears to be just as good.  No bad smell, extremely easy to apply and wow what a great price!
Appears to work as well as OEM at a MUCH better price.  Will purchase again.
Great quality, use it on my 2011 Hyundai Elantra limited.
Best tea ever, we drink it every day.  Does not get bitter even if you forget and leave the tea bag in the cup for over 10 minutes lol.Fantastic quality bagged tea.
Fits on my 2011 Hyundai Elantra Limited and works great.  No issues and appears to be very well made.
Works as well as OEM, very happy.
Smells like coconut but seems to work very well on my car's interior.  7 days later and it still looks great!
VERY stinky but a great price and seems to work great.  In combination with mobil 1 synthetic 75w-140 oil in my 2002 ford explorer's differential it has made for a much quieter ride.
Works great!  No problems at all, charges my batteries just as it should.
Appears to be very well made,  does not harm door unless you do not have any common sense and crank it way past tight so it pushes the frame out until it cracks.  Well worth the price, great deal.
Fits really loose.  Had to wrap tape around it so it would not fall out of my curt tow hitch.
Works great and super SUPER loud!  Use them on my quadcopters and they work great!

Featured in the newly released 28 Day's Later zombie movie franchise!In the new movie, the zombie apocalypse is set off by Haribo when they offer a free giveaway across the world of sugar free Haribo Gummi bears to celebrate their companies birthday.  Needless to say, shortly after billions of people around the world consume their free 1oz packet of gummi bears hell on earth is unleashed.  The newest form of "rage" rips through the population, devastating the human race and civilization as we know it.  The last remaining humans must hide from the rivers of blood pouring from colons and the angry behinds of those infected from "the plague of raging rectums".  You can see the official trailer online, it was "RELEASED" rather quickly if you know what I mean (wink wink).
Works great in my Syma x8c, it is about 2mm longer and 3 grams heavier which is nothing.  Fits and runs like the stock battery so far.
Excellent!  Works great on my syma x8c and eliminated jello.  Appears to be real cf, weighs 20grams.
Super comfy and fits my size 14 feet just fine.  Love them.
Works on 2011 Hyundai Elantra Limited.  Fits/ works as it should, easy install.
Used on my Syma x8c, fits perfectly.  Flexes enough to help with impact on hard landings, does not show in video when using yi or gopro
Fits 2011 Hyundai Elantra Limited.Hyundai does not rate the elantra for towing.  I pulled a 730lb trailer with no problems, not sure if I would go on a long trip but who knows it may be fine to do.
Works/fits the x4 great, not much more to say about that.Con- does not have gps and makes crappy espresso.
Works great!  Just adjust the screws on the side until you have enough play for the balancer to spin freely.  I was able to balance my props in seconds!
Excellent quality, very sharp and low distortion.  I did not want a fisheye, just wide angle and this lens works perfect!  The macro lens is really sharp too!!!!

I spend a lot of time cruising around late at night, especially at greyhound bus stops and dark alleys.  I have found the Back Seat Air Mattress to be a must have item to keep with me at all times.  I keep it in what I like to call my cruising kit (Back Seat Air Mattress, duct tape, rope, hatchet, bleach, shovel).One of the many features of the Back Seat Air Mattress that I love most is the easy clean up if me and a messy friend or a nice lady that needs a ride standing on a street corner late at night happens to get something on the air mattress when she asks to take a nap or something.  I can hose it off at a car wash and wipe it down with bleach and an old rag then BAM! it is good as new with no messy DNA left behind or umm ketchup or other condiments....yeah that's it.To conclude, I find the air bed bedroom aka back seat air mattress a must have for daily activities that may tucker you out or if you meet someone sleepy that needs a ride and a quick nap.  Two thumbs and a hatchet up from me!
Great knife for a cheap price.  Nice and balanced and really light and I like the sheath too.

Having a blast with my tracker.  The app is amazing, love the dual feature to challenge people on my "team".  Love the food tracker, the workout tracker (allows you to enter weight lifting ,etc and it even gets smart and guesses your type of workout after a while!)
Works great, our old one was around 14 years old when I finally had to retire it so these sweepers last a long long time.  They do great on carpet and bare floors.

I got this for an amazing price on Amazon and it works great.  The motor sounds like it is running at a low rpm but the blades are super sharp and it cuts my hear with ease.  I love the adjustable brush on it, the only con is you need to pull it off and dump out the hair while doing a larger cut or it clogs up.  The brush is a little difficult to pull off and to put back on but nothing too bad.Very nice clipper!
Using this as a helmet lock on my motorcycle.  The quality is very good and the price is very good.
32" fits my 2012 Ninja 1000 perfectly, appears to be very well made and super easy to use.  I like it a lot.
Love it, used it on my motorcycle tank bags and they look brand new!!!!SUPER, SUPER easy to use!

Excellent quality and fit as all the Marilyn Monroe nightgowns, great fit, great material and great quality.wife is 4'10", 105lbs, 34D and medium fits perfect.  would fit someone taller with no problems.

Excellent quality and fit as all the Marilyn Monroe nightgowns.  These are really hot and fit great and are made well, not cheap thin generic material.  It is just as nice as the Victoria Secrets stuff we have bought.wife is 4'10", 105lbs and 34D and the medium fits perfect.  Would fit someone taller just fine.

I wear an XL in all other brands and even in other models of Cortech but in these I had to send back the XL and get an XXL!  They are made well and vent well but wow these fit 1 size small.  The XXL BARELY fit me, they are slightly snug so do not waste your time and order your normal size.  Order 1 size up.This is inexcusable for a manufacturer to be so inconsistent in sizing.The gloves do offer good protection, look great and vent well.

Finally a protein powder that is not so sickening sweet it is undrinkable.  This stuff tastes great and mixes easily!  I use super skim milk and about 20% water and it is very drinkable, all the other brands I have tried have been so WAY over the top sweet that it is all you can do to drink a shaker bottle of it.  Also, if you did not notice this stuff is more concentrated, the 25g of protein is for 1 SCOOP not 4 SCOOPS like most others require.  So this smaller container actually goes further.My up your mass brand weight gainer requires 4 scoops for 68g of protein,  4 scoops of this would be 100g of protein and it actually tastes good!

Really great but not durable at all.  It developed a small tear on the first use and it is definitely a disposable unit.  HOWEVER it feels even better than an expensive fleshlight and you can wash this one out and reuse a few times before you have to toss it.
It is a great tasting tea, I was expecting a hot fireball spicy flavor and it does have that aroma but it is not hot at all.  It has an amazing taste though and I would effeminately buy it again.
Works great for my cat and they love the taste, a good substitute for the Lax'aire.  I was concerned they would not like the flavor but they love it!

Beautiful watch but the menu layout is not streamlined.  I purchased this watch as well as the cheaper Lad Weather watch and ended up keeping the Lad watch because it just simply works better.  The numbers when showing the current time do not go across the entire screen, they are shifted to the right for some reason.  It is also a chore to scroll through all the menus and the alarm is not loud enough compared to the Lad Weather watch.  This is a well made watch but it has a lot of little irks that made me send it back.  The barometer also only shows data from the last 12 hours, the lad weather watch shows it for the past 36 hours.I love pulsar/seiko watches but i was surprised that i liked the lad weather watch better.  It had a louder alarm than the pulsar, more features and cost less and the menu layout on the lad is well thought out and streamlined.

Great stuff from Twinings, a stronger citrus taste compared to the USA version.  I like it a lot and would purchase again.  I would not say it is better than the US version just a stronger citrus flavor, I like it just as well as the US version and it is a nice change of pace.  Worth the purchase!
1% lidocaine which is just the right amount so it does not numb you completely.  The lube is high quality and works great.

Great price, mine arrived quickly and the voltage checks out fine on them.  I bought them to replace the bateries in my Hyundai car key fob and they work perfectly.  They are also a common size for gun red dot sites which I plan to use my spares for.

As always with my experience with Spyderco, a very high quality well thought out knife.  Super, SUPER sharp out of the box with a thin profile and very smooth opening.  Everything on the knife is just right, light, strong, sharp and smooth.  It is a great looking and durable knife, i really like it a lot and it is a good price for such high quality.
Super soft and comfy, love it!  A huge step up in comfort compared to the terrible inflatable kind.

Great deal for the money but the pin pusher is weak, mine has already bent twice.  I bent it back but I expect the next time it will break.  The other tools appear to be good quality.  For the price you can not beat it though.
Extremely high quality cable, very impressed!  Much thicker than it appears in the photo (a good thing) and the appearance and quality of the plugs is top notch!

Great movie if you enjoy watching a bunch of people sitting around a table talking over top of each other.  Also, there are some great scenes of them looking out the window then they run back to the table and talk over top of each other more.  If that is your thing then you are going to LOVE this movie!  It looks like someone filmed it with a $50 consumer grade video camera from 1990 which gives it that extra special generic look to add to the tense moments of them sitting at the table talking.
Worth the extra few dollars over the other leather bands.  The color is beautiful and the leather is high quality.  Looks great!

Looks WAY better than the photos, beautiful watch with a quality weight to it.  This is a great looking, accurate and quality watch. I bought this for the wife and once we adjusted the band by easily taking out a few links it fits her perfect.  I have a 20 year old Seiko that still runs like new so I expect this watch (which is also made by Seiko) should last at least as long.  This is not a cheap China throw away watch, this baby will run for decades and look great as well.  As soon as you pick the watch up you can tell it is a quality piece, it looks like an expensive bracelet and she loves the day of the week dial.LOVE IT!

Looks WAY better than the photos, beautiful watch with a quality weight to it. When you pick this watch up you instantly feel it is a quality piece.  VERY comfortable and the links are easy to get out so you can adjust it to fit your wrist.  The blue is amazing, it is a dark metallic color that gives a nice depth to the watch and makes it look a lot more expensive than what it is.  This is made by Seiko so it is high quality and accurate watch, I have a 20 year old Seiko that I bough when I was a kid and it still keeps accurate time and runs like new so I expect this watch will give me the same.LOVE IT!
Excellent bold flavor tea!  A great quality tea, especially for the price!  This reminds me of a stout version of Barry's tea, no bitterness and great flavor.  Love it!

Good quality but the color is hideous, it is a milky reddish brown that looks like something that would belong on a cheap toy.  Ok for the price but definitely not an attractive color at all,  I would call it a hideous color but a good quality band for the price.

Terrible product, you are much better off going with a quality massage gel than this one.  The Nuru Guru products dry up fast and get extremely tacky.  Their customer service is absolutely abysmal to say the least.

These are very comfortable and very warm and they are lightweight for a boot.  They do fit around 1/2 size small, I normally wear a 13 and I ordered 14 in this boot and they fit great.  If I would have went for my normal size 13 (asics, etc) then these would not have fit.I really like the boots, they appear to be well made and they are very comfortable for a boot.  They are nearly athletic shoe comfortable!  They are definitely warm, I look forward to testing them out in deep snow to see how waterproof and well they keep my feet warm.  I will follow up on this review if they do not perform as expected.  So far though on a few cold rainy days they have worked excellent.

This simply has to be one of the worst movies I have ever seen.  I love a good low brow goofy comedy but this movie has absolutely zero laughs, it is so uncomfortably bad that I am thankful no one else was home when I had the displeasure of watching it.  Terrible acting, terrible simplistic zero intelligence little kid potty humor and zero plot which when combined sums up for a horrible waste of time.

We previously were using the hairball control light but our cat decided he did not like it anymore right after we purchased a new 17lb bag.  We bought a small 3lb bag of this new perfect weight formula and all 3 of our cats love it so we plan to switch over to this one for our big guy.The calorie content is just slightly higher but the ingredients appear to be better balanced and from the reaction from the cats the taste is much better.

Works very well but you need to use a lot of it.  You really need to soak the area with Nature's Miracle for it to work so the 32 ounce bottle does not go very far but hey it gets rid of the smell really well.
Tested class 10 speeds, Transcend reliability.  I use mostly Transcend and Kingston brand cards because of the reliability.  Works great in my Galaxy S4 phone for recording HD video or taking photos.
Fit my 2012 Craftsman LT2000 mower and the quality looks equal to the OEM filter.

These socks are great, super comfortable, no loose threads and they fit as expected.  Asics quality and fit with really good cushioning and the colors are great.  We will be ordering another set, a great price for great socks.

The sizing is slightly small, I measured at the knee 15" and the medium states it fits up to 16".  I can wear it comfortably but I doubt a leg that measures 16" could.  Mine is a tight fit, I am 6' 178lbs. As for the effectiveness, support, breath-ability it is excellent. I was unable to walk to to a meniscus tear in my knee but this brace made a HUGE difference. It works much better than I expected and it is very comfortable and my leg does not sweat at all with it on so the ventilation is great.  It is very snug when I pull it on but there is no pinching or binding so I can wear it all day with no issues. I could not imagine a brace providing better support than this one, it is a great deal.

Fits about 1/2 to 1 size too small but appears to be very well made. I normally buy Asics because of the high quality, extremely consistent sizing and comfort. Asics is a shoe I can order online, no matter what model and know that a size 13 is an actual size 13.  It is very frustrating ordering clothes and shoes online only to discover how inconsistent most manufacturers are with their sizing.  A medium in one brand fits like an xl or xs in another.  Or a size 13 shoe in one brand fits like an 11 in another.  Imagine how much profits would soar from the huge reduction in returns if manufacturers were consistent in their sizing.Back to the shoes, they are well made, good support for high arches, neutral fit and have very good padding.  HOWEVER, I wear a size 13 and my toe was touching the tip of the shoe so they fit small.  What a disappointment having to box these right back up and ship them back. If they had fit I think they would have been a very good shoe for long distances.  Back to Asics for me.

Amazing full, rich audio from a bluetooth headset!  My friend had bragged about his Audition headset for weeks, I finally talked him into allowing me to test them over labor day weekend and I was simply blown away at the comfort and performance of these.  He also owns a pair of their motorcycle headsets which work very well so I was excited to try out the noise isolation headset to see how they would compare and I was not disappointed!I would rate the comfort level a 10 out of 10, I have a medium-large head (typically I wear a medium to large in motorcycle helmets) and the Audition headset fit me perfectly.  My gf wears a small and she was able to adjust these to fit her head as well so these should fit a large range of head sizes.  The range from the connected device also scored a 10 out of 10, I was able to walk through the house and the headset had no issues maintaining connection through walls.  Volume levels are more than sufficient, even while I was mowing the lawn the headset was able to easily isolate the sound of the riding mower and still provide me with a rich full range sound.  I found these especially nice while watching TV in bed, I did not experience any external bleed-through of sound which would disturb anyone in the room.  The battery life is amazing, I did not charge the headset the entire 3 days I used them.  My friend stated he can easily go 2 weeks without charging them which is astounding.At the end of the weekend I was reluctant to give back the headset. I would have loved to do further testing for my video review blog but unfortunately I was having too much fun using them to spend any time during the 3 days to perform any "official" testing lol.I can not imagine finding a better headset for under $150, these are fantastic!

Well made unit with one speaker.  Avantree appears to have excellent customer service and their products overall appear to be well thought out and an excellent buy for their price point.  My friend has a set of the Avantree BTHS-HM100-A headsets on his helmets and I connected them to my Sena SMH-10 headsets when we went on a motorcycle trip this summer.  The Avantree headsets worked well with a good range, the noise control while riding was good but not as effective as the Sena which was expected.  We traded helmets for a day and I found the volume level to be good for only having one speaker and the battery life would last for a day of riding with moderate use.  Compared directly to my Sena headsets which were nearly $300 the Avantree's held up well.  I would love to test a set of their newest model which should perform better with dual speakers.Overall:* Very good battery life* Moderate volume levels sufficient for speeds of 60mph or lower (used with a modular helmet)*  Excellent build quality*  Held up well through a heavy rainstorm with no issues*  No problems pairing with a Sena using the universal bluetooth connection mode

Excellent quality and it works great!  When you first take them out of the package you think wow these are not going to last long but they really are durable!  We are still on our 1st pair (after 6 months of use) and they still look new!  It is amazing how fast you can exfoliate your entire body with these gloves.  Exfoliating has always been one of those things we dread because of all the time an effort but with these you can go head to toe in minutes and it feels great.

This flashlight works well.  It has a zoom function or a wide light area plus a flashing light function.  It is handy and sturdy and seems well made.  The light is powerful.  The waterproof feature is nice, too. It comes with a battery charger and no battery.  Like other reviewers, I did not notice that it comes without the rechargeable battery. I happen to have a similar flashlight with an identical charger and rechargeable battery that came with the flashlight, so I was able to try out this flashlight.  The other flashlight costs less and came with a battery.  At the price of this torch and with the many other options, it needs the battery included -- I think -- to make it a flashlight of choice.I received a sample of this product in exchange for an honest review.

This Wi-Fi extender increases the range in our house to reach the outlier spots that were about 10-15 feet outside our modem's range.  We have the extender about 15 feet from our modem.  It seems to add a delay to pulling up websites on Apple devices, but that is the only problem with its functionality.It set up easily with one exception:  I interpreted the start-up guide to read that the password for the system is "admin."  That password is for the online settings website not the Wi-Fi network.  I had to chat with customer service rep for a while before he or she mentioned that the password is the same as my home network password.  Why not put that in the start up guide?  Apart from that snafu, it set up easily both using the WPS button on the modem and using the online set up site via the wifi connector on my computer.I think this is a good product to fix dead spots in homes or office areas.

Although it is a good translation, I disagree with the translator James Clark’s assertion that Henry Suso is saint in the “fullest and best sense of the word” and is the “best antidote for soul-destroying materialism.”  While Suso was a devoted Christian and servant of God, his self-tortuous practice and reliance on mystical visions sets him apart from what we consider Christian orthodoxy today.  On the other hand, Suso’s pursuit of Eternal Wisdom and passionate commitment to Christlikeness above all else set an example of sacrificial discipleship.  Suso articulates his approach to the Christian life in the following quote:“He who hopes to overcome a pampered, rebellious body by gentleness, lacks common sense.  He who would have the world and yet serve God perfectly, strives to do the impossible and will falsify God’s teachings themselves.  Therefore, if thou art minded to renounce the world, do it to some purpose.”The above quote certainly offers a rebuke to our consumerist Christian practices today.  Unfortunately, Suso’s oppression of his body and voluntary suffering included extreme physical self-abuse and neglect.  He also counseled his devotees to engage in lesser but similar self-abuse.  As I read his story, I was equally astonished at his passion for Christ’s service and his distorted practices of following Christ.In the midst of his unseemly practices, he served Christ by serving others.  He also shares many mystical visions he experienced of angels, Jesus’ mother Mary and Christians who had passed into their eternal rest.  He was guided by the expressions and messages of these visions by which he also gained encouragement through his trials.Suso confesses that for many years he suffered under depression and anxiety due to his lack of assurance of salvation.  This led to severe mortifications of his flesh until he discerned God commanding him to stop.  Suso also attributes sicknesses to God’s Providence and form of discipline.  During one vision, he perceived that an angel told him that “God had ordained the sickness for thee for the best of reasons.”The book reveals the Medieval Roman Catholic mindset regarding purgatory.  For example, Suso is chastised by a vision of a friend of his who had died because Suso did not say Mass’s for him to release him from purgatory.  After performing Mass for the friend, the friend is apparently helped at once from purgatory.Life of a Servant is a look at the Christian life of a 14th century friar and mystic.  It is enlightening to know of Henry Suso’s devotional life, his passion for Christ, his service to others and poverty.  It is also revealing of the pre-Reformational teachings about salvation, forgiveness, suffering and purgatory.  Overall, I am impressed by the sacrificial life of service, distressed by the self-abuse and thankful for the Protestant Reformation.

This is an excellent snorkel and mask.  The mask fits comfortably and is easy to adjust.  The snorkel works well and allows swimming below the surface without leaking water.  The mask is wide for good visibility.I received this set at a discount or no cost in exchange for an honest review.

Travis Mills' story highlights the tough character of an all-American young man.  Mills seems to have grown up as an around good guy who excelled in sports, loved his family, friends and his country.  After high school, he was inspired to join the US Army and the 82nd Airborne Division where he continued to excel as a soldier and leader.  He fought bravely for his country and brothers-in-arms.Sadly Mills was injured by an IED and became a quadruple amputee.  He has accepted the challenge of overcoming his injury and not letting it get the best of him.  He has conquered great obstacles in his rehab and recovery.This is a well-written story that conveys the real person who is driven and determined to win while also maintaining an indefatigable sense of humor and compassion for others.  I believe that this book illustrates what is the best and worst of humanity.  Mills opens his heart and life to readers without an malice, resentment or despair.  Readers can develop their own opinion of the absolute evil we are fighting in groups like the Taliban.  Likewise, readers can discern that our current politicians have sent our best and brightest to fight with their hands tied behind their back.During Mills' third deployment when he was injured, he and his troops were ordered not to attack Taliban forces as they planted IED's in our troops' path.  Our forces, we learn, could not fire upon enemy combatants unless first fired upon.  This means they had to sit and watch Taliban plant IED's or drive to places of ambushes without doing anything about it.  Undoubtedly, this has led to many soldiers being injured.  Mills, however, has a great attitude through it all.  His story conveys how bravely are soldiers are fighting for their country.Readers cannot help but be proud and inspired by his accomplishments post-injury.  You will also be amazed and inspired by the many who have come along side him to help.  Amazing medics and hospital staff, therapists, family, friends and charitable groups and individuals have contributed in incredible ways to Mills' recovery.  His wife and family have come through as heroes, too.This is a great country, and Travis Mills continues to be one or our best and brightest.

These are good, quality gloves for warmth and work.  They are priced reasonably, and I think they are a good buy.  They are very comfortable.  The tight fit will enable handy work, and the tight wrist sleeve assures warmth and them staying on well.  The texture inside and out is soft.  If they is any weakness, it will reveal itself in the long-term durability.  I don't expect that to be a problem.

These Bluetooth headphones work well and are very comfortable.  At the price, these are excellent options for Bluetooth headphones.  They connect quickly and easily and sound good.  The sound quality on movies, etc. is great.  On music, the quality is not as precise as more expensive headphones; however, it is still satisfying even at a high volume.  The controls are simple -- nothing too fancy with these.  They do not have noise cancellation but they do a good job.  The cushions and adjustable size make them fit nicely.  They fold in for travel.  I have used several Bluetooth headphones for music and movies.  To get a better set, I think you will have to pay twice this much.  They come with a connection cord so that you can use them with non-Bluetooth devices.I received this product at a discount or no cost in exchange for an honest review.

Killing Trail offers an entertaining but not thrilling mystery.  The main character is Mattie, a police officer in charge of a K-9 police dog named Robo.  The author takes full advantage of the interesting element of Robo.  The police dog is as much the protagonist of the story as is her handler Mattie.  Together they solve the crime and catch the bad guys and prove themselves to be valuable members of the small town's police force.The story moves along through the mystery of solving a murder and catching some drug runners.  Although it is not a page turner, it is a decent story.  Readers will appreciate the first time effort by the author as well as her potential to build an enjoyable series based on Mattie and Robo.

Woman in Gold is a gripping, stirring moving about justice and restitution.  The narrative follows the present and the past as they relate to the return of a painting to its rightful heir for whom it has a personal meaning.  The attorney, first in it for the money, becomes obsessed with justice being done.  As his heart is stirred, he hopes that he can stir a nation to restoration.  I heartedly recommend this movie.  It can be watched by the whole family.Throughout the movie, I was tempted to google the story and find out how it ends.  I didn't and enjoyed the suspense.  If you don't know how the story ends, I encourage you to avoid spoiling it by googling it.

These 100% polyester slacks are thin and have little room for error.  If your body type does not match them perfectly, they will not fit or look good. Basically, if you have the body type and shape as the model in the picture, these pants will work well -- but what pants wouldn't.  However, if you are a bit out of proportion either from overweight or from an athletic build, I don't think these will work.  Even though, I tried my regular size, these were not even close to fitting.The fabric is lightweight, so if they fit they would be good summer casual pants.

The Rev. Dr. De Arteaga has provided a tremendous resource to Christians through the research, devotion and faithfulness displayed in this book.  He uses the life and ministry of Agnes Sanford to anchor a book on the history of the ministry of healing, deliverance and spiritual gifts through the history of Christianity.  As he asserts, one cannot read the New Testament without making the obvious conclusion that the ministry of healing and deliverance are central to the gospel proclamation of Jesus and the church.  De Arteaga strives to restore this ministry to the central role it should have in theology, Biblical interpretation, worship and Christian mission.Beginning with the early church, the author follows the ebbs and flows of spiritual gifts to the present time.  He highlights a resurgence of the healing ministry that grew out of what he terms the "Marcion Shove" of the New Thought movement of the last century.  This culminates in Agnes Sanford's ministry that contributed to the Charismatic Renewal of the 60's and 70's among mainstream church in America.  In examining Sanford's ministry, the book reveals the patterns of the healing and deliverance ministries -- the challenges and the sacrifices involved along with rewards and fruitfulness.The writing displays the author's in-depth study of the topic and his vast research in the areas addressed.  In addition to much reading, first hand and second hand accounts contribute heavily to the picture painted of Sanford's life and ministry.  The ministry of the Holy Spirit through the manifestation of spiritual gifts has clearly been a vocational calling and passion of the author.  He has presented the wide and substantive scope of the topic in this book.  De Arteaga acknowledges the opposition and arguments against the charismatic ministries.  He addresses the belief and practice of cessationism head-on, and I think shines a light on the fatal flaws in it.  He discusses the objections or distortions that serve to quench the Spirit and undermine effective ministry.Technically, the book is well written and organized with myriad references and supportive materials.  I believe this book will certainly compel the reader to pursue a fruitful ministry empowered by the Holy Spirit's gifts.  Through the reading of the book, readers will learn how to pray for healing and some of the techniques that Agnes Sanford and others developed to facilitate healing prayers.

These are comfortable, padded and lightweight cycling gloves.  They seem durable and provide a good grip.  The size is smaller than expected.  On other gloves, a large fits me nicely; however, with these gloves, the XL is actually a snug fit.

It's a cute and fun Mr. Potato Head.  Anyone who has an affinity for Mr. Potato Head's needs this one in their collection.  Of course, with the new Star Wars movie, this is a sure win for kids of any age.  The cape is the only piece that is problematic because it fits into the opening of the storage compartment which comes off if the cape is pushed too hard.  Otherwise, this is a creative, fun toy.

I have been using this snorkeling set for swimming laps in the pool.  It works well and was easy to set up and use.  The goggles don't leak and fit comfortably. The strap is easy to adjust.  The snorkel also works well and compares well to other snorkels I have used.  If I go under the water, it prevents water from leaking into it.  The wide mask would also provide good viewing for actual snorkeling in the ocean.I received this set at no cost in exchange for an honest review.

I am merely a recreational swimmer who swims laps about once a week, but still, nothing can be more frustrating than goggles that leak or are uncomfortable.  These swim goggles worked splendidly as I swam for half an hour--no leaks and no discomfort.  I did not even have to adjust the goggles at all from the way they came to me.  They do come with optional nose connectors for different size faces, and the strap is easy to adjust.

This novel is a decent "paperback" novel that provides some entertaining suspense.  There is nothing deep or complex here; it is a story geared toward readers who want a stimulating tale without much investment required.  The plot follows the search for a young woman by her FBI agent friend and her new male partner.  The plot also involves the search for a serial killer that may also be involved in the death of a US Congressman.  The FBI agents work for a special unit whose agents possess special abilities to see or hear ghosts and who use special intuitive powers to solve cases.The murders of a few young women are grisly but the author does not get too graphic on the events or the aftermath.  The violence is juxtaposed with the romance that buds between the two agents -- who of course are both beautiful and sexy.  The novel borders on being a sci-fi/fantasy/romance but never quite crosses the line fully from being semi-realistic.It does provide entertainment but is ultimately unsatisfying due to the superficiality of the writing, plot and characters.  As one reviewer commented, it is an okay "beach read."

I have tried a few foam-free shaving creams or shaving butters that cost more than off-the-shelf traditional foams or gels; like the others, this cream provides a smooth, comfortable shave.  However, the benefits of it over a $3 shaving gel are not apparent enough for me to continue with it or the others I have tried.  The cream is on my face so briefly that I cannot imagine the natural ingredients contributing to the health of my skin.  The quality of the shave really seems no better than with the Gillette gel I was using.The bottomline is that this is a good shaving cream with natural, Dead Sea ingredients that sound healthy and feel enriching.  For me, the benefit does not justify the cost difference between it and other "cheap" gels.

This is a very good Vitamin C serum.  It goes on easily and is quickly absorbed after being spread across face and neck.  The dropper makes it easy to apply.  The ingredients seems beneficial; although, I'm still not completely sold on the long-term benefits of Vitamin C.I received this product at a discount or at no cost in exchange for an honest review.

This electric, battery-powered razor does a decent job on a one-day beard (or less).  For me, it is not adequate enough to do the job on more than a one-day beard.  It is also helpful for an afternoon or evening touch up.  Even on the one-day beard, it caused some irritation.  I could imagine using this as a back-up or a one-day travel razor.  As a back up, it has the problem of relying on batteries.  As the batteries decline in strength, so does the razor until it is out of power completely.  There is no warning of battery drain.  A rechargeable product would be a better option in my opinion.

Seifrid’s commentary on Second Corinthians fulfills the aims of the PNTC series to “make clear the text of Scripture” for “serious pastors and teachers of the Bible.”  This commentary demonstrates thorough and objective scholarship.  Seifrid fully exposits the text while presenting a deeply devotional reading of the letter.  Rarely does a Biblical Commentary satisfy academic inquests and inspire faithful, deeply reflective meditation on Scripture.  By practicing robust exegesis true to proper biblical theology, the author has produced a valuable commentary for any earnest students of Scripture.The commentary approaches Scripture as God’s word and this letter as written by Paul, as he was inspired by the Holy Spirit.  Seifrid addresses critical objections to both of these assertions including the various fragmental theories of the letter’s authorship.  This book serves as a welcome challenge to critical approaches that differ.This commentary has a rightful place in seminary libraries and pastors’ studies; however, it is not the type of commentary that facilitates a quick reference of a verse here or there.  Seifrid counts on readers investing time to read through the text of this book.  He writes the commentary verse-by-verse in paragraph style.  He sometimes spends several pages on a particular verse. Readers will find it worthwhile to read this book from beginning to end. Readers will gain insight into all of the topics relevant to a clearer understanding of the letter; likewise, readers will obtain a better grasp of the Christian faith.  I think the following statement shines a light on the author’s approach to his work.  He elaborates on Paul’s understanding of the good work of intercessory prayer.  Seifrid writes, “Our labors and prayers are nothing more than a participation in God’s work in the world, which remains God’s work and not our own.”

The Bomb Maker's Son involves a courtroom drama that brings together an attorney and his long-lost father.  The father was a notorious member of a 60's radical group that used bombs to vandalize buildings and eventually killed people.  40 years after being in hiding the father, Ian Holzner, turns himself in and wants his son to defend him.The bulk of the book consists of the son trying to learn from his father the truth about what happened.  There is some mystery involved in discovering the truth about the event.  The book is well written; however, the mystery and the development of all things only goes so deep.  Several of the characters are simply crazy and practically farcical.  It was still an entertaining book.

This is good coffee...wholesome, robust, and I would say medium strength.  It makes me think of good diner coffee that you could drink cup after cup.  I think this is a safe choice for simple and satisfying coffee.

McGoey goes into significant detail to demonstrate the ins and outs of large foundations and their positive and negative effects.  While concentrating often on the Gates Foundation, she explores the history of foundations and how they have evolved to be influential players in many areas of domestic and international aid, politics, business and stature.  Throughout the book, the author seems to be seeking the answer to the question of whether foundations mostly benefit the poor or the providers and their own agendas and stature.  The answers seem to create a mixed bag of results and perceptions.  There are no doubts that those behind the large foundations wield considerable power and influence that can be used for good and bad, altruistic and self-serving purposes.McGoey really zeroes in on some particular areas of aid such as health provisions and agricultural help internationally to see the intricacies of how the lines between altruism and self-serving promotion are not so easily determined.  She also explores the backgrounds of how some of the larger foundations came to exist -- for example through less than ethical business practices.  The book paints a picture of the enormous wealth of the wealthiest 1% and how foundations serve their own purposes.  Again, the focus is largely on Bill Gates and his story of amassing a fortune and giving away a lesser but significant fortune.In the end, readers will have a better understanding of the role foundations play and will be able to make a more educated analysis of how they fit into our economy and social system.  I think what we learn is what the author quotes from one of the opportunists she discusses, "Generosity can be very profitable."  The book highlights how the wealthy use foundations to protect huge slush funds of wealth to be used beneficially according to their definition of beneficial.

Swim goggles can be a constant source of frustration for me if they leak at all, so I am leery of trying different designs and manufacturers. I have mostly setting on using snorkeling goggles and a snorkel rather than these types of goggles. I received a pair of these as a sample to review and am very impressed by them. The adjustable and break-away strap is super -- very easy to size and then to remove and put on. Best of all, these do not leak!! No water in the eyes at all. They fit comfortably; it took no more than ten seconds to adjust them, and they didn't need another touch while swimming laps. With the easily adjustable strap, these would be good for kids, too. The non-glare, reflective lenses would make them a good for outdoor pools.

Steve Topak writes with verve and doesn’t hold punches as he shares the gleanings of his experience in corporate environments.  Topak seems to have packed about 100 years of experience into his 30 year career.  His book is resourceful and effective in providing leadership guidance.  I think it would be useful to readers at all stages of their careers but especially to those starting out and hoping to climb the ladder or initiate a business.Topak offers real-world, off-the-streets writing on leadership that at times encompasses all things vocational and relational.  The book comes in at about 280 pages.  I kept waiting to get to the part of the book where Topak would become redundant and superfluous so that I could start skimming to the end.  That point never came.  He keeps offering insightful and challenging writing throughout the book.  Some readers may find the book too broad and wish it was more focused and precise.The author sets the tone right out of the gate in the introduction.  Topak writes, “You can’t fix a problem until you identify it.  And the only way any of you are going to become the innovators and business leaders of a new generation is fi someone has the guts to tell you the truth, get you off the Kool-Aid you’ve been drinking, and set you on the right path.”Topak works through the rest of the book to make that happen.  I actually used the above quote in a recent sermon (I am an Anglican priest), because it made me stop and wonder, “What Kool-Aid am I drinking from someone else or from myself?” and “What truth do I need to hear?” Before continuing the sermon, by the way, I had to explain to half the congregation the meaning behind the phrase “drinking the Kool-Aid.”  Google “Jim Jones and Jonestown” if you are unfamiliar with its origins.Topak is invested in shining a light on many of the myths we are buying into regarding leadership and developing our careers and productivity.  In this day and age, “when everyone is a focus group of one” we buy into our own narcissism and especially to the hoopla of personal branding, social media and projecting an image.  Topak contrasts these with actually forming ourselves into leaders through hard work and experience, innovation, study and developing something to offer to others rather than creating an image or brand so that it looks like we are valuable.  Here is something Topak writes that many of us probably need to hear, “The vast majority of what you do online is not only a complete waste of time, but it’s also keeping you from doing what really matters—what will enable you to someday become a successful entrepreneur and business leader.”Throughout the book, Topak references case studies of businesses and leaders for good and bad.  He shows that not only does he have significance experience but also is well researched and studied in terms of the business world.  His career involved the technology field, and many of his examples but not all come from that arena.  These are interesting and insightful.  Readers learn a good bit about many of the “celebrity” CEO’s in today’s business world.  He uses many of these examples to demonstrate what it really means to be a leader and entrepreneur.From his own career, Topak discusses successes and failures, risks that worked out and decisions and were wrong.  He provides good guidance about how to handle the ups and downs.

My son and I have completed a few Halo projects as well as several large Lego projects.  This is a great concept and can make a playful model for young boys; however, there is nothing worse than difficult instructions and illustrations, 600 pieces all jumbled together, missing pieces and pieces left over.  That is what we discovered with this tank project.  When it came to the last few pages, pieces were missing.  Fortunately, we have a trove of Lego pieces to dig through to find what we needed.  Then, as you can see by one of the pictures below, a handful of pieces are left over.We went through the instructions methodically and then back again when it didn't come together at the end.  The cannon piece that fits on top of the tank body was really frustrating.  The illustrations are difficult to determine exactly where pieces go, and in this case exact placement is vital.  Either I read it wrong a dozen times or the design instructions are faulty because based on instructions, it didn't quite fit.  I had to move things around to make it work.When it comes to a project like this, as you probably know, a few wrong instructions, a missing piece here and there (or a broken wheel axle and no extra like we had happen) can derail the fun of the project.  Finally, the 600 pieces come in about 8 bags with no rhyme or reason to their packaging.  I saw no option except dumping them all on the table and digging through them for each section.  How much more trouble would it be for the manufacturer to group pieces together by section.  It would be so much more helpful to users to work with one group of pieces at a time, and then they wouldn't be spread all over the table which my wife loved.I would call this a missed opportunity by Halo.  We still have a working tank that my son is enjoying, and we learned the lessons of overcoming challenges.  Unfortunately, the pieces are not very secure and easily fall apart when the tank is played with.  The gun barrel is especially loose.  I ended up super gluing the pieces of it together.

While providing some helpful historical contexts to the first century, Armstrong approaches the Apostle Paul's life with much skepticism and subjectivity.  She clearly esteems the intellectualism and "scholarship" of the last century over and against the traditions and beliefs that faithful Christians have held for 2,000 years.  She asserts as facts what are unsubstantiated criticisms against church traditions regarding Scripture and Paul's life.  Readers should be aware that her primary reference for the life of Jesus and the interpretation of the gospels is the unorthodox and critic John Dominic Crossan.  He is a modern critic of Scripture who rejects any supernatural element of the Christian story including the resurrection of Jesus.  Armstrong shares his assertion that the gospels and the book of Acts are nothing more than creative fiction that use some real characters to develop a false narrative.  Likewise, she holds that several of the epistles credited to Paul are fraudulent early 2nd century innovations.  In stating her unorthodox approaches, she asserts them as facts shared by "scholars."  Yet, these claims are unsubstantiated except by modern source criticism and speculation.  Many scholars hold to the traditional beliefs that were prevalent since the time of Christ.Therefore, her view of Paul is skewed by skepticism and cynicism.  She makes many suggestions about his life, thoughts and practices based on her own presuppositions that reject any thought that the Scripture and Christian beliefs might be true.  The Holy Spirit doesn't exist in Armstrong's treatment of Paul.  His mindset and teachings are based on sects, conflicts, control and general religious experiences that he imagined or developed along with the other folks in the Jesus movement who conspired to create this whole thing we call Christianity.While rejecting the very real influence of the Holy Spirit, Armstrong's explanations of the "Jesus movement's" success are simply vacuous. The complexities of this alternative view proposed by Armstrong undermine the substance of it reasonableness.  Her attempts to hang its verity on modern scholarship hold no merit.  As one Biblical scholar writes, the view shared by Armstrong "rests precariously on a web of unproved assumptions that are rarely acknowledged."  For her, anything other than the Christian teaching is believed as an unambiguous fact.  The book is full of contradictions.  For example, on one hand, she asserts that Jesus' message was "politically explosive;" while, on the next page she states that there was "nothing novel" about Jesus' teaching.Armstrong rejects the traditional views on Paul's authorship of several letters of the New Testament.  She states as a fact that scholars have concluded that only 7 of the 13 letters attributed to Paul actually are his writings.  It would have been honest to qualify what scholars and their presuppositions and to state that very many scholars disagree with her.  Then she creates a fictional account of later writers who penned letters in Paul's name to "rein Paul in and make his radical teachings more acceptable."  This is entirely arrogant speculation in contrast to what the early church taught and passed on.Similarly, she makes the statement that the second letter to the Corinthians "in fact" consists in five separate fragments from Paul and one insertion by an anonymous writer.  She presents this as irrefutable; however, this is not an accepted fact among Biblical scholars, as she asserts.  Mark Seigrid, in his recently publish commentary on Second Corinthians writes, "The notion that a letter that was instrumental in cementing the bond between the church and the apostles would be subject to a scissors-and-past operation, even at a later time, is difficult to imagine.  The burden of proof surely lies upon any theory of a composite letter."  Of course, there is no proof besides skeptically informed source criticism of the 20th century.  Her assumption that the early church was deceived by a pseudo-anonymous author of the pastoral letters to include them in the canon of Scripture is similarly unsubstantiated by anything but presumptuous source criticism biased against plain, apparent authorship as indicated by the letters.  So, her entire vision of Paul is skewed by a truncated collection of his writings and an arrogant rejection of Acts as reliable history which leaves her to fill in the gaps with imaginative historical fiction and presumptions.Armstrong discounts the main thrust of Christian teachings on various topics.  She relates Paul's concept of sin to "instinctual reptilian drives" in our brains rather than the depravity that humans possess as a result of a fall or sinful nature.  The fall and the redemptive-salvation history conveyed in Scripture comes under her category of "legendary material."  Much of the historical events of Paul's life discussed in the book are qualified with phrases like "this may or may not be true."  Of course, in her mind such a phrase must describe everything Paul tells us about Jesus, because Paul is responsible for the "gradually altered" figure of Jesus as compared to the real, "historical Jesus" who "never really interested [Paul] in the first place according to Armstrong.  This demonstrates Armstrong's fallacy of knowing the mind of Paul better than others over the last 2,000 years.Armstrong's high esteem for her own view inspires her to correct Luther and other figures of the Reformation.  According to her, Luther et al misinterpreted Paul's writings in Romans and Galatians on "justification by faith."  Paul was rather developing a Jesus cult in contrast to the cult of the emperor.  Armstrong also incorrectly insists on correcting sacramentalists like Roman Catholics on the proper interpretation of Paul's writings on the Eucharist in 1 Corinthians 11.  It would seem she is only imitating what she accuses Luke of doing in his book of Acts in which she claims he consistently put his own imaginative words in Paul's mouth to convey what he thought Paul should have said.  This is the reason why she literally warns readers that "Acts must be approached with caution."Perhaps the most confusing claim by the author is her conclusion that "Paul's radicalism was utopian."  What?  The Apostle Paul "utopian?" There is nothing ideal about his teachings or vision or practices.  Even his vision of heaven is weighted by his mourning that his brother and sister Jews might be lost due to rejection of the Messiah Jesus.  He, more than anyone except Christ, has a clear view of the evil and suffering associated with life in this world.  Nobody who emphasizes "Christ crucified" as Paul does has any utopian delusion.I recommend reading a recently published book by someone who actually believes in the Christian faith and history as it has been handed down.  Adam Hamilton's The Call: The Life and Message of the Apostle Paulis an excellent faithful look at Paul's life.
