The story is lush, evocative, erotic, vibrantly engaging, utterly compelling and emotionally charged. Apryl Summers does a wonderful job of setting the stage for what promises to be a truly erotic and captivating series as Cindy in the guide of Kelly West dives into a seedy and decadent world of lust, eroticism, danger, drama and revenge. The writing is wonderfully vivid with a great deal of imagery and tension (from sexual to suspenseful), weaving a story that manages to make you eagerly flip from page to page as Cindy becomes immersed into a completely different world than the innocent life she had lived before. Overall, this left me eager to read more in the series and see where Cindy (Kelly's) dangerous and erotically charged adventure heads next.

I recently decided to try the fast metabolism diet after a friend recommended it and the "Fast Metabolism Diet Cookbook" came to my attention when I went looking for resources to help me succeed on the diet. What I liked about the recipe book is that even though it is perfect for anyone on the Fast Metabolism Diet by Haylie Pomroy, it was created to help anyone with a goal of getting healthy, losing weight and ramping up their metabolism by offering wholesome, tasty and healthy meals. It's packed full of information and easy to create recipes that are just as delicious as any fat laden meal... they just feed your body's metabolism in an exceptional way. Overall, this turned out to be a wonderful cookbook that gave me 80 new recipes to try out while I lose weight in a healthy way.

"Flying Elephants and Other Stories" is the fifth book in the "Illustrated Moral Stories for Children Series" that I have bought and each one comes as a perfect addition to childrens picture books for Kindle for my kids. Each one of the stories is built on folklore myths and legends using modern day retelling and fun writing to teach children about morals, life, friendship, courage, education and so much more. D. R. Tara has a way of making each story fun and bouncy with a great message to relay to kids. This is perfect to go in the kids books by age 5-8 category, keeping elementary school children sucked into the kids short stories from start to finish with vibrant illustrations and well-written tales. Overall, a great addition to the series that entertained both my kids and I.

Every month I look forward to another novel release in the Single Heart series and this month is no exception. "April and the Single Heart" draws readers back into the series as Vi Zetterwall takes us on an adventure of self-discovery, romance, emotionally charged heartbreak and pain, and the promise of the kind of love that April McKenzie has always dreamed of but never found. The story is engaging with a smooth tone filled with sensuality and romance, vivid imagery and a main character that is wonderfully flawed and real.April's journey is the kind that feels authentic and compelling, bringing her from a troubled home when she was young to an adult life that isn't all it's cracked up to be, but when has a chance meeting with a man that changes everything and leaves her with a yearning for something more. I had such a good time reading this, finding myself grinning and laughing at the sassy tone and the captivating romance all the way through to the satisfying ending. As usual, it left me eager to read more in the series or just more from Vi Zetterwall.

What I liked about "The Stubbs" is that it is an erotic novella with all the juicy romance, but crafts a uniquely nostalgic story that explores life in the 80's for a girl just looking for adventure, romance and a better life. DS Love has a talent for writing that is clear from the beginning, sucking the reader into the story and weaving it into a tightly wound tale that sparks the imagination, ignites the senses and leaves you lingering on the old days with a faint grin on your face. The writing is lush, evocative, sensual, engaging and fast-paced.Overall, I have a wonderful time reading this, it was well worth the read.

"Predatory Kill" is the type of novel that mixes together action and suspenseful thrills with engaging drama and emotionally charged characters for a truly entertaining read. Kenneth Eade does a wonderful job of weaving the story together to form a tale that engages your mind and your senses... taking you on a journey of corruption, murder, danger, big business, courtroom drama and the essential human elements that bind the story together in intricate ways. The writing is refreshingly engaging, vivid in imagery, features authentic characters that draw you into their story and a thrilling plot that takes you eagerly all the way to the satisfying end.What I liked about the novel is that it feels current and all too real, big business and big banks in control and ruthlessly doing everything to make a little bit more money.. so it's exciting to read a legal thriller novel like this that explores the realities of "predatory" businesses like this one. Overall, this was an entertaining and action-packed novel that was well worth the read.

A while back I found out about the health benefits of turmeric and wanted to incorporate it into my cooking, but since then I have struggled to find ways to do it with everyday cooking... so a book like "50 Lip-Smacking Turmeric Recipes" really helps to help me add turmeric to everything from drinks to desserts. Donna Stevens skillfully delves into the mysteries of turmeric and explores the health benefits, the uses in various foods and then provides 50 healthy and delicious turmeric recipes that are easy to cook. The book has all the makings of a great addition to my cooking/health rolodex, so I'll definitely be using it to easily incorporate more turmeric into my life.Overall, it was well worth the purchase and added 50 tasty recipes for me to eagerly try out.

I have to say that "Last Name Unknown" charmed me from the very beginning with its quirky writing style and equally quirky (but lovable) main character. The writing is fresh, bouncy, suspenseful and enjoyable... keeping you laughing and entertained as Addison finds herself on the run and constantly ducking for cover after she meets Kade and the bullets start flying. Danielle Real has a definite gift for writing that is clear, she manages to weave an engaging tale from start to finish that has all the elements of a fantastic story from action to romance, authentic characters and a satisfying plot. Addison is one of those characters that you just can't help but love and want to know more about as she unravels her latest mishap and the danger it poses. Overall, this was a fun and entertaining read that had me laughing and grinning from ear to ear... it was well worth the read.

I've recently decided to try my hand at dried/dehydrate foods, but for the most part I was largely unfamiliar with the process, so "Dehydration and Drying for Beginners" turned out to be a smart and practical choice for me as I delve into the process. Tara Ford does a wonderful job of keeping the book easy to understand, straightforward and filled with a wealth of information... giving a solid foundation of knowledge so that beginners like me can easily and successfully start preserving food. What I liked about this book was that the author really takes the time to explain the intricacies of dehydration and drying, exploring everything from the type of food to dry to the end result and "shelf life", etc. It's well-written with a great deal of tips, techniques and advice on bettering you results and on truly understanding the actual process. Overall, this was well worth the read and has me eager to get started on preserving my food in a natural and more cost effective/space-saving way.

I have to say that when I started Mated and Blooded 1 I was just simply looking for an erotica story to live vicariously through for a while, but what I actually got was this uniquely erotic and yet intricately written novel. The story is credibly erotic with vibrantly crafted characters that are multi-layered, a novel plot that just has so much going for it and an author who managed to capture my attention from the very first page.At heart this is an erotic romance, but don't let that fool you into thinking its just all sex, this is a well-crafted story that engages your mind and your senses with erotica, aliens with a captivating culture, emotionally charged drama, compelling mating rituals and love in all its complexities. Ms. Luag has a unique mind that brings this story to life in odd, captivating and engaging ways that shouldn't be missed. I'll definitely be on the lookout for the next book in this erotica romance series as it was well worth the read.

"Wake Up & Lose Weight" is a smart and practical book that puts you in the driver's seat of your weightloss efforts and provides you with a wealth of advice, tips and strategies that actually have value in a busy life. What I liked about it was that Julie Draper doesn't pander to the masses or the traditional weight loss regimens, rather she forged ahead with experience and knowledge found from actually trying to lose weight with a hectic life, a struggling determination and a mass produced idea of what works for everybody. Ms. Draper insightfully explores weight loss for women in a way that give you the tools, knowledge and finely-honed practices that actually work for losing weight.This isn't a book that is geared towards people looking for an easy "diet free" weightloss programs... instead it's a book that giving you inspiration, motivation and experience in understanding your body and your life in regards to weightloss. Overall, this was a smart, insightful and practical guide to weight loss that helped me figure out just how I can lose weight when life and responsibilities hamper a more "traditional" wegithloss routine.

What I liked about Find Money Every Day is that the author puts you at ease and makes you laugh while talking about a stressful and oftentimes complicated issue like managing money and finances. The guide has sharp, funny, straightforward and clearly informed content that provides you with the tools and the know-how to save money and create a mindset that makes it possible to improve your financial outlook one day at a time.Merl Miller easily and enjoyably outlines the many avenues that you can utilize to mange your money and make it work for you, finding money every day that was bogged down by misuse, outdated concepts and a mindset that your money is always going to be a source of pain instead of a resource to help you buy/achieve the things you need and want. From money management to smarter financial windows that you can lock onto, this is a book that is well worth the read if you want to understand and use your money in a more advantageous way.

What I liked about "Reflections: Prayers from the Heart of a 14 - Year Old Boy" is that it offers an honest, poignant and engaging look at growing up in a modern world where God and morality often collide harshly with what is considered "cool" or acceptable behavior. Michael Alexander Beas writes with an insightful and thoughtful voice, delving into teenage issues that we all faced as we find ourselves growing up and having to make the choice about who we are and the way in which we want to live our lives. It really is a great book that allows both teenagers and parents to get a solid grounding stone on God in a way that helps to suss through the daily mire of temptations and bringing out a moral and godly way of sticking to what you believe in and what you know to be right.The book is well-written with a down-to-earth writing style and a smooth pace, allowing you to really gain a wealth of knowledge, insights, wisdom and just a simple sounding board on the problems everyone faces in a world where God has taken a backseat. Overall, Mr. Beas did a wonderful job of keeping this book engaging and thought-provoking, creating an illuminating book that offers you the ability to grow and change in a godly way.

"Constricted (Beyond the Brothel Walls)" is a novel that really manages to sneak up on you and take you on a intense and gripping journey. Rae Ryans adds layer upon layer to the story, smoothly crafting a vivid tale of demons, sexual slavery, revenge, anger, violence, lust and intrigue that engages the reader from start to finish. The author has a way with words that transports you to a world that seems familiar but wholly different at the same time, mixing in emotionally charged relationships and dramatic far reaching plots that bring this story to life in intricate ways. Overall, I have to say that this novel was a promising start to the Beyond the Brothel Walls series and left me eager to see where the series leads as Korrigan and Petre embark on a journey to bring their enemies to their knees.

I have to say that "The Millionaire Door Prize" is one of those erotic romance novels that perfectly balances plot with erotica to create a stimulating and thoroughly entertaining story. Emorej Luag vividly draws readers into the growing elicit romance between Alyssa and Xander as the two begin and erotic dance of love, lust, troubled pasts and a desire to finally make a connection with another person that truly means something. The story is rife with sexual tension, engaging the senses with vivid imagery and a clear chemistry between the two that sizzles as Xander does everything in his power to win Alyssa over. The writing is lush, engaging, authentic and sensual... making for a wonderfully evocative story. Overall, this was such a pleasure to read and is certainly something I would recommend to others. It left me eager for more from the author when I reached the satisfying conclusion.

Sam's Story: Book Two draws readers back into Sam's life as the once troubled and poor girl has journey from the small town she grew up in to a modern woman with a promising life and dreams of going further, reaching for more. This journey takes its ups and downs as Sam's life progresses, spanning years she she finds love, family, fulfillment and more along the way. Amy D. Crusan-Kramer skillfully creates a link between the reader and Sam, crafting an authentic character that evokes emotion and interest in who she is and where she is going. The writing is lush, engrossing, thoughtful and striking in its vibrancy... creating a complex story that always has a new layer to add to the ever-evolving story of Sam's life. I had a great time reading this sequel and just falling in love with the character all over again in new ways. Ms. Crusan-Kramer certainly impressed me with her talent for writing and her passion for telling a good story.

What I like about Marie F Crow's "The Risen" series is that it's not just your garden variety zombie horror series with gore, terror and not much else... rather it is a sweeping and deeply emotionally charged story that is set amid a world of the dead and the challenges  that Helena Hawthorn faces as she tries to keep her family safe from the dead that have risen. Each one of the books is well-written with a building story, weaving a larger tale about family, love, survival, strength, death, danger and the price to be paid in a world were zombies creep around every corner you find.Ms. Crow has a talent for writing that is deeply evocative, vibrant in imagery, uses strong dialogue to push the story along and capitalizes on authentic characters that add layer after layer to each of the novels. The series is creepy, chilling, eerie and terror inducing... making for a truly entertaining read that balances perfectly to the human elements of a good drama. By the time I had finished the fourth book "Courage" I was utterly captivated by the series and eager to see what else can spring forth from the author's imaginative mind. Overall, this was a fantastic compilation series that engaged me from start to finish and has me eager for more.

"The Dad Who Left Me" is one of those books that mixes thoughtful and insightful commentary with words of wisdom and healing from God together wonderfully. Using a introspective approach and utilizing the words of the Bible to draw strength from, Cary Holbert allows readers to help heal from the raw wounds of having a loved one betray or leave you. The books is exceptionally insightful with a down-to-earth approach and a clear aim of helping to lean on God's love and understanding when the pain of their leaving feels as if it will never heal.The book is well-written with a smooth tone, a solid grasp of scripture and wealth of wisdom that can feel like healing balm on a person's wounded heart. Mr. Holbert has a gift for writing that feel warm, inviting and comfortable... one that aids in drawing you in and feeling settled enough to actually take his words and insights to heart. Overall, I found "The Dad Who Left Me" to be well worth the read and it is something I would certainly recommend to those who are looking for help and healing through God in a time of need.

I have to admit that when I first was introduced to this book I wasn't sure if it was the right kind of book for me or not, but I decided to give it a try and all I can say is that this was an eventful, intriguingly well-written book. Shoshaku Jushaku sucks the reader into "The Cheese Stealer's Handbook" with a vivid writing style that it equal parts poignant and honest while being entertainingly imaginative and exciting. The story is captivating in the way that you never really know what the next page is going to bring, from a brutally honest glimpse into a man's trouble relationships to laugh-out-loud moments of brevity that just has you grinning from ear to ear. This is a unusual novel that captures the unique voice of the author, creating a memorable and truly compelling book that had me eagerly reading from start to finish. Overall, it was well worth the read and it is something I would definitely recommend to others readers looking for something unique to sink their teeth into.

Recently this book was recommended to me and I have to say that it provided a very in depth and exploratory look at the book of 1 Peter and God's Word within it. Cary Holbert offers readers a chance to dive into the mysteries, concepts, meaning and devotional aspects of the first book of Peter, allowing for a closer walk with God and a deeper understanding of His Word and verse. The author has a lot of insight, thought-provoking commentary and passion that comes across very clear throughout the book. It proved to be a wonderful addition to my daily devotional readings of 1 Peter by not only adding a second voice to exploration of this book of the Bible, but allowed me to truly get a grasp of areas that might have stumped me on my own.What I liked about The Servant Series' exploration of 1 Peter is that it is down-to-earth, inviting and easy to understand. It's not overly complicated or steeped in wording that feels stiff or complicated... rather it allows you to feel comfortable and ready to delve into the mysteries of 1 Peter and get a closer walk with God by understanding his Word through the writings of the Apostle Peter.Mr. Holbert skillfully approach each part of the book with a great deal of forethought, experience and vivid imagery... making for an intriguing read from start to finish. The well-written book is smart, fast-paced and smooth in tone; overall a perfect addition to my daily devotional, one that I would recommend to others easily.

J.P. Brewner brings the world of heroes, villainy, mystery, apocalyptic struggles and paranormal abilities to life in the fast-paced and entertaining novel The Trifecta: Initiation. What I liked about the novel was it's vibrant storytelling, it's intriguing and captivating characters, and the action-packed thrills that kept the story chugging along brilliantly. The story has a fun tone, despite the angst-ridden potential of an apocalyptic setting, that just gets you rooting for Michael Fleming and the Trifecta as they battle criminality and trouble in all forms that is sweeping through the city. This is a fantasy adventure novel that uses well-crafted storytelling, in depth character development and compelling world building to create a memorable start to the series. I'll definitely be reading the next in the series very soon as my anticipation in seeing where this series goes next is high.

From the very start "The Miranda Contract" caught my attention with an intriguing plot, a fast-pace and engaging characters. The novel is well-written with vibrant storytelling, strong dialogue and a plot that keeps you guessing again and again. Ben Langdon has a talent for writing that is clear from the start, sucking you into Dan and Miranda's dangerous adventure as they both get caught up in the web of supervillainy, societal expectations and trying to figure out what they actually want from life. The story has a clear aim to entertain and delight while actually having an insightful underlying concept of growing up and deciding who you want to be. Mr. Langdon skillfully crafts a web of action, mystery, intrigue, danger and human emotion that certainly impressed and made for a very enjoyable read.

"On The Isles of Mozambique" is the kind of novel that sucks you in with evocative storytelling and engaging characters, only to then take you on a thrilling and adventurous ride that balances perfectly with the more dramatic tone of the story. Mila A. Ballentine has created an exciting contemporary adventure mystery that is as fun and it is emotionally charged, making for a truly enjoyable read from start to finish.The novel is well-written with vibrant storytelling, vivid imagery, strong dialogue and a main character that just makes you eager to dive into Samira McAllister's life as she gets swept up into a spellbinding mystery and dangerous turn of events. The story has just the right pace to allow you to truly get immersed in the tale without dragging along, keeping the story fresh, imaginative and entertaining throughout. Overall, Ms. Ballentine has skillfully written a novel that is enjoyable and engaging... a novel that was well worth the read.

I have to admit that when I first was recommended this book I wasn't sure if it was my kind of book, but all too quickly I found myself being swept up in the intriguingly vivid and heartfelt storytelling by Albert Sartison. "Entangled" is a story that draws you into the complicated and aptly entangled life of Aaron, a man who has a past that haunts him, a present that brings contemplation and a future that is still undecided. Mr. Sartison weaves a story that touches your heart and mind, bringing up thought-provoking discussion on everything from life and love to death and despair. This is an imaginative novella that is authentic and real in tone and yet compellingly steeped in mystery and idealism. Overall, an intriguing and inventive story that kept me eagerly reading from start to finish.

I'm the type of person who loves to unravel mysteries, questions and concepts... so whenever I read a book I love to get a corresponding summary and analysis of it too. Book*Sense's summary and analysis of Maybe Someday by Colleen Hoover is insightful, thoughtful, enlightening and revealing. It takes an enjoyable and complex story like Maybe Someday and peels back the layers so that a reader can truly get to the heart of the story and the concepts the author was trying to convey. This is a smart and practical guide that provides an in depth analysis of the story and makes for a wonderfully useful guide when you're like me and just want to understanding the book more. Overall, this was well worth the read and is something I would certainly recommend for those who want to delve into the themes, concepts and layers of Maybe Someday by Colleen Hoover.

Recently I read NYPD Red 2 by James Patterson and Marshall Karp for my book club and as I draw closer to our meeting I wanted to get a more in depth understanding of the book as the ladies in my book club like to really analyze the books. So this handy little NYPD Red 2 summary and analysis turned out to be a perfect accompaniment to our discussion. The summary is succinct yet in depth, has a very analytical tone that allows you to delve into the underlying themes of the novel and provided a deeper enjoyment of the book as you pick up on small things that might have gone unnoticed during a first read-through. Book*Sense skillfully presents this thorough guide with a straightforward and casual writing style that allows you to take away a lot more from NYPD Red 2 than you might have without the summary and analysis. Overall, a great choice for those who want to get to know the novel a little bit more than they had before.

"In the Shadow of Shakespeare" is a spellbinding story that mixes history, mystery, drama, action and romance together to create a wonderfully imaginative novel. Ellen Wilson has a gift for writing that sucks you into the story, weaving a tale that feels both new and classic with a great deal of skill and a lot of passion. The writing is fresh, vivid, engaging, authentic in tone and straddles a fine line between a variety of genres... bringing this story to life in intriguing ways.The story centers around Alice Petrovka as she is pulled into a far reaching plot as past and present begins melding together, starting a chain of events that sends her rocketing to the past where the mystery begins to unfold and danger begins to lurk around every corner. Alice's adventure to the past and her quest in the present to uproot a centuries old mystery is one that I just couldn't help but be captivated by. This is the kind of novel that manages to be intriguing and inventive while entertaining the reader, making for a truly enjoyable and complex story that was well worth the read.

This book was recently recommended to me and at first I was a little hesitant about whether it was my cup of tea or not, but very quickly I found myself swept up in this unusual, intriguing and imaginative tale.  "Crash Gordon and the Revelations from Big Sur" has all the elements needed to make it a truly engaging novel, from an authentic and intriguing cast of characters to a fast-paced plot that makes you eagerly flip from page to page until the very end. It's sharp, evocative, lush and engaging... taking unusual twists and turns as the author weaves a tale of adventure, danger, intrigue, politics, mystery and occult tones. The writing is smooth with vibrant imagery and an ineffable quality to it that just makes you eager for more long after the story is over. Crash is a character that manages to catch you attention and keep it, all the way through his far reaching quest.  Overall, this was an imaginative and exciting story that never disappointed and that has me eager to see what else has sprang forth from the author's creative mind.

I have to say that when I first went looking for hep in not only honing my writing into an actual book and then publishing it I was a bit overwhelmed by all the books, resources and contradicting information. Then a fellow writer recommended "Book Authority: How to Write, Self-Publish & Market Your Book" and I was immediately set on an informative path to creating and self-publishing my own book. Shiv Verma does a wonderful job of keeping the book down-to-earth and straightforward, keeping the information, advice and tips concise and practical from start to finish.This is the kind of guide that provides you with a solid foundation for writing your book and then skillfully guides you through the intricate process of publishing it and then getting the word out about it with successful marketing techniques. I learned a great deal from this guide to the point that I made the final leap and have begun the tireless task of getting my idea for a book to paper so I can turn it into a successful (and profitable) eBook. Overall, this was a great choice for me as a new author and as a self-publisher. I would certainly recommend it to other authors looking to make headway in this tumultuous publishing world.

I ran across this book of recipes while browsing and I have to say that it turned out to be a great way to add a bit of flavor and variety to my cooking. This book is filled with 50 recipes that vary from burgers to BLTs and everything in between, allowing you to get a huge collection of delicious lunch and dinner options to wet your appetite with. The book is well-written and organized in a way that allows you to get the most from each of the recipes and easily find what you are looking for in the large batch of recipes.My favorite recipe that I have tried so far (and I have a lot still left to try) is "The Muffluletta" which combined a bread round that is hallowed out and stuffed full of tasty ingredients like black and green olives, pimientos, carrots, cauliflower and more to create a hearty sandwich that is truly filling and delicious.Overall, this was a yummy batch of recipes that has made for a delicious addition to my cooking and I'd definitely recommend it to those looking for easy, delicious and inventive recipes to try out.

As my children grow older and begin to ask the kind of questions that are oftentimes difficult to answer I decided it was best to help myself and them by gathering resources to make answering those hard to answer questions with a bit more knowledge and insight. "Empowering Kids: Death, Dying, and Suicide" is the kind of resource that every parent should have when talking to their children about the end of life... it's insightful, thoughtful, well-written and has an amazing uplifting message despite the sensitive subject. Lizabeth Jenkins-Dale skillfully explores this subject with a great deal of care and a wonderful amount of experience and insight.She offers parents a wealth of information, tips and advice on approaching this subject so that children will reassured and unafraid of such a tenuous of subject death... rather learning to embrace life when they realize it has an end point. The author approaches the subject in a straightforward, concise and structured way... all the while keeping the writing style warm and inviting, so that you feel comfortable learning the tools you will need to talk to your kids about death, dying and suicide. This is a smart, insightful and well thought-out resource book for parents that definitely helps to empower kids in a successful way.

I have to say that "The Kings Throne: The Elysian Blade of Truth" very quickly swept me up in this well-developed fantasy world where royal intrigue, magic, unrest, revenge and destiny meld together to create a uniquely intriguing fantasy novel. Mealea Mathews does a fantastic job sucking the reader into the story, crafting a plot that manages to be exciting and fast-paced but infinitely compelling and multi-layered. The writing is sharp, evocative, vivid and engaging... making for a truly thrilling dive into this captivating fantasy world.What I liked about this novel is the promising start it provides, layering the plot for a larger series that completely intrigues me and leaves me eager to see where the author takes the King and Queen next in their quest to regain their kingdom and freedom from the evil wizard, Nnelthu Leas. There is a startling amount of layering and world-building in this story that adds compelling sub-plots and unique scenes that just spark with imagination, it's the kind of writing that just brings a story to life in truly intricate ways.Overall, this was a fun and entertaining read that left me eager for more and has me interested in seeing what else springs forth from the mind of Mealea Mathews. I would definitely recommend the novel to other readers looking for a fantastical fantasy novel and will be eagerly awaiting the next novel in the series.

Charlotte Grace is a woman’s mind like no other. The feelings we often have, she lives with on the outside. Struggling after the death of a loved one, she is forced to try and find her way in a new life. As these men, Olivier and Wesley, among others enter into her world, she sees the fire in their eyes, literally. This book had me guessing and thinking, and I felt challenged to solve not only the mystery of these men, but the mystery in Charlotte’s head. I enjoyed the challenge and payoff. Great ending. FYI. Do not read it first or it will spoil the rest of the story.

"The Risen: Dawning (Anniversary Edition)" is a fantastic start to the series with all the making of a successful novel, from a sharp and creepy writing style to an emotional drama set in the heart of a world overrun with the dead. Marie F Crow has a talent for writing that just sucks you into the novel and sends chills down your spine and tears to your eyes in equal measure. This is a story about survival, death, destruction, family and love that manages to tell an intriguing tale while scaring the life out of you and making you thankful to be reading it instead of living it. From start to finish this is a story that left me eager for more in The Risen series and eager to see what else springs forth from the mind of such a talented author like Marie F Crow.

"Wild About You: The Strange Life of Emily Hunter" is the type of novel that beautifully blends together a number of book genres from romance to paranormal, action, emotional drama and more. It's well-written with a sharp and imaginative writing style that just sweeps you up in Emily Hunter's life as she and her husband find that secrets can only be kept so long and the outcome of those secrets is more than they ever imagined. This is a paranormal romance with all the makings of success, from authentic characters that draw you into their story to a solid plot that keeps you engaged from start to finish. Lane Hart does a fantastic job of making the reader want more in the Emily Hunter Series and has me eager to see where else Emily and Ben's adventure takes them.

When I was young we used to have the big fish tank with gorgeous fish that I used to just love to watch, but as an adult my one and only experience with caring for and choosing a fish tank went bad. So, when I decided to tank the plunge, so to speak, once again I wanted to make sure I knew what I was doing and kept the tank viable for my fish for a long time... "Which Fish Tank" was just what I was looking for. What I liked about the book is that it doesn't just tell you how to care for fish and the tank, but rather it helps you from the beginning... from deciding on the most appropriate fish tank and fish to feeding, fish health and maintenance of the fish tank and eco-system.George Butler  provides a well-written and informative guide that provides all the information you need to know whether you are new to having fish or like me and just don't know enough to actually keep the fish healthy and alive. Overall, the author offers readers a great beginner's guide to fish tanks and fish that gave me all the advice, tips and tools to help me recreate the beauty of our old family fish tank in my own home.

I have to say I haven't read such an entertaining novel is quite a while. Limo Bill the Undercover Assassin is a highly entertaining novel that bounces around from action and adventure to slapstick humor and intriguing characters. I'll admit that when I first ran across this I was skeptical about whether it was my type of novel or not, but the author has a way of writing that just makes you grin and eagerly sit on their edge of your seat as Limo Bill finds himself caught up in a world of assassins, mayhem, adventure, romantic entanglements and more. It's got a fast pace and a clear aim to be an enjoyable, upbeat and fun read... which it achieves with flying colors. Bill Ames kept me locked into this humorous and action packed story from start to finish and made for a very entertaining afternoon.

This personal size umbrella seems to be pretty well made and able to handle the elements better than some other umbrellas. The handle is on the short side and has a pair of buttons with up and down arrows for opening and closing the umbrella. When you press the open button it pops open all the way. When you press the down button it closes in the umbrella portion but you still need to pull in the handle from its extended position back into the compact position manually. This is pretty convenient. It comes with a sleeve and it is packaged in a box that could serve as a gift box. Although this is a nice umbrella, the list price seems a bit high for this size umbrella. I was provided a discounted sample of this item for my honest, unbiased review.

These carabiner clips are pretty standard quality, easy to open and close and secure. This pack comes with different colored clips, each in a separate little zip-lock bag. Each clip has engraved in it "not for climbing," so while it's good for many uses don't try to secure a rope when mountain climbing with these. The colors may vary from the ones pictured in the product listing. I was provided a free sample of these for my honest, unbiased review.

This little ebook offers some general guidance on understanding depression and finding effective ways to heal and regain your enthusiasm for life. The book offers an overview of these subjects, and does not go into a lot of detail. It is rather short and simple to read. I felt that it could have been edited better and expanded upon some, while it is a good introduction to the subject of finding natural ways to heal from depression. I have worked many years as a holistic psychotherapist and find that these types of approaches help many people - as this author says, it's best to find healing methods that get to the root of your depression to truly heal and not just rely on a medication. Research actually shows that in the long run the medications tend to perpetuate or aggravate depression, so seeking a chemical quick fix may lead to more problems in the long run. If you want to really work on overcoming depression this book offers good input and suggestions. I was provided a free copy of this ebook for my honest, unbiased review.

These shiny metal license plate frames are definitely eye catching and attractive. They won't break easily like a plastic frame, although I suspect that over time they may tarnish with exposure to the elements if you don't periodically place some protective coating on them. Since they are metal there is also a greater possible hazard of scratching your vehicle or anything else they come in contact with, so you will want to be cautious when installing them to make sure there is some buffer if needed. These look nice and would be fine for anyone who wants to show-off their license plate with something more attractive than a simple frame provided by an auto dealer. I was provided a free sample of these for my honest, unbiased review.

Anthony William is known as the "medical medium," who receives psychic guidance to help people understand their health challenges and illnesses and find solutions to restore health. In this book he focuses on exploring a variety of health concerns that have spurred debate or mystery as to their cause and how to treat them. This includes ADHD, autism, autoimmune issues, candida, chronic fatigue, depression and anxiety, diabetes, digestive disorders, fibromyalgia, Lyme disease, Epstein-Barr virus, menopause, endocrine imbalances, migraines, Multiple sclerosis, PTSD, rheumatoid arthritis, vertigo and tinnitus, and more. Williams is not the only medium or intuitive who skillfully addresses health issues, though he has garnered more attention and promotion than most. We all have untapped intuitive abilities, so what Williams can do is not exclusive or unique to him. I have worked in the holistic health field for a number of years and studied many different materials on these subjects; I also practice intuitive energy healing myself and often see people with the various conditions that are discussed in this book, noting the psychospiritual, energetic, environmental, dietary, and lifestyle patterns that are parts of the puzzle. Thus, my review is influenced by my perspective on these issues as well as my evaluation of the quality of how the medical medium presents his insights in this book format.In this book he tends to share some common themes that relate to health concerns, such as psychological stress, environmental toxin exposure, nutrition imbalances, and viral infections. This book looks mostly at the physical level of health to provide solutions even though it comes from a psychic medium. There is a lot of helpful and iconoclastic guidance in this book that I believe we can learn a lot from. However, there are a few flaws or misleading statements that I felt give reason to be cautious about relying totally on this medium. At one point he implies that the "soul" resides in the brain. In reality the brain is an interface and the soul is a higher vibrational field that accesses the whole body but doesn't reside within the body at all. He also gives his view on causes of conditions which are often incomplete and overly rigid explanations. They may be very useful and valid parts of the picture, but not the whole picture, and not precisely the same for everyone with the same diagnosis. He gives suggestion for herbs and foods that can help heal, which are generally very good suggestions. He is a big fan of things like blue-green algae and seaweeds, which I also find are very helpful for many issues. Thus, I see this book as giving valuable and often novel input but not a complete guide to any of the conditions it discusses.Some of the more insightful things he addresses are the immune system, endocrine system, and hormones - explaining how some types of hormones can suppress the immune system and how autoimmune illnesses are typically the immune system trying to address viral infections that have become embedded in our cells or tissues. He exposes how heavy metal toxins create major problems in our bodies, though he fails to mention how vaccinations have become a leading source of disruption to our body systems by their creating hidden infections and heavy metal toxicity within the body via injecting viral and chemical cocktails directly into the bloodstream, especially with so many given to babies with immature immune systems. I would definitely recommend reading what Anthony says about these various health topics, as well as the psychological and spiritual healing tips he offers. I would have liked to have seen him discuss issues more on a metaphysical and energetic level, while what he has presented is valuable and may open more people up to exploring the spiritual and energetic layer of their being. Aside from a few flaws this book is really a valuable source of information for helping people understand how to address common health issues.

In the area of reproductive health and safety people are typically conscious about using condoms to prevent pregnancy and STDs. However, most conventional condoms actually contain harmful chemicals that can foster disease. These Sustain condoms are made without any harmful chemicals, designed with all natural materials and lubrication. The manufacturer also donates a portion of profits to women's health initiatives. For anyone truly concerned about their health and the health of their partner it is a good idea to choose natural condoms like these. You will probably find that these are just as comfortable if not more comfortable than the mainstream brands, and the extra cost is worth it since you are less likely to experience any irritation or allergic reaction to these relative to the ones that have synthetic chemicals.

This cotton canvas shoulder bag has a nice appearance and plenty of space for holding a variety of items. You could use it for cameras, tablets, snacks, and other items. The material is sturdy, the zippers work smoothly, and the strap is comfortable.This came with a tag with writing in Chinese, while the brand name label uses an English name. This bag is versatile and has that great classic look that complements casual attire. I was provided a free sample of this item for my honest, unbiased review.

This lightweight backpack is pretty spacious and easy to store in a compact space when not in use. There are plenty of compartments in this and it is fairly comfortable to carry. Really the only drawback is that this material could be ripped by something sharp. If you need a backpack that is waterproof but not too heavy and not meant for an overly heavy load, then this one would be a good option. I was provided a discounted sample of this item for my honest, unbiased review.

These shoe sole inserts are designed to boost your height off the ground a bit, mainly by lifting the heel of your foot higher. These provide some cushioning, though they are especially meant for the height effect. These do take up a lot of space in your shoe, so if the top of the shoe is low then your heel will lift above it. These seem to be ideal for about a size 9 US mens shoe. If your shoe is a bit shorter you could trim the toes end to fit, while if you have a longer shoe this might slide a bit. This is a useful way to temporarily boost your height, though it's not healthy to be shifting your weight and bending your feet this way for long. Just as high heels are not good for women's feet or spines, they can cause problems for men also. Thus, this may be something to use occasionally when you are in front of people who will look up to someone who is taller. These function OK for their intended purpose, though they are not for everyone and they may not fit some shoes so well. I was provided a free sample of these for my honest, unbiased review.

This sturdy cotton canvas backpack is attractive and relatively lightweight. It's got plenty of space to hold a variety of items, including a zippered external side section and a few different pockets on the inside. It could have a bit more internal cushioning to protect something sensitive like a laptop, otherwise this is a good pack to carry most items. The shoulder straps are adjustable and comfortable. This is a nice multi-purpose backpack that a variety of people could use. I was provided a free sample of this item for my honest, unbiased review.
Nice gentle, relaxing music, good for massage and other healing work. The album is a bit on the short side, but overall it's got nice flowing, soothing music that will create a relaxing atmosphere.

From the time we are children we are taught to care for our teeth and maintain our dental health. Regular dental checkups and cleanings are a part of most people's lives in modern Western society. What many people haven't been taught is that dentistry has been infused with some misguided ideas and practices that are destructive to one's health. Dental doctor James E. Rota DDS has written a book called Mirror Of The Body to detail his own journey through dentistry. In that journey he discovers that his own health has been harmed by common dental practices and he changes his approach to dentistry to help keep others from suffering that harm, while also delving into detoxification and holistic medicine to help reverse the harm that has occurred.Dr. Rota's career spans from being a dentistry professor at UCLA in the 1960s to being a prominent dentist for celebrities in Los Angeles. His book includes endorsements from Dick Van Dyke and Raquel Welch. Rota writes a lot about the dangers of mercury used in dentistry, and the need for detoxification  practices to help clear our bodies of mercury and other substances that are impairing the functioning of our cells and organs. Rota shares about the discoveries of how our mouth and teeth are connected to the whole body, with each tooth energetically connected to a different acupuncture meridian. The book includes scientific references documenting the dangers of mercury amalgam fillings, with many online resources for holistic dentistry and healing options.Rota's personal healing journey is interesting to follow. Most recently he has included cannabis oil in his regimen of natural therapies to halt the growth of prostate cancer. Ozone, rebounding, saunas, and other resources for detoxification have been part of his protocol to stay healthy into his 80s. Something important that we can learn from this book is how an entire profession can cling to dangerous practices and faulty beliefs. As individuals seeking to be healthy we need to research things on our own rather than blindly following professionals who are trained to follow the status quo and maintain denial about any harm their treatments and procedures may be causing.For those who do have mercury dental fillings it is important to learn about safe ways of removing them as well as ways to detox the mercury from the body. This book provides some helpful guidance about this. It also shares general wisdom for health and healing that applies to any issue. Rota says "Take time to meditate and reflect on your life. Clarity is important in the healing process. Embrace life's challenges, for there are lessons in them. Release fears and expectations. Find harmony within the conflict of life. Give ourselves permission for the struggle to be there and to release it. Establish your connection to the grid, to the collective consciousness. Be of service to yourself and to others."Overall I found this book to be a nice account of the author's personal journey as well as a source of valuable guidance for reclaiming one's health.

These solar lights are designed to automatically sense the lighting and turn on at night, off during the day. They have a dim light that will temporarily shift to bright when motion is sensed. These are simple to install, and include a pin to push through the hole in the light to activate them. Just let it charge in the sunlight and it will work fine. Also, be careful to position it away from anything that would be in motion, such as a tree branch. The only thing I would change about this type of light is to add an option of having them fully off until motion is sensed and maybe an option to just have them on at night with no motion sensing active. This 2-pack is a good deal for these solar outdoor motion senor lights. I was provided a free sample for my honest, unbiased review

This probiotics formula from Viva Labs has some well-researched strains with 25 billion CFU to help you build up healthy amounts of beneficial gut bacteria. These are capsules which are easy to swallow and are designed to release the probiotics where they are needed so they don't get destroyed before they reach the intestines. These seem to work fine for me so far. These are a pretty good value, and probiotics can be helpful for a lot of health concerns so they are worth trying. As a reviewer I was provided a free sample for my unbiased review, while if I were looking to purchase probiotics I would definitely consider these based upon their quality and their cost relative to other good probiotic formulas. Different formulas have different strains which may address some different health issues, so there isn't really a single probiotic product that is best for everyone. For a good general probiotic formula this item is a nice option.

This LED head lamp offers bright LED light, which is zoomable and has multiple modes. This uses 18650 size rechargeable batteries (comes with charging cable). The battery compartment cover is a rubbery, flimsy material, though otherwise the headlamp components seem solid. If you need a bright head lamp for working in a dark environment then this one seems like a good option. Just make sure you take out the batteries and remove their plastic wrap before re-inserting them for charging. This is a bit heavier than some other types of head lamps, but not too bulky. The zoom capability and adjustable angle of the light are nice features. The instructions could have been more thorough but were adequate. I was provided a free sample of this for my honest, unbiased review.

This high density foam roller comes in a suitable size and shape for a roller of this type. However, the density is too hard for what many people may desire, and the foam material has a couple of issues. First, it is likely to wear out and lose its form over time. Second, it's a polyethylene (EPP) foam that has an unpleasant chemical smell. I don't see myself using this on a regular basis. It may be OK for some people, but I would look for other options. I was provided a free sample of this item for my honest, unbiased review.

This R/C Mustang car has an attractive appearance and provides good basic radio control functionality. The car and controller use AA and AAA batteries. This is designed for using on flat surfaces. The car is very low to the ground which means it will get stuck easily if it's coming over a carpet or some debris on the ground. I have the Maisto 1:14 scale version of the same R/C car and that is not as low as this since it's a larger vehicle in scale, but still has the issue of the vehicle not being raised up above the wheels enough. Thus, while the car looks great and the control function is OK, this could have been improved to handle more surfaces.

This essential oil diffuser/mister is designed to let you fill your room with aromas from essential oils. This has a pretty simple, basic design, so you can't adjust the mist or set it on a timer, and there's just one color of light that this has. This works smoothly at doing what it is made for, but for the cost of this I would have expected more features. Diffusers have become more popular as aromatherapy has been promoted for its health benefits, and you can find more inexpensive diffusers that function just as well as this. Thus, while this is a good item to have it doesn't appear to offer a great value in comparison to other similar items.

This digital postal scale is a sleek and precise way to weigh a variety of items. It has a power button that is easy to see in the front and comes with batteries and two different power cables. There is a standard A/C power cable as well as a USB power cable, so you can use this scale wherever you go, with or without batteries. The scale surface has decent dimensions and is designed to handle up to 86lbs. This came well-calibrated and worked fine when I tried it out. The scale comes with a 10 year limited warranty in case any problem does arise. I like the idea of having a scale that can use either battery or A/C power, and this one provides those features. I was provided a free sample of this for my honest, unbiased review.

These LED auto lights are really nice and bright, offering a good replacement for older incandescent bulbs. These function as expected and will last a long time, making them a good value when compared to traditional bulbs. The only drawback in these is the Chinese only writing on the packaging, though you don't really need to read the package if you know which bulbs you've purchased and can see that the base fits into the bulb socket that you are placing them in. If you need this size/model of bulb then these are a good value. I was provided a free sample of this for my honest, unbiased review.

This Vitamin C formula uses a non-GMO corn source to get the vitamin and includes the bioflavinoid/rose hips mix to help the body better assimilate the Vitamin C. These capsules are vegetarian friendly and one of the better Vitamin C products in capsule form. I personally like to use whole food Vitamin sources such as berry powders, so this Viva Labs Vitamin C isn't perfect, but it's pretty good compared to most Vitamin C supplements and provides 1000 mg, which is a useful therapeutic dose.

This portable Bluetooth speaker comes with some nice features and decent sound quality. The speaker has a carabiner clip to hang it in a convenient spot. It syncs with any Bluetooth audio source and also has a 3.5mm line in to connect with a wired audio input. It charges up fairly quickly and will go several hours before needing to recharge. The speaker has a TF card input so you can use a memory card with it and it has LED lights that become animated when the speaker is receiving input. The controls are easy to use and the speaker case has a solid construction that will protect it in case you drop it. The sound is good for a small room and the light show is fun though a bit limited in what it does. The instruction sheet was a bit limited but adequate. This speaker is nice to have if you want portable audio that you can use for music and conversation. I was provided a free sample for my honest, unbiased review.

This neoprene sleeve case fits a variety of small tablet devices - it's designed to fit the Kindle Fire 7" with a FreeTime kid-proof case on it, so you know it's pretty spacious. The cushioning is nice and the case has a zippered side pocket which could be used for a charging cable. There's also an ID info window on the side so a kid could have their info on it in case it gets lost. This has a handle that makes it easy to carry. Overall this is a quite functional tablet sleeve. However, I do think this is a bit expensive for a small neoprene sleeve so I give it 4 stars rather than 5.

These are sturdy plastic badge/card holders designed to be worn attached to a lanyard or clip. Each one can hold multiple cards and has a space for a clip and holes to slide through a lanyard string. These have a zip-lock that keeps the cards from falling out and keeps moisture from getting in. These do have a heavy duty feel, they are not likely to rip easily and they will hold up a long time. This also comes with a little cloth to remove dirt or dust. This all comes in a plastic zip-lock bag that you can reuse. Overall I am impressed with the quality of these. I was provided a free sample for my honest, unbiased review.

These decorative battery-powered LED lights are attractive and offer a great ambiance for a variety of occasions. This set comes in a box with both the ball lights and bell lights. The bells jingle, making them great for the holidays. The ball lights string light uses 3 AA batteries while the bell lights string works with 2 AA batteries (batteries not included). The battery compartment cover slides on and off, no tools required. The box these come in is kind of weak, if you put something heavy atop it then the box can be bent/crushed. I really like how these lights appear, providing warm light via attractive ornaments. The one star is taken off for the gift box, which is mainly designed to let you see the ornaments through the clear plastic but doesn't protect the contents well. I was provided a fee sample of this for my honest, unbiased review.

These solar colored string lights are multicolored lights in long teardrop shapes. The light string connects to a solar panel that you stake in the ground in an area the sun light reaches. The panel base has an on/off button switch as well as a button to switch between solid and flashing light modes. These lights look great and provide LED lighting fueled by the sun, making it affordable to brighten your holidays with these. If you wish to add some colorful lights to your home or trees outdoors then these are nice to have. I was provided this item for free to give my honest, unbiased review.

Magnesium is a vital mineral that is deficient in foods and quickly depleted by emotional and physical stress - thus most people are deficient in magnesium. Unfortunately, unless the deficiency is so extreme that it shows up in your blood, your doctor probably won't realize you have this deficiency since the body will bring magnesium to the cardiovascular system and pull it from other areas of the body if necessary. Magnesium is part of hundreds of metabolic processes. Using magnesium supplements can thus help with a variety of health concerns - from muscle soreness, restless legs, fibromyalgia, bone loss, and cardiovascular problems to anxiety, ADHD, and insomnia, magnesium can be a source of relief. This mineral comes in a variety of forms, and this powder from Doctor's Best is in an easy to absorb chelated form. Just mix it into water or another beverage. This has no other ingredients, so you know you are getting just the desire supplement and no fillers or additives.

This is a nice gift pack of manicure items - all the tools you need to do your nails in a cute little apple case. The set seems to be average quality construction, and each item works fine. If you need some tools to do a good manicure and want a nice case to keep them in then this set may be for you. I was provided a greatly discounted sample of this for my honest, unbiased review.

This charger works for Qi enabled mobile devices, allowing you to just place your phone over the charger and have it start to charge up. The charger connects to a USB power source. This means that you don't need a cable to charge your device - great for those who have a habit of losing or breaking their charging cables. Just check to see if your device is capable of charging via the Qi technology before getting one of these. This provides a pretty decent charging speed, and you won't have to buy any cables in the future, so it may be worth it to get one of these. I was provided a free sample of this for my honest, unbiased review.
Great value on bulk bee pollen! This nutrient rich food is a great resource for health and Stakich provides unprocessed bee pollen at a reasonable cost.

This yoga-adapted backpack is designed for you to carry anything you would include in a regular backpack with the addition of adjustable side straps to attach a yoga mat. This even has a bag inside that you could use to hold a mat or other items (the black bag which appears flat and folded in the product photo). The backpack has soft shoulder straps, a zippered pocket and a side pocket ideal for a water bottle. This backpack is really a clever idea, and it has a nice appearance also. You can pick from a few different colors. I was provided a sample of this bag at no cost for my honest, unbiased review.

This dog lead has a very comfortable handle connected to a strap that's a few feet long and latches on to a dog collar. This doesn't let your dog wander or stray much, so if you want to give your dog more freedom as you walk it then you may wish to attach this lead to a leash. The best part of this lead is the handle. This will keep your hand comfortable and you won't be getting sore from your dog tugging on the lead.

This reflective red nylon rope is useful for a variety of purposes. It is strong and highly visible, great for camping and outdoors. The rope I received says 5mm on the package, so the 4mm in the description may not be accurate if you are counting the ropes covering. This comes in a handy spool and is easy to take off or wind back onto the spool. My only significant criticism of this is the labeling on the item's wrapper - it's all in Chinese. If they wish to sell this on Amazon it would be wise to add English and maybe even Spanish translations. I was provided a fee sample of this item for my honest, unbiased review.

These solar outdoor motion sensor lights are a useful way to provide lighting in a small area. These can be mounted on any flat, vertical surface, like a wood deck or fence, or a wall. The screws and brackets are included, along with a pin to push the internal button to turn these on. The lights need to be mounted in an area where there isn't too much motion near them. If you have a branch or something that blows in the wind it can put these into bright mode too much during the night and drain the battery too quickly. Otherwise, these are really nice and offer a good amount of light. The housing on these is solid and these will be durable. I was provided a free sample of these lights for my honest, unbiased review.

This compact manual chain saw is designed as a survival gear item, as it can saw in a variety of situations and doesn't take up space or require gas or electric power. I tried this on a thin branch and it did a decent job of cutting through it. For a larger branch I think having two people work with it would be better. Since this is manual it is much slower than using a powered saw and it is not as good as a regular manual saw for some tasks. Thus, I would just use this if another saw isn't available or practical to use in the space where you need to cut. This saw seems just as well made as a saw chain on a regular chain saw, and it comes with a nice solid nylon carry pouch which can be hooked on a belt or belt loop. This came with a small sheet that provides instructions for how to use it. I was provided a sample of this at no cost for my honest, unbiased review.

This little HDD drive case provides a solid, semi-flexible outer shell with good cushioning inside. There is a strap to hold the drive in place and a pocket to hold accessories. The zipper goes smoothly and the case fits 2.5" drives fine. The only thing missing here is a handle. Overall I would say this is a good protective case for portable HDD drives and other electronics of a similar size. I was provided a free sample of this item for my honest, unbiased review.

This broom/mop rack organizer is a great way to hang up some of your tools or maintenance items. There are 4 slots for broom handles and 5 hooks included in this organizer. This has an aluminum frame and is easy to install. This is pretty strong and seems to solidly hold all the items I've hung on it. This is a good value for this type of organizer. I was provided a free sample of this item for my honest, unbiased review.

This vegetarian enzyme formula is one that includes some probiotics and prebiotics along with digestion boosting herbs and spices. It has a decent selection of enzymes and the additional ingredients are great for helping stimulate digestive activities. These capsules do have standard filler ingredients of magnesium stearate and silicon dioxide. Overall, this is a good digestive formula, which can help rebalance your digestive system, especially when combined with a healthy diet, exercise, and stress reduction. I was provided a free sample of this item for my honest, unbiased review.

This supplement is a formula designed to promote hair growth using vitamins and herbs. It is a good source of nutrients to help with that and other health concerns, while the capsules are vegetarian capsules made using standard ingredients like magnesium stearate and silicon dioxide. One issue with this is the labeling - the proprietary herbal blend in this is listed in such small lettering it's hard to read, and even the vitamins included here are in a smaller font than the inert ingredients used to create the capsules. This supplement can help maintain healthy hair, while it is not a fix for every problem that might contribute to hair thinning and hair loss. It is relatively safe to use this, and certainly worth trying if you wish to address hair growth concerns. I was provided a free sample of this item for my honest, unbiased review.

This supplement is a green tea extract with a bit of added vitamin C, designed for an antioxidant boost and weight loss. This supplement does not identify the source of where the green tea came from or what type of vitamin C is used. This is OK as a green tea extract, while the small amount of vitamin C is not a replacement for a regular vitamin C supplement. This supplement comes in a capsule made with magnesium stearate and silicon dixoide, all in a vegetable capsule suitable for vegetarians. This supplement is OK if you are looking for a green tea extract, but it could be improved by using organic, non-GMO ingredients and a natural vitamin C that comes with co-factors from the plant source. I was provided a free sample of this item for my honest, unbiased review.

These are nice microfiber cleaning cloths, great for wiping and dusting a variety of surfaces. The material is soft and not overly thin, while it clings to dirt and is easy to wash. These are a pretty practical size cloth to clean with and this pack of 6 will last for a while. These are just what I expect from a microfiber cleaning cloth.

This nice set of cotton dish clothes has vibrant colors and is pretty absorbent. Each cloth is 12" by 12" and seems well stitched. If you need cloths for drying dishes or other items that are not too big then these towels would be nice. This set has 8 towels, 2 of each color. The colors are red, yellow, green, and blue, so I may just call these my Microsoft dishcloths!

These dish clothes have a nice terry cloth cotton texture - absorbent and easy to wash. These are a nice size and a decent looking pattern. These are reasonably priced and make a wonderful towel for cleaning and drying dishes.

Tryptophan is the amino acid that is essential for the body to synthesize serotonin and melatonin. Thus, for anyone experiencing depression or insomnia, insufficient tryptophan needed to replenish those hormones and neurotransmitters may be part of the problem. Using a tryptophan supplement is one of the safer ways to treat depression, and has a long history of safety and effectiveness. Many years ago there was a scare caused by a tainted batch that led to suppression of this supplement in the USA and the explosion of SSRI drug prescriptions. Of course, SSRIs use a dangerous approach to promote temporary increases in serotonin activity (by impairing/blocking the reuptake cycle) and often lead to more depression and other problems in the long term. I've worked as a psychotherapist for many years and have seen the harm done by psychotropic drugs, and I encourage people to consider natural supplements that work to help the body balance itself rather than drugs that disrupt natural systems to create a temporarily illusion of improvement. Thus, tryptophan, which can be absorbed from both foods and supplements is one thing I recommend as an alternative. This particular L-Tryptophan supplement offers 500 mg per capsule, with no fillers or additives other than magnesium stearate. Combining this with a balanced diet, and counseling and holistic therapy approaches to reduce stress and better manage thoughts will be helpful to relieve depression and insomnia. If you are taking any medications for sleep or depression you will want to consult with your physician when using this type of supplement, as when your body starts to be able to improve neurotransmitter metabolism you may need to reduce or wean off of medications. I was provided a sample of this product at no cost for my honest, unbiased review.

This is an essential oil blend designed to ward off infectious illnesses. These therapeutic oils were originally used in medieval times by thieves, who were able to stay healthy during plagues by using these oils. The Young Living company developed a blend based on the ancient recipe that they call thieves, so this Prime Natural oil blend emulates that formula. This is an effective resource for preventing illness, perhaps not as high quality oils as Young Living but still quite good, and at a more affordable price. You can use the oil as a spritz diffused into the air or place it on your skin, and some people will even place a drop in a carrier oil like almond or olive oil and use it internally. Since this oil is rather strong it is something you will need to dilute even for using it topically. If you are healthy and don't want your feeling of wellness stolen by microbes, then "thief" is a nice oil blend to try. I was provided a free sample of this for my honest, unbiased review.

This essential oil blend is designed to help soothe and heal muscles, using all natural therapeutic oils in a pure, additive-free blend. These oils work great and this is a good value that is designed to provide quality oils similar to products from leading MLM companies, but without the high cost typically associated with buying from those network marketing sellers. If you are looking for therapeutic essential oils that work well and fit your budget this muscle relief formula is a nice option. I was provided a free sample of this for my honest, unbiased review.

This set of 5 exercise resistance bands comes with a small instruction sheet and a storage bag. Each band is a different color and tension. These are made with a high quality natural latex that is better than some of the other types of latex bands commonly used on this type of product. These function quite well and seem like they will be durable; in case there is a problem with them you can get a lifetime guarantee by filling in your info at their website. If you are looking for good exercise resistance bands to safely stretch and work with your muscles then this set is excellent. I was provided a free sample of these for my honest, unbiased review.

These are a nice thick, quality latex glove that can be used to protect your hands in a variety of tasks. These are disposable and they fit rather well. These seem to be more durable than some other latex gloves you might try, and this box has plenty of gloves to meet your needs. For good quality latex gloves these seem to be a very good option.

This 4 foot T8 fluorescent light bulb replacement is an LED bulb that is more eco-friendly and uses less power than fluorescent bulbs, while producing a nicer spectrum of light. This came in a solid cardboard tube package but did not have instructions for converting ballast type fluorescent fixtures to handle this newer type of bulb. Many older fixtures will need this adjustment to work with this bulb - it's not hard to rewire but you do need to do it properly if you want it to work and not damage the wires or the bulb. Once this bulb is installed it will be impressive compared to any fluorescent bulb. I would definitely recommend making this upgrade to LED. I was provided a free sample of this bulb for my honest, unbiased review.

This little double dish set is a kind of clever idea. It has a dish/bowl with extended side lips that holds a smaller round dish/bowl in its center. You can leave the smaller bowl nested in the larger one or take it out and use it separately. This has a variety of uses. The dishes are a solid but lightweight melamine, which is not microwavable. They came packaged in a small cardboard box. While these are nice, multi-functional small serving bowls, I would think you can find similar melamine bowls that are more inexpensive. Thus, while the dishes are useful, there is nothing exceptional about them and they aren't a great value for melamine. I was provided a free sample of this for my honest, unbiased review.

This aluminum, spring-based guitar capo is the 4th one in my collection - the others are Keyser, Planet Waves, and Dunlop. I've found that all of these work pretty well on my guitars. This Furios one reminds me the most of the Dunlop capo. It may actually have an even stronger spring tension. This design is pretty simple and easy to clip on your guitar neck. It firmly hugs the frets and will fit most guitar necks without a problem. This is competitively priced and even comes in multiple colors. If you are looking for a solid, reliable capo this one is a good value. I was provided a free sample of this item for my honest, unbiased review.

I was sent a sample of this for review in the Amazon Vine program and would like to point out that there are 2 different enzyme products from Jarrow that seem to get included on this review page: Jarro-Zymes Plus and Jarro-Zymes for Gluten digestion. I received the one for Gluten digestion, which has a somewhat different formula. You would need to be aware of which food components you may have a weakness digesting to decide which product is better for you. The Gluten digestion formula contains endopeptidase and exopeptidase, proteases, aspergillpepsin, and DPP IV. The capsule is a vegi-cap with non-GMO maltodextrin included. This formula is a pretty good one that is likely to help improve digestion for those with certain food sensitivities involving proteins. These are worth trying if you have some issues with gluten but don't have a major allergy. There are a variety of alternative healing approaches that can potentially clear up Gluten intolerances and allergies (especially from an energetic and subconscious emotional level) so I think using enzymes combined with those methods can help reset your system to start properly digesting these foods and stop reacting to them as something threatening.

This headphone stand is a simple, stylish way to display your headphones. It can stand on any flat surface and will fit pretty much any standard type of headphones. The stand is a hard plastic material that can flex a bit. While this is useful it does seem a bit expensive for what it is - a sculpted piece of plastic. I was provided a free sample of this item for my honest, unbiased review.

These wool-nylon socks come in multiple colors with attractive patterns that coordinate well with other winter clothes. This 5-pack is a nice value and would make a nice gift. These socks are designed for women but could also fit many smaller men's feet as well. The wool/nylon blend provides the warmth of wool with the flexibility of nylon, making these pretty comfortable socks for cold weather. I was provided a discounted sample of these for my honest, unbiased review.

This is a full set of stainless steel flatware, suitable for serving 5 people. You get the large fork and small fork for the main dish and salad, you get a large spoon and small spoon, for soups and desserts, and a place knife/butter knife. These are solid pieces of flatware that have a nice shiny finish and are durable. These don't appear overly fancy, as their design is pretty standard. These are reasonably priced and will be suitable for pretty much any meal you serve. I was provided a deeply discounted sample of these for my honest, unbiased review.

This walking/hiking pole has a lightweight carbon fiber composition and a comfortable handle. It can be adjusted in length and the separate sections can be pulled apart and folded to fit into the carry bag. This actually came with 2 carry bags: a simple lightweight carry sleeve with drawstring, and a larger, more durable nylon type bag that has extra pockets to carry additional items and which has a shoulder strap. The walking pole is easy to move and to anchor on the ground and seems to provide pretty good support and stability. For hiking on uneven terrain this pole will be a great resource. I really like the design of this pole and find it convenient to carry, so I would definitely recommend this for anyone who does lots of hiking. I was provided a sample of this at no cost for my honest, unbiased review.

This little wire mesh desktop/countertop organizer is made with a simple, practical design, to hold an assortment of small items. The base has 4 soft buffers to keep this from scratching the surface you place it on. This organizer is just as pictured, with the multiple compartments and slide out drawer. It is similar to other wire mesh organizers, and the value is average based on the current price. This type of organizer is nice in appearance, though the mesh design means if you have a pen leak ink then it won't protect your desktop. I would thus be cautious with which types of pen I might place in it. I was provided a free sample of this for my honest, unbiased review.

This slip-preventing bathtub mat is a nice full size and a pleasant blue color. It has suctions on the bottom to adhere to the tub surface and holes for water to drain through. This is something to put in place once that tub bottom is clean.
